Original: On-screen: Mako Reactor 1
Dialogue: Mako Reactor 1

Original: Barret: Get down here, merc.
Dialogue: Get down here, merc.

Original: Security Officer (1): Halt!
Dialogue: Halt!

Original: Security Officer (2): Who goes there!?
Dialogue: Who goes there!?

Original: Barret: You're up.
Dialogue: You're up.

Original: Security Officer (1): You're coming with us.
Dialogue: You're coming with us.

Original: Security Officer (2): Nice and easy!
Dialogue: Nice and easy!

Original: Cloud: Don't think so.
Dialogue: Don't think so.

Original: Security Officer: Who in the hell!?
Dialogue: Who in the hell—!?

Original: Security Officer: Hands where I can see 'em!
Dialogue: Hands where I can see 'em!

Original: Jessie: Have fun!
Dialogue: Have fun!

Original: Security Officer (3): Freeze!
Dialogue: Freeze!

Original: Security Officer (4): Move and we shoot!
Dialogue: Move and we shoot!

Original: Cloud: Go ahead.
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Original: Cloud: Enough of this.
Dialogue: Enough of this.

Original: Security Officer: Holy shit! He a SOLDIER operator?
Dialogue: Holy shit! He a SOLDIER operator?

Original: Security Officer: He can use magic!?
Dialogue: He can use magic!?

Original: Security Officer: Drop the weapon!
Dialogue: Drop the weapon!

Original: Biggs: You got this!
Dialogue: You got this!

Original: Wedge: Yeah, what he said!
Dialogue: Yeah, what he said!

Original: Security Officer: You're coming with us!
Dialogue: You're coming with us!

Original: Cloud: Can't get surrounded.
Dialogue: Can't get surrounded.

Original: Jessie: So what's SOLDIER boy's deal? Is he one of us now? He's got balls, this, uh... Uh...what was his name again?
Dialogue: So what's SOLDIER boy's deal? Is he one of us now? He's got balls, this, uh... Uh...what was his name again?

Original: Biggs: Cloud. Cloud Strife.
Dialogue: Cloud. Cloud Strife.

Original: Jessie: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Biggs: And he isn't a SOLDIER anymore. Still, he's a professionalunlike the rest of us. I'm glad to have him.
Dialogue: And he isn't a SOLDIER anymore. Still, he's a professional—unlike the rest of us. I'm glad to have him.

Original: Cloud: This is a onetime gig. When it's done, we're done.
Dialogue: This is a onetime gig. When it's done, we're done.

Original: Biggs: Real joy to work with though.
Dialogue: Real joy to work with though.

Original: Jessie: Real joy to look at too.
Dialogue: Real joy to look at too.

Original: Biggs: Here we go...
Dialogue: Here we go...

Original: Jessie: Looks are what people notice first.
Dialogue: Looks are what people notice first.

Original: Biggs: Guess I'm not on the same page as "people."
Dialogue: Guess I'm not on the same page as "people."

Original: Jessie: I'd say you're not even reading the same book.
Dialogue: I'd say you're not even reading the same book.

Original: Biggs: Enough. We're done here.
Dialogue: Enough. We're done here.

Original: Jessie: Or even the same
Dialogue: Or even the same—

Original: Biggs: Give it a rest.
Dialogue: Give it a rest.

Original: Wedge: C'mon, nobody'd do something this crazy just for money.Theymay not think you're a true believer, but you know what I think?
Dialogue: C'mon, nobody'd do something this crazy just for money. They may not think you're a true believer, but you know what I think?

Original: Cloud: Not interested.
Dialogue: Not interested.

Original: Barret: Wedge!
Dialogue: Wedge!

Original: Barret: You'd better be worth the money, merc. Every last gil.
Dialogue: You'd better be worth the money, merc. Every last gil.

Original: Security Officer: Get him, boy!
Dialogue: Get him, boy!

Original: Cloud: Guess you're first.
Dialogue: Guess you're first.

Original: Security Officer: Hey!
Dialogue: Hey!

Original: Cloud: Looks like you're next.
Dialogue: Looks like you're next.

Original: Security Officer: I found one!
Dialogue: I found one!

Original: Wedge: Hey Cloud! Elevator's over there! Catch up soon!
Dialogue: Hey Cloud! Elevator's over there! Catch up soon!

Original: Biggs: This way!
Dialogue: This way!

Original: Biggs: Not so fast. We've got company.
Dialogue: Not so fast. We've got company.

Original: Security Officer (1): There's one!
Dialogue: There's one!

Original: Security Officer (2): Get him!
Dialogue: Get him!

Original: Barret: You know what to donowgo!
Dialogue: You know what to do—now go!

Original: Wedge: See you later!
Dialogue: See you later!

Original: Jessie: C'mon, Cloud!
Dialogue: C'mon, Cloud!

Original: Barret: Pick up the pace!
Dialogue: Pick up the pace!

Original: On-screen: Mako Reactor 1 - Interior
Dialogue: Mako Reactor 1 - Interior

Original: Barret: SOLDIERs may attack on command, but I hear they make good guard dogs too. Bet you've seen a few reactors. So how do we get to the bridge above mako storage?
Dialogue: SOLDIERs may attack on command, but I hear they make good guard dogs too. Bet you've seen a few reactors. So how do we get to the bridge above mako storage?

Original: Barret: Ain't holding out on me, are you? Stamp scared to bite the hand that fed him? Or is he a loyal little doggie!?
Dialogue: Ain't holding out on me, are you? Stamp scared to bite the hand that fed him? Or is he a loyal little doggie!?

Original: Barret: Have it your way, mutt. We can do thiswithyou, or we can do thiswithoutyou.
Dialogue: Have it your way, mutt. We can do this with you, or we can do this without you.

Original: Cloud: Different reactor, different layout. Depends when it was built. Never seen one like this, but I'll manage.
Dialogue: Different reactor, different layout. Depends when it was built. Never seen one like this, but I'll manage.

Original: Jessie: Don't you worry. Biggs'll have the door open soon.
Dialogue: Don't you worry. Biggs'll have the door open soon.

Original: Barret: I'm watching you.
Dialogue: I'm watching you.

Original: Biggs: In three, two... Damn, I'm good!
Dialogue: In three, two... Damn, I'm good!

Original: Security Officer (1): Who's there!? Door!
Dialogue: Who's there!? Door!

Original: Barret: W-wait!
Dialogue: W-wait!

Original: Security Officer (2): It's over!
Dialogue: It's over!

Original: Cloud: That's my line.
Dialogue: That's my line.

Original: Security Officer (1): He's alone! We can take him!
Dialogue: He's alone! We can take him!

Original: Security Officer (2): Make it rain!
Dialogue: Make it rain!

Original: Jessie: We're back!
Dialogue: We're back!

Original: Cloud: Then let's move.
Dialogue: Then let's move.

Original: Jessie: He always knows just what to say!
Dialogue: He always knows just what to say!

Original: Barret: Cut it out!
Dialogue: Cut it out!

Original: Barret: Simmer down, hotshot.
Dialogue: Simmer down, hotshot.

Original: Jessie: It's a good thing I know someone who can get us the passcodes. Pity no one else at command will talk to us, but what can you do? And we're good!
Dialogue: It's a good thing I know someone who can get us the passcodes. Pity no one else at command will talk to us, but what can you do? And we're good!

Original: Biggs: Careful in there.
Dialogue: Careful in there.

Original: Biggs: Well, what're you waiting for?
Dialogue: Well, what're you waiting for?

Original: Biggs: I got this place covered.
Dialogue: I got this place covered.

Original: Barret: Security's only gonna get tighter, so be ready. We can't afford any mistakes.
Dialogue: Security's only gonna get tighter, so be ready. We can't afford any mistakes.

Original: Jessie: Looks like the elevator's on another floor. Mind pushing that button?
Dialogue: Looks like the elevator's on another floor. Mind pushing that button?

Original: Jessie: So...you know Tifa, right? It's not really my business, but are you guysclose?
Dialogue: So...you know Tifa, right? It's not really my business, but are you guys close?

Original: Tifa: Cloud! Are you ignoring me!?
Dialogue: Cloud! Are you ignoring me!?

Original: Cloud: Tifa and I...
Dialogue: Tifa and I...

Original: Heidegger: These sewer rats appear to call themselves Avalanche, sir. We are currently investigating whether they belong to the same group that made the attempt on your life. Rest assured, our inquiries will not take much longer.
Dialogue: These sewer rats appear to call themselves Avalanche, sir. We are currently investigating whether they belong to the same group that made the attempt on your life. Rest assured, our inquiries will not take much longer.

Original: Barret: This pump's sole purpose is to drain the planet dry. While you sleep, while you eat, while you shitit's here, sucking up mako. It doesn't rest and it doesn't care! You do realize what mako is, don't you?
Dialogue: This pump's sole purpose is to drain the planet dry. While you sleep, while you eat, while you shit—it's here, sucking up mako. It doesn't rest and it doesn't care! You do realize what mako is, don't you?

Original: Barret: Mako is the lifeblood of our world. The planet bleeds green like you and me bleed red. The hell you think's gonna happen when it's all gone, huh!? Answer me!
Dialogue: Mako is the lifeblood of our world. The planet bleeds green like you and me bleed red. The hell you think's gonna happen when it's all gone, huh!? Answer me!

Original: Barret: You gonna stand there and pretend you can't hear the planet crying out in pain? I know you can!
Dialogue: You gonna stand there and pretend you can't hear the planet crying out in pain? I know you can!

Original: Cloud: You really hear that?
Dialogue: You really hear that?

Original: Barret: Damn straight I do!
Dialogue: Damn straight I do!

Original: Cloud: Get help.
Dialogue: Get help.

Original: Barret: Say that again!
Dialogue: Say that again!

Original: Cloud: I'd worry less about the planet and more about the next five seconds. Save the screaming for later.
Dialogue: I'd worry less about the planet and more about the next five seconds. Save the screaming for later.

Original: On-screen: Mako Reactor 1 - Utility Access
Dialogue: Mako Reactor 1 - Utility Access

Original: Barret: Our lives are on the line now. You listening, merc? One false move... And that happens!
Dialogue: Our lives are on the line now. You listening, merc? One false move... And that happens!

Original: Jessie: Well, so much for having Cloud do all the fighting. There are some places a sword just can't reach... Just...bear with him for me, would you?
Dialogue: Well, so much for having Cloud do all the fighting. There are some places a sword just can't reach... Just...bear with him for me, would you?

Original: Cloud: Should've asked for more money.
Dialogue: Should've asked for more money.

Original: Barret: Gonna throw your sword at 'em? Let the man with the gun go to work! These tin cans ain't got nothing on me!
Dialogue: Gonna throw your sword at 'em? Let the man with the gun go to work! These tin cans ain't got nothing on me!

Original: Barret: Now for the real show!
Dialogue: Now for the real show!

Original: Barret: Do your job, merc!
Dialogue: Do your job, merc!

Original: Cloud: Shut up and move over.
Dialogue: Shut up and move over.

Original: Cloud: Don't forget to aim.
Dialogue: Don't forget to aim.

Original: Barret: Oh yeah? How about I aim for your head!?
Dialogue: Oh yeah? How about I aim for your head!?

Original: Jessie: Look what we have here.
Dialogue: Look what we have here.

Original: Cloud: A laser security system... Great.
Dialogue: A laser security system... Great.

Original: Jessie: Those things'll hurt more than your pride if you're careless. They'll cut you down to size and then some. ...But I'm guessing you've done this kind of thing before.
Dialogue: Those things'll hurt more than your pride if you're careless. They'll cut you down to size and then some. ...But I'm guessing you've done this kind of thing before.

Original: Cloud: Yeah. Figure out the timing of the lasers. Then make a move when they cycle off.
Dialogue: Yeah. Figure out the timing of the lasers. Then make a move when they cycle off.

Original: Jessie: Exactly! I'll go first. Nothing like a little danger to get the blood pumping.
Dialogue: Exactly! I'll go first. Nothing like a little danger to get the blood pumping.

Original: Cloud: Hey!
Dialogue: Hey!

Original: Jessie: Just keep those baby blues of yours on me!
Dialogue: Just keep those baby blues of yours on me!

Original: Jessie: Huh. He's a natural!
Dialogue: Huh. He's a natural!

Original: Jessie: Not too shabby.
Dialogue: Not too shabby.

Original: Jessie: You're doing good, SOLDIER!
Dialogue: You're doing good, SOLDIER!

Original: Jessie: Okay, let's see what's up next!
Dialogue: Okay, let's see what's up next!

Original: Jessie: ...And it's more of the same. Come on, then.
Dialogue: ...And it's more of the same. Come on, then.

Original: Jessie: Pretty easy, right?
Dialogue: Pretty easy, right?

Original: Jessie: Nice job, Cloud!
Dialogue: Nice job, Cloud!

Original: Jessie: Like a walk in the park, huh?
Dialogue: Like a walk in the park, huh?

Original: Jessie: Not a scratch! Now onto the objective!
Dialogue: Not a scratch! Now onto the objective!

Original: Jessie: Well, I'm glad that's over with. And we're almost at our objective.
Dialogue: Well, I'm glad that's over with. And we're almost at our objective.

Original: Jessie: Look. They don't call those things sweepers for nothing. They can wipe out a whole squad in seconds.
Dialogue: Look. They don't call those things sweepers for nothing. They can wipe out a whole squad in seconds.

Original: Cloud: Not if you wipe the floor with them first.
Dialogue: Not if you wipe the floor with them first.

Original: Barret: Hah! We can take this hunk of junk!
Dialogue: Hah! We can take this hunk of junk!

Original: Cloud: That "hunk of junk" is a heavy weapons platform. If we rush in...we die.
Dialogue: That "hunk of junk" is a heavy weapons platform. If we rush in...we die.

Original: Barret: Is that right?
Dialogue: Is that right?

Original: Cloud: Need to hit it with magic. That should give us an opening.
Dialogue: Need to hit it with magic. That should give us an opening.

Original: Barret: Hey! It stopped moving!
Dialogue: Hey! It stopped moving!

Original: Cloud: Let's pin it down! Give it all you've got!
Dialogue: Let's pin it down! Give it all you've got!

Original: Barret: Of course, it just had to get back up.
Dialogue: Of course, it just had to get back up.

Original: Cloud: So we knock it down again. No time to complain.
Dialogue: So we knock it down again. No time to complain.

Original: Cloud: Now's our chance! Go!
Dialogue: Now's our chance! Go!

Original: Barret: Don't need to tell me twice! I'm gonna enjoy this!
Dialogue: Don't need to tell me twice! I'm gonna enjoy this!

Original: Jessie: And that's that!
Dialogue: And that's that!

Original: Barret: What are you, twenty-something?
Dialogue: What are you, twenty-something?

Original: Cloud: First.
Dialogue: First.

Original: Barret: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Cloud: SOLDIER: First Class. Doesn't go into the twenties.
Dialogue: SOLDIER First Class. Doesn't go into the twenties.

Original: Barret: The hell you talking about? I mean your age, not your goddamn rank!
Dialogue: The hell you talking about? I mean your age, not your goddamn rank!

Original: Cloud: I, uh...
Dialogue: I, uh...

Original: Barret: Though, for all I know, a SOLDIER's rank could be the same as his age... Mm-hmm. Guess that'd make you a one-year-old, huh? Live and learn!
Dialogue: Though, for all I know, a SOLDIER's rank could be the same as his age... Mm-hmm. Guess that'd make you a one-year-old, huh? Live and learn!

Original: Jessie: That's our target. The reactor core. Gotta set the bomb at the bottom.
Dialogue: That's our target. The reactor core. Gotta set the bomb at the bottom.

Original: Jessie: Let's get down there.
Dialogue: Let's get down there.

Original: Barret: Goddamn... I can practicallytastethe mako in here... Hurry it up!
Dialogue: Goddamn... I can practically taste the mako in here... Hurry it up!

Original: Barret: My heart's pounding like a jackhammer!
Dialogue: My heart's pounding like a jackhammer!

Original: Cloud: Scared, huh?
Dialogue: Scared, huh?

Original: Barret: Hah! More like excited. I've been dreaming about this for years!
Dialogue: Hah! More like excited. I've been dreaming about this for years!

Original: Jessie: Heads up, boysthe end's in sight. I leave the rest in your capable hands. Good luck!
Dialogue: Heads up, boys—the end's in sight. I leave the rest in your capable hands. Good luck!

Original: Jessie: Not that way! Down the ladder, dummy!
Dialogue: Not that way! Down the ladder, dummy!

Original: Barret: You think, if we fell in, we'd sink right down to the bottom? To the planet's core?
Dialogue: You think, if we fell in, we'd sink right down to the bottom? To the planet's core?

Original: Cloud: No, the pump would suck us back up.
Dialogue: No, the pump would suck us back up.

Original: Barret: How comforting.
Dialogue: How comforting.

Original: On-screen: Mako Reactor 1 - Core
Dialogue: Mako Reactor 1 - Core

Original: Barret: Yeah, let's do this... Let's do this!
Dialogue: Yeah, let's do this... Let's do this!

Original: Barret: All right. Let's see if little Stamp reallycanbite the hand that feeds...
Dialogue: All right. Let's see if little Stamp really can bite the hand that feeds...

Original: Barret: Go on. Do the honors. Prove to me you're the man Tifa says you are. That you're one of us.
Dialogue: Go on. Do the honors. Prove to me you're the man Tifa says you are. That you're one of us.

Original: Cloud: Never said I was. I'm just here for the paycheck.
Dialogue: Never said I was. I'm just here for the paycheck.

Original: Barret: Then do the damn job!
Dialogue: Then do the damn job!

Original: Barret: What's wrong?
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Original: Cloud: I'm fine. What about the timer?
Dialogue: I'm fine. What about the timer?

Original: Barret: Your call, merc.
Dialogue: Your call, merc.

Original: On-screen: Set the timer:
Dialogue: Set the timer

Original: Barret: Pretty cocky, ain'tcha?
Dialogue: Pretty cocky, ain'tcha?

Original: Barret: Hah! That long enough for you?
Dialogue: Hah! That long enough for you?

Original: Barret: You double-crossing
Dialogue: You double-crossing—

Original: Cloud: Heads up!
Dialogue: Heads up!

Original: Barret: What in the hell!?
Dialogue: What in the hell!?

Original: Barret: Hey! How the hell do we fight this thing?
Dialogue: Hey! How the hell do we fight this thing?

Original: Cloud: It's got reinforced armor platingbut the internals can be overloaded. Lightning magic.
Dialogue: It's got reinforced armor plating—but the internals can be overloaded. Lightning magic.

Original: Barret: No other option, huh.
Dialogue: No other option, huh.

Original: Cloud: Can't see an opening... Impressive...
Dialogue: Can't see an opening... Impressive...

Original: Barret: Damn, this thing is tough!
Dialogue: Damn, this thing is tough!

Original: Cloud: Wouldn't be much of a weapon if it went down easy.
Dialogue: Wouldn't be much of a weapon if it went down easy.

Original: Barret: Don't compliment the giant scorpion!
Dialogue: Don't compliment the giant scorpion!

Original: Cloud: Gotta heal up.
Dialogue: Gotta heal up.

Original: Barret: Sure could use a break...
Dialogue: Sure could use a break...

Original: Cloud: Damnit. Need to heal up soon...
Dialogue: Damnit. Need to heal up soon...

Original: Cloud: Gotta memorize the attack patterns...
Dialogue: Gotta memorize the attack patterns...

Original: Cloud: Gotta time our attacks just right! Hold out until you spot an opening!
Dialogue: Gotta time our attacks just right! Hold out until you spot an opening!

Original: Barret: Hell yeah! You see the damage that did!?
Dialogue: Hell yeah! You see the damage that did!?

Original: Cloud: Keep it up!
Dialogue: Keep it up!

Original: Barret: We barely scratched the damn thing!
Dialogue: We barely scratched the damn thing!

Original: Cloud: Didn't I tell you to use magic!?
Dialogue: Didn't I tell you to use magic!?

Original: Barret: Thought you were full of shit.
Dialogue: Thought you were full of shit.

Original: Cloud: Think whatever you wantjust do it!
Dialogue: Think whatever you want—just do it!

Original: Barret: Damn pain in the ass...
Dialogue: Damn pain in the ass...

Original: Barret: Got anything you wanna say?
Dialogue: Got anything you wanna say?

Original: Barret: Funny way to ask for help.
Dialogue: Funny way to ask for help.

Original: Barret: Shit. Was just about to get you out.
Dialogue: Shit. Was just about to get you out.

Original: Cloud: Wasn't expecting you to do jack...
Dialogue: Wasn't expecting you to do jack...

Original: Barret: Pretty quick for a heap of scrap!
Dialogue: Pretty quick for a heap of scrap!

Original: Barret: The hell is that!?
Dialogue: The hell is that!?

Original: Cloud: A barrier? Never seen this defense system before...
Dialogue: A barrier? Never seen this defense system before...

Original: Barret: Thought you were the expert!
Dialogue: Thought you were the expert!

Original: Cloud: So what's your brilliant plan, genius?
Dialogue: So what's your brilliant plan, genius?

Original: Cloud: There! Attack it from the rear!
Dialogue: There! Attack it from the rear!

Original: Barret: Aight, SOLDIER boy! Show me what you got!
Dialogue: Aight, SOLDIER boy! Show me what you got!

Original: Cloud: Bingo. Focus on that core!
Dialogue: Bingo. Focus on that core!

Original: Barret: Oh,nowhe remembers. Don't keep me waiting in suspense next time!
Dialogue: Oh, now he remembers. Don't keep me waiting in suspense next time!

Original: Barret: Huh!? It didn't work!?
Dialogue: Huh!? It didn't work!?

Original: Barret: Dammit! Gotta do something about that barrier first!
Dialogue: Dammit! Gotta do something about that barrier first!

Original: Barret: Damn, this thing is tough!
Dialogue: Damn, this thing is tough!

Original: Cloud: Wouldn't be much of a weapon if it went down easy.
Dialogue: Wouldn't be much of a weapon if it went down easy.

Original: Barret: Don't compliment the giant scorpion!
Dialogue: Don't compliment the giant scorpion!

Original: Barret: (chuckles) It's my time to shine!
Dialogue: (chuckles) It's my time to shine!

Original: Cloud: Or go down in flames...
Dialogue: Or go down in flames...

Original: Cloud: Another barrier!?
Dialogue: Another barrier!?

Original: Barret: Enough with the barriers!
Dialogue: Enough with the barriers!

Original: Cloud: Watch the tail! You don't want to get hit by that laser!
Dialogue: Watch the tail! You don't want to get hit by that laser!

Original: Barret: Huh!? So, whadda we do!?
Dialogue: Huh!? So, whadda we do!?

Original: Cloud: Don't get hit! Take cover behind that debris.
Dialogue: Don't get hit! Take cover behind that debris.

Original: Cloud: Now! Go!
Dialogue: Now! Go!

Original: Barret: Now! Get in there and do some damage!
Dialogue: Now! Get in there and do some damage!

Original: Barret: It's wide open! Gonna light it up!
Dialogue: It's wide open! Gonna light it up!

Original: Cloud: Heads uptail laser!
Dialogue: Heads up—tail laser!

Original: Barret: I see it!
Dialogue: I see it!

Original: Cloud: Then take cover already!
Dialogue: Then take cover already!

Original: Cloud: Incomingtake cover!
Dialogue: Incoming—take cover!

Original: Barret: There really no other option?
Dialogue: There really no other option?

Original: Cloud: Wanna get shot? Be my guest!
Dialogue: Wanna get shot? Be my guest!

Original: Barret: Hey, it's doing that thing again!
Dialogue: Hey, it's doing that thing again!

Original: Cloud: Find cover and hunker down!
Dialogue: Find cover and hunker down!

Original: Barret: Again and again and again!
Dialogue: Again and again and again!

Original: Cloud: Now! Go!
Dialogue: Now! Go!

Original: Barret: Aw, hell, what's it doing now!?
Dialogue: Aw, hell, what's it doing now!?

Original: Cloud: An auto-repair unit? Dammitwe gotta take it out quick or we're screwed!
Dialogue: An auto-repair unit? Dammit—we gotta take it out quick or we're screwed!

Original: Barret: Oh, I am way ahead of you, merc!
Dialogue: Oh, I am way ahead of you, merc!

Original: Barret: When I get my chance, I'm gonna blow this bastard the hell up! And that's a promise!
Dialogue: When I get my chance, I'm gonna blow this bastard the hell up! And that's a promise!

Original: Cloud: Gotta time our attacks just right! Hold out until you spot an opening!
Dialogue: Gotta time our attacks just right! Hold out until you spot an opening!

Original: Cloud: It's down! Rain hell on it!
Dialogue: It's down! Rain hell on it!

Original: Barret: Ain't gotta tell me twice!
Dialogue: Ain't gotta tell me twice!

Original: Cloud: There goes another! Now's our chance to do some real damage!
Dialogue: There goes another! Now's our chance to do some real damage!

Original: Barret: Shit! The bomb!
Dialogue: Shit! The bomb!

Original: Announcement: Twenty minutes until detonation.
Dialogue: Twenty minutes until detonation.

Original: Announcement: Thirty minutes until detonation.
Dialogue: Thirty minutes until detonation.

Original: Barret: Hah, you hear that? Damn thing showed you how it's done!
Dialogue: Hah, you hear that? Damn thing showed you how it's done!

Original: Cloud: Come on, we've gotta move.
Dialogue: Come on, we've gotta move.

Original: Barret: Wedge should be covering our way out! Go, go, go!
Dialogue: Wedge should be covering our way out! Go, go, go!

Original: Cloud: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Jessie: Do I look okay!? Help a girl out, would ya!?
Dialogue: Do I look okay!? Help a girl out, would ya!?

Original: Jessie: My hero!
Dialogue: My hero!

Original: Barret: Hey! We'll link up over there! Look after Jessie!
Dialogue: Hey! We'll link up over there! Look after Jessie!

Original: Jessie: Come this way! This route should lead us straight to Barret! Probably!
Dialogue: Come this way! This route should lead us straight to Barret! Probably!

Original: Jessie: I think I see an exit. Come on!
Dialogue: I think I see an exit. Come on!

Original: Jessie: Don't look back! Let's go, let's go, let's go!
Dialogue: Don't look back! Let's go, let's go, let's go!

Original: Jessie: We're running out of time!
Dialogue: We're running out of time!

Original: Cloud: Shut up and climb. You're not helping.
Dialogue: Shut up and climb. You're not helping.

Original: Jessie: Sorry, it just It keeps me focused! I'll freak out if I don't talk!
Dialogue: Sorry, it just— It keeps me focused! I'll freak out if I don't talk!

Original: Cloud: Have it your way.
Dialogue: Have it your way.

Original: Jessie: Barret
Dialogue: Barret—

Original: Barret: I've got you covered. Find us a way outta here!
Dialogue: I've got you covered. Find us a way outta here!

Original: Jessie: But then
Dialogue: But then—

Original: Barret: Don't worry, I'll be fine. I've got SOLDIER boy with me!
Dialogue: Don't worry, I'll be fine. I've got SOLDIER boy with me!

Original: Cloud: Ex-SOLDIER boy.
Dialogue: Ex-SOLDIER boy.

Original: Security Officer (1): They're here!
Dialogue: They're here!

Original: Security Officer (2): Take 'em down!
Dialogue: Take 'em down!

Original: Barret: We don't have time for this shit! The clock's ticking!
Dialogue: We don't have time for this shit! The clock's ticking!

Original: Cloud: Cool it. Five seconds is all we need.
Dialogue: Cool it. Five seconds is all we need.

Original: Barret: You don't look so good. Take care of those wounds before you bleed out.
Dialogue: You don't look so good. Take care of those wounds before you bleed out.

Original: Barret: Let's go! The others are waiting! Gotta get the hell outta here ASAP...
Dialogue: Let's go! The others are waiting! Gotta get the hell outta here ASAP...

Original: Barret: Ugh! This is all we need!
Dialogue: Ugh! This is all we need!

Original: Cloud: You got that right.
Dialogue: You got that right.

Original: Barret: Heads up! We got a whole lotta company!
Dialogue: Heads up! We got a whole lotta company!

Original: Cloud: No shit.
Dialogue: No shit.

Original: Barret: Whoa! Ain't you a feisty one!
Dialogue: Whoa! Ain't you a feisty one!

Original: Cloud: Like a rook seeing his first action...
Dialogue: Like a rook seeing his first action...

Original: Heidegger: Sir.
Dialogue: Sir.

Original: Barret: Come on...come on, come on, come on!
Dialogue: Come on...come on, come on, come on!

Original: Jessie: Door's open!
Dialogue: Door's open!

Original: Barret: Bada-bing bada-boombam!
Dialogue: Bada-bing bada-boom—bam!

Original: Jessie: We don't have a lot of time here! Pick up the pace, people!
Dialogue: We don't have a lot of time here! Pick up the pace, people!

Original: Wedge: Over here! This way!
Dialogue: Over here! This way!

Original: Cloud: Can you walk?
Dialogue: Can you walk?

Original: Jessie: If I couldn't, believe me, you'd be the first to know.
Dialogue: If I couldn't, believe me, you'd be the first to know.

Original: Cloud: I'll take that as a yes.
Dialogue: I'll take that as a yes.

Original: Jessie: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Jessie: Okay,thatwas pretty cool.
Dialogue: Okay, that was pretty cool.

Original: Jessie: All right. Come on!
Dialogue: All right. Come on!

Original: Barret: Looks like we made it. And with nothing but a few scratches to show
Dialogue: Looks like we made it. And with nothing but a few scratches to show—

Original: Barret: Think you might've overdone it?
Dialogue: Think you might've overdone it?

Original: Jessie: I followed the instructions to the letter. Maybe it triggered a reaction with the mako?
Dialogue: I followed the instructions to the letter. Maybe it triggered a reaction with the mako?

Original: Barret: Well, let's hope this city's still in one piece.
Dialogue: Well, let's hope this city's still in one piece.

Original: Biggs: But the planet's what matters, right?
Dialogue: But the planet's what matters, right?

Original: Biggs: I mean...this must've helpedsome.
Dialogue: I mean...this must've helped some.

Original: Jessie: After all that, it better have. Anyway, let's get going. We in Sector 8?
Dialogue: After all that, it better have. Anyway, let's get going. We in Sector 8?

Original: Wedge: That'd be just down there!
Dialogue: That'd be just down there!

Original: Barret: All right, then. Lead the way.
Dialogue: All right, then. Lead the way.

Original: Wedge: You got it!
Dialogue: You got it!

Original: Wedge: Watch out for live wires. They're everywhere.
Dialogue: Watch out for live wires. They're everywhere.

Original: Biggs: Ugh, the air in here reeks. Can't wait to get out in the open!
Dialogue: Ugh, the air in here reeks. Can't wait to get out in the open!

Original: Biggs: (sniffs) Man, whatisthat? I've never smelled anything so foul. (sniffs) Aw, it's me. Gotta do something about that, and soon.
Dialogue: (sniffs) Man, what is that? I've never smelled anything so foul. (sniffs) Aw, it's me. Gotta do something about that, and soon.

Original: Wedge: I felt that one in my guts...
Dialogue: I felt that one in my guts...

Original: Biggs: They just keep on coming.
Dialogue: They just keep on coming.

Original: Barret: We need to get out of this place.
Dialogue: We need to get out of this place.

Original: Jessie: Was it the mako density? The primary explosive? The blasting agent?
Dialogue: Was it the mako density? The primary explosive? The blasting agent?

Original: Biggs: Hey, we can figure that out later.
Dialogue: Hey, we can figure that out later.

Original: Wedge: Ugh. I'm running on empty here...
Dialogue: Ugh. I'm running on empty here...

Original: Barret: You can refuel at the base.
Dialogue: You can refuel at the base.

Original: Wedge: Next time, I'll have to bring a little pick-me-up.
Dialogue: Next time, I'll have to bring a little pick-me-up.

Original: Jessie: How much farther do we have to go?
Dialogue: How much farther do we have to go?

Original: Wedge: Not far!
Dialogue: Not far!

Original: Wedge: That's about as good a place as any.
Dialogue: That's about as good a place as any.

Original: Jessie: Stand back then. I'll set the bomb.
Dialogue: Stand back then. I'll set the bomb.

Original: Barret: Can't wait to see you, Marlene.
Dialogue: Can't wait to see you, Marlene.

Original: Biggs: Can't wait to take a hot shower.
Dialogue: Can't wait to take a hot shower.

Original: Jessie: She's good to go.
Dialogue: She's good to go.

Original: Jessie: Fire in the hole!
Dialogue: Fire in the hole!

Original: Biggs: You sure told those doors.
Dialogue: You sure told those doors.

Original: Jessie: Let that be a lesson to anything that gets in my way!
Dialogue: Let that be a lesson to anything that gets in my way!

Original: On-screen: Sector 8 Business District
Dialogue: Sector 8 Business District

Original: Announcement: Attention all citizens. Attention all citizens. This is an alert from the Shinra Emergency Operations Center. Unidentified intruders have detonated a bomb inside Mako Reactor 1. Multiple explosions have been confirmed, as well as ongoing fires. In response, a disaster warning has been issued in Sectors 1 and 8. Structures in the area are at high risk of collapse, rendering the entire sector hazardous.
Dialogue: Attention all citizens. Attention all citizens. This is an alert from the Shinra Emergency Operations Center. Unidentified intruders have detonated a bomb inside Mako Reactor 1. Multiple explosions have been confirmed, as well as ongoing fires. In response, a disaster warning has been issued in Sectors 1 and 8. Structures in the area are at high risk of collapse, rendering the entire sector hazardous.

Original: Jessie: No... No way.
Dialogue: No... No way.

Original: Biggs: This couldn't have been us...could it?
Dialogue: This couldn't have been us...could it?

Original: Wedge: But what if it was...?
Dialogue: But what if it was...?

Original: Cloud: What's done is done.
Dialogue: What's done is done.

Original: Barret: Merc's right. It ain't pretty, but we can't stop now. This was just the first reactor. And the planet won't be safe till we get the rest.
Dialogue: Merc's right. It ain't pretty, but we can't stop now. This was just the first reactor. And the planet won't be safe till we get the rest.

Original: Biggs: Yeah... We always knew this was gonna get messy.
Dialogue: Yeah... We always knew this was gonna get messy.

Original: Wedge: And this is only the beginning...
Dialogue: And this is only the beginning...

Original: Barret: Y'all gotta look at the bigger picture here. Nothing worth fighting for was ever won without sacrifice. Though you may not be crying out, I know you're in painjust like the planet. But it's okay, 'cause I'm here for you! To help take the load off your shoulders!
Dialogue: Y'all gotta look at the bigger picture here. Nothing worth fighting for was ever won without sacrifice. Though you may not be crying out, I know you're in pain—just like the planet. But it's okay, 'cause I'm here for you! To help take the load off your shoulders!

Original: Barret: Your fears... Your worries... Your concerns... And yes, your fees... Whatever your problem, I got you.
Dialogue: Your fears... Your worries... Your concerns... And yes, your fees... Whatever your problem, I got you.

Original: Biggs: So, what's our next move, boss?
Dialogue: So, what's our next move, boss?

Original: Barret: That's easy enough! We get our asses home!
Dialogue: That's easy enough! We get our asses home!

Original: Barret: We'll split up and shoot for the last train home. Regroup in the freight car. Got it?
Dialogue: We'll split up and shoot for the last train home. Regroup in the freight car. Got it?

Original: Wedge: Later then!
Dialogue: Later then!

Original: Cloud: Hey. I'd like my money now.
Dialogue: Hey. I'd like my money now.

Original: Barret: You can have itonce we'reback at base.
Dialogue: You can have it—once we're back at base.

Original: Jessie: Yoo-hoo.
Dialogue: Yoo-hoo.

Original: Jessie: I don't need to tell you what this is, right?
Dialogue: I don't need to tell you what this is, right?

Original: Cloud: Of course not. It's healing materia.
Dialogue: Of course not. It's healing materia.

Original: Jessie: You can have it. For saving my life.
Dialogue: You can have it. For saving my life.

Original: Cloud: Just doing my job. Nothing more.
Dialogue: Just doing my job. Nothing more.

Original: Jessie: Yeah, yeah... Fact is, I'm lucky you were there.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah... Fact is, I'm lucky you were there.

Original: Cloud: Survival can be a matter of luck or skill. And you can't rely on luck.
Dialogue: Survival can be a matter of luck or skill. And you can't rely on luck.

Original: Jessie: Words to live by!
Dialogue: Words to live by!

Original: Cloud: Yeah, well...thanks.
Dialogue: Yeah, well...thanks.

Original: Jessie: You do know how to use it, right?
Dialogue: You do know how to use it, right?

Original: Cloud: You do know what I was, right?
Dialogue: You do know what I was, right?

Original: Jessie: Okay! I was only trying to help.
Dialogue: Okay! I was only trying to help.

Original: Jessie: Ohbefore I forget, here's a little something extra, for being so brave. That really was the ride of a lifetime... Well, see you on the train!
Dialogue: Oh—before I forget, here's a little something extra, for being so brave. That really was the ride of a lifetime... Well, see you on the train!

Original: Jessie: Cloud! Up here! Look up! I said lookup!
Dialogue: Cloud! Up here! Look up! I said look up!

Original: Jessie: I said lookup!
Dialogue: I said look up!

Original: Jessie: I give up. If you ever get up here, just be careful you don't fall, okay?
Dialogue: I give up. If you ever get up here, just be careful you don't fall, okay?

Original: Jessie: Careful up here! This could collapse at any moment! If you want up, you'll have to use those stairs!
Dialogue: Careful up here! This could collapse at any moment! If you want up, you'll have to use those stairs!

Original: Cloud: Station's intact.
Dialogue: Station's intact.

Original: Cloud: What the...?
Dialogue: What the...?

Original: Cloud: How...!?
Cloud: He couldn't be... But then...
Dialogue: He couldn't be... But then...

Original: Cloud: The hell...?
Dialogue: The hell...?

Original: Cloud: Wait...
Dialogue: Wait...

Original: Cloud: You're not real... You're... ...dead!
Dialogue: You're not real... You're... ...dead!

Original: Sephiroth: I am?
Dialogue: I am?

Original: Cloud: I killed you with my own
Dialogue: I killed you with my own—

Original: Sephiroth: Oh, you need not remind me. It was the crowning moment of our time together. But that was then, and this is now. I have a favor to ask.
Dialogue: Oh, you need not remind me. It was the crowning moment of our time together. But that was then, and this is now. I have a favor to ask.

Original: Sephiroth: Our beloved planet is dying. Slowly. Silently. Painfully. Can you bear to see the planet suffer... Cloud?
Dialogue: Our beloved planet is dying. Slowly. Silently. Painfully. Can you bear to see the planet suffer... Cloud?

Original: Cloud: Mom... Mom...
Dialogue: Mom... Mom...

Original: Sephiroth: Were the planet to die, so many things would be lost. Your hometown that burns so bright... The sound of her voice pleading for me to spare you. The shiver of her flesh yielding to cold steel.
Dialogue: Were the planet to die, so many things would be lost. Your hometown that burns so bright... The sound of her voice pleading for me to spare you. The shiver of her flesh yielding to cold steel.

Original: Sephiroth: That which binds us together would be no more. And I would be loath to live in such a world. Which is why I must ask you this one favor. Don't worry. It's a simple thing.
Dialogue: That which binds us together would be no more. And I would be loath to live in such a world. Which is why I must ask you this one favor. Don't worry. It's a simple thing.

Original: Sephiroth: Run, Cloud... Run away. You have to leave... You have to live.
Dialogue: Run, Cloud... Run away. You have to leave... You have to live.

Original: Cloud: You bastard!
Dialogue: You bastard!

Original: Cloud: I'm seeing things. Fumes from all the mako, maybe. All right. You got this.
Dialogue: I'm seeing things. Fumes from all the mako, maybe. All right. You got this.

Original: Topside Resident (1): Shooting for the station? Take the alley and climb up to the roof of that building at the end and you're practically there.
Dialogue: Shooting for the station? Take the alley and climb up to the roof of that building at the end and you're practically there.

Original: Topside Resident (2): If you make it that far...
Dialogue: If you make it that far...

Original: Topside Resident (2): Sure, we could try the alley, but is getting to the station really worth breaking our necks over?
Dialogue: Sure, we could try the alley, but is getting to the station really worth breaking our necks over?

Original: Topside Resident (1): Yes, because we won't.
Dialogue: Yes, because we won't.

Original: Cloud: Man... What a mess.
Dialogue: Man... What a mess.

Original: On-screen: Loveless Street
Dialogue: Loveless Street

Original: Security Officer: Don't let the intruder escape!
Dialogue: Don't let the intruder escape!

Original: Cloud: Security's everywhere...
Dialogue: Security's everywhere...

Original: Security Officer: He must be close.
Dialogue: He must be close.

Original: Cloud: No need to make it harder for yourself.
Dialogue: No need to make it harder for yourself.

Original: Sephiroth: You are too weak to save anyone. Not even yourself.
Dialogue: You are too weak to save anyone. Not even yourself.

Original: Flower Peddler: Hey... Are you okay?
Dialogue: Hey... Are you okay?

Original: Cloud: I'm fine.
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Original: Flower Peddler: Here. This is for you.
Dialogue: Here. This is for you.

Original: Cloud: A flower?
Dialogue: A flower?

Original: Flower Peddler: That's right. It's a gift. You know, for scaring those things away.
Dialogue: That's right. It's a gift. You know, for scaring those things away.

Original: Cloud: What things?
Dialogue: What things?

Original: Flower Peddler: Never mind. Think of it as a memento.
Dialogue: Never mind. Think of it as a memento.

Original: Cloud: Just my luck...
Dialogue: Just my luck...

Original: Flower Peddler: I heard that, you know.
Dialogue: I heard that, you know.

Original: On-screen: Here. This is for you.
Dialogue: Here. This is for you.

Original: Cloud: How much?
Dialogue: How much?

Original: Flower Peddler: Well, that depends on the customer. In your case... It's on the house.
Dialogue: Well, that depends on the customer. In your case... It's on the house.

Original: Cloud: I'm good.
Dialogue: I'm good.

Original: Flower Peddler: Oh, don't be like that. I know you want one. When was the last time you saw a real flower, huh? Plus, it'll make your girlfriend's day. I guarantee it.
Dialogue: Oh, don't be like that. I know you want one. When was the last time you saw a real flower, huh? Plus, it'll make your girlfriend's day. I guarantee it.

Original: Cloud: How much?
Dialogue: How much?

Original: Flower Peddler: Well, that depends on the customer. In your case... It's on the house.
Dialogue: Well, that depends on the customer. In your case... It's on the house.

Original: Cloud: Enough already. I'll give you two gil for it.
Dialogue: Enough already. I'll give you two gil for it.

Original: Flower Peddler:Two measly gil!? For a real flower? Come on.
Dialogue: Two measly gil!? For a real flower? Come on.

Original: Cloud: Five then.Flower Peddler:Please, that's not nearly enough. Besides, I clearly said it was on the
Dialogue: Five then.Flower PeddlerPlease, that's not nearly enough. Besides, I clearly said it was on the—

Original: Flower Peddler: You're trying to get rid of me! For five lousy gil! Sorry, but your plan won't work.
Dialogue: You're trying to get rid of me! For five lousy gil! Sorry, but your plan won't work.

Original: Flower Peddler: Lovers used to give these when they were reunited...
Dialogue: Lovers used to give these when they were reunited...

Original: Cloud: Look, I'm involved in things. Dangerous things.
Dialogue: Look, I'm involved in things. Dangerous things.

Original: Flower Peddler: Oh, I'm sure you are. So?
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sure you are. So?

Original: Cloud: So keep your distance.
Dialogue: So keep your distance.

Original: Flower Peddler: Waityou think someone's out to get you? Is that what you're all worked up about? Relax. No one's going to attack you. I promise.
Dialogue: Wait—you think someone's out to get you? Is that what you're all worked up about? Relax. No one's going to attack you. I promise.

Original: Cloud: Hey, a mako reactor just blew. You shouldn't be out here trying to sell fl
Dialogue: Hey, a mako reactor just blew. You shouldn't be out here trying to sell fl—

Original: Flower Peddler: Help me!
Dialogue: Help me!

Original: Flower Peddler: What are they?
Dialogue: What are they?

Original: Security Officer: Drop your weapon!
Dialogue: Drop your weapon!

Original: Cloud: Are you blind...?
Dialogue: Are you blind...?

Original: Flower Peddler: You knowyou're right!
Dialogue: You know—you're right!

Original: Cloud: WhaWait!
Dialogue: Wha—Wait!

Original: Flower Peddler: Nice meeting you!
Dialogue: Nice meeting you!

Original: Security Officer: Sword on the ground! Right now!
Dialogue: Sword on the ground! Right now!

Original: Captain: That bastard couldn't have gotten far. Stay alert!
Dialogue: That bastard couldn't have gotten far. Stay alert!

Original: Cloud: Don't wanna stick around here.
Dialogue: Don't wanna stick around here.

Original: Captain: Arrestanyonewho looks suspicious!
Dialogue: Arrest anyone who looks suspicious!

Original: Cloud: Gonna have to find a way around.
Dialogue: Gonna have to find a way around.

Original: Captain: The suspect is armed and dangerous. Be on your guard!
Dialogue: The suspect is armed and dangerous. Be on your guard!

Original: Cloud: So much for the direct route.
Dialogue: So much for the direct route.

Original: Security Officer: Hey! You there!
Dialogue: Hey! You there!

Original: Security Officer (1): You!
Dialogue: You!

Original: Security Officer (1): There he is! You're not going anywhere!
Dialogue: There he is! You're not going anywhere!

Original: Security Officer (2): HQ, this is Sector 8 Unit 4. We have eyes on the target! We need backup! I repeat: this is 8-4 requesting immediate backup!
Dialogue: HQ, this is Sector 8 Unit 4. We have eyes on the target! We need backup! I repeat this is 8-4 requesting immediate backup!

Original: Security Officer: All clear.
Dialogue: All clear.

Original: Security Officer (1): Just give it up!
Dialogue: Just give it up!

Original: Security Officer (2): Don't run!
Dialogue: Don't run!

Original: Security Officer (1): Sic 'em!
Dialogue: Sic 'em!

Original: Security Officer (3): Box him in! Box him in!
Dialogue: Box him in! Box him in!

Original: Security Officer (4): There's nowhere to run!
Dialogue: There's nowhere to run!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Target sighted. I repeat, target sighted.
Dialogue: Target sighted. I repeat, target sighted.

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Shock troopers, prep for immediate deployment!
Dialogue: Shock troopers, prep for immediate deployment!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Troopers on standby!
Dialogue: Troopers on standby!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: You are clear to engage!
Dialogue: You are clear to engage!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Be advisedtarget is headed for the station!
Dialogue: Be advised—target is headed for the station!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Enemy combatantyou are surrounded! Lay down your weapon and surrender!
Dialogue: Enemy combatant—you are surrounded! Lay down your weapon and surrender!

Original: Security Officer (5): Don't let him escape!
Dialogue: Don't let him escape!

Original: Security Officer (6): Give up!
Dialogue: Give up!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Ground forces engaging target in fountain plaza! All nearby units converge and provide immediate support!
Dialogue: Ground forces engaging target in fountain plaza! All nearby units converge and provide immediate support!

Original: Security Officer (7): There's no way out.
Dialogue: There's no way out.

Original: Security Officer (8): Move in!
Dialogue: Move in!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Requesting immediate reinforcements at fountain plaza!
Dialogue: Requesting immediate reinforcements at fountain plaza!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Target still mobile! Support, proceed to rally point at the station.
Dialogue: Target still mobile! Support, proceed to rally point at the station.

Original: Cloud: So much for the direct route. Find another way... Use the rooftops, maybe...
Dialogue: So much for the direct route. Find another way... Use the rooftops, maybe...

Original: Security Officer: Don't let him get away, no matter what!
Dialogue: Don't let him get away, no matter what!

Original: Cloud: ...But the rooftops look clear.
Dialogue: ...But the rooftops look clear.

Original: Security Officer (1): Over there!
Dialogue: Over there!

Original: Security Officer (2): Open fire! Shoot to kill!
Dialogue: Open fire! Shoot to kill!

Original: Cloud: Close call.
Dialogue: Close call.

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Be advisedtarget approaching residential area. Seal all access immediately!
Dialogue: Be advised—target approaching residential area. Seal all access immediately!

Original: Security Officer: Target sighted! Get him!
Dialogue: Target sighted! Get him!

Original: Cloud: It's all or nothing now...
Dialogue: It's all or nothing now...

Original: On-screen: Sector 8 Residential Area
Dialogue: Sector 8 Residential Area

Original: Security Officer: Don't underestimate him!
Dialogue: Don't underestimate him!

Original: Security Officer: I see him!
Dialogue: I see him!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Confirmedtarget has entered residential area!
Dialogue: Confirmed—target has entered residential area!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Full lockdown is in effect! All units
Dialogue: Full lockdown is in effect! All units—

Original: Security Officer (1): I have eyes on the target.
Dialogue: I have eyes on the target.

Original: Security Officer (2): You're mine now.
Dialogue: You're mine now.

Original: Security Officer: Target spotted! Moving to intercept!
Dialogue: Target spotted! Moving to intercept!

Original: Security Officer: He's here!
Dialogue: He's here!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: Enemy combatantyou have been warned! Surrender yourself to Public Security immediately!
Dialogue: Enemy combatant—you have been warned! Surrender yourself to Public Security immediately!

Original: Security Officer: Not so fast!
Dialogue: Not so fast!

Original: Shinra Helicopter: You have nowhere to run!
Dialogue: You have nowhere to run!

Original: Security Officer (1): End of the line, punk!
Dialogue: End of the line, punk!

Original: Security Officer (2): I'm gonna enjoy this!
Dialogue: I'm gonna enjoy this!

Original: Security Officer (1): Move in!
Dialogue: Move in!

Original: Security Officer (2): Don't let him escape!
Dialogue: Don't let him escape!

Original: Security Officer (3): HQ, this is Sector 8 Unit 2. Target is surrounded. Moving to secure.
Dialogue: HQ, this is Sector 8 Unit 2. Target is surrounded. Moving to secure.

Original: Security Officer (4): Wait! I know that
Dialogue: Wait! I know that—

Original: Wedge: Guess Cloud won't be joining us after all...
Dialogue: Guess Cloud won't be joining us after all...

Original: Biggs: No need to assume the worst. I'm sure he's fine. You saw him in action, didn't you? Guy's a SOLDIER. Goddamn one-man army.
Dialogue: No need to assume the worst. I'm sure he's fine. You saw him in action, didn't you? Guy's a SOLDIER. Goddamn one-man army.

Original: Jessie': Mmm, you think he's a keeper?
Dialogue: Mmm, you think he's a keeper?

Original: Barret: On my go.
Dialogue: On my go.

Original: Barret: Ugh, you had me worried for a minute...
Dialogue: Ugh, you had me worried for a minute...

Original: Barret: What the hell you been up to? Huh!?
Dialogue: What the hell you been up to? Huh!?

Original: Cloud: Giving Public Security the runaround, that's what. Had to draw them away from the station somehow.
Dialogue: Giving Public Security the runaround, that's what. Had to draw them away from the station somehow.

Original: Jessie: Nicely done.
Dialogue: Nicely done.

Original: Cloud: Wait. Got a question for you all.
Dialogue: Wait. Got a question for you all.

Original: Barret: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Cloud: Ever been attacked by an invisible enemy?
Dialogue: Ever been attacked by an invisible enemy?

Original: Cloud: Wearing robes. Came and went like the wind.
Dialogue: Wearing robes. Came and went like the wind.

Original: Biggs: Thought they were invisible.
Dialogue: Thought they were invisible.

Original: Cloud: They wereat first. Only saw them after she grabbed me...
Dialogue: They were—at first. Only saw them after she grabbed me...

Original: Jessie: A new Shinra weapon, maybe?
Dialogue: A new Shinra weapon, maybe?

Original: Barret: Hah! More like a panic-induced hallucination!
Dialogue: Hah! More like a panic-induced hallucination!

Original: Cloud: Never mind. Forget I said anything.
Dialogue: Never mind. Forget I said anything.

Original: Barret: Suit yourself. C'mon, let's move up.
Dialogue: Suit yourself. C'mon, let's move up.

Original: Wedge: Lotta people here.
Dialogue: Lotta people here.

Original: Jessie: And in the freight car, too...
Dialogue: And in the freight car, too...

Original: Biggs: 'Cause of the evacuation order, maybe?
Dialogue: Cause of the evacuation order, maybe?

Original: Barret: Lucky us. We've got a crowd to hide in. Head for the front of the train and hold there.
Dialogue: Lucky us. We've got a crowd to hide in. Head for the front of the train and hold there.

Original: Announcer: Due to an explosion at Mako Reactor 1, an emergency schedule is now in effect. Your understanding and cooperation is appreciated.
Dialogue: Due to an explosion at Mako Reactor 1, an emergency schedule is now in effect. Your understanding and cooperation is appreciated.

Original: Wedge: Ugh, so cramped...
Dialogue: Ugh, so cramped...

Original: Wedge: Man, everyone's on edge.
Dialogue: Man, everyone's on edge.

Original: Cloud: Of course they are.
Dialogue: Of course they are.

Original: Wedge: Hey, Cloud, I...um...
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud, I...um...

Original: Cloud: If you're about to "unburden" yourselfdon't.
Dialogue: If you're about to "unburden" yourself—don't.

Original: Wedge: Yeesh... You don't make it easy...
Dialogue: Yeesh... You don't make it easy...

Original: Biggs: Hey, got a sec?
Dialogue: Hey, got a sec?

Original: Biggs: You're uh...holding up pretty well, huh? Even after what we saw at the station and all over Sector 8?
Dialogue: You're uh...holding up pretty well, huh? Even after what we saw at the station and all over Sector 8?

Original: Cloud: I'm a SOLDIER.
Dialogue: I'm a SOLDIER.

Original: Biggs: Well...my hands are still shaking.
Dialogue: Well...my hands are still shaking.

Original: Cloud: You get used to it.
Dialogue: You get used to it.

Original: Biggs: Something to look forward to... Or maybe not.
Dialogue: Something to look forward to... Or maybe not.

Original: Jessie: Little help, Cloud? Please?
Dialogue: Little help, Cloud? Please?

Original: Jessie: I can't stop thinking about it. The bomb I made shouldn't have produced an explosion that big. It doesn't make any sense...
Dialogue: I can't stop thinking about it. The bomb I made shouldn't have produced an explosion that big. It doesn't make any sense...

Original: Cloud: The explosion triggered a reaction with the mako. You said so yourself.
Dialogue: The explosion triggered a reaction with the mako. You said so yourself.

Original: Jessie: That was my first guessbut shouldn't a reactor have failsafes to prevent that kinda thing? You mentioned "invisible enemies" back there, right?
Dialogue: That was my first guess—but shouldn't a reactor have fail—safes to prevent that kinda thing? You mentioned "invisible enemies" back there, right?

Original: Cloud: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Jessie: Hmm... No. I'm just looking for excuses for something that was clearly my own fault. Gotta own up to it if I'm gonna learn from this and move on. Thanks, Cloud. You're a good listener.
Dialogue: Hmm... No. I'm just looking for excuses for something that was clearly my own fault. Gotta own up to it if I'm gonna learn from this and move on. Thanks, Cloud. You're a good listener.

Original: Shinra Employee (1): What kind of maniacs would go so far as to bomb a reactor?
Dialogue: What kind of maniacs would go so far as to bomb a reactor?

Original: Shinra Employee (2): They've yet to announce it publicly, but I heard it was Avalanche's doing.
Dialogue: They've yet to announce it publicly, but I heard it was Avalanche's doing.

Original: Shinra Employee (1): Really? Aren't they the terrorists who tried to kill the president?
Dialogue: Really? Aren't they the terrorists who tried to kill the president?

Original: Shinra Employee (3): Is there nothing they won't do?
Dialogue: Is there nothing they won't do?

Original: Barret: Hey! Quit talking out your ass. Everyone knows Avalanche only cares about saving the planet.
Dialogue: Hey! Quit talking out your ass. Everyone knows Avalanche only cares about saving the planet.

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: J-just who do you think you are?
Dialogue: J-just who do you think you are?

Original: Barret: A law-abiding concerned citizen.
Dialogue: A law-abiding concerned citizen.

Original: Shinra Employee (1): "Law-abiding"? Really?
Dialogue: "Law-abiding"? Really?

Original: Shinra Employee (2): Don't antagonize him!
Dialogue: Don't antagonize him!

Original: Barret: In my humble opinion, that explosion was a messagea message to the bastards bleeding our planet dry. Think they got it? Heard it loud and clear? Y'all's masters?
Dialogue: In my humble opinion, that explosion was a message—a message to the bastards bleeding our planet dry. Think they got it? Heard it loud and clear? Y'all's masters?

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: We will not submit to intimidation or violence! But work together for peace and prosperity! That is how civilized people change the world!
Dialogue: We will not submit to intimidation or violence! But work together for peace and prosperity! That is how civilized people change the world!

Original: Shinra Employee (1): That's right!
Dialogue: That's right!

Original: Shinra Employee (2): That is the Shinra creed!
Dialogue: That is the Shinra creed!

Original: Barret: Hmph. Them's fighting words.
Dialogue: Hmph. Them's fighting words.

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: It's what we believe. We all have to follow our conscience, don't we?
Dialogue: It's what we believe. We all have to follow our conscience, don't we?

Original: Shinra Employee (3): We should go.
Dialogue: We should go.

Original: Wedge:You got somewhere you need to be?
Dialogue: You got somewhere you need to be?

Original: Biggs:Don't wander off, huh?
Dialogue: Don't wander off, huh?

Original: Barret:Quit acting like a damn kid. I ain't in the mood.
Dialogue: Quit acting like a damn kid. I ain't in the mood.

Original: Jessie:Cloud! Over here.
Dialogue: Cloud! Over here.

Original: Jessie: Let's get this out of the way... Personally, I find visual aids make the dull stuff a lot more bearable. If it helps, think of it as an initiation rite.
Dialogue: Let's get this out of the way... Personally, I find visual aids make the dull stuff a lot more bearable. If it helps, think of it as an initiation rite.

Original: Cloud: How many times do I have to tell you people. I'm not
Dialogue: How many times do I have to tell you people. I'm not—

Original: Jessie: Shh. There's such a thing as playing too hard to get.
Dialogue: Shh. There's such a thing as playing too hard to get.

Original: Jessie: So, here we've got a wireframe model of the great city of Midgar. Complete with massive steel plates suspended three hundred meters above ground level... Atop which stands a shining beacon of civilization. The whole system is sustained by the mako reactors, which feed the insatiable appetites of the public.
Dialogue: So, here we've got a wireframe model of the great city of Midgar. Complete with massive steel plates suspended three hundred meters above ground level... Atop which stands a shining beacon of civilization. The whole system is sustained by the mako reactors, which feed the insatiable appetites of the public.

Original: Announcement: The train will be passing through an ID checkpoint shortly.
Dialogue: The train will be passing through an ID checkpoint shortly.

Original: Jessie: This here is the train's route. As you can see, it'll take us around this main pillar. Lookwe're about halfway through it now. They've set up a checkpoint here to scan the IDs of all passengers heading in and out. Date of birth, residential status, criminal history... All that and more is automatically cross-referenced in their databases. Public Security wouldn't have it any other way. Heads up.
Dialogue: This here is the train's route. As you can see, it'll take us around this main pillar. Look—we're about halfway through it now. They've set up a checkpoint here to scan the IDs of all passengers heading in and out. Date of birth, residential status, criminal history... All that and more is automatically cross-referenced in their databases. Public Security wouldn't have it any other way. Heads up.

Original: Jessie: Don't worry. Our IDs are impeccable.
Dialogue: Don't worry. Our IDs are impeccable.

Original: Jessie: What'd I tell you? Have a little faith.
Dialogue: What'd I tell you? Have a little faith.

Original: Jessie: Won't be long till we reach the bottom. Relax.
Dialogue: Won't be long till we reach the bottom. Relax.

Original: Barret: Take a good look. It's because of that great big pizza in the sky that people down there gotta struggle to survive. Shinra sucks up mako while the soil turns to dust, the air fills with smog, and the flowers die.
Dialogue: Take a good look. It's because of that great big pizza in the sky that people down there gotta struggle to survive. Shinra sucks up mako while the soil turns to dust, the air fills with smog, and the flowers die.

Original: Cloud: Then leave and don't look back. That's what's always worked for me.
Dialogue: Then leave and don't look back. That's what's always worked for me.

Original: Barret: Hmph! Well, that's all well and good if you're only out for yourself. But the folks down there don't have the luxury of choice, you know?
Dialogue: Hmph! Well, that's all well and good if you're only out for yourself. But the folks down there don't have the luxury of choice, you know?

Original: Cloud: Like this train, I suppose... There's only one way it can go...
Dialogue: Like this train, I suppose... There's only one way it can go...

Original: Barret: Hot damn, we are good!
Dialogue: Hot damn, we are good!

Original: Jessie: Woohoo!
Dialogue: Woohoo!

Original: Biggs: Yes!
Dialogue: Yes!

Original: Wedge: Bombs detonated: one. Members lost: zero!
Dialogue: Bombs detonated one. Members lost zero!

Original: Biggs: And one step closer to a brighter future!
Dialogue: And one step closer to a brighter future!

Original: Jessie: Hell yeah!
Dialogue: Hell yeah!

Original: Barret: Guys! Lower your voices, huh? People are listening.
Dialogue: Guys! Lower your voices, huh? People are listening.

Original: Barret: Now get some R&R. You've earned it. Just be ready for the next mission, alright?
Dialogue: Now get some R&R. You've earned it. Just be ready for the next mission, alright?

Original: Barret: See you soon. At Seventh Heaven? You know, where Tifa works? Don't keep her waiting. She'll worry.
Dialogue: See you soon. At Seventh Heaven? You know, where Tifa works? Don't keep her waiting. She'll worry.

Original: On-screen: Sector 7 Undercity Station
Dialogue: Sector 7 Undercity Station

Original: Barret: Not long now, honey! (laughs) Daddy's almost home!
Dialogue: Not long now, honey! (laughs) Daddy's almost home!

Original: Undercity Resident: Hah. "Mako is the lifeblood of the planet"? The hell it is. Goddamn eco-warriors with their dumbass posters. I tear 'em down and they're back up inside of an hour. Like I've got nothing better to do...
Dialogue: Hah. "Mako is the lifeblood of the planet"? The hell it is. Goddamn eco-warriors with their dumbass posters. I tear 'em down and they're back up inside of an hour. Like I've got nothing better to do...

Original: Undercity Resident: I mean, look at all that steelwork... You're trying to tell me that's not progress?
Dialogue: I mean, look at all that steelwork... You're trying to tell me that's not progress?

Original: Undercity Resident: What theYou okay, buddy?
Dialogue: What the—You okay, buddy?

Original: Undercity Resident: Mako junkie, huh? Figures...
Dialogue: Mako junkie, huh? Figures...

Original: Cloud: You again...
Dialogue: You again...

Original: Biggs: That hot shower can't come soon enough. I can barely tell my skin from all the ash and sweat.
Dialogue: That hot shower can't come soon enough. I can barely tell my skin from all the ash and sweat.

Original: Wedge: When I get back, it's refuelin' time.
Dialogue: When I get back, it's refuelin' time.

Original: Biggs: And you, Jessie?
Dialogue: And you, Jessie?

Original: Jessie: I dunno. Figure out how I screwed up?
Dialogue: I dunno. Figure out how I screwed up?

Original: Biggs: Hah! You're such a kidder.
Dialogue: Hah! You're such a kidder.

Original: New Recruit: Um, excuse me. Due to an emergency, entry into this area is prohibited. Sorry for the inconvenience.
Dialogue: Um, excuse me. Due to an emergency, entry into this area is prohibited. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Original: Senior Officer: You call that a warning!?
Dialogue: You call that a warning!?

Original: New Recruit: No, sir!
Dialogue: No, sir!

Original: New Recruit: In accordance with emergency regulations, entry into this area is prohibited. Please, leave at once!
Dialogue: In accordance with emergency regulations, entry into this area is prohibited. Please, leave at once!

Original: Senior Officer: Still too nice!
Dialogue: Still too nice!

Original: New Recruit: This area's off-limits! Turn around and leave at once! If you don't, I'll have no choice but to use force!
Dialogue: This area's off-limits! Turn around and leave at once! If you don't, I'll have no choice but to use force!

Original: Senior Officer:Nowyou're gettin' the hang of it!
Dialogue: Now you're gettin' the hang of it!

Original: On-screen: Sector 7 Slums
Dialogue: Sector 7 Slums

Original: Announcer: Once again, relief supplies are currently being distributed in the lobby of the Shinra Building. Doctors are also stationed at the building's disaster relief center. If you are unable to reach the building on your own, please contact the nearest Shinra employee for assistance. Mayor Domino, in conjunction with President Shinra, has declared a state of emergency in Midgar. The administration have issued assurances that they are doing everything they can that they are doing everything in their power to provide aid to those most in need. As yet, no group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but security services are doing everything they can to identify those involved. If you have any information pertaining to the identity of the perpetrators, please contact your nearest Public Security officer or Security Headquarters.
Dialogue: Once again, relief supplies are currently being distributed in the lobby of the Shinra Building. Doctors are also stationed at the building's disaster relief center. If you are unable to reach the building on your own, please contact the nearest Shinra employee for assistance. Mayor Domino, in conjunction with President Shinra, has declared a state of emergency in Midgar. The administration have issued assurances that they are doing everything they can that they are doing everything in their power to provide aid to those most in need. As yet, no group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but security services are doing everything they can to identify those involved. If you have any information pertaining to the identity of the perpetrators, please contact your nearest Public Security officer or Security Headquarters.

Original: Tifa: Marlene!
Dialogue: Marlene!

Original: Marlene: Daddy! You're home!
Dialogue: Daddy! You're home!

Original: Barret: That's right angel, I am! (laughs)
Dialogue: That's right angel, I am! (laughs)

Original: Tifa: Welcome back!
Dialogue: Welcome back!

Original: Barret: Have you been a good girl?
Dialogue: Have you been a good girl?

Original: Marlene: Yeah, I've been helping Tifa.
Dialogue: Yeah, I've been helping Tifa.

Original: Barret: Oh you did, did you? Well, well...(laughs)
Dialogue: Oh you did, did you? Well, well...(laughs)

Original: Tifa: You made it.
Dialogue: You made it.

Original: Tifa: Where'd you get that? I can't remember the last time I saw a real one.
Dialogue: Where'd you get that? I can't remember the last time I saw a real one.

Original: Tifa: How sweet. When didyouget so thoughtful?
Dialogue: How sweet. When did you get so thoughtful?

Original: Cloud: A guy can change.Hasbeen five years.
Dialogue: A guy can change. Has been five years.

Original: Tifa: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Cloud: I need to talk to Barret.
Dialogue: I need to talk to Barret.

Original: Tifa: Right. Come on in.
Dialogue: Right. Come on in.

Original: Marlene: Daddy, the mako place blew up. Everyone on TV's talking about it.
Dialogue: Daddy, the mako place blew up. Everyone on TV's talking about it.

Original: Barret: Don't you worry about all that silliness. Daddy's here, and he's not going anywhere tonight. Now turn that thing off and let's get you to bed, huh?
Dialogue: Don't you worry about all that silliness. Daddy's here, and he's not going anywhere tonight. Now turn that thing off and let's get you to bed, huh?

Original: Tifa: Do you mind keeping Marlene company until I'm done with this?
Dialogue: Do you mind keeping Marlene company until I'm done with this?

Original: Cloud: Me?
Dialogue: Me?

Original: Tifa: Yeah, you.
Dialogue: Yeah, you.

Original: Barret: Yeah, yeah, your money. Ask Tifa. She takes care of all that.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, your money. Ask Tifa. She takes care of all that.

Original: Barret: Hey! The hell you think you're doing scaring my daughter like that!?
Dialogue: Hey! The hell you think you're doing scaring my daughter like that!?

Original: Marlene: Daddy says never talk to strangers.
Dialogue: Daddy says never talk to strangers.

Original: Barret: That's right, honey, I do say that. What a good girl you are, remembering Daddy's lessons. You know what else good girls do? They go to bed on time. C'mon.
Dialogue: That's right, honey, I do say that. What a good girl you are, remembering Daddy's lessons. You know what else good girls do? They go to bed on time. C'mon.

Original: Marlene: But I'm not tired! I wanna talk some more, Daddy...
Dialogue: But I'm not tired! I wanna talk some more, Daddy...

Original: Barret: Mmm...Alrightbut just this once!
Dialogue: Mmm...Alright—but just this once!

Original: Tifa: So, then! What can I get you?
Dialogue: So, then! What can I get you?

Original: Cloud: My money. I'm still waiting on it.
Dialogue: My money. I'm still waiting on it.

Original: Tifa: Ah... Right... About that... We should talk. Outside.
Dialogue: Ah... Right... About that... We should talk. Outside.

Original: Marlene: Um, Daddy...did the people who died all return to the planet?
Dialogue: Um, Daddy...did the people who died all return to the planet?

Original: Barret: Of course.
Dialogue: Of course.

Original: Barret: Let that be a lesson to you.
Dialogue: Let that be a lesson to you.

Original: Barret: When you wanna talk to a little kid, don't go giving her the professional-killer eyes.
Dialogue: When you wanna talk to a little kid, don't go giving her the professional-killer eyes.

Original: Tifa: Before we get onto money... There's an empty apartment in a place just down the road. It's nothing fancy, but... I was thinking you could stay there for now. The landlady's a big friend of the cause, so you wouldn't even have to pay rent! Sound good?
Dialogue: Before we get onto money... There's an empty apartment in a place just down the road. It's nothing fancy, but... I was thinking you could stay there for now. The landlady's a big friend of the cause, so you wouldn't even have to pay rent! Sound good?

Original: Cloud: Sure does. Thanks.
Dialogue: Sure does. Thanks.

Original: Tifa: Follow me then!
Dialogue: Follow me then!

Original: Tifa: How was it up on the plate?
Dialogue: How was it up on the plate?

Original: Cloud: It was...chaotic.
Dialogue: It was...chaotic.

Original: Tifa: Sorry for dragging you into all this. It was wrong of me to put you in danger like that. I promise I won't do it again.
Dialogue: Sorry for dragging you into all this. It was wrong of me to put you in danger like that. I promise I won't do it again.

Original: Cloud: Danger's part of the job. Don't worry about me.
Dialogue: Danger's part of the job. Don't worry about me.

Original: Tifa: I'll try not to.
Dialogue: I'll try not to.

Original: Cloud: Always happy to help stick it to Shinra.
Dialogue: Always happy to help stick it to Shinra.

Original: Tifa: So, you make nice with everyone?
Dialogue: So, you make nice with everyone?

Original: Cloud: Much as I could, all things considered. Maybe not enough for them.
Dialogue: Much as I could, all things considered. Maybe not enough for them.

Original: Tifa: Good. You had me worried. You're not exactly a people person.
Dialogue: Good. You had me worried. You're not exactly a people person.

Original: Cloud: I'll give you that.
Dialogue: I'll give you that.

Original: Tifa: I saw Sector 8 on the news... It was like a war zone...
Dialogue: I saw Sector 8 on the news... It was like a war zone...

Original: Cloud: The news is just another Shinra mouthpiece. They'll spread whatever lies Shinra tells 'em to.
Dialogue: The news is just another Shinra mouthpiece. They'll spread whatever lies Shinra tells 'em to.

Original: Tifa: So...it wasn't that bad?
Dialogue: So...it wasn't that bad?

Original: Cloud: ...It was.
Dialogue: ...It was.

Original: Tifa: Oh. Right.
Dialogue: Oh. Right.

Original: Tifa: And here we are. Good ol' Stargazer Heights. You're on the second floor.
Dialogue: And here we are. Good ol' Stargazer Heights. You're on the second floor.

Original: Tifa: Room 201 here is where I sleep. Don't have time for much else, what with Seventh Heaven and all. Not even time to decorate.
Dialogue: Room 201 here is where I sleep. Don't have time for much else, what with Seventh Heaven and all. Not even time to decorate.

Original: Tifa: Here's your room202. Don't worry, I already told the landlady about you.
Dialogue: Here's your room—202. Don't worry, I already told the landlady about you.

Original: Cloud: You did?
Dialogue: You did?

Original: Tifa: Yes? Ohhh, I mean I told her I had a friend looking for a place to stay. Was that too much?
Dialogue: Yes? Ohhh, I mean I told her I had a friend looking for a place to stay. Was that too much?

Original: Cloud: No. It's fine. And this?
Dialogue: No. It's fine. And this?

Original: Tifa: That one's, uh... Know what, it's getting late. I'll introduce you tomorrow.
Dialogue: That one's, uh... Know what, it's getting late. I'll introduce you tomorrow.

Original: Cloud: Wait a minute. That's Tifa's room. Don't be weird.
Dialogue: Wait a minute. That's Tifa's room. Don't be weird.

Original: Cloud: What are you doing? You've never even meet this person.
Dialogue: What are you doing? You've never even meet this person.

Original: Tifa: It's a little bare, but should be enough to get you through the night. If you want anything else, we can always get it
Dialogue: It's a little bare, but should be enough to get you through the night. If you want anything else, we can always get it—

Original: Cloud: There is one thing. My money. You guys owe me two thousand, remember?
Dialogue: There is one thing. My money. You guys owe me two thousand, remember?

Original: Tifa: I do, and we'd love to settle up, especially since this was your first job for us, but...
Dialogue: I do, and we'd love to settle up, especially since this was your first job for us, but...

Original: Cloud: That's it?
Dialogue: That's it?

Original: Tifa: Sorry. We spent the rest preparing for the mission. That really is it. But not for long! I'm collecting money for filters tomorrow, so I can pay you after.
Dialogue: Sorry. We spent the rest preparing for the mission. That really is it. But not for long! I'm collecting money for filters tomorrow, so I can pay you after.

Original: Cloud: (sighs) And you're sure about that?
Dialogue: (sighs) And you're sure about that?

Original: Tifa: Of course...as long as you help, that is. Wait... Then I'd have to pay you for that too. Never mind.
Dialogue: Of course...as long as you help, that is. Wait... Then I'd have to pay you for that too. Never mind.

Original: Cloud: No, two thousand's enough. That's what we agreed on, so that'll be the price. With what you gave me, that leaves fifteen hundred.
Dialogue: No, two thousand's enough. That's what we agreed on, so that'll be the price. With what you gave me, that leaves fifteen hundred.

Original: Tifa: You're the best! I'll see you bright and early at the bar, then. Thanks again for everything. Sleep tight!
Dialogue: You're the best! I'll see you bright and early at the bar, then. Thanks again for everything. Sleep tight!

Original: Cloud: Guess it's time for introductions.
Dialogue: Guess it's time for introductions.

Original: Cloud: What, you gonna wake her up?
Dialogue: What, you gonna wake her up?

Original: Cloud: Hey. You okay in there?
Dialogue: Hey. You okay in there?

Original: Cloud: Coming in.
Dialogue: Coming in.

Original: Tifa: Cloud! Stop!
Dialogue: Cloud! Stop!

Original: Cloud: Get back inside!
Dialogue: Get back inside!

Original: Cloud: Get off me!
Dialogue: Get off me!

Original: ???: Reunion... Reunion...
Dialogue: Reunion... Reunion...

Original: Tifa: What are you doing to Marco? This is his apartment. He's got a few problems, but he's not a bad guy. The landlady asked me to check on him now and then to make sure he's okay. Can I ask you to do the same?
Dialogue: What are you doing to Marco? This is his apartment. He's got a few problems, but he's not a bad guy. The landlady asked me to check on him now and then to make sure he's okay. Can I ask you to do the same?

Original: Cloud: Sure...
Dialogue: Sure...

Original: Marle: Well, now. You must be Cloud. I'm Marle, your landlady. So how'd you like the place? You from up on high?
Dialogue: Well, now. You must be Cloud. I'm Marle, your landlady. So how'd you like the place? You from up on high?

Original: Cloud: I've been around.
Dialogue: I've been around.

Original: Marle: I'll bet. No matter. All kinds come through with all kinds of reasons. If you ever need an ear to bend, I'll lend you mine. Can be about anythingeven Tifa.
Dialogue: I'll bet. No matter. All kinds come through with all kinds of reasons. If you ever need an ear to bend, I'll lend you mine. Can be about anything—even Tifa.

Original: Cloud: What's she to you?
Dialogue: What's she to you?

Original: Marle: The granddaughter I never had. And if you hurt her, I'll take it out of your hide. You hear me?
Dialogue: The granddaughter I never had. And if you hurt her, I'll take it out of your hide. You hear me?

Original: Cloud: Loud and clear.
Dialogue: Loud and clear.
