Original: Marle: Good! Now you'd best get a move on to Seventh Heaven! She's got a head start on you and then some.
Dialogue: Good! Now you'd best get a move on to Seventh Heaven! She's got a head start on you and then some.

Original: Tifa: Morning!
Dialogue: Morning!

Original: Cloud: Hey.
Dialogue: Hey.

Original: Tifa: Just so you know, Marlene's still asleep.
Dialogue: Just so you know, Marlene's still asleep.

Original: Tifa: Let's get down to business, shall we? These water filters won't replace themselves. Although, the next batch probablycould, if Jessie put her mind to it. Most every home in the area has one. Folks love 'em 'cause they practically eliminate the rotten-egg smell. Honestly, they make us more money than this place. And it's easy money too. We bring new filters, collect the old ones, and get paid.
Dialogue: Let's get down to business, shall we? These water filters won't replace themselves. Although, the next batch probably could, if Jessie put her mind to it. Most every home in the area has one. Folks love 'em 'cause they practically eliminate the rotten-egg smell. Honestly, they make us more money than this place. And it's easy money too. We bring new filters, collect the old ones, and get paid.

Original: Tifa: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Cloud: Gimme a break. I'm not a salesman. I'm a SOLDIER.
Dialogue: Gimme a break. I'm not a salesman. I'm a SOLDIER.

Original: Tifa: Which is why no one will refuse to pay. What do you say? Please?
Dialogue: Which is why no one will refuse to pay. What do you say? Please?

Original: Cloud: Let's get this over with.
Dialogue: Let's get this over with.

Original: Tifa: Great. And while we're at it, I'll give you the grand tour.
Dialogue: Great. And while we're at it, I'll give you the grand tour.

Original: Tifa: Go ahead and keep whatever we collect. Seeing as you didn't bring any luggage, I'm guessing there's stuff you need to buy.
Dialogue: Go ahead and keep whatever we collect. Seeing as you didn't bring any luggage, I'm guessing there's stuff you need to buy.

Original: Cloud: Thanks.
Dialogue: Thanks.

Original: Tifa: And don't worry. We'll pay you the difference after. Barret's out making his rounds too.
Dialogue: And don't worry. We'll pay you the difference after. Barret's out making his rounds too.

Original: Cloud: As long as I get it all today.
Dialogue: As long as I get it all today.

Original: Tifa: Hey, there. Here to change out your water filter.
Dialogue: Hey, there. Here to change out your water filter.

Original: Item Store Owner: Tifa baby, how you doing? Been waiting for you toWait. Who's he?
Dialogue: Tifa baby, how you doing? Been waiting for you to—Wait. Who's he?

Original: Tifa: Cloud's in charge of collections. He'll take your money.
Dialogue: Cloud's in charge of collections. He'll take your money.

Original: Item Store Owner: Sounds like a pretty sweet gig! If you ever need someone to fill in, I'm your man.
Dialogue: Sounds like a pretty sweet gig! If you ever need someone to fill in, I'm your man.

Original: Cloud: In your dreams, maybe.
Dialogue: In your dreams, maybe.

Original: Item Store Owner: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Tifa: Cloud! Uh...since we're here, maybe we should do a little shopping?
Dialogue: Cloud! Uh...since we're here, maybe we should do a little shopping?

Original: Cloud: Suppose I could take a look.
Dialogue: Suppose I could take a look.

Original: Item Store Owner: Thanks! If you're ever in the market for anything else, drop on by. Especially if Tifa's with you.
Dialogue: Thanks! If you're ever in the market for anything else, drop on by. Especially if Tifa's with you.

Original: Tifa: We'll see you around, okay? And let us know when your filter next needs changing!
Dialogue: We'll see you around, okay? And let us know when your filter next needs changing!

Original: Tifa: He's a regular. Stock up here and he might throw in a freebie or two.
Dialogue: He's a regular. Stock up here and he might throw in a freebie or two.

Original: Cloud: Foryoumaybe...
Dialogue: For you maybe...

Original: Tifa: Well... You could try being a little nicer.
Dialogue: Well... You could try being a little nicer.

Original: Cloud: To get free shit? Not my style.
Dialogue: To get free shit? Not my style.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) Our next stop is Stargazer Heights. Landlady's a client.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Our next stop is Stargazer Heights. Landlady's a client.

Original: Cloud: Just met her.
Dialogue: Just met her.

Original: Tifa: Then you know what to expect. Remember: she's a good friend of Avalanche, so be nice. Please.
Dialogue: Then you know what to expect. Remember she's a good friend of Avalanche, so be nice. Please.

Original: Tifa: Hey, Marle! Got some filters for you.
Dialogue: Hey, Marle! Got some filters for you.

Original: Marle: Tifa! My dear, dear girl! ...Oh. What's he doing here?
Dialogue: Tifa! My dear, dear girl! ...Oh. What's he doing here?

Original: Cloud: Working.
Dialogue: Working.

Original: Tifa: Be nice! Cloud's helping me with collections.
Dialogue: Be nice! Cloud's helping me with collections.

Original: Marle: You'd better take care of her!
Dialogue: You'd better take care of her!

Original: Tifa: I'm pretty good at taking care of myself, you know.
Dialogue: I'm pretty good at taking care of myself, you know.

Original: Marle: That I do. Still, better him than you. No charm, no wit. Big sword...but no skills.
Dialogue: That I do. Still, better him than you. No charm, no wit. Big sword...but no skills.

Original: Cloud: I've got skills.
Dialogue: I've got skills.

Original: Tifa: Be nice!
Dialogue: Be nice!

Original: Cloud: I'm doing my best...
Dialogue: I'm doing my best...

Original: Marle: You're looking awfully glum. Are you getting enough sleep? A good long rest'll cure anything, I tell you.
Dialogue: You're looking awfully glum. Are you getting enough sleep? A good long rest'll cure anything, I tell you.

Original: Tifa: A tried-and-true lesson for life on the ground floor, am I right?
Dialogue: A tried-and-true lesson for life on the ground floor, am I right?

Original: Marle: That you are. Nowyour money.
Dialogue: That you are. Now—your money.

Original: Tifa: Thanks, Marle. You take care of yourself.
Dialogue: Thanks, Marle. You take care of yourself.

Original: Marle: Don't do anything I wouldn't do!
Dialogue: Don't do anything I wouldn't do!

Original: Tifa: Marle's great. She helped get me set up back in the day.
Dialogue: Marle's great. She helped get me set up back in the day.

Original: Cloud: You...been here a while now?
Dialogue: You...been here a while now?

Original: Tifa: Five years, give or take... But never mind that! We've gotta get you your money! Last stop is the weapon store.
Dialogue: Five years, give or take... But never mind that! We've gotta get you your money! Last stop is the weapon store.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Hey! That last filter didn't do shit!
Dialogue: Hey! That last filter didn't do shit!

Original: Tifa: We're so sorry about that. Hopefully this one will work better...
Dialogue: We're so sorry about that. Hopefully this one will work better...

Original: Weapons Vendor: Save your excuses and get out!
Dialogue: Save your excuses and get out!

Original: Tifa: All right. If you could just settle your bill, we'll be on our way.
Dialogue: All right. If you could just settle your bill, we'll be on our way.

Original: Weapons Vendor: The hell? You charging me for your busted-ass goods?
Dialogue: The hell? You charging me for your busted-ass goods?

Original: Tifa: My associate handles payment disputes...
Dialogue: My associate handles payment disputes...

Original: Weapons Vendor: Think you can mosey up in here and have it your way?
Dialogue: Think you can mosey up in here and have it your way?

Original: Cloud: Pretty please.
Dialogue: Pretty please.

Original: Tifa: Thank you very much!
Dialogue: Thank you very much!

Original: Tifa: Seeing as we're done with our rounds, and you've got a small fortune now, why not take a gander at the weapons?
Dialogue: Seeing as we're done with our rounds, and you've got a small fortune now, why not take a gander at the weapons?

Original: Cloud: Well...when will Barret be back with the rest?
Dialogue: Well...when will Barret be back with the rest?

Original: Tifa: Before we open up tonight. It'll be a while yet, so...what do you wanna do?
Dialogue: Before we open up tonight. It'll be a while yet, so...what do you wanna do?

Original: Cloud: Don't really know...
Dialogue: Don't really know...

Original: Tifa: In that case, I've got a suggestion. Wanna hear it? If you're serious about becoming a merc, then you're going to need to start making connections. "It's not what you know, but who you know," y'know?
Dialogue: In that case, I've got a suggestion. Wanna hear it? If you're serious about becoming a merc, then you're going to need to start making connections. "It's not what you know, but who you know," y'know?

Original: Cloud: Hmph. Another lesson for life on the ground floor?
Dialogue: Hmph. Another lesson for life on the ground floor?

Original: Tifa: Yep. Connections get you jobs, jobs build your rep, and more rep gets you better connections...
Dialogue: Yep. Connections get you jobs, jobs build your rep, and more rep gets you better connections...

Original: Cloud: How do I start?
Dialogue: How do I start?

Original: Tifa: Hmm...why not help out the neighborhood watch? They're mostly volunteers, but you'll get to know people.
Dialogue: Hmm...why not help out the neighborhood watch? They're mostly volunteers, but you'll get to know people.

Original: Cloud: Yeah, okay.
Dialogue: Yeah, okay.

Original: Tifa: Didn't see anybody at the office, so let's head up top.
Dialogue: Didn't see anybody at the office, so let's head up top.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Huh? I ain't got nothing for a punk-ass bitch like you! Get on outta here!
Dialogue: Huh? I ain't got nothing for a punk-ass bitch like you! Get on outta here!

Original: Tifa: Huh, didn't know you were holding down the fort.
Dialogue: Huh, didn't know you were holding down the fort.

Original: Wedge: Oh, hey, Cloud. Looking to join the neighborhood watch?
Dialogue: Oh, hey, Cloud. Looking to join the neighborhood watch?

Original: Cloud: That depends. What does this neighborhood watch do?
Dialogue: That depends. What does this neighborhood watch do?

Original: Biggs: Umm...lots of stuff, really. But our top priority is taking care of any beasts that wander into town. That, and teaching the locals how to defend themselves.
Dialogue: Umm...lots of stuff, really. But our top priority is taking care of any beasts that wander into town. That, and teaching the locals how to defend themselves.

Original: Wedge: Like they say: "The only one who'll look out for you is you."
Dialogue: Like they say "The only one who'll look out for you is you."

Original: Tifa: Cloud's a great fighter, but only we know that. If no one knows him, no one'll hire him. Thought if he joined the watch, he could get his name out there.
Dialogue: Cloud's a great fighter, but only we know that. If no one knows him, no one'll hire him. Thought if he joined the watch, he could get his name out there.

Original: Wedge: That would work for everybody!
Dialogue: That would work for everybody!

Original: Biggs: Truth be told, we could really use your help. We can't pay you in girl, but we'll work something out. For example... Aha, what about your sword? I could mod it for you.
Dialogue: Truth be told, we could really use your help. We can't pay you in girl, but we'll work something out. For example... Aha, what about your sword? I could mod it for you.

Original: Cloud: No thanks. It's fine just the way it is.
Dialogue: No thanks. It's fine just the way it is.

Original: Biggs: You some kind of a purist? I knowI'dnever pass up a chance to improve my gear. C'mon...at least let me show you how it's done.
Dialogue: You some kind of a purist? I know I'd never pass up a chance to improve my gear. C'mon...at least let me show you how it's done.

Original: Biggs: All set? Needless to say, you'll have to try it out to appreciate the difference.
Dialogue: All set? Needless to say, you'll have to try it out to appreciate the difference.

Original: Cloud: Thanks.
Dialogue: Thanks.

Original: Biggs: We'll do you one betterspread the word to everyone who'll listen about the new merc in town.
Dialogue: We'll do you one better—spread the word to everyone who'll listen about the new merc in town.

Original: Tifa: Between him and Wedge, there isn't anyone they don't know.
Dialogue: Between him and Wedge, there isn't anyone they don't know.

Original: Wedge: I'll march through the streets singing your praiseseven on an empty stomach!
Dialogue: I'll march through the streets singing your praises—even on an empty stomach!

Original: Cloud: So...where are these monsters?
Dialogue: So...where are these monsters?

Original: Biggs: Scrap Boulevard. Good hunting.
Dialogue: Scrap Boulevard. Good hunting.

Original: Tifa: Hey, Cloud. I'll come with.
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud. I'll come with.

Original: Cloud: No, I've got this.
Dialogue: No, I've got this.

Original: Tifa: But...you don't know the way, do you?
Dialogue: But...you don't know the way, do you?

Original: Cloud: Lead on.
Dialogue: Lead on.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) Sure thing. I know these streets better than anyone.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Sure thing. I know these streets better than anyone.

Original: Tifa: Scrap Boulevard is out west. Past the barricades supposed to keep the monsters out. Anyway, we should prepare, just in case.
Dialogue: Scrap Boulevard is out west. Past the barricades supposed to keep the monsters out. Anyway, we should prepare, just in case.

Original: On-screen: Scrap Boulevard
Dialogue: Scrap Boulevard

Original: Tifa: Here's Scrap Boulevard.
Dialogue: Here's Scrap Boulevard.

Original: Cloud: I can see why monsters'd feel right at home.
Dialogue: I can see why monsters'd feel right at home.

Original: Tifa: Hm. And the more we pile up, the more they show up.
Dialogue: Hm. And the more we pile up, the more they show up.

Original: Tifa: And there's our first challenger! Show me what you got, Cloud!
Dialogue: And there's our first challenger! Show me what you got, Cloud!

Original: Tifa: Wow... So that's what a SOLDIER looks line in action.
Dialogue: Wow... So that's what a SOLDIER looks line in action.

Original: Cloud: This was just a warm-up.
Dialogue: This was just a warm-up.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) I'll bet. Let's keep at it!
Dialogue: (chuckles) I'll bet. Let's keep at it!

Original: Tifa: You're good at this! Charging in like it was nothing...
Dialogue: You're good at this! Charging in like it was nothing...

Original: Cloud: You too. It's a little surprising.
Dialogue: You too. It's a little surprising.

Original: Tifa: Well, I've been here five years now. "If you don't look out for yourself, no one else will." By the waythat one's gonna be on the test.
Dialogue: Well, I've been here five years now. "If you don't look out for yourself, no one else will." By the way—that one's gonna be on the test.

Original: Cloud: This a lesson?
Dialogue: This a lesson?

Original: Tifa: Gotta learn if you're gonna stick around. Okay, let's wrap this up...
Dialogue: Gotta learn if you're gonna stick around. Okay, let's wrap this up...

Original: Tifa: Alright. I think that might be the last of them.
Dialogue: Alright. I think that might be the last of them.

Original: Cloud: They won't stay gone for long...
Dialogue: They won't stay gone for long...

Original: Tifa: Of course not. Even so, folks'll be grateful for the peace and quiet in the meantime. A win's a win, you know?
Dialogue: Of course not. Even so, folks'll be grateful for the peace and quiet in the meantime. A win's a win, you know?

Original: Cloud: True.
Dialogue: True.

Original: Tifa: Trust meit'll do wonders for your rep. Right, let's go check in with Biggs and Wedge.
Dialogue: Trust me—it'll do wonders for your rep. Right, let's go check in with Biggs and Wedge.

Original: Katie: It's you! You're the merc everybody's talking about, am I right?
Dialogue: It's you! You're the merc everybody's talking about, am I right?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Katie: Iknewit! So, the board here tracks how many monsters folks've taken down, right? A bigger number means a safer townand who wouldn't want that? Just between you and me, thoughthey're pretty much allyourkills. Cool, huh? Anyway, keep up the good work! We'll try to make it worth your while.
Dialogue: I knew it! So, the board here tracks how many monsters folks've taken down, right? A bigger number means a safer town—and who wouldn't want that? Just between you and me, though—they're pretty much all your kills. Cool, huh? Anyway, keep up the good work! We'll try to make it worth your while.

Original: Katie: C'mon you guys! Let's get these numbers up!
Dialogue: C'mon you guys! Let's get these numbers up!

Original: Katie: Whoa, check it out! I don't think the number's ever gone that high before! At this rate, we won't have to worry about monsters ever again! What a thing to be able to say...
Dialogue: Whoa, check it out! I don't think the number's ever gone that high before! At this rate, we won't have to worry about monsters ever again! What a thing to be able to say...

Original: Katie: Thank you so, so much! We'll never forget how many bloodthirsty beasts you kept off our streets! Ahhh, smell that fresh air! That's the smell of a safe and happy townone you can be proud to call home!
Dialogue: Thank you so, so much! We'll never forget how many bloodthirsty beasts you kept off our streets! Ahhh, smell that fresh air! That's the smell of a safe and happy town—one you can be proud to call home!

Original: Katie: Hey there, how's it going? I don't think anyone's ever gonna beat that record of yours! It's incredible!
Dialogue: Hey there, how's it going? I don't think anyone's ever gonna beat that record of yours! It's incredible!

Original: Biggs: Back already?
Dialogue: Back already?

Original: Tifa: Got every last one too. Now the slums should be safe.
Dialogue: Got every last one too. Now the slums should be safe.

Original: Wedge: You guys are machines!
Dialogue: You guys are machines!

Original: Biggs: Good job. Meanwhile, we told everyone we could about you.
Dialogue: Good job. Meanwhile, we told everyone we could about you.

Original: Cloud: So I heard. I've gotta ask though.Whatdid you tell them?
Dialogue: So I heard. I've gotta ask though. What did you tell them?

Original: Tifa: It's alright. All you gotta do is keep up the good work. It'll pay off soon enough, I promise.
Dialogue: It's alright. All you gotta do is keep up the good work. It'll pay off soon enough, I promise.

Original: Biggs: How's the sword, by the way?
Dialogue: How's the sword, by the way?

Original: Cloud: Good.
Dialogue: Good.

Original: Biggs: Glad to hear it. Seems like the perfect fit for you.
Dialogue: Glad to hear it. Seems like the perfect fit for you.

Original: Cloud: Yeah. We've been through a lot
Dialogue: Yeah. We've been through a lot—

Original: Tifa: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Cloud: I'm fine.
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Original: Tifa: Been meaning to ask... After you left the village...
Dialogue: Been meaning to ask... After you left the village...

Original: Cloud: It's a long story.
Dialogue: It's a long story.

Original: Tifa: I've got time! Why don't you tell me all about it while we try to rustle up some more work for you?
Dialogue: I've got time! Why don't you tell me all about it while we try to rustle up some more work for you?

Original: Wedge: That sounds great! I'll come too!
Dialogue: That sounds great! I'll come too!

Original: Biggs: Oh, no you won't. Run along now, you two. Go on.
Dialogue: Oh, no you won't. Run along now, you two. Go on.

Original: Tifa: Sorry. Maybe next time.
Dialogue: Sorry. Maybe next time.

Original: Wedge: No fair!
Dialogue: No fair!

Original: Biggs: Think about it for a second. They haven't seen each other in years. You'd be a third wheel!
Dialogue: Think about it for a second. They haven't seen each other in years. You'd be a third wheel!

Original: Tifa: Hey, before we get back to it, why don't you check out the weapons?
Dialogue: Hey, before we get back to it, why don't you check out the weapons?

Original: Cloud: No need.
Dialogue: No need.

Original: Tifa: C'mon, the dealer's probably heard all about you by now. Might treat you better.
Dialogue: C'mon, the dealer's probably heard all about you by now. Might treat you better.

Original: Cloud: I dunno about that...
Dialogue: I dunno about that...

Original: Weapons Vendor: Hold up. Heard there's a merc that'll take on any monster. You the man?
Dialogue: Hold up. Heard there's a merc that'll take on any monster. You the man?

Original: Tifa: Word spreads fast around here.
Dialogue: Word spreads fast around here.

Original: Cloud: What if I am?
Dialogue: What if I am?

Original: Weapons Vendor: Sorry 'bout before. I get antsy when business is slow. Man in your line of work needs weapons, no? Why not try that one on for size? Yours on the house. Badass like you rocking my weapons is good advertising. Think about it.
Dialogue: Sorry 'bout before. I get antsy when business is slow. Man in your line of work needs weapons, no? Why not try that one on for size? Yours on the house. Badass like you rocking my weapons is good advertising. Think about it.

Original: Cloud: Fine.
Dialogue: Fine.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Or if you wanna take a look at something else...
Dialogue: Or if you wanna take a look at something else...

Original: Cloud: Just a look.
Dialogue: Just a look.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Don't be a stranger.
Dialogue: Don't be a stranger.

Original: Tifa: Since you've got yourself a new weapon, let's see if we can't put it to good use. Come on. Let's go chat up Wymer.
Dialogue: Since you've got yourself a new weapon, let's see if we can't put it to good use. Come on. Let's go chat up Wymer.

Original: Cloud: Who?
Dialogue: Who?

Original: Tifa: The guy who tracks all the requests that come to the watch. You never knowcould toss some work your way.
Dialogue: The guy who tracks all the requests that come to the watch. You never know—could toss some work your way.

Original: Cloud: Where's he at?
Dialogue: Where's he at?

Original: Tifa: Oh, he should be back at the office by now.
Dialogue: Oh, he should be back at the office by now.

Original: Wymer: Hey there, Tifa! You need a helping hand?
Dialogue: Hey there, Tifa! You need a helping hand?

Original: Tifa: Actually, I wanted to introduce you to an old friend of mine. This is Cloud. He's a merc.
Dialogue: Actually, I wanted to introduce you to an old friend of mine. This is Cloud. He's a merc.

Original: Wymer: Hah, you don't say! Well, we're always on the lookout for experienced fighters to help us deal with the bigger critters.
Dialogue: Hah, you don't say! Well, we're always on the lookout for experienced fighters to help us deal with the bigger critters.

Original: Cloud: I'll take on anything. For the right price, that is.
Dialogue: I'll take on anything. For the right price, that is.

Original: Wymer: Experiencedandcocky, huh? If it's a challenge you want, I might have a few good ones. Your clients can fill you in on the details. Prove yourself with these jobs, and I'll see if I can't find you some more.
Dialogue: Experienced and cocky, huh? If it's a challenge you want, I might have a few good ones. Your clients can fill you in on the details. Prove yourself with these jobs, and I'll see if I can't find you some more.

Original: Cloud: Thanks.
Dialogue: Thanks.

Original: DJ: Hey man, check it out! This song's pretty sweet, ain't it? You like it? Have a copy!
Dialogue: Hey man, check it out! This song's pretty sweet, ain't it? You like it? Have a copy!

Original: Tifa: Something's wrong. Let's check it out.
Dialogue: Something's wrong. Let's check it out.

Original: Tifa: That went well. Could be you've found your calling.
Dialogue: That went well. Could be you've found your calling.

Original: Cloud: Eh. Was alright I guess.
Dialogue: Eh. Was alright I guess.

Original: Tifa: Think of each job as an opportunitynot to make money, but to build connections.
Dialogue: Think of each job as an opportunity—not to make money, but to build connections.

Original: Cloud: "It's not what you know, but who."
Dialogue: "It's not what you know, but who."

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) You remembered.
Dialogue: (chuckles) You remembered.

Original: Cloud: Had a patient teacher.
Dialogue: Had a patient teacher.

Original: Tifa: Maybe not so patient next time.
Dialogue: Maybe not so patient next time.

Original: Cloud: Hoo boy.
Dialogue: Hoo boy.

Original: Tifa: Oh, Barret should've finished collecting his share of the money by now, so what do you wanna do? Head back to the bar?
Dialogue: Oh, Barret should've finished collecting his share of the money by now, so what do you wanna do? Head back to the bar?

Original: Tifa: I'll be a lot of people are talking about you right now. "There's this amazing merc who can handle anything!"
Dialogue: I'll be a lot of people are talking about you right now. "There's this amazing merc who can handle anything!"

Original: Cloud: Nothing I've done around here has been all that special though.
Dialogue: Nothing I've done around here has been all that special though.

Original: Tifa: Oh, so you want more of a challenge, huh?
Dialogue: Oh, so you want more of a challenge, huh?

Original: Tifa: Okay then! That's another solid gig in the books! You know the whole town is really impressed with what you've done. Keep it up and you'll have enough work to keep you fed for a lifetime!
Dialogue: Okay then! That's another solid gig in the books! You know the whole town is really impressed with what you've done. Keep it up and you'll have enough work to keep you fed for a lifetime!

Original: Cloud: All thanks to you.
Dialogue: All thanks to you.

Original: Tifa: And don't you forget it!
Dialogue: And don't you forget it!

Original: Cloud: So where do we get paid? The shop or something?
Dialogue: So where do we get paid? The shop or something?

Original: Tifa: Yeah, but why don't we head back to the apartments first? Take a quick breather.
Dialogue: Yeah, but why don't we head back to the apartments first? Take a quick breather.

Original: Cloud: Which lesson was that again...?
Dialogue: Which lesson was that again...?

Original: Tifa: Lesson one. Got it? Anyway, let's go!
Dialogue: Lesson one. Got it? Anyway, let's go!

Original: Chadley: Candidate detected. Performing physical analysis... Sizable weapon, excellent cardiovascular health and impressive lung capacity. Perfectly balanced muscle and bone structure... An optimal candidate!
Dialogue: Candidate detected. Performing physical analysis... Sizable weapon, excellent cardiovascular health and impressive lung capacity. Perfectly balanced muscle and bone structure... An optimal candidate!

Original: Chadley: My name is Chadley. I'm an intern for Shinra's Research and Development Division. I hope you'll be interested in helping me with my research. Please accept this as a down payment.
Dialogue: My name is Chadley. I'm an intern for Shinra's Research and Development Division. I hope you'll be interested in helping me with my research. Please accept this as a down payment.

Original: Chadley: I would like you to set that Assess materia in your equipment and use it to gather intelligence in battle. This data will help me to develop new types of materia.
Dialogue: I would like you to set that Assess materia in your equipment and use it to gather intelligence in battle. This data will help me to develop new types of materia.

Original: Cloud: I'm not interested in working for Shinra.
Dialogue: I'm not interested in working for Shinra.

Original: Chadley: You should know that I work actively to undermine Shinra's efforts. I'm sure you of all people can appreciate the tremendous power of materiaas well as how it might be wielded against your corporate enemies. And if you later decide that I am not worthy of your trust, you can do what you do best.
Dialogue: You should know that I work actively to undermine Shinra's efforts. I'm sure you of all people can appreciate the tremendous power of materia—as well as how it might be wielded against your corporate enemies. And if you later decide that I am not worthy of your trust, you can do what you do best.

Original: Cloud: I will hold you to that.
Dialogue: I will hold you to that.

Original: Chadley: Excellent! Then we shall work together so long as you deem fit. Once you've completed your task, please return and report to me.
Dialogue: Excellent! Then we shall work together so long as you deem fit. Once you've completed your task, please return and report to me.

Original: Chadley: Please set the orb of Assess materia to your equipment, and use it to whether battle intel.
Dialogue: Please set the orb of Assess materia to your equipment, and use it to whether battle intel.

Original: Cloud: There. That should be enough intel for the kid.
Dialogue: There. That should be enough intel for the kid.

Original: On-screen: Return to Chadley?
Dialogue: Return to Chadley?

Original: Chadley: Cloud. You were the first to gather the data I requested. Here is the rest of your payment. I have developed new materia. Would you like to see it?
Dialogue: Cloud. You were the first to gather the data I requested. Here is the rest of your payment. I have developed new materia. Would you like to see it?

Original: Chadley: I plan to develop more materia in the future. Together, we can harness enough power to take down Shinra. I'll be preparing more battle intel reports, which I hope you will assist me in completing.
Dialogue: I plan to develop more materia in the future. Together, we can harness enough power to take down Shinra. I'll be preparing more battle intel reports, which I hope you will assist me in completing.

Original: Chadley: Cloud, I've come up with the most fascinating theory. Perhaps you can lend me your assistance in gathering data to test it?
Dialogue: Cloud, I've come up with the most fascinating theory. Perhaps you can lend me your assistance in gathering data to test it?

Original: Item Store Owner: Hey there, Tifa, welcome back! And you. The new merc in town looking for work, right?
Dialogue: Hey there, Tifa, welcome back! And you. The new merc in town looking for work, right?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Item Store Owner: In that case, maybe you could do something about the doomrats? Them and their wererat buddies have been tearing up town, looking for food and whatnot. Got into the store and made one hell of a mess, let me tell you.
Dialogue: In that case, maybe you could do something about the doomrats? Them and their wererat buddies have been tearing up town, looking for food and whatnot. Got into the store and made one hell of a mess, let me tell you.

Original: Item Store Owner: Oh, you think that's funny, do you? Don't lie. I saw you crack a smile. Well, do the job and you can laugh it up for all I care. Anyway...they're probably nesting in the outskirts. Now I've heard a wererat in pain'll call its friends for help. And the whole rat pack'll come running, just like that.
Dialogue: Oh, you think that's funny, do you? Don't lie. I saw you crack a smile. Well, do the job and you can laugh it up for all I care. Anyway...they're probably nesting in the outskirts. Now I've heard a wererat in pain'll call its friends for help. And the whole rat pack'll come running, just like that.

Original: Undercity Resident: The leader of the rat pack is the worst of 'em all. The loudest, most obnoxious squeaking... Johnny liked to mimic it until we told him to cut that shit out.
Dialogue: The leader of the rat pack is the worst of 'em all. The loudest, most obnoxious squeaking... Johnny liked to mimic it until we told him to cut that shit out.

Original: Cloud: I don't see any "doomrats" around...
Dialogue: I don't see any "doomrats" around...

Original: Tifa: Hmm, what do you think? Should we wait? You know, this might be a waste of time. Let's head back to the store and touch base for now.
Dialogue: Hmm, what do you think? Should we wait? You know, this might be a waste of time. Let's head back to the store and touch base for now.

Original: Item Store Owner: Well? Rats too much to handle? I'm just messing with youheard you took out some wererats, which is nice and all, but the job was to wipe out the doomrats. No biggieget back out there and finish the job and we're good.
Dialogue: Well? Rats too much to handle? I'm just messing with you—heard you took out some wererats, which is nice and all, but the job was to wipe out the doomrats. No biggie—get back out there and finish the job and we're good.

Original: Item Store Owner: Don't look so glum. It's only a matter of time till they show. You'll get 'em this time for sure!
Dialogue: Don't look so glum. It's only a matter of time till they show. You'll get 'em this time for sure!

Original: On-screen: Return to the item store?
Dialogue: Return to the item store?

Original: Item Store Owner: Finally managed to get those doomrats, huh? Thanks guysyou're the greatest! Was so dead in here I thought I might have to close up shop for good.
Dialogue: Finally managed to get those doomrats, huh? Thanks guys—you're the greatest! Was so dead in here I thought I might have to close up shop for good.

Original: Item Store Owner: Heygot an idea. Hear me out. If the guy who took care of the town's rat problem told everybody where he liked to shop... Well? Whaddya say?
Dialogue: Hey—got an idea. Hear me out. If the guy who took care of the town's rat problem told everybody where he liked to shop... Well? Whaddya say?

Original: Item Store Owner: I'll make it worth your while, of course. Give you some incentive. Talk you up to Wymer and my customers and anybody else who'll listen. You'll be swimming in work before you know it!
Dialogue: I'll make it worth your while, of course. Give you some incentive. Talk you up to Wymer and my customers and anybody else who'll listen. You'll be swimming in work before you know it!

Original: Cloud: Yeah, sure.
Dialogue: Yeah, sure.

Original: Item Store Owner: (laughs) Okay then! That's what I like to hear! Seventh Heaven, the new merc in town, and my little store! I can see it now! We're gonna clean up!
Dialogue: (laughs) Okay then! That's what I like to hear! Seventh Heaven, the new merc in town, and my little store! I can see it now! We're gonna clean up!

Original: Item Store Owner: Keepin' your nose to the grindstone, huh? I've got just the thing for a go-getter like you!
Dialogue: Keepin' your nose to the grindstone, huh? I've got just the thing for a go-getter like you!

Original: Item Store Owner: Pleasure as always. Say hi to Wymer for me!
Dialogue: Pleasure as always. Say hi to Wymer for me!

Original: Undercity Resident: I'm guessing you're the merc who dealt with those damn rats? That wasn't me who put in the request, but as a resident of Culvert Street, I appreciate what you did.
Dialogue: I'm guessing you're the merc who dealt with those damn rats? That wasn't me who put in the request, but as a resident of Culvert Street, I appreciate what you did.

Original: Junk Dealer: Hello, hello! Oho, what do we have here? I'm guessing you're that merc I've heard so much about. You're not here to shop, are you? People were right. You look like you can handle yourself.
Dialogue: Hello, hello! Oho, what do we have here? I'm guessing you're that merc I've heard so much about. You're not here to shop, are you? People were right. You look like you can handle yourself.

Original: Junk Dealer: So some drakes've made themselves at home in the abandoned Talagger factory. Can't have that kind of trouble around here. My regulars will do anything to get their hands on the scrap in there, and if they run into those drakes, they could get hurt.
Dialogue: So some drakes've made themselves at home in the abandoned Talagger factory. Can't have that kind of trouble around here. My regulars will do anything to get their hands on the scrap in there, and if they run into those drakes, they could get hurt.

Original: Cloud: I'll handle it.
Dialogue: I'll handle it.

Original: Junk Dealer: Much obliged, sir! Head on over to the old Talagger factory and talk to Narjin. He's the watchman guarding the entrance. Good luck! I'm counting on ya, my friend!
Dialogue: Much obliged, sir! Head on over to the old Talagger factory and talk to Narjin. He's the watchman guarding the entrance. Good luck! I'm counting on ya, my friend!

Original: Junk Dealer: Narjin's the one with all the details. You'll found him outside the old Talagger factory. Don't forget to stock up before you go!
Dialogue: Narjin's the one with all the details. You'll found him outside the old Talagger factory. Don't forget to stock up before you go!

Original: Narjin: Step back.
Dialogue: Step back.

Original: Narjin: Factory's off-limits. Drakes have been spotted inside.
Dialogue: Factory's off-limits. Drakes have been spotted inside.

Original: Narjin: Huh? Wait a minute. Tifa? Don't tell me you're here to take care of those things. Are you? In that case, be my guest! We believe there's at least two groups lurking somewhere inside the factory. Find and cull 'em all.
Dialogue: Huh? Wait a minute. Tifa? Don't tell me you're here to take care of those things. Are you? In that case, be my guest! We believe there's at least two groups lurking somewhere inside the factory. Find and cull 'em all.

Original: (Upon talking to him again.)Narjin: Reports said the drakes looked like they were nesting. Need you to clear 'em out before they breed.
Dialogue: Reports said the drakes looked like they were nesting. Need you to clear 'em out before they breed.

Original: On-screen: Abandoned Talagger Factory
Dialogue: Abandoned Talagger Factory

Original: On-screen: Return to the scrap dealer?
Dialogue: Return to the scrap dealer?

Original: Junk Dealer: Got rid of those drakes in the factory, did ya? What a relief! I can't wait to give my regulars the good news!
Dialogue: Got rid of those drakes in the factory, did ya? What a relief! I can't wait to give my regulars the good news!

Original: Junk Dealer: You're the real deal all right. Keep it up, and I can see you going far as a merc in this town. I've worked with my fair share over the years, so believe me when I say that I know what I'm talking about.
Dialogue: You're the real deal all right. Keep it up, and I can see you going far as a merc in this town. I've worked with my fair share over the years, so believe me when I say that I know what I'm talking about.

Original: Junk Dealer: Anywayyou're needed over at the pillar. Apparently another flying bastard's stirring up trouble. Bet you can't get enough of this, eh?
Dialogue: Anyway—you're needed over at the pillar. Apparently another flying bastard's stirring up trouble. Bet you can't get enough of this, eh?

Original: Cloud: Well...
Dialogue: Well...

Original: Junk Dealer: No, I get it. If you're good at something, might as well make it your living. May not know you, but I know a man who's found his calling when I see one. Keep at it! I switch out my stock every so often, so drop by when you're in the neighborhood, huh?
Dialogue: No, I get it. If you're good at something, might as well make it your living. May not know you, but I know a man who's found his calling when I see one. Keep at it! I switch out my stock every so often, so drop by when you're in the neighborhood, huh?

Original: Junk Dealer: Always a pleasure. Ohyou look into that other gig yet? If you're planning to, might wanna buy some extra supplies first.
Dialogue: Always a pleasure. Oh—you look into that other gig yet? If you're planning to, might wanna buy some extra supplies first.

Original: Betty: Hey...where'd you guys go?
Dialogue: Hey...where'd you guys go?

Original: Betty: Oh, hey there! Uhh, is Marlene with you?
Dialogue: Oh, hey there! Uhh, is Marlene with you?

Original: Tifa: No.
Dialogue: No.

Original: Betty: Oh, okay. I was kinda hoping she could help me find my friends.
Dialogue: Oh, okay. I was kinda hoping she could help me find my friends.

Original: Tifa: I know someone who can help you. This guy right here.
Dialogue: I know someone who can help you. This guy right here.

Original: Betty: Really!? Okay! Lemme tell you all about them. They have long arms and legs. And they're a little skinny. They like places where there's food. And nice people who give them treats when they ask! And small spaces! Oh yeah, and they're all cats!
Dialogue: Really!? Okay! Lemme tell you all about them. They have long arms and legs. And they're a little skinny. They like places where there's food. And nice people who give them treats when they ask! And small spaces! Oh yeah, and they're all cats!

Original: Cloud: I'm looking for cats?
Dialogue: I'm looking for cats?

Original: Betty: They're friendly, so if you call them, they'll come running. All three of them! Find my friends. Please!
Dialogue: They're friendly, so if you call them, they'll come running. All three of them! Find my friends. Please!

Original: Undercity Resident: Hey, what are you doing in there? Come on out.
Dialogue: Hey, what are you doing in there? Come on out.

Original: Undercity Resident: I'm trying to get a cat to come out. It snatched one of my pastries and scurried in there. Will you be a dear and lend me a hand?
Dialogue: I'm trying to get a cat to come out. It snatched one of my pastries and scurried in there. Will you be a dear and lend me a hand?

Original: Cloud: This sucks.
Dialogue: This sucks.

Original: Undercity Resident: Oh, for the love of... I am sick and tired of chasing this little guy around!\
Dialogue: Oh, for the love of... I am sick and tired of chasing this little guy around!\

Original: Cloud: Ugh, screw this.
Dialogue: Ugh, screw this.

Original: On-screen: Return to Betty?
Dialogue: Return to Betty?

Original: Betty: What? They ran away? So...I'm never gonna see them again?
Dialogue: What? They ran away? So...I'm never gonna see them again?

Original: Betty: You guys! You came back! They said that a scary man was chasing them! Thank you!
Dialogue: You guys! You came back! They said that a scary man was chasing them! Thank you!

Original: Wymer: Hey, I got another job for you, merc.
Dialogue: Hey, I got another job for you, merc.

Original: Wymer: A certain shopkeeper told me you paid him a visit. Thanks for helping him out. Just so happens there's another job I'd like to offer you, now that I know you can handle yourself in a fight.
Dialogue: A certain shopkeeper told me you paid him a visit. Thanks for helping him out. Just so happens there's another job I'd like to offer you, now that I know you can handle yourself in a fight.

Original: Wymer: We've got a real killer on the loose, you see. A rabid catch dog. Maybe you heard people talking about it? Shinra mutt gone feral. Last sighting was in Scrap Boulevard. Think you're up to it?
Dialogue: We've got a real killer on the loose, you see. A rabid catch dog. Maybe you heard people talking about it? Shinra mutt gone feral. Last sighting was in Scrap Boulevard. Think you're up to it?

Original: Cloud: I'll handle it.
Dialogue: I'll handle it.

Original: Wymer: You're a lifesaver! Doubt anyone else around here stands a chance! Go get 'em, bud.
Dialogue: You're a lifesaver! Doubt anyone else around here stands a chance! Go get 'em, bud.

Original: Wymer: Hey! Over here! Tifa! Hey, Cloud!
Dialogue: Hey! Over here! Tifa! Hey, Cloud!

Original: Wymer: I drove the hound into the area up ahead. He's pissed, so make sure you're ready.
Dialogue: I drove the hound into the area up ahead. He's pissed, so make sure you're ready.

Original: On-screen: Return to Wymer?
Dialogue: Return to Wymer?

Original: Wymer: Took care of the dog, did ya? Phew! We owe you one.
Dialogue: Took care of the dog, did ya? Phew! We owe you one.

Original: Cloud: Gotta say, I've never seen a Shinra breed like that before. Out of curiosity, when exactly did it show up?
Dialogue: Gotta say, I've never seen a Shinra breed like that before. Out of curiosity, when exactly did it show up?

Original: Wymer: Oh, today. The first reports came in just this morning. Uh...why do you ask?
Dialogue: Oh, today. The first reports came in just this morning. Uh...why do you ask?

Original: Wymer: Wait a minute... There's this crazy story about a Shinra research lab hidden right beneath our feetunder the slums.
Dialogue: Wait a minute... There's this crazy story about a Shinra research lab hidden right beneath our feet—under the slums.

Original: Cloud: Huh. Really...? That's news to me.
Dialogue: Huh. Really...? That's news to me.

Original: Wymer: (laughs) And here I thought you might know something I don't! Well, I guess not.
Dialogue: (laughs) And here I thought you might know something I don't! Well, I guess not.

Original: Cloud: It's a big organization. I'm sure there's lots of secrets I don't know.
Dialogue: It's a big organization. I'm sure there's lots of secrets I don't know.

Original: Wymer: Yeah, fair enough. You got the bastard. That's good enough for me.
Dialogue: Yeah, fair enough. You got the bastard. That's good enough for me.

Original: Gwen: Seriously!?
Dialogue: Seriously!?

Original: New Recruit: I'm sorry, but it's outside our jurisdiction!
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but it's outside our jurisdiction!

Original: Senior Officer: Show some spine!
Dialogue: Show some spine!

Original: New Recruit: Y-yessir! Ma'am, if you don't leave at once, I will be forced to arrest you!
Dialogue: Y-yessir! Ma'am, if you don't leave at once, I will be forced to arrest you!

Original: Gwen: Oh yeah? Go ahead!
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Go ahead!

Original: Gwen: Tifa! You won't believe this! A cerulean drake flew in from the train graveyard, but these two clowns refuse to get off their butts and do anything about it!
Dialogue: Tifa! You won't believe this! A cerulean drake flew in from the train graveyard, but these two clowns refuse to get off their butts and do anything about it!

Original: Gwen: Hey... Is that...? It is you! The new merc! Then maybe you can help us out? The drake is in the old Talagger factory over there, but to reach it you'll need to get ahold of a watch security key. You should be able to find one inside one of the cratesI forget which. Just smash 'em all.
Dialogue: Hey... Is that...? It is you! The new merc! Then maybe you can help us out? The drake is in the old Talagger factory over there, but to reach it you'll need to get ahold of a watch security key. You should be able to find one inside one of the crates—I forget which. Just smash 'em all.

Original: New Recruit: This really isn't a good time...
Dialogue: This really isn't a good time...

Original: Senior Officer: What was that!? Do your job!
Dialogue: What was that!? Do your job!

Original: New Recruit: Y-yessir!
Dialogue: Y-yessir!

Original: New Recruit: I'm on duty...
Dialogue: I'm on duty...

Original: Senior Officer: Don't fraternize with civilians!
Dialogue: Don't fraternize with civilians!

Original: New Recruit: Y-yessir! You will r-respect my authority, or else I'll...I'll give you what for!
Dialogue: Y-yessir! You will r-respect my authority, or else I'll...I'll give you what for!

Original: New Recruit: I'm on duty...
Dialogue: I'm on duty...

Original: Senior Officer: Don't fraternize with civilians!
Dialogue: Don't fraternize with civilians!

Original: New Recruit: Y-yessir! You will r-respect my authority, or else I'll...I'll give you what for!
Dialogue: Y-yessir! You will r-respect my authority, or else I'll...I'll give you what for!

Original: Narjin: If it ain't the merc himself.
Dialogue: If it ain't the merc himself.

Original: Tifa: That the key?
Dialogue: That the key?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: On-screen: Return to Gwen?
Dialogue: Return to Gwen?

Original: Gwen: And there he is! I knew you were the right man for the job! There's no denying you're the real deal! Not like these idiots, with their excuses. Rather have one of you than twenty of them!
Dialogue: And there he is! I knew you were the right man for the job! There's no denying you're the real deal! Not like these idiots, with their excuses. Rather have one of you than twenty of them!

Original: Cloud: They're just doing their jobs. Can't expect them to be at your beck and call.
Dialogue: They're just doing their jobs. Can't expect them to be at your beck and call.

Original: Gwen: What exactly is it you're trying to say, merc?
Dialogue: What exactly is it you're trying to say, merc?

Original: Cloud: You need people who can follow orders too.
Dialogue: You need people who can follow orders too.

Original: Gwen: I see now. Heard you were ex-Shinra. Guess I shouldn't be surprised you'd go to bat for your old buddies. Me, I'm just looking out for my people. All there is to it.
Dialogue: I see now. Heard you were ex-Shinra. Guess I shouldn't be surprised you'd go to bat for your old buddies. Me, I'm just looking out for my people. All there is to it.

Original: Gwen: Hell with you. We can take care of this town ourselves! No more mercs or Shinrawe'll build up the watch and kick you all out!
Dialogue: Hell with you. We can take care of this town ourselves! No more mercs or Shinra—we'll build up the watch and kick you all out!

Original: (Upon talking to Gwen after completing the quest.)Gwen: We don't want your so-called "protection"! We'll take care of ourselves!
Dialogue: We don't want your so-called "protection"! We'll take care of ourselves!

Original: New Recruit: But...we're only here to...
Dialogue: But...we're only here to...

Original: Senior Officer: Recruit!
Dialogue: Recruit!

Original: New Recruit: Y-yessir! Leave now, otherwise I'll be forced to arrest you!
Dialogue: Y-yessir! Leave now, otherwise I'll be forced to arrest you!

Original: Gwen: C'mon then, tough guy, do it!
Dialogue: C'mon then, tough guy, do it!

Original: Marle: Huh? Someone's back awful early. Not that I mind! Would you two be dears and swap your filters out for me? I left them in your rooms.
Dialogue: Huh? Someone's back awful early. Not that I mind! Would you two be dears and swap your filters out for me? I left them in your rooms.

Original: Tifa: Sure thing!
Dialogue: Sure thing!

Original: Marle: Not so fast, you. Do me a favor. She needs a frienda real friend.
Dialogue: Not so fast, you. Do me a favor. She needs a friend—a real friend.

Original: Cloud: ...We're already friends.
Dialogue: ...We're already friends.

Original: Marle: So when she talks, are you really listening? Thinking about her and her feelings? Or are you just going through the motions? Go on.
Dialogue: So when she talks, are you really listening? Thinking about her and her feelings? Or are you just going through the motions? Go on.

Original: Tifa: Let's take care of this real quick, okay?
Dialogue: Let's take care of this real quick, okay?

Original: Cloud: Sure.
Dialogue: Sure.

Original: Tifa: Come over when you're done.
Dialogue: Come over when you're done.

Original: On-screen: You changed the filter.
Dialogue: You changed the filter.

Original: Tifa: Gimme one sec. I'll be done in a bit.
Dialogue: Gimme one sec. I'll be done in a bit.

Original: Tifa: Finally!
Dialogue: Finally!

Original: Tifa: So. After you left the village.
Dialogue: So. After you left the village.

Original: Cloud: Hm?
Dialogue: Hm?

Original: Tifa: I let you off the hook before. Back at the hall. But not this time.
Dialogue: I let you off the hook before. Back at the hall. But not this time.

Original: Cloud: Well, when we were kids...everybody wanted to be a SOLDIER, right?
Dialogue: Well, when we were kids...everybody wanted to be a SOLDIER, right?

Original: Tifa: Yeah, I remember they were on the news every day during the war.
Dialogue: Yeah, I remember they were on the news every day during the war.

Original: Cloud: Thing is, by the time I finally made it in, they didn't need heroes anymore. It was nothing like what we'd dreamt of. It was just...working for Shinra. Just...
Dialogue: Thing is, by the time I finally made it in, they didn't need heroes anymore. It was nothing like what we'd dreamt of. It was just...working for Shinra. Just...

Original: Tifa: I'm sorry. I know it's a touchy subject.
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I know it's a touchy subject.

Original: Cloud: Not exactly small talk. Especially with someone you haven't seen in a while.
Dialogue: Not exactly small talk. Especially with someone you haven't seen in a while.

Original: Tifa: I get it. Still, it's kinda funny. Us going our separate ways, thinking that must be it... that we'd never meet againand then here of all places we do.
Dialogue: I get it. Still, it's kinda funny. Us going our separate ways, thinking that must be it... that we'd never meet again—and then here of all places we do.

Original: Tifa: You know what? We should totally celebrate! Let's dress up and hit the town!
Dialogue: You know what? We should totally celebrate! Let's dress up and hit the town!

Original: Cloud: Really?
Dialogue: Really?

Original: Tifa: I mean, why not? It'll be fun!
Dialogue: I mean, why not? It'll be fun!

Original: Cloud: Do you even have fancy clothes?
Dialogue: Do you even have fancy clothes?

Original: Tifa: Not likefancyfancy, but I'll figure something out! What do you think would suit me, huh?
Dialogue: Not like fancy fancy, but I'll figure something out! What do you think would suit me, huh?

Original: On-screen: I wonder what would suit me.
Dialogue: I wonder what would suit me.

Original: Cloud: Something refined.
Dialogue: Something refined.

Original: Tifa: Yeah, I guess we're not kids anymore.
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess we're not kids anymore.

Original: Cloud: Something...sporty?
Dialogue: Something...sporty?

Original: Tifa: I don't think that'd be so different from my usual.
Dialogue: I don't think that'd be so different from my usual.

Original: Cloud: Something exotic?
Dialogue: Something exotic?

Original: Tifa: Uhhh...really? Then again, if we're making an effort...
Dialogue: Uhhh...really? Then again, if we're making an effort...

Original: Tifa: Be sure to pick an outfit that goes with mine, okay?
Dialogue: Be sure to pick an outfit that goes with mine, okay?

Original: Cloud: Will do.
Dialogue: Will do.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) This is gonna be so much fun, you'll see!
Dialogue: (chuckles) This is gonna be so much fun, you'll see!

Original: Cloud: Yeah...maybe.
Dialogue: Yeah...maybe.

Original: Tifa: And on that happy note, I think it's time we headed back to the bar. C'mon!
Dialogue: And on that happy note, I think it's time we headed back to the bar. C'mon!

Original: Cloud: Uh, you don't need a break?
Dialogue: Uh, you don't need a break?

Original: Tifa: Honestly, I'm feeling pretty good. Marle isn't always right you know.
Dialogue: Honestly, I'm feeling pretty good. Marle isn't always right you know.

Original: Tifa: Hey, Marle. We took care of the filters, so we're gonna head back to the bar now.
Dialogue: Hey, Marle. We took care of the filters, so we're gonna head back to the bar now.

Original: Marle: Take care you two! ...Oh? You're looking pretty chipper!
Dialogue: Take care you two! ...Oh? You're looking pretty chipper!

Original: Tifa: Uh...I don't feel that different.
Dialogue: Uh...I don't feel that different.

Original: Marle: Must be my imagination then. (chuckles) Anyway! Keep your wits about you, merc! A token of my appreciation. Be good to her.
Dialogue: Must be my imagination then. (chuckles) Anyway! Keep your wits about you, merc! A token of my appreciation. Be good to her.

Original: Johnny: Stay away from me!
Dialogue: Stay away from me!

Original: Johnny: Get off me, assholes! I didn't do shit!
Dialogue: Get off me, assholes! I didn't do shit!

Original: Security Officer: Shut it, punk!
Dialogue: Shut it, punk!

Original: Johnny: Or what!? Screw you!
Dialogue: Or what!? Screw you!

Original: Tifa: What's going on?
Dialogue: What's going on?

Original: Undercity Resident (1): "Somebody" went and stole some blasting agent from a Shinra warehouse. So Public Security started asking questions, and you know how Johnny gets...
Dialogue: "Somebody" went and stole some blasting agent from a Shinra warehouse. So Public Security started asking questions, and you know how Johnny gets...

Original: Undercity Resident (2): It's because of the reactor bombing, I bet. I could be wrong... But something tells me they're not gonna settle for just roughing him up this time.
Dialogue: It's because of the reactor bombing, I bet. I could be wrong... But something tells me they're not gonna settle for just roughing him up this time.

Original: Tifa: We've gotta save him, Cloud!
Dialogue: We've gotta save him, Cloud!

Original: Cloud: Is he Avalanche?
Dialogue: Is he Avalanche?

Original: Tifa: No. He doesn't really know what we do...but he has his suspicions. And... He's a talker.
Dialogue: No. He doesn't really know what we do...but he has his suspicions. And... He's a talker.

Original: Tifa: Actually, you know what...maybe I should go alone.
Dialogue: Actually, you know what...maybe I should go alone.

Original: Cloud: I'm coming.
Dialogue: I'm coming.

Original: Tifa: Uh...are you sure?
Dialogue: Uh...are you sure?

Original: Cloud: It's the least I can do. Lead on.
Dialogue: It's the least I can do. Lead on.

Original: Tifa: Thanks. Come on!
Dialogue: Thanks. Come on!

Original: Johnny: (screams) What the hell, man!? You trying to break my arm!? Dragging me through the street like this isowcruel and unusual punishment!
Dialogue: (screams) What the hell, man!? You trying to break my arm!? Dragging me through the street like this is—ow—cruel and unusual punishment!

Original: Security Officer: Shut your mouth and keep walking! Or else!
Dialogue: Shut your mouth and keep walking! Or else!

Original: Johnny: Come on, guys! Is this any way to treat a model citizen of Midgar?
Dialogue: Come on, guys! Is this any way to treat a model citizen of Midgar?

Original: Tifa: Come on. Let's get a closer look.
Dialogue: Come on. Let's get a closer look.

Original: Security Officer: Model citizens don't steal blasting agent! So why don't you tell me why your ID popped when we were going over the warehouse logs!?
Dialogue: Model citizens don't steal blasting agent! So why don't you tell me why your ID popped when we were going over the warehouse logs!?

Original: Johnny: Huh? You've got it all wrong! I've never gone anywhere near a Shinra warehouse! Unless it was Jessie... She jacked my ID!
Dialogue: Huh? You've got it all wrong! I've never gone anywhere near a Shinra warehouse! Unless it was Jessie... She jacked my ID!

Original: Security Officer: Your ID was never logged, dumbass. It would've never gotten you inside a Shinra installation in the first place! But don't you worrywe'll take all the time we need to help you get your story straight.
Dialogue: Your ID was never logged, dumbass. It would've never gotten you inside a Shinra installation in the first place! But don't you worry—we'll take all the time we need to help you get your story straight.

Original: Johnny: What!? That's bullshit! Cheap bullshit! Entrapment! Yeah, yeah! I know my rights!
Dialogue: What!? That's bullshit! Cheap bullshit! Entrapment! Yeah, yeah! I know my rights!

Original: Tifa: I swear, all he had to do was keep his mouth shut.
Dialogue: I swear, all he had to do was keep his mouth shut.

Original: Cloud: Yep.
Dialogue: Yep.

Original: Tifa: Anyway, you distract the officers, and I'll...figure something out.
Dialogue: Anyway, you distract the officers, and I'll...figure something out.

Original: Cloud: Let him go.
Dialogue: Let him go.

Original: Security Officer: Who're you? The cavalry?
Dialogue: Who're you? The cavalry?

Original: Johnny: Is thatis that who I think it is!? Aw, hell yeah! You guys really came to save me! Ava
Dialogue: Is that—is that who I think it is!? Aw, hell yeah! You guys really came to save me! Ava—

Original: Security Officer: Hey! The hell you think you're doing!?
Dialogue: Hey! The hell you think you're doing!?

Original: Tifa: Here we go...
Dialogue: Here we go...

Original: Johnny: Uh...so...is it over? Yo, anybody there? If you're there, then help me!
Dialogue: Uh...so...is it over? Yo, anybody there? If you're there, then help me!

Original: Tifa: Grab Johnny so we can get outta here.
Dialogue: Grab Johnny so we can get outta here.

Original: Cloud: Alright.
Dialogue: Alright.

Original: Tifa: Whwhat now?
Dialogue: Wh—what now?

Original: Cloud: He's a talker.
Dialogue: He's a talker.

Original: Tifa: No!
Dialogue: No!

Original: Johnny: Huh!? You're not gonna... Hold up! Wait! Don'tdon't do it, man!
Dialogue: Huh!? You're not gonna... Hold up! Wait! Don't—don't do it, man!

Original: Cloud: You wanna live, then get the hell out of town.
Dialogue: You wanna live, then get the hell out of town.

Original: Johnny: Y-y-you got it, boss! You ain't never gonna see my face again, I swear!
Dialogue: Y-y-you got it, boss! You ain't never gonna see my face again, I swear!

Original: Cloud: Are you sure about this? It's a big risk.
Dialogue: Are you sure about this? It's a big risk.

Original: Tifa: I know, but...it's fine.
Dialogue: I know, but...it's fine.

Original: Cloud: And them?
Dialogue: And them?

Original: Tifa: No more... Cloud... You're scaring me.
Dialogue: No more... Cloud... You're scaring me.

Original: Tifa: We need to go before they wake up.
Dialogue: We need to go before they wake up.

Original: Tifa: I...I'm worried about Johnny.
Dialogue: I...I'm worried about Johnny.

Original: Cloud: I'm more worried about us. We gotta go, right?
Dialogue: I'm more worried about us. We gotta go, right?

Original: Tifa: Right...
Dialogue: Right...

Original: Cloud: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Tifa: It's just...you've really changed.
Dialogue: It's just...you've really changed.

Original: Cloud: How?
Dialogue: How?

Original: Tifa: I suppose it's...yeah. Your eyes. They used to be less...
Dialogue: I suppose it's...yeah. Your eyes. They used to be less...

Original: Cloud: It's the mako. SOLDIER, remember?
Dialogue: It's the mako. SOLDIER, remember?

Original: Tifa: ...I remember. So, what do you wanna do now? Head back to the bar? Or do you wanna tackle another job or two?
Dialogue: ...I remember. So, what do you wanna do now? Head back to the bar? Or do you wanna tackle another job or two?

Original: Tifa: And here we are. You must be tired.
Dialogue: And here we are. You must be tired.

Original: Cloud: Same as you, I guess.
Dialogue: Same as you, I guess.

Original: Tifa: Could use a little something to take the edge off, right? How about a refreshing cocktail made by yours truly that you can sit back and savor?
Dialogue: Could use a little something to take the edge off, right? How about a refreshing cocktail made by yours truly that you can sit back and savor?

Original: Cloud: Tifa...
Dialogue: Tifa...

Original: Tifa: Yeah, I'm feeling it a bit too. Hey... Do you think you'll stick around a little longer?
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm feeling it a bit too. Hey... Do you think you'll stick around a little longer?

Original: Cloud: Maybe. Work for a minute, build up some savings...
Dialogue: Maybe. Work for a minute, build up some savings...

Original: Tifa: I see. In that case, wanna head back out and look for more gigs?
Dialogue: I see. In that case, wanna head back out and look for more gigs?

Original: On-screen: Head back out into town?
Dialogue: Head back out into town?

Original: Cloud: Yeah, why not.
Dialogue: Yeah, why not.

Original: Tifa: Well? You wanna head inside?
Dialogue: Well? You wanna head inside?

Original: On-screen: Head into Seventh Heaven?
Dialogue: Head into Seventh Heaven?

Original: Tifa: We're back.
Dialogue: We're back.

Original: Marlene: Did you...have fun?
Dialogue: Did you...have fun?

Original: Tifa: Lotsa fun.
Dialogue: Lotsa fun.

Original: Barret: Heyneed y'all downstairs.
Dialogue: Hey—need y'all downstairs.

Original: Tifa: Uh...right now? Then the plan is...?
Dialogue: Uh...right now? Then the plan is...?

Original: Barret: Marlene, wanna go wait for Jessie out front?
Dialogue: Marlene, wanna go wait for Jessie out front?

Original: Marlene: Okay!
Dialogue: Okay!

Original: Tifa: Looks like we're officially on for tomorrow night, then. Gotta go over the details with the others.
Dialogue: Looks like we're officially on for tomorrow night, then. Gotta go over the details with the others.

Original: Cloud: Before you do, about my pay
Dialogue: Before you do, about my pay—

Original: Barret: You'll get your money! So sit down and shut up until we're finished. Double time, Tifa.
Dialogue: You'll get your money! So sit down and shut up until we're finished. Double time, Tifa.

Original: Tifa: I'm really sorry...but it shouldn't take much longer. In the meantime... Grab a seat.
Dialogue: I'm really sorry...but it shouldn't take much longer. In the meantime... Grab a seat.

Original: Tifa: What'll it be?
Dialogue: What'll it be?

Original: On-screen: What'll it be?
Dialogue: What'll it be?

Original: Cloud: I dunno...something hard and bitter.
Dialogue: I dunno...something hard and bitter.

Original: Cloud: Not really in the mood right now.
Dialogue: Not really in the mood right now.

Original: Tifa: But if you were, then maybe...
Dialogue: But if you were, then maybe...

Original: Tifa: Well? Most people would say something sweet right about now.
Dialogue: Well? Most people would say something sweet right about now.

Original: Cloud: I'm sure they would.
Dialogue: I'm sure they would.

Original: Tifa: Ahh, but you're a more discerning customer, aren't you? In which case...
Dialogue: Ahh, but you're a more discerning customer, aren't you? In which case...

Original: Tifa: Our house special: the Cosmo Canyon.
Dialogue: Our house special the Cosmo Canyon.

Original: Cloud: Beautiful.
Dialogue: Beautiful.

Original: Tifa: I gotta go. Enjoy.
Dialogue: I gotta go. Enjoy.

Original: Jessie: Hey! You see the news? "The reactor bombing was the work of the eco-extremist group 'Avalanche.'" Public enemy number one! Gets your heart racing, doesn't it? They don't know our faces, so we're in the clear for now, but we'll wanna capitalize on this momentum. Speaking of which, you coming on the next one?
Dialogue: Hey! You see the news? "The reactor bombing was the work of the eco-extremist group 'Avalanche.'" Public enemy number one! Gets your heart racing, doesn't it? They don't know our faces, so we're in the clear for now, but we'll wanna capitalize on this momentum. Speaking of which, you coming on the next one?

Original: Cloud: For the right price.
Dialogue: For the right price.

Original: Jessie: Oh, you can bet I'll be pushing hard for a raise!
Dialogue: Oh, you can bet I'll be pushing hard for a raise!

Original: Jessie: Tifa'll be joining us too, but I dunno... Even a blind man can see her heart's not in it. She was never on board with the bombings, so if it comes down to do or die... If I've got to put my life in someone else's hands... Then...I'd rather that someone was a professional. Like you.
Dialogue: Tifa'll be joining us too, but I dunno... Even a blind man can see her heart's not in it. She was never on board with the bombings, so if it comes down to do or die... If I've got to put my life in someone else's hands... Then...I'd rather that someone was a professional. Like you.

Original: Cloud: Could still kill some time.
Dialogue: Could still kill some time.

Original: Cloud: What was up with that girl anyway?
Dialogue: What was up with that girl anyway?

Original: On-screen: Play some darts?
Dialogue: Play some darts?

Original: Cloud: Maybe just chill a bit.
Dialogue: Maybe just chill a bit.

Original: On-screen: Wait at the counter for Tifa?
Dialogue: Wait at the counter for Tifa?

Original: Cloud: I heard you're having second thoughts.
Dialogue: I heard you're having second thoughts.

Original: Tifa: I know we have to think big if we're going to make a difference. But not like this. I just... I feel trapped.
Dialogue: I know we have to think big if we're going to make a difference. But not like this. I just... I feel trapped.

Original: Cloud: If it feels wrong, don't do it.
Dialogue: If it feels wrong, don't do it.

Original: Tifa: Guess that's that, then.
Dialogue: Guess that's that, then.

Original: Cloud: What, they kick you out?
Dialogue: What, they kick you out?

Original: Tifa: We agreed to disagree. Soyou want another drink?
Dialogue: We agreed to disagree. So—you want another drink?

Original: Barret: Tifa! Time to celebrate! Break out all the good stuff!
Dialogue: Tifa! Time to celebrate! Break out all the good stuff!

Original: Tifa: Oh. Sure.
Dialogue: Oh. Sure.

Original: Barret: We won't be needing you for this next job. Feel free to look for work elsewhere.
Dialogue: We won't be needing you for this next job. Feel free to look for work elsewhere.

Original: Cloud: Fine by me. That's how I like it. No contract, no obligation.
Dialogue: Fine by me. That's how I like it. No contract, no obligation.

Original: Barret: Figured you'd say that. Herethe rest of your payment, along with a little extra for your exemplary service. And thus concludes our business. Gonna have to ask you to leave now. This here's a private affair.
Dialogue: Figured you'd say that. Here—the rest of your payment, along with a little extra for your exemplary service. And thus concludes our business. Gonna have to ask you to leave now. This here's a private affair.

Original: Jessie: Sorry, I tried. We talked it over, but...in the end... We didn't want to put so much on you. This is our fight.
Dialogue: Sorry, I tried. We talked it over, but...in the end... We didn't want to put so much on you. This is our fight.

Original: Biggs: Jessie, what's the holdup?
Dialogue: Jessie, what's the holdup?

Original: Jessie: Be right there!
Dialogue: Be right there!

Original: Jessie: No hard feelings, huh?
Dialogue: No hard feelings, huh?

Original: Cloud: It's fine.
Dialogue: It's fine.

Original: Jessie: Let's talk more after I'm done here, okay?
Dialogue: Let's talk more after I'm done here, okay?

Original: Cloud: Really, it's fine.
Dialogue: Really, it's fine.

Original: Wedge: C'mon, Jessie! I'm dying here!
Dialogue: C'mon, Jessie! I'm dying here!

Original: Jessie: I'll catch you later.
Dialogue: I'll catch you later.

Original: Jessie: Sorry to keep you thirsty boys waiting!
Dialogue: Sorry to keep you thirsty boys waiting!

Original: Everyone: Avalanche!
Dialogue: Avalanche!

Original: Biggs: Glug, glug, glug, glug... Ahhh! That hit the spot!
Dialogue: Glug, glug, glug, glug... Ahhh! That hit the spot!

Original: Jessie: Damn, Biggs, slow down!
Dialogue: Damn, Biggs, slow down!

Original: Barret: Keep it tight! Ain't no room for error come tomorrow!
Dialogue: Keep it tight! Ain't no room for error come tomorrow!

Original: Wedge: More reason to live it up now!
Dialogue: More reason to live it up now!

Original: Biggs: Yep! Best way to clear your head so. you can focus when it counts!
Dialogue: Yep! Best way to clear your head so. you can focus when it counts!

Original: Tifa: It's been too long since we did this.
Dialogue: It's been too long since we did this.

Original: Wedge: Not since we went on that all-night bender after HQ gave us the boot.
Dialogue: Not since we went on that all-night bender after HQ gave us the boot.

Original: Jessie: They did not "give us the boot"!
Dialogue: They did not "give us the boot"!

Original: Barret: It was an "amicable separation."
Dialogue: It was an "amicable separation."

Original: Jessie: Just thinking about it's making me mad again.
Dialogue: Just thinking about it's making me mad again.

Original: Tifa: Can't believe it's already been a year. I don't know how we managed.
Dialogue: Can't believe it's already been a year. I don't know how we managed.

Original: Barret: Well, I do. It was you guys going above and beyond. Thank you.
Dialogue: Well, I do. It was you guys going above and beyond. Thank you.

Original: Biggs: No need for that, boss. We all knew what we were signing up for.
Dialogue: No need for that, boss. We all knew what we were signing up for.

Original: Barret: Yeah, but when shit hits the fan, it's good to know you're in my corner. End of the day...you're all I got!
Dialogue: Yeah, but when shit hits the fan, it's good to know you're in my corner. End of the day...you're all I got!

Original: Biggs: Happy to look out for you, like I know you'll look out for me.
Dialogue: Happy to look out for you, like I know you'll look out for me.

Original: Wedge: So long as someone looks out for my stomach!
Dialogue: So long as someone looks out for my stomach!

Original: Jessie: Tifa's got you covered there.
Dialogue: Tifa's got you covered there.

Original: Barret: As a friend, or as a cook?
Dialogue: As a friend, or as a cook?

Original: Jessie: As if you've really gotta ask!
Dialogue: As if you've really gotta ask!

Original: Wedge: That tickled!
Dialogue: That tickled!

Original: Tifa: I guess it is kinda obvious!
Dialogue: I guess it is kinda obvious!

Original: Wedge: You know, it'd be really cool if we could do this again tomorrow night.
Dialogue: You know, it'd be really cool if we could do this again tomorrow night.

Original: Barret: Oh we will. Avalanche!
Dialogue: Oh we will. Avalanche!

Original: Everyone: Avalanche!
Dialogue: Avalanche!

Original: Tifa: You guys...
Dialogue: You guys...

Original: Cloud: What's up with them?
Dialogue: What's up with them?

Original: Hoodlum (1): So what, we just hang around here till he shows up? Big guy with a gun for an arm?
Dialogue: So what, we just hang around here till he shows up? Big guy with a gun for an arm?

Original: Hoodlum (2): Word is he lives in this town. Just shut up and wait. We'll find him soon enough.
Dialogue: Word is he lives in this town. Just shut up and wait. We'll find him soon enough.

Original: Hoodlum (3): Man! Seems like the boss always gives us the most shit-tastic assignments.
Dialogue: Man! Seems like the boss always gives us the most shit-tastic assignments.

Original: Hoodlum (2): Guess that's why we're paid so damn much.
Dialogue: Guess that's why we're paid so damn much.

Original: Hoodlum (1): What're you looking at?
Dialogue: What're you looking at?

Original: Hoodlum (3): We got a problem?
Dialogue: We got a problem?

Original: Hoodlum (2): What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Hoodlum: Hey brother! You from around the way?
Dialogue: Hey brother! You from around the way?

Original: Cloud: I guess.
Dialogue: I guess.

Original: Hoodlum: Know a big man with a big gun strapped to his right arm? Heard he's set up shop somewhere in the neighborhood.
Dialogue: Know a big man with a big gun strapped to his right arm? Heard he's set up shop somewhere in the neighborhood.

Original: Cloud: That depends...
Dialogue: That depends...

Original: Hoodlum: Clever. Smell an opportunity to make some scratch, do ya?
Dialogue: Clever. Smell an opportunity to make some scratch, do ya?

Original: Cloud: Five hundred.
Dialogue: Five hundred.

Original: Hoodlum: Two hundred.
Dialogue: Two hundred.

Original: Cloud: Mm, three.
Dialogue: Mm, three.

Original: Hoodlum: Whatever, man. Let's fin somewhere quiet to talk. Walk with me.
Dialogue: Whatever, man. Let's fin somewhere quiet to talk. Walk with me.

Original: Hoodlum (1): Got something to say!?
Dialogue: Got something to say!?

Original: Hoodlum (2): You lookin' at me?
Dialogue: You lookin' at me?

Original: Hoodlum (1): Move it! I saidmove!
Dialogue: Move it! I said move!

Original: Hoodlum (2): Look at all these assholes starin' at us.
Dialogue: Look at all these assholes starin' at us.

Original: Hoodlum (3): This shithole's got nothing on Wall Marketam I right?
Dialogue: This shithole's got nothing on Wall Market—am I right?

Original: Hoodlum (2): Word of advice, blondie. Don't piss off my friend here, or you'll be real sorry. Unless you've got some kinda death withthen be my guest. (laughs)
Dialogue: Word of advice, blondie. Don't piss off my friend here, or you'll be real sorry. Unless you've got some kinda death with—then be my guest. (laughs)

Original: Hoodlum (1): After you, brother... And don't worryI ain't the backstabbin' typemostdays...
Dialogue: After you, brother... And don't worry—I ain't the backstabbin' type—most days...

Original: Hoodlum: Spill it. You know where the bastard's hiding, don't you?
Dialogue: Spill it. You know where the bastard's hiding, don't you?

Original: Cloud: I told you before... That depends.
Dialogue: I told you before... That depends.

Original: Hoodlum: Oh yeah? You wasting my time!?
Dialogue: Oh yeah? You wasting my time!?

Original: Cloud: Shinra's time, you mean?
Dialogue: Shinra's time, you mean?

Original: Hoodlum: Hah. Shinra knows better than to stick its nose inmyboss's business.
Dialogue: Hah. Shinra knows better than to stick its nose in my boss's business.

Original: Cloud: Like I give a shit.
Dialogue: Like I give a shit.

Original: Cloud: Big man with a big gun for an arm, right!?
Dialogue: Big man with a big gun for an arm, right!?

Original: Hoodlum: Uh... Hey...it's...
Dialogue: Uh... Hey...it's...

Original: Cloud: Why do you want him?
Dialogue: Why do you want him?

Original: Hoodlum: Just a grunt following orders, you know? Nobody tells me shit. Lemme walk away. Please!
Dialogue: Just a grunt following orders, you know? Nobody tells me shit. Lemme walk away. Please!

Original: Cloud: So, if they weren't Shinra, then...
Dialogue: So, if they weren't Shinra, then...

Original: Cloud: Not my problem. Lesson one for life on the ground floor... Get some rest.
Dialogue: Not my problem. Lesson one for life on the ground floor... Get some rest.

Original: Jessie: Welcome home, honey! Took your sweet time.
Dialogue: Welcome home, honey! Took your sweet time.

Original: Jessie: Psych.
Dialogue: Psych.

Original: Jessie: Are you gonna let me in so we can talk in private?
Dialogue: Are you gonna let me in so we can talk in private?

Original: Jessie: Guess I'll get right to the point, then.
Dialogue: Guess I'll get right to the point, then.

Original: Cloud: What've you got there?
Dialogue: What've you got there?

Original: Jessie: An apology. For not getting you on the mission. Or not. What doyouthink it is?
Dialogue: An apology. For not getting you on the mission. Or not. What do you think it is?

Original: Cloud: A proposition.
Dialogue: A proposition.

Original: Jessie: Nailed it in one. Gonna have to ask you to keep all this a secret from the others, though. It's a personal mattersomething I need to sort out tonight.
Dialogue: Nailed it in one. Gonna have to ask you to keep all this a secret from the others, though. It's a personal matter—something I need to sort out tonight.

Original: Cloud: Tonight?
Dialogue: Tonight?

Original: Jessie: Tonight. You and me, together. I want you to come with me to the Sector 7 plate. I'll give you the details on the way.
Dialogue: Tonight. You and me, together. I want you to come with me to the Sector 7 plate. I'll give you the details on the way.

Original: Cloud: That's fine by me... But don't you have a pretty big day ahead of you?
Dialogue: That's fine by me... But don't you have a pretty big day ahead of you?

Original: Jessie: I do, but... If I don't deal with this now, it's only gonna get harder... Anyway... I can count on you, can't I?
