Original: Engineering Officer: B5, this is Engineering. You need to pick up the pacewe're running dangerously low on components because of those terrorists!
Dialogue: B5, this is Engineering. You need to pick up the pace—we're running dangerously low on components because of those terrorists!

Original: Security Officer: Copy!
Dialogue: Copy!

Original: Security Officer: They're here!
Dialogue: They're here!

Original: Barret: Buncha pushovers. C'mon, y'all. Let's see what kinda mischief they were getting up to.
Dialogue: Buncha pushovers. C'mon, y'all. Let's see what kinda mischief they were getting up to.

Original: Cloud: Four consoles. And never enough keycards...
Dialogue: Four consoles. And never enough keycards...

Original: Tifa: Think we've done enough to weaken the robot?
Dialogue: Think we've done enough to weaken the robot?

Original: Cloud: All that we can, at least.
Dialogue: All that we can, at least.

Original: Barret: It's all good. The stage is setall that's left is to hijack Heidegger's show!
Dialogue: It's all good. The stage is set—all that's left is to hijack Heidegger's show!

Original: Barret: We're coming up on the exit. Tifadetonator still in range?
Dialogue: We're coming up on the exit. Tifa—detonator still in range?

Original: Tifa: We should be good.
Dialogue: We should be good.

Original: Barret: The moment big boy goes down, you hit that switch.
Dialogue: The moment big boy goes down, you hit that switch.

Original: Tifa: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Barret: Can't say we didn't prepare. Now we just gotta get it done!
Dialogue: Can't say we didn't prepare. Now we just gotta get it done!

Original: Engineering Officer: Status report!
Dialogue: Status report!

Original: Security Officer: We're short on XXX, but tracking down replacements!
Dialogue: We're short on XXX, but tracking down replacements!

Original: Engineering Officer: Work faster! Or you'll hear it from the brass!
Dialogue: Work faster! Or you'll hear it from the brass!

Original: Barret: Look! They're still preppin' it!
Dialogue: Look! They're still preppin' it!

Original: Engineering Officer: They're here! Hold 'em back! Buy us every second you can!
Dialogue: They're here! Hold 'em back! Buy us every second you can!

Original: Heidegger: What is the status of my airbuster? Report!
Dialogue: What is the status of my airbuster? Report!

Original: Engineering Officer: I'm sorry, sir. We're going to need more time! The terrorists have breached the room and are engaging our forces. At this rate, there's no telling when we'll have it fully operational!
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir. We're going to need more time! The terrorists have breached the room and are engaging our forces. At this rate, there's no telling when we'll have it fully operational!

Original: Heidegger: (laughs) As expected. Deploy it at once!
Dialogue: (laughs) As expected. Deploy it at once!

Original: Engineering Officer: But sir, it's not ready yet!
Dialogue: But sir, it's not ready yet!

Original: Heidegger: That was an order!
Dialogue: That was an order!

Original: Engineering Officer: Understood. Prepare the airbuster for immediate deployment!
Dialogue: Understood. Prepare the airbuster for immediate deployment!

Original: Barret: Shit! We too late?
Dialogue: Shit! We too late?

Original: Engineering Officer: That's far enough, you bastards! I'm taking you down!
Dialogue: That's far enough, you bastards! I'm taking you down!

Original: Barret: Y'all never had a chance!
Dialogue: Y'all never had a chance!

Original: Tifa: Hey, guys.
Dialogue: Hey, guys.

Original: Tifa: Looks like a performance assessment, don't you think?
Dialogue: Looks like a performance assessment, don't you think?

Original: Tifa: Reduced response time... Should work in our favor.
Dialogue: Reduced response time... Should work in our favor.

Original: Cloud: We'll figure out its weaknesses as we fight it. As long as we stay focused, we'll be fine. We can do this.
Dialogue: We'll figure out its weaknesses as we fight it. As long as we stay focused, we'll be fine. We can do this.

Original: Barret: For real, though, we need to talk victory poses. Something coordinated for the live, on-camera finish! Could blow up bigstart a new trend!
Dialogue: For real, though, we need to talk victory poses. Something coordinated for the live, on-camera finish! Could blow up big—start a new trend!

Original: Cloud: Veto.
Dialogue: Veto.

Original: Barret: Huh. No way up?
Dialogue: Huh. No way up?

Original: Barret: Damn near gave me a heart attack!
Dialogue: Damn near gave me a heart attack!

Original: Barret: Bastard cleared the way for us.
Dialogue: Bastard cleared the way for us.

Original: Cloud: Real subtle invitation.
Dialogue: Real subtle invitation.

Original: Barret: We were gonna spring the trap anyway!
Dialogue: We were gonna spring the trap anyway!

Original: Barret: Big boy's going to an execution all right. We're gonna put him out of his misery while the whole damn city watches!
Dialogue: Big boy's going to an execution all right. We're gonna put him out of his misery while the whole damn city watches!

Original: Tifa: We give it our all and we'll win!
Dialogue: We give it our all and we'll win!

Original: Barret: We're gonna get through this. We're gonna make it home. All of us. No exceptions.
Dialogue: We're gonna get through this. We're gonna make it home. All of us. No exceptions.

Original: Tifa: Right. We don't wanna disappoint Marlene.
Dialogue: Right. We don't wanna disappoint Marlene.

Original: Tifa: That goes for you too, Cloud. Right?
Dialogue: That goes for you too, Cloud. Right?

Original: Barret: You'd better give her a big ol' smile this time.
Dialogue: You'd better give her a big ol' smile this time.

Original: Cloud: If the price is right.
Dialogue: If the price is right.

Original: Barret: What? Open it already!
Dialogue: What? Open it already!

Original: Cloud: It's locked down.
Dialogue: It's locked down.

Original: Tifa: Is there any way we can get it open?
Dialogue: Is there any way we can get it open?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. From that room over there.
Dialogue: Yeah. From that room over there.

Original: Barret: Why does everything have to be so damn complicated...?
Dialogue: Why does everything have to be so damn complicated...?

Original: Cloud: You know, the faulty equipment storeroom's that way too.
Dialogue: You know, the faulty equipment storeroom's that way too.

Original: Tifa: Do you think we'll find the components we diverted there?
Dialogue: Do you think we'll find the components we diverted there?

Original: Barret: It's like a treasure vault! Hoo, I like the sound of that!
Dialogue: It's like a treasure vault! Hoo, I like the sound of that!

Original: Tifa: So how do we do this?
Dialogue: So how do we do this?

Original: Cloud: It's simple, really. We move the levers at the same time.
Dialogue: It's simple, really. We move the levers at the same time.

Original: Tifa: Got these ones.
Dialogue: Got these ones.

Original: Barret: I'll take left. Which just leaves right, SOLDIER boy.
Dialogue: I'll take left. Which just leaves right, SOLDIER boy.

Original: Announcement: Emergency lockdown is currently in effect.
Dialogue: Emergency lockdown is currently in effect.

Original: Tifa: So we need to synchronize our movements?
Dialogue: So we need to synchronize our movements?

Original: Barret: In that case, follow my lead.
Dialogue: In that case, follow my lead.

Original: Cloud: NahTifa's.
Dialogue: Nah—Tifa's.

Original: Barret: Fine! Have it your way!
Dialogue: Fine! Have it your way!

Original: Tifa: Okay, pay attention, you two...
Dialogue: Okay, pay attention, you two...

Original: Tifa: Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Three, two, one...

Original: Barret: I'm, uh, still getting warmed up!
Dialogue: I'm, uh, still getting warmed up!

Original: Barret: Shit!
Dialogue: Shit!

Original: Tifa: No good. Let's try again.
Dialogue: No good. Let's try again.

Original: Tifa: Don't rush it!
Dialogue: Don't rush it!

Original: Tifa: Um... Breathe when I breathe!
Dialogue: Um... Breathe when I breathe!

Original: Barret: No need to grip it so hard!
Dialogue: No need to grip it so hard!

Original: Barret: Got an idea! Seventh seventh heaven heaven hoo-ah! Seventh seventh heaven heaven hoo-ah!
Dialogue: Got an idea! Seventh seventh heaven heaven hoo-ah! Seventh seventh heaven heaven hoo-ah!

Original: Cloud: Hell no.
Dialogue: Hell no.

Original: Barret: How 'bout this then? Seveeenth heaven! Heaven! Heaven!
Dialogue: How 'bout this then? Seveeenth heaven! Heaven! Heaven!

Original: Tifa: We're doing it my way! Three, two, one...
Dialogue: We're doing it my way! Three, two, one...

Original: Barret: Hey, are you even trying? How 'bout a chant to help us time it right? Aaa-vaaa-lanche!
Dialogue: Hey, are you even trying? How 'bout a chant to help us time it right? Aaa-vaaa-lanche!

Original: Tifa: This is exhausting!
Dialogue: This is exhausting!

Original: Barret: Hey, I think I should lead after all. Five...four...three-two-one-go!
Dialogue: Hey, I think I should lead after all. Five...four...three-two-one-go!

Original: Cloud: Much better.
Dialogue: Much better.

Original: Tifa: We got this. Three, two, one...
Dialogue: We got this. Three, two, one...

Original: Tifa: Shake it off. Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Shake it off. Three, two, one...

Original: Tifa: Focus! Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Focus! Three, two, one...

Original: Tifa: Let's just get through this. Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Let's just get through this. Three, two, one...

Original: Announcement: Emergency lockdowndisengaged.
Dialogue: Emergency lockdown—disengaged.

Original: Tifa: Thank god...
Dialogue: Thank god...

Original: Barret: How the hell we made it through with dumbass here, I'll never know.
Dialogue: How the hell we made it through with dumbass here, I'll never know.

Original: Cloud: We really are in sync. Took the words right outta my mouth.
Dialogue: We really are in sync. Took the words right outta my mouth.

Original: Barret: What did you say!?
Dialogue: What did you say!?

Original: Tifa: Okay, that's it. Let's go.
Dialogue: Okay, that's it. Let's go.

Original: Barret: Gotcha!
Dialogue: Gotcha!

Original: Tifa: Now that is what I call teamwork!
Dialogue: Now that is what I call teamwork!

Original: Cloud: Go team.
Dialogue: Go team.

Original: Barret: Hell yeah! (laughs)
Dialogue: Hell yeah! (laughs)

Original: Tifa: We really did it! Great timingright on the money!
Dialogue: We really did it! Great timing—right on the money!

Original: Cloud: Yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah...

Original: Barret: Whatcha'll got tucked away in that vault, huh?
Dialogue: Whatcha'll got tucked away in that vault, huh?

Original: Barret: This would be the treasure vault?
Dialogue: This would be the treasure vault?

Original: Cloud: That's right.
Dialogue: That's right.

Original: Tifa: What's the catch?
Dialogue: What's the catch?

Original: Cloud: Need to bypass a high-level security lock.
Dialogue: Need to bypass a high-level security lock.

Original: Barret: Different from the other one?
Dialogue: Different from the other one?

Original: Cloud: Same deal, but we gotta do it several times.
Dialogue: Same deal, but we gotta do it several times.

Original: Barret: Hah. Not a problem!
Dialogue: Hah. Not a problem!

Original: Tifa: Yeah, let's try!
Dialogue: Yeah, let's try!

Original: Announcement: Delta-level security lockdown is currently in effect.
Dialogue: Delta-level security lockdown is currently in effect.

Original: Tifa: Okay, guys. You know what we have to do.
Dialogue: Okay, guys. You know what we have to do.

Original: Barret: Copy me?
Dialogue: Copy me?

Original: Cloud: No, Tifa leads.
Dialogue: No, Tifa leads.

Original: Barret: Oh, fine! After you, girl.
Dialogue: Oh, fine! After you, girl.

Original: Tifa: Gotta get past level one first, right? Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Gotta get past level one first, right? Three, two, one...

Original: Announcement: Alpha-level securitydisengaged.
Dialogue: Alpha-level security—disengaged.

Original: Tifa: That was great, you guys! Let's keep it up!
Dialogue: That was great, you guys! Let's keep it up!

Original: Announcement: Beta-level securitydisengaged.
Dialogue: Beta-level security—disengaged.

Original: Tifa: Wow! Think we've got this?
Dialogue: Wow! Think we've got this?

Original: Barret: Hell yeah, bring it on! Ain't nothing I love more than sticking it to Shinra!
Dialogue: Hell yeah, bring it on! Ain't nothing I love more than sticking it to Shinra!

Original: Tifa: Halfway there. Steady, guys. Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Halfway there. Steady, guys. Three, two, one...

Original: Announcement: Gamma-level securitydisengaged.
Dialogue: Gamma-level security—disengaged.

Original: Tifa: No way! You guys are naturals!
Dialogue: No way! You guys are naturals!

Original: Tifa: Okay, final round. Don't lose focus. Three, two, one...
Dialogue: Okay, final round. Don't lose focus. Three, two, one...

Original: Announcement: Delta-level securitydisengaged. Disposal room now accessible.
Dialogue: Delta-level security—disengaged. Disposal room now accessible.

Original: Tifa: Finally. I was beginning to think it'd never end.
Dialogue: Finally. I was beginning to think it'd never end.

Original: Barret: Ayo, Cloud, what's the deal? You really a bona fire SOLDIER?
Dialogue: Ayo, Cloud, what's the deal? You really a bona fire SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud: We didn't train for this stuff.
Dialogue: We didn't train for this stuff.

Original: Barret: All that marching with no rhythm? How did you SOLDIER on?
Dialogue: All that marching with no rhythm? How did you SOLDIER on?

Original: Tifa: Okay, that's enough of that. Let's see what's inside.
Dialogue: Okay, that's enough of that. Let's see what's inside.

Original: Barret: Take that, Shinra? Makin' us jump through hoops to steal your shit...
Dialogue: Take that, Shinra? Makin' us jump through hoops to steal your shit...

Original: Tifa: Didn't take as long as I expected! Good work guys!
Dialogue: Didn't take as long as I expected! Good work guys!

Original: Cloud: Likewise. You made it easy.
Dialogue: Likewise. You made it easy.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) I put my heart and soul into those countdowns...
Dialogue: (chuckles) I put my heart and soul into those countdowns...

Original: Barret: Boo-yah! Bet all the Shinra suits watching enjoyed that!
Dialogue: Boo-yah! Bet all the Shinra suits watching enjoyed that!

Original: Tifa: You guys were great!
Dialogue: You guys were great!

Original: Tifa: I swear, your timing was perfect. It's almost like...you could read my mind. SOLDIERs can't do that, can they?
Dialogue: I swear, your timing was perfect. It's almost like...you could read my mind. SOLDIERs can't do that, can they?

Original: Cloud: I can'tyet.
Dialogue: I can't—yet.

Original: Tifa: Thank god.
Dialogue: Thank god.

Original: Barret: C'mon, you two, let's see what we got.
Dialogue: C'mon, you two, let's see what we got.

Original: Tifa: Score! It's just like Cloud said!
Dialogue: Score! It's just like Cloud said!

Original: Barret: They say a job well done's its own reward... I say take everything that ain't nailed down!
Dialogue: They say a job well done's its own reward... I say take everything that ain't nailed down!

Original: Barret: All right, time to go!
Dialogue: All right, time to go!

Original: Tifa: Look!
Dialogue: Look!

Original: Barret: President Shinra?
Dialogue: President Shinra?

Original: President Shinra: Oho. The eyes of one who has bathed in mako... Which would make you...a SOLDIER?
Dialogue: Oho. The eyes of one who has bathed in mako... Which would make you...a SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud: Ex-SOLDIER.
Dialogue: Ex-SOLDIER.

Original: President Shinra: Once a SOLDIER, always a SOLDIER. Though not, alas, for very long. Accelerated cellular degradation being the most common cause of death by far. This is classified, of course, but every SOLDIER knows the truth.
Dialogue: Once a SOLDIER, always a SOLDIER. Though not, alas, for very long. Accelerated cellular degradation being the most common cause of death by far. This is classified, of course, but every SOLDIER knows the truth.

Original: Cloud: ...That's right.
Dialogue: ...That's right.

Original: Barret: Think you forgettin' someone!?
Dialogue: Think you forgettin' someone!?

Original: President Shinra: Would that I could. You strike me as the type to go on without end.
Dialogue: Would that I could. You strike me as the type to go on without end.

Original: Barret: Ain't enough hours in the day to hold you to account for all your crimes!
Dialogue: Ain't enough hours in the day to hold you to account for all your crimes!

Original: President Shinra: And what a wasteful indulgence it would be even if there were.
Dialogue: And what a wasteful indulgence it would be even if there were.

Original: Barret: Oh, okay then... Let's talk about wasteful indulgences. What is mako? The lifestream! The lifeblood of the planetour planet! But Shinra keeps on slurping it up like a thirsty dog! Whadda you think's gonna happen if you don't stop, huh!?
Dialogue: Oh, okay then... Let's talk about wasteful indulgences. What is mako? The lifestream! The lifeblood of the planet—our planet! But Shinra keeps on slurping it up like a thirsty dog! Whadda you think's gonna happen if you don't stop, huh!?

Original: President Shinra: We do indeed keep on "slurping it up," as you say... But...for whose benefit, I wonder. The true nature of mako is known to one and all, yet the people willfully turn a blind eye to the cost. As you must surely be aware?
Dialogue: We do indeed keep on "slurping it up," as you say... But...for whose benefit, I wonder. The true nature of mako is known to one and all, yet the people willfully turn a blind eye to the cost. As you must surely be aware?

Original: Barret: Don't you dare try to put this on us! If anyone's going along with your plans... it's 'cause you brainwashed 'em!
Dialogue: Don't you dare try to put this on us! If anyone's going along with your plans... it's 'cause you brainwashed 'em!

Original: President Shinra: Such methods are beneath me. As are you, my faithful sewer rats. Henceforth allies of wicked Wutai, our sworn enemy. Thank you for stoking our people's patriotic fever.
Dialogue: Such methods are beneath me. As are you, my faithful sewer rats. Henceforth allies of wicked Wutai, our sworn enemy. Thank you for stoking our people's patriotic fever.

Original: Barret: Wutai? The hell we are?
Dialogue: Wutai? The hell we are?

Original: Heidegger: (laughs) You still don't understand your role in this.
Dialogue: (laughs) You still don't understand your role in this.

Original: Barret: What are they doin'!?
Dialogue: What are they doin'!?

Original: Heidegger: Don't you see? You fools were never in control. Never anything but pawns in our plans to sell great and glorious war to the people! And your instruments of insurrection will detonatewhen we so choose!
Dialogue: Don't you see? You fools were never in control. Never anything but pawns in our plans to sell great and glorious war to the people! And your instruments of insurrection will detonate—when we so choose!

Original: Barret: Goddammit!
Dialogue: Goddammit!

Original: Heidegger: Now let us raise the curtain on our main event! The trial of the eco-extremist group "Avalanche"! Terrorists who conspired with Wutai against Midgar! Your guilt is undeniable! Your punishment: death!
Dialogue: Now let us raise the curtain on our main event! The trial of the eco-extremist group "Avalanche"! Terrorists who conspired with Wutai against Midgar! Your guilt is undeniable! Your punishment death!

Original: Tifa: I'm sick of this. I'm sick of all of this!
Dialogue: I'm sick of this. I'm sick of all of this!

Original: Cloud (in his memory):It's just like...like when I failed you.
Dialogue: It's just like...like when I failed you.

Original: Barret: Cloud! Get your head in the game! We're counting on you, man.
Dialogue: Cloud! Get your head in the game! We're counting on you, man.

Original: Heidegger: (laughs) Sewer rats of Avalanche, pawns of Wutai! The people of Midgar will now see you for the cowards you are!
Dialogue: (laughs) Sewer rats of Avalanche, pawns of Wutai! The people of Midgar will now see you for the cowards you are!

Original: Tifa: Cloud, are you all right?
Dialogue: Cloud, are you all right?

Original: Cloud: I'm fine, You guys good to go?
Dialogue: I'm fine, You guys good to go?

Original: Barret: As good as I'll ever be!
Dialogue: As good as I'll ever be!

Original: Tifa: Cloud? What'd it do to you?
Dialogue: Cloud? What'd it do to you?

Original: Barret: Dammit! Big boy means business!
Dialogue: Dammit! Big boy means business!

Original: Heidegger: Commencing phase two of the combat trial. You've seen but a fraction of this machine's true capabilities!
Dialogue: Commencing phase two of the combat trial. You've seen but a fraction of this machine's true capabilities!

Original: Heidegger: Tankbuster ready to fire! Now, show me how fast you can run!
Dialogue: Tankbuster ready to fire! Now, show me how fast you can run!

Original: Barret: Damn, that thing's powerful!
Dialogue: Damn, that thing's powerful!

Original: Tifa: That was too close...
Dialogue: That was too close...

Original: Cloud: We need to come up with a plan.
Dialogue: We need to come up with a plan.

Original: Heidegger: Your efforts are futile. It'll chase you to the edge of the world if need be.
Dialogue: Your efforts are futile. It'll chase you to the edge of the world if need be.

Original: Tifa: I hate when they do that!
Dialogue: I hate when they do that!

Original: Cloud: Let's take care of them first.
Dialogue: Let's take care of them first.

Original: Heidegger: Hmph! I hope this isn't the end for you three. I was looking forward to a battle against worthy opponents.
Dialogue: Hmph! I hope this isn't the end for you three. I was looking forward to a battle against worthy opponents.

Original: Cloud: Now we can finally take it down!
Dialogue: Now we can finally take it down!

Original: Heidegger: Behold the full potential of the airbuster!
Dialogue: Behold the full potential of the airbuster!

Original: Heidegger: Time to carry out your executions!
Dialogue: Time to carry out your executions!

Original: Cloud: Damn, all those drones. Time to do your thing, big man.
Dialogue: Damn, all those drones. Time to do your thing, big man.

Original: Barret: Watch and learn! Just make sure you got my back, all right?
Dialogue: Watch and learn! Just make sure you got my back, all right?

Original: Cloud: Now! Get in there!
Dialogue: Now! Get in there!

Original: Tifa: Yep! I hear you loud and clear!
Dialogue: Yep! I hear you loud and clear!

Original: Barret: Let me show ya how it's done!
Dialogue: Let me show ya how it's done!

Original: Cloud: Yeah. Light 'em up!
Dialogue: Yeah. Light 'em up!

Original: Cloud: Now!
Dialogue: Now!

Original: Tifa: Right! Give it all you've got!
Dialogue: Right! Give it all you've got!

Original: Heidegger: And now for the grand finale! The tankbuster is ready to be deployed!
Dialogue: And now for the grand finale! The tankbuster is ready to be deployed!

Original: Cloud: It's coming. Move!
Dialogue: It's coming. Move!

Original: Heidegger: My dearest Avalanche. My apologies, but it is time that we part ways. This footage will prove invaluable in raising the morale of our Shinra rank and file. (laughs)
Dialogue: My dearest Avalanche. My apologies, but it is time that we part ways. This footage will prove invaluable in raising the morale of our Shinra rank and file. (laughs)

Original: Cloud: We almost got this. Come on, guys!
Dialogue: We almost got this. Come on, guys!

Original: Tifa: Bring it on!
Dialogue: Bring it on!

Original: Barret: Let's show 'em what we're made of!
Dialogue: Let's show 'em what we're made of!

Original: Tifa: Again!?
Dialogue: Again!?

Original: Cloud: This ends right here!
Dialogue: This ends right here!

Original: Barret: We don't have long to get clear!
Dialogue: We don't have long to get clear!

Original: Cloud: Take Tifa, and get outta here!
Dialogue: Take Tifa, and get outta here!

Original: Barret: I...I was wrong aboutchya
Dialogue: I...I was wrong aboutchya—

Original: Cloud: This ain't the end of the line for youorme!
Dialogue: This ain't the end of the line for you or me!

Original: Tifa: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Barret: C'mon!
Dialogue: C'mon!

Original: Cloud (in his mind):Hey, buddy. You okay?
Dialogue: Hey, buddy. You okay?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Cloud (in his mind):Made it through with just a couple of scraped knees back then...
Dialogue: Made it through with just a couple of scraped knees back then...

Original: Cloud: "Back then"?
Dialogue: "Back then"?

Original: Cloud (in his mind):Whaddya say? We doing this?
Dialogue: Whaddya say? We doing this?

Original: Cloud: Have we
Dialogue: Have we—

Original: Cloud (in his mind):Never mind about that. Right now, you need to focus on yourself. Move something, anything.
Dialogue: Never mind about that. Right now, you need to focus on yourself. Move something, anything.

Original: Cloud: Why not...
Dialogue: Why not...

Original: Cloud (in his mind):Good. Easy does it. Slow...and steady...
Dialogue: Good. Easy does it. Slow...and steady...

Original: Cloud: Yeah, yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah...

Original: Flower Peddler: Hello?
Dialogue: Hello?

Original: Cloud: Hey, uh... Who are you? Who are you!?
Dialogue: Hey, uh... Who are you? Who are you!?

Original: Sephiroth: I am...your everything.
Dialogue: I am...your everything.

Original: Flower Peddler: Hello in there!
Dialogue: Hello in there!

Original: Sephiroth: Oh, Cloud. There's still so much to be done.
Dialogue: Oh, Cloud. There's still so much to be done.

Original: On-screen: Sector 5 Slums - Church
Dialogue: Sector 5 Slums - Church

Original: Flower Peddler: Maybe you'renotokay...
Dialogue: Maybe you're not okay...

Original: Flower Peddler: Ah, he lives! Finally awake, are we?
Dialogue: Ah, he lives! Finally awake, are we?

Original: Cloud: You're...
Dialogue: You're...

Original: Aerith: Aerith. It's Aerith. And you are...?
Dialogue: Aerith. It's Aerith. And you are...?

Original: Cloud: Cloud.
Dialogue: Cloud.

Original: Aerith: Nice to meet you again.
Dialogue: Nice to meet you again.

Original: Cloud: "Again," huh?
Dialogue: "Again," huh?

Original: Aerith: What? You don't remember? What about...the flowers?
Dialogue: What? You don't remember? What about...the flowers?

Original: Cloud: Ohhh... The flower girl. And this is...?
Dialogue: Ohhh... The flower girl. And this is...?

Original: Aerith: An old church in the Sector 5 slums. You came crashing through the roof without so much as a "look out below." Fell right into my flower bed. Lucky for you. Like, really.
Dialogue: An old church in the Sector 5 slums. You came crashing through the roof without so much as a "look out below." Fell right into my flower bed. Lucky for you. Like, really.

Original: Cloud: S-sorry, I-I didn't mean to
Dialogue: S-sorry, I-I didn't mean to—

Original: Aerith: Don't worry about it. They're a lot tougher than they look. This place... It has a kind of power.
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. They're a lot tougher than they look. This place... It has a kind of power.

Original: Aerith: Before I forgetyou dropped this when you landed.
Dialogue: Before I forget—you dropped this when you landed.

Original: Cloud: Thanks.
Dialogue: Thanks.

Original: Aerith: I've got one too.
Dialogue: I've got one too.

Original: Cloud: You and everybody and their mother.
Dialogue: You and everybody and their mother.

Original: Aerith: Not like mine, no. It's special. Mine's not good for anything at all.
Dialogue: Not like mine, no. It's special. Mine's not good for anything at all.

Original: Cloud: Bet you just don't know how to use it.
Dialogue: Bet you just don't know how to use it.

Original: Aerith: Could be. Though, I really don't mind. Just having it is enough. It was a gift from my mother.
Dialogue: Could be. Though, I really don't mind. Just having it is enough. It was a gift from my mother.

Original: Aerith: Pretty crazy, huh? Us meeting again like this. You should stay awhile.
Dialogue: Pretty crazy, huh? Us meeting again like this. You should stay awhile.

Original: Aerith: And just when I had finished tending the flowers here... Gotta start over... Just me, myself, and I...
Dialogue: And just when I had finished tending the flowers here... Gotta start over... Just me, myself, and I...

Original: Reno: Hang back. We're not in any hurry.
Dialogue: Hang back. We're not in any hurry.

Original: Cloud: I could stick around a bit.
Dialogue: I could stick around a bit.

Original: Aerith: Really!? You will!? In that case...
Dialogue: Really!? You will!? In that case...

Original: Reno: I'll see myself in, thanks. And who are you?
Dialogue: I'll see myself in, thanks. And who are you?

Original: Aerith: He's my bodyguard. And a SOLDIER. Pretty cool, huh?
Dialogue: He's my bodyguard. And a SOLDIER. Pretty cool, huh?

Original: Reno: A SOLDIER?
Dialogue: A SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud: Ex-SOLDIER.
Dialogue: Ex-SOLDIER.

Original: Reno: Well whaddya know, you've got the eyes at least.
Dialogue: Well whaddya know, you've got the eyes at least.

Original: Aerith: You don't mind, do you? Bodyguard work's not too different from merc stuff, right?
Dialogue: You don't mind, do you? Bodyguard work's not too different from merc stuff, right?

Original: Aerith: Uh... I guessed! From the sword! Just do this for me, okay?
Dialogue: Uh... I guessed! From the sword! Just do this for me, okay?

Original: Cloud: Fine, but it'll cost you. A lot.
Dialogue: Fine, but it'll cost you. A lot.

Original: Aerith: Alot, huh? One date ought to do it.
Dialogue: A lot, huh? One date ought to do it.

Original: Reno: Well, you're weird enough to be one... What class?
Dialogue: Well, you're weird enough to be one... What class?

Original: Cloud: First.
Dialogue: First.

Original: Reno: (laughs) If you're gonna bullshit me, at least try to make it believable...
Dialogue: (laughs) If you're gonna bullshit me, at least try to make it believable...

Original: Reno: Ooh!
Dialogue: Ooh!

Original: Aerith: Hey! Watch the flowers!
Dialogue: Hey! Watch the flowers!

Original: Cloud: I'll make this quick.
Dialogue: I'll make this quick.

Original: Aerith: You better!
Dialogue: You better!

Original: Reno: Bodyguard, huh? You know I'm hers too, right?
Dialogue: Bodyguard, huh? You know I'm hers too, right?

Original: Aerith: Really? Since when? This is the first I've heard of it.
Dialogue: Really? Since when? This is the first I've heard of it.

Original: Reno: 'Cause it was a classified op, princess.
Dialogue: Cause it was a classified op, princess.

Original: Aerith: I don't think that counts then.
Dialogue: I don't think that counts then.

Original: Reno: Ugh... Hey! Little help in here, guys?
Dialogue: Ugh... Hey! Little help in here, guys?

Original: Reno: Good ol' what's-his-face. Hardly knew ya.
Dialogue: Good ol' what's-his-face. Hardly knew ya.

Original: Reno: Hate doing cleanup, but... I'm damn good at it!
Dialogue: Hate doing cleanup, but... I'm damn good at it!

Original: Aerith: Cloud, be careful!
Dialogue: Cloud, be careful!

Original: Reno: Whatcha waiting for, bodyguard? I'm right here!
Dialogue: Whatcha waiting for, bodyguard? I'm right here!

Original: Reno: C'mere, SOLDIER boy. I won't bite.
Dialogue: C'mere, SOLDIER boy. I won't bite.

Original: Reno: Gonna make me work for it, huh? Well, lucky for youtough guy... I'm a consummate professional!
Dialogue: Gonna make me work for it, huh? Well, lucky for you—tough guy... I'm a consummate professional!

Original: Reno: Figured this dance of ours could use a spark!
Dialogue: Figured this dance of ours could use a spark!

Original: Reno: Oooh. Feeling all right there, mister bodyguard?
Dialogue: Oooh. Feeling all right there, mister bodyguard?

Original: Reno: Not so tough now, are you!
Dialogue: Not so tough now, are you!

Original: Reno: Yoo-hoo! SOLDIER boy!
Dialogue: Yoo-hoo! SOLDIER boy!

Original: Reno: Don't tell me you're trying to cut and run.
Dialogue: Don't tell me you're trying to cut and run.

Original: Reno: Heads up!
Dialogue: Heads up!

Original: Reno: You've got it all wrong, man. I just wanted to
Dialogue: You've got it all wrong, man. I just wanted to—

Original: Aerith: Cloud! No!
Dialogue: Cloud! No!

Original: Security Officer: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Security Officer: Were they
Dialogue: Were they—

Original: Security Officer: Sir! Are you hurt!?
Dialogue: Sir! Are you hurt!?

Original: Reno: I'm fine! Go get the girl.
Dialogue: I'm fine! Go get the girl.

Original: Security Officer: Sir!
Dialogue: Sir!

Original: Cloud: The hell?
Dialogue: The hell?

Original: Aerith: Weird. They're not attacking.
Dialogue: Weird. They're not attacking.

Original: Security Officer: Hey! Open up!
Dialogue: Hey! Open up!

Original: Cloud: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: Aerith: Over here!
Dialogue: Over here!

Original: Security Officer: Hey! Open up in there!
Dialogue: Hey! Open up in there!

Original: Aerith: Nowhere to go but up...
Dialogue: Nowhere to go but up...

Original: Cloud: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Aerith: Are they trying to stop us?
Dialogue: Are they trying to stop us?

Original: Cloud: What do they want?
Dialogue: What do they want?

Original: Aerith: Do they want us to go upstairs?
Dialogue: Do they want us to go upstairs?

Original: Cloud: Could be a trap.
Dialogue: Could be a trap.

Original: Aerith: They're...trying to show us the way.
Dialogue: They're...trying to show us the way.

Original: Cloud: I don't like it.
Dialogue: I don't like it.

Original: Aerith: Um, we should run.
Dialogue: Um, we should run.

Original: Security Officer: What's going on!?
Dialogue: What's going on!?

Original: Aerith: Through the atticmaybe we can get out that way!
Dialogue: Through the attic—maybe we can get out that way!

Original: Cloud: Right. Through that hole.
Dialogue: Right. Through that hole.

Original: Aerith: Huh? They saved me...
Dialogue: Huh? They saved me...

Original: Cloud: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: (Upon trying to cross the ladder without Aerith.)Cloud: Can't leave now. She needs help.
Dialogue: Can't leave now. She needs help.

Original: Security Officer: Break it down!
Dialogue: Break it down!

Original: Cloud: I'll go first.
Dialogue: I'll go first.

Original: Cloud: Come on.
Dialogue: Come on.

Original: Security Officer: Nothing!
Dialogue: Nothing!

Original: Security Officer: Up there!
Dialogue: Up there!

Original: Reno: Hey! No shooting!
Dialogue: Hey! No shooting!

Original: Aerith: Aw, man...
Dialogue: Aw, man...

Original: Cloud: Hey, you okay?
Dialogue: Hey, you okay?

Original: Aerith: Probably! ...Or maybe not.
Dialogue: Probably! ...Or maybe not.

Original: Reno: If there's so much as a scratch on her...you're done.
Dialogue: If there's so much as a scratch on her...you're done.

Original: Security Officer: Sir!
Dialogue: Sir!

Original: Reno: We bring her in in one piece.
Dialogue: We bring her in in one piece.

Original: Security Officer: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Reno: What now?
Dialogue: What now?

Original: Cloud: Run!
Dialogue: Run!

Original: Security Officer: Move and I'll shoot!
Dialogue: Move and I'll shoot!

Original: Reno: Oh no, you won't!
Dialogue: Oh no, you won't!

Original: Security Officer: But, sir!
Dialogue: But, sir!

Original: Cloud: Could drop that.
Dialogue: Could drop that.

Original: Cloud: Can't leave now. She needs help.
Dialogue: Can't leave now. She needs help.

Original: Cloud: Okay.
Dialogue: Okay.

Original: Reno: What's the holdup!?
Dialogue: What's the holdup!?

Original: Security Officer: I can't get to her!
Dialogue: I can't get to her!

Original: Reno: Huh. Some kind of magic trick?
Dialogue: Huh. Some kind of magic trick?

Original: Cloud: Run!
Dialogue: Run!

Original: Aerith: 'Kay!
Dialogue: Kay!

Original: Reno: Stop her!
Dialogue: Stop her!

Original: Security Officer: Over there!
Dialogue: Over there!

Original: Aerith: Cloud! Over here!
Dialogue: Cloud! Over here!

Original: Aerith: Thank you!
Dialogue: Thank you!

Original: Cloud: Let's move.
Dialogue: Let's move.

Original: Aerith: Cloud, gimme a hand!
Dialogue: Cloud, gimme a hand!

Original: Security Officer: They're in the attic. Should we pursue?
Dialogue: They're in the attic. Should we pursue?

Original: Reno: Nah. Leave 'em be.
Dialogue: Nah. Leave 'em be.

Original: Security Officer: But, sir!
Dialogue: But, sir!

Original: Reno: Partner's got it. We. Are. Out. Beginner's luck.
Dialogue: Partner's got it. We. Are. Out. Beginner's luck.

Original: Cloud: More of those things.
Dialogue: More of those things.

Original: Aerith: It's like they're...guiding us.
Dialogue: It's like they're...guiding us.

Original: Cloud: Stay close.
Dialogue: Stay close.

Original: Aerith: So cool.
Dialogue: So cool.

Original: Aerith: There!
Dialogue: There!

Original: Cloud: Need to stay ahead of 'em.
Dialogue: Need to stay ahead of 'em.

Original: Security Officer: Prep for exfil.
Dialogue: Prep for exfil.

Original: Cloud: Or not...?
Dialogue: Or not...?

Original: Cloud: They gone?
Dialogue: They gone?

Original: Aerith: Yeah. Think so.
Dialogue: Yeah. Think so.

Original: Cloud: What are they?
Dialogue: What are they?

Original: Aerith: I think... Actually...I don't know. Let's just go.
Dialogue: I think... Actually...I don't know. Let's just go.

Original: Aerith: Okay. Up for crossing the rooftops? See that pillar over there? There's a station right by it. Shall we mosey on over?
Dialogue: Okay. Up for crossing the rooftops? See that pillar over there? There's a station right by it. Shall we mosey on over?

Original: Cloud: Let's.
Dialogue: Let's.

Original: Aerith: So...what's next for you?
Dialogue: So...what's next for you?

Original: Cloud: A little bit of bodyguard work.
Dialogue: A little bit of bodyguard work.

Original: Aerith: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Cloud: After that, it's back to the Sector 7 slums.
Dialogue: After that, it's back to the Sector 7 slums.

Original: Aerith: You...know how to get there?
Dialogue: You...know how to get there?

Original: Cloud: Yup.
Dialogue: Yup.

Original: Aerith: 'Course you do...
Dialogue: Course you do...

Original: Cloud: That suit from earlier. He was one of Shinra's Turks. What's a Turk want with you?
Dialogue: That suit from earlier. He was one of Shinra's Turks. What's a Turk want with you?

Original: Aerith: Dunno...
Dialogue: Dunno...

Original: Aerith: Hey, don't Turks keep an eye out for potential SOLDIERs and stuff?
Dialogue: Hey, don't Turks keep an eye out for potential SOLDIERs and stuff?

Original: Cloud: They do more than just scout for candidates. Turks get called in to handle all kinds of situations. With extreme prejudice.
Dialogue: They do more than just scout for candidates. Turks get called in to handle all kinds of situations. With extreme prejudice.

Original: Aerith: Professional bad guys. Gotta love 'em.
Dialogue: Professional bad guys. Gotta love 'em.

Original: Cloud: Back to my question. So what's he to you? Looked like you knew each other.
Dialogue: Back to my question. So what's he to you? Looked like you knew each other.

Original: Aerith: Maybe he thought I could be the greatest SOLDIER yet!
Dialogue: Maybe he thought I could be the greatest SOLDIER yet!

Original: Cloud: Forget it.
Dialogue: Forget it.

Original: Aerith: Hmm? You mad?
Dialogue: Hmm? You mad?

Original: Aerith: I...actually...haven't traveled by rooftop before.
Dialogue: I...actually...haven't traveled by rooftop before.

Original: Cloud: Be surprised if you had.
Dialogue: Be surprised if you had.

Original: Aerith: It's honestly...kind of exciting.
Dialogue: It's honestly...kind of exciting.

Original: Cloud: Well... First time and all.
Dialogue: Well... First time and all.

Original: Aerith: Wait! Give me a moment!
Dialogue: Wait! Give me a moment!

Original: Aerith: Don't just...run off on your own...
Dialogue: Don't just...run off on your own...

Original: Cloud: Those the words of a SOLDIER candidate?
Dialogue: Those the words of a SOLDIER candidate?

Original: Aerith: So petty.
Dialogue: So petty.

Original: Cloud: So, does no one live in these buildings?
Dialogue: So, does no one live in these buildings?

Original: Aerith: Nope. No one to get mad if we make noise.
Dialogue: Nope. No one to get mad if we make noise.

Original: Aerith: Looks kinda...rusty.
Dialogue: Looks kinda...rusty.

Original: Cloud: I'll go first.
Dialogue: I'll go first.

Original: Cloud: It's pretty old. Be careful.
Dialogue: It's pretty old. Be careful.

Original: Aerith: Okay...
Dialogue: Okay...

Original: Cloud: Easy now.
Dialogue: Easy now.

Original: Aerith: You worry too much. I'm not some princess who needs to be coddled.
Dialogue: You worry too much. I'm not some princess who needs to be coddled.

Original: Aerith: Shit.
Dialogue: Shit.

Original: Aerith: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Aerith: Whew, that was unexpected! Thank you, Cloud.
Dialogue: Whew, that was unexpected! Thank you, Cloud.

Original: Aerith: Ah, there it is. The wall.
Dialogue: Ah, there it is. The wall.

Original: Aerith: You know, I thought about leaving once... But...in the end, I couldn't.
Dialogue: You know, I thought about leaving once... But...in the end, I couldn't.

Original: Cloud: Too dangerous?
Dialogue: Too dangerous?

Original: Aerith: Too much. A whole world, bursting with life. Maybe more than I can handle, I think sometimes... Even now. People hate the steel sky, the slums...but I don't. How could I? All that passion, all those dreams... Flowing and blending together into something greater...
Dialogue: Too much. A whole world, bursting with life. Maybe more than I can handle, I think sometimes... Even now. People hate the steel sky, the slums...but I don't. How could I? All that passion, all those dreams... Flowing and blending together into something greater...

Original: Aerith: This time I'll go first. After all, I can't count on you to wait.
Dialogue: This time I'll go first. After all, I can't count on you to wait.

Original: Cloud: Sure about this?
Dialogue: Sure about this?

Original: Aerith: See for yourself!
Dialogue: See for yourself!

Original: Aerith: Hmm... Maybe I'll go on ahead and leave you all by your lonesome! Just
Dialogue: Hmm... Maybe I'll go on ahead and leave you all by your lonesome! Just—

Original: Cloud: Maybe you shouldn't talk.
Dialogue: Maybe you shouldn't talk.

Original: Aerith: Then you talk. Tell me a story.
Dialogue: Then you talk. Tell me a story.

Original: Cloud: Not for free.
Dialogue: Not for free.

Original: Aerith: Cheapskate. You're(screams)
Dialogue: Cheapskate. You're—(screams)

Original: Aerith: Gotcha.
Dialogue: Gotcha.

Original: Cloud: You're killing me here.
Dialogue: You're killing me here.

Original: Aerith: Here goes nothing!
Dialogue: Here goes nothing!

Original: Cloud: You good?
Dialogue: You good?

Original: Aerith: Of course!
Dialogue: Of course!

Original: Aerith: My hero!
Dialogue: My hero!

Original: Cloud: Never a dull moment with you.
Dialogue: Never a dull moment with you.

Original: Aerith: That a compliment?
Dialogue: That a compliment?

Original: Cloud: Not really.
Dialogue: Not really.

Original: Aerith: Thanks anyway!
Dialogue: Thanks anyway!

Original: Aerith: We're getting closer to the station. Even so, we'll probably run into a few monsters on the way.
Dialogue: We're getting closer to the station. Even so, we'll probably run into a few monsters on the way.

Original: Aerith: Heh... There's a face that screams "so what?"
Dialogue: Heh... There's a face that screams "so what?"

Original: Cloud: Eh. I've fought scarier things in my sleep.
Dialogue: Eh. I've fought scarier things in my sleep.

Original: Aerith: Where are you going, Cloud?
Dialogue: Where are you going, Cloud?

Original: Aerith: Look out, Cloud!
Dialogue: Look out, Cloud!

Original: Aerith: Someone looks like they're in their element.
Dialogue: Someone looks like they're in their element.

Original: Aerith: So Cloud...you don't know the slums that well, do you?
Dialogue: So Cloud...you don't know the slums that well, do you?

Original: Cloud: Compared to you? No. Training grounds, barracks, battlefieldsthat's the world I know.
Dialogue: Compared to you? No. Training grounds, barracks, battlefields—that's the world I know.

Original: Aerith: Heh, you sound proud of that.
Dialogue: Heh, you sound proud of that.

Original: Aerith: Station's there.
Dialogue: Station's there.

Original: Cloud: I can see that.
Dialogue: I can see that.

Original: Aerith: Oh? Thought the world you knew didn't include stations.
Dialogue: Oh? Thought the world you knew didn't include stations.

Original: Cloud: Hah hah...
Dialogue: Hah hah...

Original: On-screen: Sector 5 Slums - Station
Dialogue: Sector 5 Slums - Station

Original: Undercity Resident (1): We poured so much of our blood and sweat into building that reactor, and now...
Dialogue: We poured so much of our blood and sweat into building that reactor, and now...

Original: Undercity Resident (2): I can't believe this is happening...
Dialogue: I can't believe this is happening...

Original: Station Worker: If you would all just please calm down...
Dialogue: If you would all just please calm down...

Original: Undercity Resident (3): Hey, what the hell's going on!?
Dialogue: Hey, what the hell's going on!?

Original: Girl: Check it out, Mom!
Dialogue: Check it out, Mom!

Original: Undercity Resident (4): Come on, there's no need to shout...
Dialogue: Come on, there's no need to shout...

Original: Cloud: Popular place.
Dialogue: Popular place.

Original: Aerith: Yeah, well, it's got a good view of the reactor.
Dialogue: Yeah, well, it's got a good view of the reactor.

Original: Undercity Resident (5): It's on fire!
Dialogue: It's on fire!

Original: Cloud: Ain't a show.
Dialogue: Ain't a show.

Original: Aerith: They know that. They're worried.
Dialogue: They know that. They're worried.

Original: Undercity Resident: Oh! Didn't expect to see you here.
Dialogue: Oh! Didn't expect to see you here.

Original: Aerith: Huh? Um... Yeah...
Dialogue: Huh? Um... Yeah...

Original: Undercity Resident: Oh, on your way home from the church?
Dialogue: Oh, on your way home from the church?

Original: Aerith: That's...right.
Dialogue: That's...right.

Original: Undercity Resident: Well, I'm glad you're okay. Did any debris hit the church?
Dialogue: Well, I'm glad you're okay. Did any debris hit the church?

Original: Aerith: Not debris, no...
Dialogue: Not debris, no...

Original: Undercity Resident: That's something, at leastbut you may not be so lucky next time!
Dialogue: That's something, at least—but you may not be so lucky next time!

Original: Aerith: OhCloud! Wait!
Dialogue: Oh—Cloud! Wait!

Original: Topside Resident: Hey. You know a way to get topside other than the train?
Dialogue: Hey. You know a way to get topside other than the train?

Original: Aerith: Sorry, can't say I do...
Dialogue: Sorry, can't say I do...

Original: Topside Resident: Figured as much. What a goddamn pain in the ass...
Dialogue: Figured as much. What a goddamn pain in the ass...

Original: Cloud: Wait.
Dialogue: Wait.

Original: Security Officer (1): Deck is all clear!
Dialogue: Deck is all clear!

Original: Security Officer (2): Rope's good! Go!
Dialogue: Rope's good! Go!

Original: Security Officer (3): Form up!
Dialogue: Form up!

Original: Security Officer (1): Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: Cloud: Another Turk.
Dialogue: Another Turk.

Original: Aerith: A real man on a mission.
Dialogue: A real man on a mission.

Original: Cloud: On the hunt, more like.
Dialogue: On the hunt, more like.

Original: Aerith: For me? Or you?
Dialogue: For me? Or you?

Original: Cloud: Don't know. Don't care.
Dialogue: Don't know. Don't care.

Original: Aerith: Then...let's stick to the backstreets? Ah. There will be monsters.
Dialogue: Then...let's stick to the backstreets? Ah. There will be monsters.

Original: Cloud: Better than Shinra.
Dialogue: Better than Shinra.

Original: On-screen: Sector 5 Slums - Scrapyard
Dialogue: Sector 5 Slums - Scrapyard

Original: Aerith: There's a Shinra dump site up ahead. Not the kind of place anyone would ever choose to hang around in.
Dialogue: There's a Shinra dump site up ahead. Not the kind of place anyone would ever choose to hang around in.

Original: Cloud: But a great place to lay low.
Dialogue: But a great place to lay low.

Original: Cloud: They've got the run of it.
Dialogue: They've got the run of it.

Original: Aerith: No telling where they'll come from...
Dialogue: No telling where they'll come from...

Original: Cloud: Monsters instinctively target weaker prey.
Dialogue: Monsters instinctively target weaker prey.

Original: Aerith: Hmm... You'd better watch out then, Cloud.
Dialogue: Hmm... You'd better watch out then, Cloud.

Original: Aerith: That way's a dead end. They were doing some construction, but quit halfway.
Dialogue: That way's a dead end. They were doing some construction, but quit halfway.

Original: Aerith: Over here.
Dialogue: Over here.

Original: Aerith: That didn't work. Maybe it's broken?
Dialogue: That didn't work. Maybe it's broken?

Original: Aerith: Pretty sure this path we're on loops around, too, so...
Dialogue: Pretty sure this path we're on loops around, too, so...

Original: Aerith: Hmm, wonder if we can move this.
Dialogue: Hmm, wonder if we can move this.

Original: Aerith: Ah, I knew it!
Dialogue: Ah, I knew it!

Original: Aerith: Must've been a new breed.
Dialogue: Must've been a new breed.

Original: Cloud: How do you figure?
Dialogue: How do you figure?

Original: Aerith: 'Cause they went for the stronger prey.
Dialogue: Cause they went for the stronger prey.

Original: Aerith: Therecheck it out! The heart of the slums.
Dialogue: There—check it out! The heart of the slums.

Original: Cloud: Still a fair ways off...
Dialogue: Still a fair ways off...

Original: Aerith: Well, we did take a detour. Getting tired?
Dialogue: Well, we did take a detour. Getting tired?

Original: Cloud: Nah.
Dialogue: Nah.

Original: Aerith: Me, I'm feeling a bit hungry. How about you?
Dialogue: Me, I'm feeling a bit hungry. How about you?

Original: Cloud: Amazed...
Dialogue: Amazed...

Original: Aerith: You're in for a treat when we make it back.
Dialogue: You're in for a treat when we make it back.

Original: Cloud: Don't have time for that.
Dialogue: Don't have time for that.

Original: Aerith: You'll wanna make time for my mom's cooking! And that's the final word on it! We'll get home quick and eat ourselves stupid!
Dialogue: You'll wanna make time for my mom's cooking! And that's the final word on it! We'll get home quick and eat ourselves stupid!

Original: Aerith: (screams) It's awake!
Dialogue: (screams) It's awake!

Original: Cloud: Gonna wish it kept sleeping.
Dialogue: Gonna wish it kept sleeping.

Original: Aerith: Don't think it'll open. What to do... That gate just doesn't want to open, does it? Maybe there's a way to get over it? For you, at least.
Dialogue: Don't think it'll open. What to do... That gate just doesn't want to open, does it? Maybe there's a way to get over it? For you, at least.

Original: Aerith: No good. That sucks. Ah! Try moving that container to make a path.
Dialogue: No good. That sucks. Ah! Try moving that container to make a path.

Original: Aerith: Yeah! That should do the trick!
Dialogue: Yeah! That should do the trick!

Original: Aerith: Thanks, Cloud. I knew you'd find a way.
Dialogue: Thanks, Cloud. I knew you'd find a way.

Original: Aerith: Guess we're home free.
Dialogue: Guess we're home free.

Original: Cloud: No need for thanks. I'd rather get paid.
Dialogue: No need for thanks. I'd rather get paid.

Original: Aerith: Hm? You're getting paid right now.
Dialogue: Hm? You're getting paid right now.

Original: Cloud: Hm?
Dialogue: Hm?

Original: Aerith: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Cloud: Oh...
Dialogue: Oh...

Original: Aerith: Should be able to relax a little now...
Dialogue: Should be able to relax a little now...

Original: Cloud: Don't forget about the Turks.
Dialogue: Don't forget about the Turks.

Original: Aerith: Ah!
Dialogue: Ah!

Original: Cloud: Could come at us anytime. Keep an eye out.
Dialogue: Could come at us anytime. Keep an eye out.

Original: Aerith: Uhhh... That's the station.
Dialogue: Uhhh... That's the station.

Original: Aerith: Somewhere else you'd rather be?
Dialogue: Somewhere else you'd rather be?

Original: On-screen: Sector 5 Slums - Center District
Dialogue: Sector 5 Slums - Center District

Original: Aerith: What're they watching?
Dialogue: What're they watching?

Original: Cloud: Hey!
Dialogue: Hey!

Original: Reporter: I'm standing inside the gutted shell of Mako Reactor 5. As you can see, there's still a lot of smoke rising from the rubble. While fallen beams and other debris continue to hinder rescue efforts, the fires appear to have been mostly extinguished.
Dialogue: I'm standing inside the gutted shell of Mako Reactor 5. As you can see, there's still a lot of smoke rising from the rubble. While fallen beams and other debris continue to hinder rescue efforts, the fires appear to have been mostly extinguished.

Original: Reporter: Ah, over there! That's the director of Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division, isn't it? Excuse me, ma'am, but would you mind answering a few questions?
Dialogue: Ah, over there! That's the director of Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division, isn't it? Excuse me, ma'am, but would you mind answering a few questions?

Original: Scarlet: Move.
Dialogue: Move.

Original: Reporter: Can you give us any updates on the status of the reactor? What kind of damage did it suffer in the explosion? Are we in any danger?
Dialogue: Can you give us any updates on the status of the reactor? What kind of damage did it suffer in the explosion? Are we in any danger?

Original: Scarlet: Mako Reactor 5 has been temporarily shut down, and all fires have been successfully extinguished. The situation is under control, and the people of our fair city need not worry about any additional complications. We are in the process of conducting a full forensic investigation. But we suspect the device used was similar to that employed in the attack on Mako Reactor 1.
Dialogue: Mako Reactor 5 has been temporarily shut down, and all fires have been successfully extinguished. The situation is under control, and the people of our fair city need not worry about any additional complications. We are in the process of conducting a full forensic investigation. But we suspect the device used was similar to that employed in the attack on Mako Reactor 1.

Original: Scarlet: The perpetrators of that atrocity were filmed making their escape. These agents of the eco-terrorist group Avalanche are currently believed to be hiding somewhere in Midgar...
Dialogue: The perpetrators of that atrocity were filmed making their escape. These agents of the eco-terrorist group Avalanche are currently believed to be hiding somewhere in Midgar...

Original: Reporter: And...given that this group has now attacked two reactors in quick succession...can they really be stopped before they strike again?
Dialogue: And...given that this group has now attacked two reactors in quick succession...can they really be stopped before they strike again?

Original: Scarlet: What doyouthink?
Dialogue: What do you think?

Original: Reporter: Well, I
Dialogue: Well, I—

Original: Scarlet: Have no fear. Shinrawillkeep Midgar safe.
Dialogue: Have no fear. Shinra will keep Midgar safe.

Original: Security Officer: Okay, time's up!
Dialogue: Okay, time's up!

Original: Aerith: Alright...let's go.
Dialogue: Alright...let's go.

Original: Aerith:Hey, my house is this way.
Dialogue: Hey, my house is this way.

Original: Restaurant Owner: Aw, what timing. Mind lending me a hand?
Dialogue: Aw, what timing. Mind lending me a hand?

Original: Aerith: The place is really hopping, huh?
Dialogue: The place is really hopping, huh?

Original: Restaurant Owner: Nice side effect of the train situation! So, whaddya say?
Dialogue: Nice side effect of the train situation! So, whaddya say?

Original: Aerith: I'd love to, but...
Dialogue: I'd love to, but...

Original: Aerith: I help out every now and then. It's fun.
Dialogue: I help out every now and then. It's fun.

Original: Oates: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Aerith: Well, well, what are you doing all the way up there?
Dialogue: Well, well, what are you doing all the way up there?

Original: Oates: Was trying to get a look at the reactor. Who's this guy?
Dialogue: Was trying to get a look at the reactor. Who's this guy?

Original: Aerith: This is Cloud. He's a mercenary...and currently my bodyguard. That's Oates.
Dialogue: This is Cloud. He's a mercenary...and currently my bodyguard. That's Oates.

Original: Oates: See you.
Dialogue: See you.

Original: Aerith: Two peas in a pod.
Dialogue: Two peas in a pod.

Original: Boy: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Aerith: So, what are you guys up to?
Dialogue: So, what are you guys up to?

Original: Girl: We all went to see the reactor.
Dialogue: We all went to see the reactor.

Original: Boy: Oh, that's right. You're supposed to come by the House.
Dialogue: Oh, that's right. You're supposed to come by the House.

Original: Aerith: What for?
Dialogue: What for?

Original: Girl: I dunno. You're just supposed to.
Dialogue: I dunno. You're just supposed to.

Original: Aerith: Well, guess we have a new destination.
Dialogue: Well, guess we have a new destination.

Original: Aerith: I should probably explain. The Leaf House is the local orphanage. That's where all these kids live.
Dialogue: I should probably explain. The Leaf House is the local orphanage. That's where all these kids live.

Original: Girl: Hey Aerith, where'd you go?
Dialogue: Hey Aerith, where'd you go?

Original: Boy: The church again?
Dialogue: The church again?

Original: Girl: Next time, we should all go together!
Dialogue: Next time, we should all go together!

Original: Doctor: Why hello, Aerith. As popular as ever, I see.
Dialogue: Why hello, Aerith. As popular as ever, I see.

Original: Aerith: Apparently. But they sure keep me on my toes!
Dialogue: Apparently. But they sure keep me on my toes!

Original: Doctor: (laughs) Better than being bedridden!
Dialogue: (laughs) Better than being bedridden!

Original: Doctor: Thanks again for all those herbs. You've helped a lot of people.
Dialogue: Thanks again for all those herbs. You've helped a lot of people.

Original: Aerith: No problem. Anytime.
Dialogue: No problem. Anytime.

Original: Doctor: How'd you manage to find so many, anyway?
Dialogue: How'd you manage to find so many, anyway?

Original: Aerith: (chuckles) Oh, I have my ways.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Oh, I have my ways.

Original: Doctor: And him?
Dialogue: And him?

Original: Aerith: He's my bodyguard. Just until I get home.
Dialogue: He's my bodyguard. Just until I get home.

Original: Doctor: And you're sure he's up to it?
Dialogue: And you're sure he's up to it?

Original: Aerith: Hmmm... Maybe?
Dialogue: Hmmm... Maybe?

Original: Aerith: Since I'm so generous, I gather medicinal herbs for his patients sometimes.
Dialogue: Since I'm so generous, I gather medicinal herbs for his patients sometimes.

Original: Aerith: Here's the Leaf House.
Dialogue: Here's the Leaf House.

Original: Housemother: There you are.
Dialogue: There you are.

Original: Boy: We're back! And we brought Aerith with us!
Dialogue: We're back! And we brought Aerith with us!

Original: Housemother: Sorry to make you come out here.
Dialogue: Sorry to make you come out here.

Original: Aerith: Don't be. It's on my way home.
Dialogue: Don't be. It's on my way home.

Original: Housemother: Well then, I hope you won't mind me asking for some flowers.
Dialogue: Well then, I hope you won't mind me asking for some flowers.

Original: Aerith: No problem! How many?
Dialogue: No problem! How many?

Original: Housemother: All you can carry. What with all the doom and gloom we've been hearing on the news recently, I thought some flowers might help cheer everyone up.
Dialogue: All you can carry. What with all the doom and gloom we've been hearing on the news recently, I thought some flowers might help cheer everyone up.

Original: Aerith: I'm sure they will, and I'd love to help.
Dialogue: I'm sure they will, and I'd love to help.

Original: Housemother: Let's all wash up before our meal.
Dialogue: Let's all wash up before our meal.

Original: Aerith: So, Cloud, what's your favorite flower?
Dialogue: So, Cloud, what's your favorite flower?

Original: Cloud: They're all the same to me.
Dialogue: They're all the same to me.

Original: Aerith: (chuckles) You sure you wanna say that to a florist?
Dialogue: (chuckles) You sure you wanna say that to a florist?

Original: Cloud: Better than lying.
Dialogue: Better than lying.

Original: Aerith: Okay, then what'd you do with the flower I gave you?
Dialogue: Okay, then what'd you do with the flower I gave you?

Original: Cloud: I, uh...
Dialogue: I, uh...

Original: Aerith: You give it away?
Dialogue: You give it away?

Original: Cloud: I did.
Dialogue: I did.

Original: Aerith: Ooh! To who? Tell me!
Dialogue: Ooh! To who? Tell me!

Original: Cloud: Don't recall.
Dialogue: Don't recall.

Original: Aerith: Hmmm?
Dialogue: Hmmm?

Original: Cloud: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Aerith: Thought you didn't like lying.
Dialogue: Thought you didn't like lying.

Original: Aerith: Well, anyway...
Dialogue: Well, anyway...

Original: Aerith: My house is just up this path. Mom should be home by now, so I'll introduce you.
Dialogue: My house is just up this path. Mom should be home by now, so I'll introduce you.

Original: Aerith: There you go. That's my house.
Dialogue: There you go. That's my house.

Original: Cloud: It's amazing.
Dialogue: It's amazing.

Original: Aerith: Come on.
Dialogue: Come on.

Original: Aerith: I'm home!
Dialogue: I'm home!

Original: Elmyra: Hey baby. Been up to no good? Rude came by
Dialogue: Hey baby. Been up to no good? Rude came by—

Original: Aerith: So, this is my mom, Elmyra. And this is Cloud. My bodyguard.
Dialogue: So, this is my mom, Elmyra. And this is Cloud. My bodyguard.

Original: Cloud: Uh...hi.
Dialogue: Uh...hi.

Original: Elmyra: Take good care of her?
Dialogue: Take good care of her?

Original: Cloud: That's my job. Orwasmy job.
Dialogue: That's my job. Or was my job.

Original: Aerith: Yep. Thanks. So, Cloud, you gonna head back to Sector 7?
Dialogue: Yep. Thanks. So, Cloud, you gonna head back to Sector 7?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Aerith: Then I'll show you the way.
Dialogue: Then I'll show you the way.

Original: Cloud: Then why'd you have me bring you here? What if the Turks show up again?
Dialogue: Then why'd you have me bring you here? What if the Turks show up again?

Original: Aerith: It'd suck, but I've dealt with them before. Honestly, I'm much more worried about you. What if you get lost, huh? You'd be too embarrassed to admit it, so you'd just and so you'd just keep on going.
Dialogue: It'd suck, but I've dealt with them before. Honestly, I'm much more worried about you. What if you get lost, huh? You'd be too embarrassed to admit it, so you'd just and so you'd just keep on going.

Original: Cloud: Quit acting like you know me.
Dialogue: Quit acting like you know me.

Original: Aerith: Hey, Mom? I'm gonna go take Cloud over to Sector 7, okay?
Dialogue: Hey, Mom? I'm gonna go take Cloud over to Sector 7, okay?

Original: Elmyra: Okay... But why not wait until tomorrow? If you head out now, it'll be dark when you get back. Better to rest up here and make the trip first thing in the morning. When you'll have daylight to spare.
Dialogue: Okay... But why not wait until tomorrow? If you head out now, it'll be dark when you get back. Better to rest up here and make the trip first thing in the morning. When you'll have daylight to spare.

Original: Aerith: That's true. She's got a point, Cloud.
Dialogue: That's true. She's got a point, Cloud.

Original: Cloud: Hold up.
Dialogue: Hold up.

Original: Aerith: Oh, yeah! I still need to deliver some flowers to the Leaf House. Since we have a little time before dinner... You should come with.
Dialogue: Oh, yeah! I still need to deliver some flowers to the Leaf House. Since we have a little time before dinner... You should come with.

Original: Cloud: That wasn't the deal.
Dialogue: That wasn't the deal.

Original: Aerith: You mean you want more? Even though you've got apricelessreward coming your way? Do you know what I promised him?
Dialogue: You mean you want more? Even though you've got a priceless reward coming your way? Do you know what I promised him?

Original: Cloud: I'll do it!
Dialogue: I'll do it!

Original: Aerith: I'll go grab the baskets. Be right back!
Dialogue: I'll go grab the baskets. Be right back!

Original: Elmyra: That Aerith... She's a handful, isn't she?
Dialogue: That Aerith... She's a handful, isn't she?

Original: Elmyra: It must be tough No, never mind.
Dialogue: It must be tough— No, never mind.

Original: Elmyra: Hmph.
Dialogue: Hmph.

Original: Aerith: That's weird. Could've sworn I put them here...
Dialogue: That's weird. Could've sworn I put them here...

Original: Cloud: Huh.
Dialogue: Huh.

Original: Aerith: Found 'em!
Dialogue: Found 'em!

Original: Aerith: You take this one. Take it.
Dialogue: You take this one. Take it.

Original: Aerith: Right. Off we go!
Dialogue: Right. Off we go!

Original: Aerith: And these, right here, are my babies.
Dialogue: And these, right here, are my babies.

Original: Aerith: Hmm... Which ones do you think we should pick?
Dialogue: Hmm... Which ones do you think we should pick?

Original: Cloud: Any of them.
Dialogue: Any of them.

Original: Aerith: Aw, don't be like that. I know you have an eye for this kind of thing.
Dialogue: Aw, don't be like that. I know you have an eye for this kind of thing.

Original: Aerith: That's the one I gave you.
Dialogue: That's the one I gave you.

Original: Cloud: Huh. It is?
Dialogue: Huh. It is?

Original: Aerith: Nice try, mister. You can't fool me.
Dialogue: Nice try, mister. You can't fool me.

Original: Aerith: Whoa, foxtails, huh? I gotta hand it to you, I never would've thought of that. It'll definitely take them by surprise.
Dialogue: Whoa, foxtails, huh? I gotta hand it to you, I never would've thought of that. It'll definitely take them by surprise.

Original: Aerith: Good eye. People used to give these to declare their loyalty to one another. Interesting, right?
Dialogue: Good eye. People used to give these to declare their loyalty to one another. Interesting, right?

Original: Aerith: I think we still need a few more. What should we pick next?
Dialogue: I think we still need a few more. What should we pick next?

Original: Aerith: She said "as many as you can carry," so maybe a few more?
Dialogue: She said "as many as you can carry," so maybe a few more?

Original: Aerith: I think we're good now. Whaddya say? Shall we go?
Dialogue: I think we're good now. Whaddya say? Shall we go?

Original: Aerith: No need to hurry. We're not under the gun or anything.
Dialogue: No need to hurry. We're not under the gun or anything.

Original: Cloud: I'm not cut out for this crap.
Dialogue: I'm not cut out for this crap.

Original: Aerith: Sure you are. And when you're done, you'll be drowning in job offers.
Dialogue: Sure you are. And when you're done, you'll be drowning in job offers.

Original: Aerith: So, how do you think they'll arrange these flowers?
Dialogue: So, how do you think they'll arrange these flowers?

Original: Cloud: Dunno.
Dialogue: Dunno.

Original: Aerith: Well, we'll soon find out.
Dialogue: Well, we'll soon find out.

Original: Cloud: I'll wait out here.
Dialogue: I'll wait out here.

Original: Aerith: Oh, okay. But I might be a while. Why not check out the town?
Dialogue: Oh, okay. But I might be a while. Why not check out the town?

Original: Cloud: Nah, can't leave without telling her.
Dialogue: Nah, can't leave without telling her.

Original: Chadley: Cloud, I have the most amazing news! I believe I might know how to develop summoning materia, something heretofore thought impossible. Scientists say that this materia can only be found in nature, but I may just be able to prove otherwise! And so, Cloud, I turn to you. I would like to test this theory by way of my combat simulatorto wit, I want you to fight and defeat summon data in VR. I sense that you find my phrasing to be somewhat...obtuse.
Dialogue: Cloud, I have the most amazing news! I believe I might know how to develop summoning materia, something heretofore thought impossible. Scientists say that this materia can only be found in nature, but I may just be able to prove otherwise! And so, Cloud, I turn to you. I would like to test this theory by way of my combat simulator—to wit, I want you to fight and defeat summon data in VR. I sense that you find my phrasing to be somewhat...obtuse.

Original: Chadley: Then I invite you to ready your portable battle simulator.
Dialogue: Then I invite you to ready your portable battle simulator.

Original: Chadley: What a shame. It was a close match. However, I did manage to obtain valuable data. Analyze and learn from your mistakes, so that you can claim victory next time.
Dialogue: What a shame. It was a close match. However, I did manage to obtain valuable data. Analyze and learn from your mistakes, so that you can claim victory next time.

Original: Chadley: Outstanding. The Shiva summoning materia is complete. And now it's yours. Use it as you see fit. The lady of frost is the perfect companion for a man like you, Cloud. She will prove most useful when the time comes to destroy Shinra.
Dialogue: Outstanding. The Shiva summoning materia is complete. And now it's yours. Use it as you see fit. The lady of frost is the perfect companion for a man like you, Cloud. She will prove most useful when the time comes to destroy Shinra.

Original: Materia Vendor: I've got the finest collection of materia you'll find anywhere.
Dialogue: I've got the finest collection of materia you'll find anywhere.

Original: Materia Vendor: I knew you had a keen eye.
Dialogue: I knew you had a keen eye.

Original: Weapon Vendor: What'll it be for you today?
Dialogue: What'll it be for you today?

Original: Weapon Vendor: Got what you need to stay safe?
Dialogue: Got what you need to stay safe?

Original: Boy: Nuh-uh! No grown-ups allowed!
Dialogue: Nuh-uh! No grown-ups allowed!

Original: Oates: Ah!
Dialogue: Ah!

Original: Cloud: I remember you...
Dialogue: I remember you...

Original: Oates: Where's Aerith?
Dialogue: Where's Aerith?

Original: Cloud: The Leaf House.
Dialogue: The Leaf House.

Original: Cloud: Is something wrong?
Dialogue: Is something wrong?

Original: Aerith: You could say that. Sounds like someone spooked the kids.
Dialogue: You could say that. Sounds like someone spooked the kids.

Original: Oates: Yeah, two of 'em disappeared. They ran away after this creepy guy wearing black clothes showed up.
Dialogue: Yeah, two of 'em disappeared. They ran away after this creepy guy wearing black clothes showed up.

Original: Cloud: A Turk?
Dialogue: A Turk?

Original: Aerith: That's what I thought, but no.
Dialogue: That's what I thought, but no.

Original: Oates: It's this guy who's always stumbling around town in a dirty robe full of holes. They say he's sick or something. Oh, and he had some kind of number tattooed on his arm.
Dialogue: It's this guy who's always stumbling around town in a dirty robe full of holes. They say he's sick or something. Oh, and he had some kind of number tattooed on his arm.

Original: Aerith: I don't like the sound of this. I'm gonna check it out.
Dialogue: I don't like the sound of this. I'm gonna check it out.

Original: Cloud: I know someone who fits that description. I'll come with.
Dialogue: I know someone who fits that description. I'll come with.

Original: Aerith: 'Kay.
Dialogue: Kay.

Original: Oates: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: Chadley: Cloud! I understand you must be busy, but I hope you haven't forgotten about my research.
Dialogue: Cloud! I understand you must be busy, but I hope you haven't forgotten about my research.

Original: Chadley: Oh, hello. Cloud has been assisting me with my research and development.
Dialogue: Oh, hello. Cloud has been assisting me with my research and development.

Original: Aerith: Ooh, that sounds fun. Count me in.
Dialogue: Ooh, that sounds fun. Count me in.

Original: Chadley: One moment while I run diagnostics. Huh... How very strange... You don't appear to be in my database...
Dialogue: One moment while I run diagnostics. Huh... How very strange... You don't appear to be in my database...

Original: Aerith: And that's bad?
Dialogue: And that's bad?

Original: Chadley: There must have been some sort of server error. Oh well, any friend of Cloud's is sure to be of great help.
Dialogue: There must have been some sort of server error. Oh well, any friend of Cloud's is sure to be of great help.

Original: Oates: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: Aerith: I know this place is off-limits to grown-ups, but if we want to rescue them...well... We gotta break the rules.
Dialogue: I know this place is off-limits to grown-ups, but if we want to rescue them...well... We gotta break the rules.

Original: Boy (1): Oates!
Dialogue: Oates!

Original: Boy (2): You're back!
Dialogue: You're back!

Original: Oates: Aerith's come to help.
Dialogue: Aerith's come to help.

Original: Aerith: Yeah, leave it to us. We'll take care of it from here.
Dialogue: Yeah, leave it to us. We'll take care of it from here.

Original: Boy (1): But there are monsters out there!
Dialogue: But there are monsters out there!

Original: Aerith: Don't worry. I've brought a superstrong friend along with me.
Dialogue: Don't worry. I've brought a superstrong friend along with me.

Original: Cloud: I used to be a SOLDIER. So where's the guy?
Dialogue: I used to be a SOLDIER. So where's the guy?

Original: Oates: I dunno. He disappeared and we can't find him.
Dialogue: I dunno. He disappeared and we can't find him.

Original: Aerith: Right now, let's worry about the kids.
Dialogue: Right now, let's worry about the kids.

Original: Oates: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: Oates: They ran off this way. Be careful.
Dialogue: They ran off this way. Be careful.

Original: On-screen: Sector 5 Slums - Undeveloped Area
Dialogue: Sector 5 Slums - Undeveloped Area

Original: Aerith: Where do you think they went?
Dialogue: Where do you think they went?

Original: Cloud: Who knows. They're kids. Nothing to do but look all over.
Dialogue: Who knows. They're kids. Nothing to do but look all over.

Original: Aerith: I just hope we find them in time.
Dialogue: I just hope we find them in time.

Original: Aerith: There they are!
Dialogue: There they are!

Original: Cloud: And they're not alone.
Dialogue: And they're not alone.

Original: Aerith: Quickly! We gotta save them!
Dialogue: Quickly! We gotta save them!

Original: Cloud: Alright.
Dialogue: Alright.

Original: Boy: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Girl: Hey, Aerith!
Dialogue: Hey, Aerith!

Original: Aerith: Hold on!
Dialogue: Hold on!

Original: Boy: Stay back!
Dialogue: Stay back!

Original: Cloud: Careful.
Dialogue: Careful.

Original: Girl: Watch out! The ground's really shaky!
Dialogue: Watch out! The ground's really shaky!

Original: Boy: It's 'cause of the reactor. You can't trust your feet.
Dialogue: It's 'cause of the reactor. You can't trust your feet.

Original: Cloud: I'll go.
Dialogue: I'll go.

Original: Cloud: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: Boy: Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Girl: That was cool...
Dialogue: That was cool...

Original: Aerith: Okay. Let's head back.
Dialogue: Okay. Let's head back.

Original: Boy: That'ssocool!
Dialogue: That's so cool!

Original: Girl: How did you get to be so strong!?
Dialogue: How did you get to be so strong!?

Original: Aerith: Well you see, Cloud here used to be a SOLDIER!
Dialogue: Well you see, Cloud here used to be a SOLDIER!

Original: Boy: He was?
Dialogue: He was?

Original: Girl: Did you go fight in the war?
Dialogue: Did you go fight in the war?

Original: Cloud: I might've.
Dialogue: I might've.

Original: Boy: I'm gonna grow up to be a SOLDIERlike you.
Dialogue: I'm gonna grow up to be a SOLDIER—like you.

Original: Girl: You can't just grow up to be a SOLDIER. You gotta work at it.
Dialogue: You can't just grow up to be a SOLDIER. You gotta work at it.

Original: Boy: Cloud thinks I'm good enough to be one. Right?
Dialogue: Cloud thinks I'm good enough to be one. Right?

Original: Aerith: Look at you, Mr. Popular.
Dialogue: Look at you, Mr. Popular.

Original: Boy: That was so cool, you guys! Especially that, "Hah! Yah!"
Dialogue: That was so cool, you guys! Especially that, "Hah! Yah!"

Original: Girl: Yeah, it was really cool when you went like, "Hah! Yah!"
Dialogue: Yeah, it was really cool when you went like, "Hah! Yah!"

Original: Boy: You've got it all wrong. (imitates fight noises) Likethat.
Dialogue: You've got it all wrong. (imitates fight noises) Like that.

Original: Girl: No way! It was way faster than that! (imitates fight noises) Likethat.
Dialogue: No way! It was way faster than that! (imitates fight noises) Like that.

Original: Boy: Fine, then how about(imitates fight noises) Yeah?
Dialogue: Fine, then how about—(imitates fight noises) Yeah?

Original: Girl: Yeah! (imitates fight noises) Like that.
Dialogue: Yeah! (imitates fight noises) Like that.

Original: Boy: Isn't that right, Cloud?
Dialogue: Isn't that right, Cloud?

Original: Girl: Isn't that right, Cloud?
Dialogue: Isn't that right, Cloud?

Original: Boy (in Cloud's memory): Tifa, wait!
Dialogue: Tifa, wait!

Original: Boy (in Cloud's memory): Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa!

Original: Cloud: Tifa...
Dialogue: Tifa...

Original: Aerith: Tifa?
Dialogue: Tifa?

Original: Aerith: What's wrong?
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Original: Cloud: Nothing.
Dialogue: Nothing.

Original: Aerith: Is Tifa, like...your girlfriend?
Dialogue: Is Tifa, like...your girlfriend?

Original: Cloud: No.
Dialogue: No.

Original: Aerith: But she's someone special.
Dialogue: But she's someone special.

Original: Cloud: It's not like that. More like... I don't know how to explain...
Dialogue: It's not like that. More like... I don't know how to explain...

Original: Aerith: I see...
Dialogue: I see...

Original: Oates: Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Aerith: From now on, if you run into trouble, promise me you'll find an adult, okay?
Dialogue: From now on, if you run into trouble, promise me you'll find an adult, okay?

Original: Oates: Okay, I will. And here. Since you're so cool. You guys are both grown-ups, but you're also one of us now. You can come and play here whenever you want.
Dialogue: Okay, I will. And here. Since you're so cool. You guys are both grown-ups, but you're also one of us now. You can come and play here whenever you want.

Original: Aerith: Don't worry. It'll be okay.
Dialogue: Don't worry. It'll be okay.

Original: Cloud: Wait.
Dialogue: Wait.

Original: Cloud: Hm. Not him, but looks pretty damn similar.
Dialogue: Hm. Not him, but looks pretty damn similar.

Original: Aerith: Huh? There's the number...but why "2"?
Dialogue: Huh? There's the number...but why "2"?

Original: Cloud: Who knows. Come to think
Dialogue: Who knows. Come to think—

Original: Sephiroth: The reunion...is nothing to fear.
