Dialogue: The reunion...is nothing to fear.

Original: Aerith: Cloud? Get it together. Come on.
Dialogue: Cloud? Get it together. Come on.

Original: Cloud: You don't know who Sephiroth is...do you?
Dialogue: You don't know who Sephiroth is...do you?

Original: Aerith: Sephiroth, the war hero? I know he died in an accident five years ago. They said so on the news.
Dialogue: Sephiroth, the war hero? I know he died in an accident five years ago. They said so on the news.

Original: Cloud: Maybe they did. But I've got a feeling he's still alive.
Dialogue: Maybe they did. But I've got a feeling he's still alive.

Original: Aerith: Oh...right. C'mon, let's go.
Dialogue: Oh...right. C'mon, let's go.

Original: Boy 1: My dad told me that that man, he used to be a SOLDIER when he was younger.
Dialogue: My dad told me that that man, he used to be a SOLDIER when he was younger.

Original: Boy 2: I heard he came back because he got sick or something. Isn't that kinda weird? Can SOLDIERs even get sick?
Dialogue: I heard he came back because he got sick or something. Isn't that kinda weird? Can SOLDIERs even get sick?

Original: Oates: Hey, Cloud. I know a lot of people around here need help. When I'm out on patrol, a lot of them tell me about their problems. Do you think you might be interested in helping out?
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud. I know a lot of people around here need help. When I'm out on patrol, a lot of them tell me about their problems. Do you think you might be interested in helping out?

Original: Aerith: Well, I'm all for it! We still have plenty of time.
Dialogue: Well, I'm all for it! We still have plenty of time.

Original: Cloud: I'm on the clock.
Dialogue: I'm on the clock.

Original: Aerith: Don't worry. I give you permission!
Dialogue: Don't worry. I give you permission!

Original: Oates: I always have the latest information. Come find me if you wanna know.
Dialogue: I always have the latest information. Come find me if you wanna know.

Original: Oates: The monsters out there are getting stronger and stronger. But that's no problem for you, though, right? ...Be careful anyway.
Dialogue: The monsters out there are getting stronger and stronger. But that's no problem for you, though, right? ...Be careful anyway.

Original: Aerith: I see you're working hard, mister merc.
Dialogue: I see you're working hard, mister merc.

Original: Cloud: Yep.
Dialogue: Yep.

Original: Aerith: So whaddya gonna do next?
Dialogue: So whaddya gonna do next?

Original: Cloud: Keep on working hard.
Dialogue: Keep on working hard.

Original: Aerith: As you always do, I'm sure.
Dialogue: As you always do, I'm sure.

Original: Cloud: You know, thisishow I earn a living.
Dialogue: You know, this is how I earn a living.

Original: Aerith: Huh? Really!? I thought you were just doing it for fun!
Dialogue: Huh? Really!? I thought you were just doing it for fun!

Original: Cloud: I suppose some people do.
Dialogue: I suppose some people do.

Original: Aerith: Hello! I'm some people. Nice to meet you!
Dialogue: Hello! I'm some people. Nice to meet you!

Original: Weapons Vendor: People are talking about you. You've got one helluva reputation.
Dialogue: People are talking about you. You've got one helluva reputation.

Original: Aerith: It feels good to help people out, doesn't it?
Dialogue: It feels good to help people out, doesn't it?

Original: Cloud: Eh.
Dialogue: Eh.

Original: Aerith: You having fun yet?
Dialogue: You having fun yet?

Original: Cloud: Heaps.
Dialogue: Heaps.

Original: Aerith: Then you can't be afraid to show it more. Don't forget, it's all about service and salesmanship.
Dialogue: Then you can't be afraid to show it more. Don't forget, it's all about service and salesmanship.

Original: Cloud: I'll leave that to you.
Dialogue: I'll leave that to you.

Original: Aerith: All right, but don't think you can rely on me forever, mister.
Dialogue: All right, but don't think you can rely on me forever, mister.

Original: Cloud: Wasn't planning to.
Dialogue: Wasn't planning to.

Original: Aerith: That's good. 'Cause I demand a very good salary.
Dialogue: That's good. 'Cause I demand a very good salary.

Original: Aerith: We probably oughta call it a day.
Dialogue: We probably oughta call it a day.

Original: Cloud: Getting late, huh?
Dialogue: Getting late, huh?

Original: Aerith: You've been working so hard, you lost track of time.
Dialogue: You've been working so hard, you lost track of time.

Original: Cloud: Had to. The pay sucked.
Dialogue: Had to. The pay sucked.

Original: Aerith: 'Cause they didn't know if you were worth it yet. But now they do. C'mon. Let's go home.
Dialogue: Cause they didn't know if you were worth it yet. But now they do. C'mon. Let's go home.

Original: Housemother: Aerith, you're back. Come, look what we've done with the flowers. Lovely, don't you think?
Dialogue: Aerith, you're back. Come, look what we've done with the flowers. Lovely, don't you think?

Original: Aerith: Great job. It's wonderful.
Dialogue: Great job. It's wonderful.

Original: Housemother: Isn't it?
Dialogue: Isn't it?

Original: Housemother: Oh, I nearly forgot. I saw some Shinra suit walking towards your house a little while ago. He was dressed all in black. A little scary looking.
Dialogue: Oh, I nearly forgot. I saw some Shinra suit walking towards your house a little while ago. He was dressed all in black. A little scary looking.

Original: Housemother: You alright?
Dialogue: You alright?

Original: Rude: Hello, Aerith.
Dialogue: Hello, Aerith.

Original: Aerith: What do you want?
Dialogue: What do you want?

Original: Rude: Haven't seen him before. He your new boy toy?
Dialogue: Haven't seen him before. He your new boy toy?

Original: Aerith: He's mybodyguard, if you must know.
Dialogue: He's my bodyguard, if you must know.

Original: Rude: Wait a minute... Those eyes... Is he the one who beat up Reno?
Dialogue: Wait a minute... Those eyes... Is he the one who beat up Reno?

Original: Cloud: And what if I am?
Dialogue: And what if I am?

Original: Rude: Need to cross my T's, dot my I's. That's all.
Dialogue: Need to cross my T's, dot my I's. That's all.

Original: Aerith: Cloud, leave him be. Rude's not a bad person. Really.
Dialogue: Cloud, leave him be. Rude's not a bad person. Really.

Original: Rude: No, I'm not bad. But like it or not... I sometimes have to do bad things. Don't take it personal.
Dialogue: No, I'm not bad. But like it or not... I sometimes have to do bad things. Don't take it personal.

Original: Cloud: You Turks are all the same. All bark...no bite.
Dialogue: You Turks are all the same. All bark...no bite.

Original: Rude: You're one to talk!
Dialogue: You're one to talk!

Original: Aerith: No need to get rough!
Dialogue: No need to get rough!

Original: Cloud & Rude: Stay back.
Dialogue: Stay back.

Original: Aerith: Can't you leave us alone?
Dialogue: Can't you leave us alone?

Original: Rude: No.
Dialogue: No.

Original: Rude: Gotta get a little payback for my partner.
Dialogue: Gotta get a little payback for my partner.

Original: Cloud: Come on then.
Dialogue: Come on then.

Original: Rude: Hmph. SOLDIER huh?
Dialogue: Hmph. SOLDIER huh?

Original: Cloud: First Class.
Dialogue: First Class.

Original: Rude: Okay then.
Dialogue: Okay then.

Original: Aerith: So, you had enough yet?
Dialogue: So, you had enough yet?

Original: Rude: No, I don't believe that I have.
Dialogue: No, I don't believe that I have.

Original: Aerith: Just stop it.
Dialogue: Just stop it.

Original: Rude: Can't. It's my job.
Dialogue: Can't. It's my job.

Original: Aerith: Cloud's pretty strong, isn't he?
Dialogue: Cloud's pretty strong, isn't he?

Original: Rude: I've seen his type before.
Dialogue: I've seen his type before.

Original: Cloud: How's that payback working out for ya?
Dialogue: How's that payback working out for ya?

Original: Rude: Oh, better than expected.
Dialogue: Oh, better than expected.

Original: Rude: I thought you didn't wanna get rough.
Dialogue: I thought you didn't wanna get rough.

Original: Aerith: No...but this is self-defense!
Dialogue: No...but this is self-defense!

Original: Aerith: Please. Just leave us alone.
Dialogue: Please. Just leave us alone.

Original: Rude: You know I can't do that.
Dialogue: You know I can't do that.

Original: Reno (on phone): Hey there, partner. I'm sure you're having the time of your life, but we're needed on standby for a job. Something about Sector 7. So get your ass back here now.
Dialogue: Hey there, partner. I'm sure you're having the time of your life, but we're needed on standby for a job. Something about Sector 7. So get your ass back here now.

Original: Rude: Understood.
Dialogue: Understood.

Original: Aerith: Got somewhere else to be?
Dialogue: Got somewhere else to be?

Original: Rude: ...Apparently so.
Dialogue: ...Apparently so.

Original: Rude: Go home and stay there.
Dialogue: Go home and stay there.

Original: Aerith: You know I can't do that!
Dialogue: You know I can't do that!

Original: Rude: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Aerith: You're heading in already?
Dialogue: You're heading in already?

Original: On-screen: Return to Aerith's house?
Dialogue: Return to Aerith's house?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. That's enough for one day.
Dialogue: Yeah. That's enough for one day.

Original: Cloud: Nah. Not quite yet.
Dialogue: Nah. Not quite yet.

Original: Aerith: Oh my! Is that a moogle!?
Dialogue: Oh my! Is that a moogle!?

Original: Moggie: You can see me, kupo? Then you two must be very, very special people. In that case... Welcome to the Moogle Emporium! I'm the ownerMoggie!
Dialogue: You can see me, kupo? Then you two must be very, very special people. In that case... Welcome to the Moogle Emporium! I'm the owner—Moggie!

Original: Aerith: You must not be familiar with "Mog the Moogle." It's a pretty famous fairy tale. Mog wanted to bring happiness to all the moogles of the forest, so he decided to open a shop of wonders.
Dialogue: You must not be familiar with "Mog the Moogle." It's a pretty famous fairy tale. Mog wanted to bring happiness to all the moogles of the forest, so he decided to open a shop of wonders.

Original: Moggie: That's right, kupo! I opened a store to bring happiness to the slumslike Mog! And you know, only people with the purest of hearts can even see moogles!
Dialogue: That's right, kupo! I opened a store to bring happiness to the slums—like Mog! And you know, only people with the purest of hearts can even see moogles!

Original: Cloud: Uh...you talking 'bout me?
Dialogue: Uh...you talking 'bout me?

Original: Moggie: Well...moogle magic isn't perfect, kupo. Anyway, we've collected all kinds of rare and wonderous goods! They can be yours if you've got enough moogle medals. But you'll need to buy a membership first!
Dialogue: Well...moogle magic isn't perfect, kupo. Anyway, we've collected all kinds of rare and wonderous goods! They can be yours if you've got enough moogle medals. But you'll need to buy a membership first!

Original: Moggie: If you find any moogle medals, you can spend them here, kupo!
Dialogue: If you find any moogle medals, you can spend them here, kupo!

Original: Aerith: So, Moggie, what do you do with the medals we give you?
Dialogue: So, Moggie, what do you do with the medals we give you?

Original: Moggie: Oh, you know what! I use them to make everyone happy! That's the duty of every moogle!
Dialogue: Oh, you know what! I use them to make everyone happy! That's the duty of every moogle!

Original: Aerith: Of course. Just like Mog the Moogle.
Dialogue: Of course. Just like Mog the Moogle.

Original: Moggie: You guys are great! Thanks to you, I've got a ton of medals, kupo! Which means I can bring happiness to a ton of people!
Dialogue: You guys are great! Thanks to you, I've got a ton of medals, kupo! Which means I can bring happiness to a ton of people!

Original: Cloud: Good for you.
Dialogue: Good for you.

Original: Aerith: Hey, Cloud...maybe say it like you mean it?
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud...maybe say it like you mean it?

Original: Cloud: Not until I'm happy. Go on. Work your magic. Make me smile. From ear to ear.
Dialogue: Not until I'm happy. Go on. Work your magic. Make me smile. From ear to ear.

Original: Moggie: I'll need a lot more medals, kupo!
Dialogue: I'll need a lot more medals, kupo!

Original: Aerith: Well, that won't do! C'mon Cloudlet's go get more!
Dialogue: Well, that won't do! C'mon Cloud—let's go get more!

Original: Moggie: Good luck, guys!
Dialogue: Good luck, guys!

Original: Moggie: A pleasure as always, kupo.
Dialogue: A pleasure as always, kupo.

Original: Ms. Folia: Oh... You're that former SOLDIER, aren't you? Cloud, was it?
Dialogue: Oh... You're that former SOLDIER, aren't you? Cloud, was it?

Original: Aerith: Former SOLDIER turned problem solver. Are you okay, Ms. Folia? You look upset.
Dialogue: Former SOLDIER turned problem solver. Are you okay, Ms. Folia? You look upset.

Original: Ms. Folia: Yeah! I am pretty upset. The kids are still off doing patrols, even though it's now time for their lessons. Not a single one of them has come back yet!
Dialogue: Yeah! I am pretty upset. The kids are still off doing patrols, even though it's now time for their lessons. Not a single one of them has come back yet!

Original: Aerith: Patrols? Is that a Leaf House thing? Something they do to help out?
Dialogue: Patrols? Is that a Leaf House thing? Something they do to help out?

Original: Ms. Folia: That's right. In return for the donations we receive, the kids go around town picking up litter, running errandsthat kind of thing. I don't suppose you've seen any of them, have you? You see, I have some important plans this evening, and I really need to go and get ready.
Dialogue: That's right. In return for the donations we receive, the kids go around town picking up litter, running errands—that kind of thing. I don't suppose you've seen any of them, have you? You see, I have some important plans this evening, and I really need to go and get ready.

Original: Aerith: Would you like us to go round them up?
Dialogue: Would you like us to go round them up?

Original: Ms. Folia: That would be wonderful! There are five of them out on patrol right now. They all wear homemade swords on their back, so they should be easy to spot.
Dialogue: That would be wonderful! There are five of them out on patrol right now. They all wear homemade swords on their back, so they should be easy to spot.

Original: Girl: Wow, you're that SOLDIER, right? Can I ask you a super important question? I heard bad people broke the mako reactor and there's gonna be another war 'cause of it. Is that true?
Dialogue: Wow, you're that SOLDIER, right? Can I ask you a super important question? I heard bad people broke the mako reactor and there's gonna be another war 'cause of it. Is that true?

Original: Cloud: Who knows, but isn't there something else you should be worrying about right now?
Dialogue: Who knows, but isn't there something else you should be worrying about right now?

Original: Girl: I forgot about Ms. Folia's lesson! I gotta head back to the House.
Dialogue: I forgot about Ms. Folia's lesson! I gotta head back to the House.

Original: Boy: Cloud!?
Dialogue: Cloud!?

Original: Aerith: Hey there. How goes the patrol?
Dialogue: Hey there. How goes the patrol?

Original: Boy: There's a lot more people on the streets than usual. Maybe because the reactor blew up?
Dialogue: There's a lot more people on the streets than usual. Maybe because the reactor blew up?

Original: Aerith: Well, you've been keeping a very sharp lookout. But don't you think you're forgetting something important?
Dialogue: Well, you've been keeping a very sharp lookout. But don't you think you're forgetting something important?

Original: Boy: Oh, Ms. Folia's lessons! I gotta get back to the House!
Dialogue: Oh, Ms. Folia's lessons! I gotta get back to the House!

Original: Aerith: Hey there. How goes the patrol?
Dialogue: Hey there. How goes the patrol?

Original: Girl: Great! I've been picking up garbage and giving people directions! Plus, I helped an old lady cross the street!
Dialogue: Great! I've been picking up garbage and giving people directions! Plus, I helped an old lady cross the street!

Original: Aerith: You've been busy.
Dialogue: You've been busy.

Original: Girl: It's a normal day for me. Gotta work hardthe House depends on people's donations!
Dialogue: It's a normal day for me. Gotta work hard—the House depends on people's donations!

Original: Girl: Oh no, I'm late! Did you see Ms. Folia? Is she mad? I gotta go! I'm sorry!
Dialogue: Oh no, I'm late! Did you see Ms. Folia? Is she mad? I gotta go! I'm sorry!

Original: Boy: You scared me!
Dialogue: You scared me!

Original: Aerith: Hey there. How goes the patrol?
Dialogue: Hey there. How goes the patrol?

Original: Boy: I've been watching them really close. I'm trying to learn all about the business.
Dialogue: I've been watching them really close. I'm trying to learn all about the business.

Original: Aerith: You wanna open up a shop of your own someday?
Dialogue: You wanna open up a shop of your own someday?

Original: Boy: Yeah, so I can earn lots of money and use it to help the House. The teachers don't like to talk about it, but we know the donations aren't enough to keep things running. ...But that's a secret, okay? I'm not supposed to tell anyone! Anyway, I gotta go study!
Dialogue: Yeah, so I can earn lots of money and use it to help the House. The teachers don't like to talk about it, but we know the donations aren't enough to keep things running. ...But that's a secret, okay? I'm not supposed to tell anyone! Anyway, I gotta go study!

Original: Boy: Hello, CloudSir! It's a real honor to meet you! I think you SOLDIER guys are awesome! I wanna be strong and tough when I grow up too!
Dialogue: Hello, Cloud—Sir! It's a real honor to meet you! I think you SOLDIER guys are awesome! I wanna be strong and tough when I grow up too!

Original: Aerith: You sound very determined.
Dialogue: You sound very determined.

Original: Boy: These are dangerous times! A reactor blew up, and a bunch of kids lost their friends and families. Who knows what might blow up next?
Dialogue: These are dangerous times! A reactor blew up, and a bunch of kids lost their friends and families. Who knows what might blow up next?

Original: Aerith: I guess that means more children might be coming to the House soon.
Dialogue: I guess that means more children might be coming to the House soon.

Original: Boy: Then I think the teachers are gonna have a whole lot more work to do.
Dialogue: Then I think the teachers are gonna have a whole lot more work to do.

Original: Cloud: Speaking of teachers, Ms. Folia is looking for you.
Dialogue: Speaking of teachers, Ms. Folia is looking for you.

Original: Boy: Oh man, I completely forgot! I have to get back right now!
Dialogue: Oh man, I completely forgot! I have to get back right now!

Original: Aerith: That's everyone. Let's go back to the House.
Dialogue: That's everyone. Let's go back to the House.

Original: Ms. Folia: The children finally came backthanks to you two. You've been a great help. Okay, everyone! Come insideit's time to hit the books!
Dialogue: The children finally came back—thanks to you two. You've been a great help. Okay, everyone! Come inside—it's time to hit the books!

Original: Boy (1): You guys, the toad king's back! I saw him near the hideout!
Dialogue: You guys, the toad king's back! I saw him near the hideout!

Original: Boy (2): We gotta do something about him.
Dialogue: We gotta do something about him.

Original: Aerith: The toad "king"?
Dialogue: The toad "king"?

Original: Boy (2): A weird, creepy monster we've seen near the hideout lately.
Dialogue: A weird, creepy monster we've seen near the hideout lately.

Original: Girl (1): He wears a crown and walks around like he owns the place. If he's not a king, he's gotta be monster royalty at least. I bet a SOLDIER could beat him up easy!
Dialogue: He wears a crown and walks around like he owns the place. If he's not a king, he's gotta be monster royalty at least. I bet a SOLDIER could beat him up easy!

Original: Cloud: Oh, yeah. Real easy. But here's the thing...I don't work for freeor cheap.
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Real easy. But here's the thing...I don't work for free—or cheap.

Original: Girl (1): But we don't have any money!
Dialogue: But we don't have any money!

Original: Girl (2): The watch wouldn't ask for money.
Dialogue: The watch wouldn't ask for money.

Original: Boy (1): But if we ask any other grown-ups for help, they'll find out about the hideout, and that'll be it!
Dialogue: But if we ask any other grown-ups for help, they'll find out about the hideout, and that'll be it!

Original: Girl (2): We really don't wanna lose the hideout. C'mon, help us! Ohand we'll give you some cool treasure if you do!
Dialogue: We really don't wanna lose the hideout. C'mon, help us! Oh—and we'll give you some cool treasure if you do!

Original: Boy (3): And if that's not enough, I'll pay the rest of your fee once I open my shop!
Dialogue: And if that's not enough, I'll pay the rest of your fee once I open my shop!

Original: Boy (4): Well! If you won't help, then we'll just have to kill it ourselves!
Dialogue: Well! If you won't help, then we'll just have to kill it ourselves!

Original: Cloud: I'll do it for three gil. I'm offering a special discount right now on toad king jobs. Looks like it's your lucky day.
Dialogue: I'll do it for three gil. I'm offering a special discount right now on toad king jobs. Looks like it's your lucky day.

Original: Boy (2): Awesome! Now that's my kind of bargain!
Dialogue: Awesome! Now that's my kind of bargain!

Original: Boy: The toad king wants to take over our hideout. He's mean and angry, and smells bad too, so be careful!
Dialogue: The toad king wants to take over our hideout. He's mean and angry, and smells bad too, so be careful!

Original: (Upon defeating the Hedgehog Pie King.)On-screen: Return to the Leaf House?
Dialogue: Return to the Leaf House?

Original: Boy: Did you defeat the toad king!?
Dialogue: Did you defeat the toad king!?

Original: Cloud: Yup. Kicked his butt real good.
Dialogue: Yup. Kicked his butt real good.

Original: Boy: Awesome! I knew you could do it!
Dialogue: Awesome! I knew you could do it!

Original: Boy: Now we don't have to worry about the king and his smelly friends!
Dialogue: Now we don't have to worry about the king and his smelly friends!

Original: Girl: Thank you so much! Herethis is for youthe treasure we promised. It's definitely worth at least three gil.
Dialogue: Thank you so much! Here—this is for you—the treasure we promised. It's definitely worth at least three gil.

Original: Ms. Folia: Okay, kids, playtime's over for now! I've prepared a special assignment for everyone. One that I expect you to finish today. Understood?
Dialogue: Okay, kids, playtime's over for now! I've prepared a special assignment for everyone. One that I expect you to finish today. Understood?

Original: Boy: Yes! Yes, Ms. Folia!
Dialogue: Yes! Yes, Ms. Folia!

Original: Ms. Folia: I appreciate you getting rid of the toad king, by the way.
Dialogue: I appreciate you getting rid of the toad king, by the way.

Original: Aerith: Wow, Ms. Folia. You must know all their secrets.
Dialogue: Wow, Ms. Folia. You must know all their secrets.

Original: Ms. Folia: Oh, if only. Easier said than done. They're always on the move, looking for new adventures, chasing new dreams, all while trying to make the lives of everyone around them just a little better. I try to make sure they don't stumble and fall, and when they finally do, I help them back up.
Dialogue: Oh, if only. Easier said than done. They're always on the move, looking for new adventures, chasing new dreams, all while trying to make the lives of everyone around them just a little better. I try to make sure they don't stumble and fall, and when they finally do, I help them back up.

Original: Cloud: Sounds exhausting.
Dialogue: Sounds exhausting.

Original: Ms. Folia: Sometimes it is. But I want the children to know that until they can stand on their own two feet that I'm here to support them, care for them, love themthat even if we're not actually related, we're still a familya real family, in all the ways that matter. If I can do that for them, then well...then maybe I'm making this world a better place.
Dialogue: Sometimes it is. But I want the children to know that until they can stand on their own two feet that I'm here to support them, care for them, love them—that even if we're not actually related, we're still a family—a real family, in all the ways that matter. If I can do that for them, then well...then maybe I'm making this world a better place.

Original: Aerith: I know you are.
Dialogue: I know you are.

Original: Ms. Folia: My predecessor taught me everything I know. I just took up his torch and ran with it, I guess. Not that I'm anything close to what he was. Biggs is one of a kind.
Dialogue: My predecessor taught me everything I know. I just took up his torch and ran with it, I guess. Not that I'm anything close to what he was. Biggs is one of a kind.

Original: Ms. Folia: Oh no! I've completely lost track of time!
Dialogue: Oh no! I've completely lost track of time!

Original: Aerith: Do you have somewhere you need to be?
Dialogue: Do you have somewhere you need to be?

Original: Ms. Folia: More like a dream I need to fulfill! Thank you again for your help!
Dialogue: More like a dream I need to fulfill! Thank you again for your help!

Original: Aerith: I wonder what kind of dream she's chasing tonight.
Dialogue: I wonder what kind of dream she's chasing tonight.

Original: Cloud: No idea.
Dialogue: No idea.

Original: Boy: Thanks again for saving our hideout from the king. In return, I let everyone know you guys can join the "game"as special guests. If you wanna know more, then come to the hideout!
Dialogue: Thanks again for saving our hideout from the king. In return, I let everyone know you guys can join the "game"—as special guests. If you wanna know more, then come to the hideout!

Original: Oates: Now that things are starting to settle down a bit, we can finally play Whack-a-Box again! It's all thanks to you!
Dialogue: Now that things are starting to settle down a bit, we can finally play Whack-a-Box again! It's all thanks to you!

Original: Oates: Oh, yeah, I forgot. There's this tired-looking guy out by the community center...and I heard he was looking for some help.
Dialogue: Oh, yeah, I forgot. There's this tired-looking guy out by the community center...and I heard he was looking for some help.

Original: Scared Man: Shinra weapons are on the rampage. Five of 'em, like floatin' eyeballs! I saw them wander off into the scrap, but if they come back into town, it'd be a disaster. We need someone who's willing and able to fight...
Dialogue: Shinra weapons are on the rampage. Five of 'em, like floatin' eyeballs! I saw them wander off into the scrap, but if they come back into town, it'd be a disaster. We need someone who's willing and able to fight...

Original: Cloud: I'll handle it.
Dialogue: I'll handle it.

Original: Scared Man: You will!? Aw man, you're the best! I could hear them shouting "intruder detected" or some other nonsense when they floated off. Be careful. They looked dangerous!
Dialogue: You will!? Aw man, you're the best! I could hear them shouting "intruder detected" or some other nonsense when they floated off. Be careful. They looked dangerous!

Original: On-screen: Return to the scared man?
Dialogue: Return to the scared man?

Original: Scared Man: I heard, I heard! You got 'em all, right? Robots from the reactor getting lost in the slums... Must be because of the explosion up top, huh? They must've thought they were protecting the reactor, and figured I was trespassin' on their turf or something.
Dialogue: I heard, I heard! You got 'em all, right? Robots from the reactor getting lost in the slums... Must be because of the explosion up top, huh? They must've thought they were protecting the reactor, and figured I was trespassin' on their turf or something.

Original: Cloud: Maybe.
Dialogue: Maybe.

Original: Scared Man: Almost feel sorry for 'em, getting all lost and confused like that.
Dialogue: Almost feel sorry for 'em, getting all lost and confused like that.

Original: Scared Man: Ah, what am I sayin'? Man or machine... Shinra bitches get what they deserve.
Dialogue: Ah, what am I sayin'? Man or machine... Shinra bitches get what they deserve.

Original: Cloud: Now hold on
Dialogue: Now hold on—

Original: Aerith: Anyway, I think it's safe to say our work here is finished! If you're ever in the market for a merc again, remember: you can count on Cloud!
Dialogue: Anyway, I think it's safe to say our work here is finished! If you're ever in the market for a merc again, remember you can count on Cloud!

Original: Scared Man: Uh, sure. And sorry about putting this on you all of a sudden. I'm really glad you were willing to help out, though! Thanks again.
Dialogue: Uh, sure. And sorry about putting this on you all of a sudden. I'm really glad you were willing to help out, though! Thanks again.

Original: Scared Man: Actually, while you're here, I've got another favor to ask. There's this old guy who hangs out in front of the weapons shop. I think he might need your help. Would you mind talking to him?
Dialogue: Actually, while you're here, I've got another favor to ask. There's this old guy who hangs out in front of the weapons shop. I think he might need your help. Would you mind talking to him?

Original: Scared Man: I'd appreciate it if you could talk to that old guy. He helped me out a while back, and I'd like to return the favor.
Dialogue: I'd appreciate it if you could talk to that old guy. He helped me out a while back, and I'd like to return the favor.

Original: Sarah: Oh hey, Cloud! You're just in time for our favorite gameWhack-a-Box! You want in? It's super fun! The rules are easy. The person who whacks the most boxes is crowned champion of the hideout! We usually don't let adults play, but since you're cool, we're gonna make a special exception just for you.
Dialogue: Oh hey, Cloud! You're just in time for our favorite game—Whack-a-Box! You want in? It's super fun! The rules are easy. The person who whacks the most boxes is crowned champion of the hideout! We usually don't let adults play, but since you're cool, we're gonna make a special exception just for you.

Original: On-screen: Play a game of Whack-a-Box?
Dialogue: Play a game of Whack-a-Box?

Original: Sarah: See? Pretty fun, right? Play with us again, 'kay!
Dialogue: See? Pretty fun, right? Play with us again, 'kay!

Original: Sarah: Holy cow! You crushed it!
Dialogue: Holy cow! You crushed it!

Original: Sarah: Wanna play some Whack-a-Box?
Dialogue: Wanna play some Whack-a-Box?

Original: Damon: Ah, you wouldn't happen to be a certain merc that's become the talk of the town?
Dialogue: Ah, you wouldn't happen to be a certain merc that's become the talk of the town?

Original: Cloud: Yup.
Dialogue: Yup.

Original: Damon: I'm Damon. Little more than a humble reporter with the Daily Buzz.
Dialogue: I'm Damon. Little more than a humble reporter with the Daily Buzz.

Original: Aerith: Ugh, that rag? The one that's always printing awful rumors about the slums?
Dialogue: Ugh, that rag? The one that's always printing awful rumors about the slums?

Original: Damon: On the contrary, my dear! We strive to raise awareness of the plight of our undercity brethren. We seek a better future for everyone, rich and poor.
Dialogue: On the contrary, my dear! We strive to raise awareness of the plight of our undercity brethren. We seek a better future for everyone, rich and poor.

Original: Damon: Now then, my friends. I find myself in need of your exceptional services for a trifling matter. Are you familiar with the mysteriousand notoriousbandit known as the "Angel of the Slums"? She delivers written declarations to her victimsusually Shinra associatesbefore divesting them of their valuables.
Dialogue: Now then, my friends. I find myself in need of your exceptional services for a trifling matter. Are you familiar with the mysterious—and notorious—bandit known as the "Angel of the Slums"? She delivers written declarations to her victims—usually Shinra associates—before divesting them of their valuables.

Original: Aerith: Everyone knows her. Everything she steals, she gives to the poor and needy.
Dialogue: Everyone knows her. Everything she steals, she gives to the poor and needy.

Original: Damon: Yes. She's got a knack for public relations. Very popular down here as a result. Nevertheless, she is a criminal and a threat to the public order! I've made it my mission to unmask the villain, but the locals have been uncooperative and uncommunicative, to put it mildly. And now that my identity as a reporter has been exposed, my sources have all deserted me! Which brings me to youthe merc of the hour, and the man who will serve up my scoop!
Dialogue: Yes. She's got a knack for public relations. Very popular down here as a result. Nevertheless, she is a criminal and a threat to the public order! I've made it my mission to unmask the villain, but the locals have been uncooperative and uncommunicative, to put it mildly. And now that my identity as a reporter has been exposed, my sources have all deserted me! Which brings me to you—the merc of the hour, and the man who will serve up my scoop!

Original: Damon: I'll welcome any and all information pertaining to the so-called Angel of the Slums.
Dialogue: I'll welcome any and all information pertaining to the so-called Angel of the Slums.

Original: Undercity Resident (1): Why, hello! What is it? The Guardian Angel of the Slums? Such a mysterious figure. Always talked about, but neverseenby anyone! The Angel gets in and out without being noticed and always leaves a calling card. Maybe a magician!? No, no, it's no magic trickit's genuine magic! Rumor has it that the Angel is a witch.
Dialogue: Why, hello! What is it? The Guardian Angel of the Slums? Such a mysterious figure. Always talked about, but never seen by anyone! The Angel gets in and out without being noticed and always leaves a calling card. Maybe a magician!? No, no, it's no magic trick—it's genuine magic! Rumor has it that the Angel is a witch.

Original: Undercity Resident (2): If we're going by rumors, then I've heard that it's actually a monster in disguise.
Dialogue: If we're going by rumors, then I've heard that it's actually a monster in disguise.

Original: Undercity Resident (1): Well, I could talk all day about thedozensof storiesI'veheard!
Dialogue: Well, I could talk all day about the dozens of stories I've heard!

Original: Aerith: Good to see you again, Mireille.
Dialogue: Good to see you again, Mireille.

Original: Mireille: Good to see you too, Aerith. I'd heard you found yourself a funny new friend.
Dialogue: Good to see you too, Aerith. I'd heard you found yourself a funny new friend.

Original: Aerith: Cloud, meet Mireille. She knows everything there is to know about the slums. Mireille, meet Cloud. He's a former SOLDIER, and super strong.
Dialogue: Cloud, meet Mireille. She knows everything there is to know about the slums. Mireille, meet Cloud. He's a former SOLDIER, and super strong.

Original: Mireille: He looks useful enough. The kids have been talking about you. The defender of the secret hideout. And now the Hero of the Leaf House is helping the Daily Buzz look for the Angel of the Slums.
Dialogue: He looks useful enough. The kids have been talking about you. The defender of the secret hideout. And now the Hero of the Leaf House is helping the Daily Buzz look for the Angel of the Slums.

Original: Cloud: I am?
Dialogue: I am?

Original: Mireille: (chuckles) I'm a lover of the whispered word. Not that it's any real secret, considering how chatty that Shinra mutt's been.
Dialogue: (chuckles) I'm a lover of the whispered word. Not that it's any real secret, considering how chatty that Shinra mutt's been.

Original: Cloud: Not looking into it for the reporter. I'm doing it for myself. Call it curiosity...or whatever.
Dialogue: Not looking into it for the reporter. I'm doing it for myself. Call it curiosity...or whatever.

Original: Mireille: Or could it be you've fallen under the Angel's spell like so many others? Anywayit so happens that I have some information for you. But I'll need a moment before I can give it to you. Why don't you wait with that reporter of yours?
Dialogue: Or could it be you've fallen under the Angel's spell like so many others? Anyway—it so happens that I have some information for you. But I'll need a moment before I can give it to you. Why don't you wait with that reporter of yours?

Original: Mireille: Just wait outside with the reporter. I'll be along soon.
Dialogue: Just wait outside with the reporter. I'll be along soon.

Original: Damon: So! Any news?
Dialogue: So! Any news?

Original: Aerith: Have you tried talking to Mireille at all? She told us that she had some information to share.
Dialogue: Have you tried talking to Mireille at all? She told us that she had some information to share.

Original: Damon: Mireille as intheMireille? The town gossip? I chased her for days, begging for info, but she wouldn't give up a single scrap! So how'dyouget the old bird to talk?
Dialogue: Mireille as in the Mireille? The town gossip? I chased her for days, begging for info, but she wouldn't give up a single scrap! So how'd you get the old bird to talk?

Original: Mireille: This old bird had a change of heart, that's all.
Dialogue: This old bird had a change of heart, that's all.

Original: Damon: Then quickly, before you have another, tell us: what do you know about the notorious Angel of the Slums? Has she struck again? Is that it!?
Dialogue: Then quickly, before you have another, tell us what do you know about the notorious Angel of the Slums? Has she struck again? Is that it!?

Original: Mireille: I don't know anything about that. But I do know where her hideout is.
Dialogue: I don't know anything about that. But I do know where her hideout is.

Original: Damon: Her base of operations? Now that's a scoop! Where is it!? Tell me!
Dialogue: Her base of operations? Now that's a scoop! Where is it!? Tell me!

Original: Mireille: Deep in the scrapat Lookout Point. Hardly anyone goes out there these days. It's the perfect place for a criminal to hole up.
Dialogue: Deep in the scrap—at Lookout Point. Hardly anyone goes out there these days. It's the perfect place for a criminal to hole up.

Original: Damon: Lookout Pointgot it! I'll check it out right now!
Dialogue: Lookout Point—got it! I'll check it out right now!

Original: Mireille: But before you go, I should warn you about this rumor I heardabout a terrible fiend that's claimed the Angel's hideout as its lair. Quite large, lots of teeth, always hungry. I don't know about you, but I'd not go anywhere near that thing.
Dialogue: But before you go, I should warn you about this rumor I heard—about a terrible fiend that's claimed the Angel's hideout as its lair. Quite large, lots of teeth, always hungry. I don't know about you, but I'd not go anywhere near that thing.

Original: Damon: Er, well, uh... Well! A good reporter knows never to take foolish risks. "Plan first, then act." That's every respectable journalist's motto!
Dialogue: Er, well, uh... Well! A good reporter knows never to take foolish risks. "Plan first, then act." That's every respectable journalist's motto!

Original: Mireille: If it's a "plan" you're looking for, I'd say you have one right here. Wouldn't you?
Dialogue: If it's a "plan" you're looking for, I'd say you have one right here. Wouldn't you?

Original: Damon: So, my good mercenary. If I might impose upon you again, it would be lovely if you investigated Lookout Point for me.
Dialogue: So, my good mercenary. If I might impose upon you again, it would be lovely if you investigated Lookout Point for me.

Original: Cloud: Okay then. Guess we should look around.
Dialogue: Okay then. Guess we should look around.

Original: Cloud: "The Guardian Angel of the Slums will collect your offering on behalf of the poor."
Dialogue: "The Guardian Angel of the Slums will collect your offering on behalf of the poor."

Original: Aerith: This must be one of her calling cards!
Dialogue: This must be one of her calling cards!

Original: Cloud: I don't see anything else interesting. Let's head back and tell them what we found.
Dialogue: I don't see anything else interesting. Let's head back and tell them what we found.

Original: On-screen: Return to the reporter?
Dialogue: Return to the reporter?

Original: Damon: I can't believe it! You found one of her calling cards! This is the genuine article, I'm sure of it! Penned by the Angel herself!
Dialogue: I can't believe it! You found one of her calling cards! This is the genuine article, I'm sure of it! Penned by the Angel herself!

Original: Mireille: Hmm... So this is one of her famous warnings.
Dialogue: Hmm... So this is one of her famous warnings.

Original: Damon: It's an incredible find! Ohwas that all?
Dialogue: It's an incredible find! Oh—was that all?

Original: Mireille: Hold on. Looks like there's something elsea message. "To the nosy Shinra reporter sniffing around... I was planning to teach you a lesson you would never forget. However, by the grace of your mercenary friend, you were spared that lesson. But next time he might not be around to save you. You would be wise to watch your step."
Dialogue: Hold on. Looks like there's something else—a message. "To the nosy Shinra reporter sniffing around... I was planning to teach you a lesson you would never forget. However, by the grace of your mercenary friend, you were spared that lesson. But next time he might not be around to save you. You would be wise to watch your step."

Original: Damon: Not just a message from the Angel... A warning!
Dialogue: Not just a message from the Angel... A warning!

Original: Mireille: If the merc here hadn't bailed you out, that fiend in the scrap would've ripped you to shreds. Sorry about that, friend. Here I was just trying to help you out, but instead my kindness almost got you violently killed.
Dialogue: If the merc here hadn't bailed you out, that fiend in the scrap would've ripped you to shreds. Sorry about that, friend. Here I was just trying to help you out, but instead my kindness almost got you violently killed.

Original: Damon: Now, now. No harm, no foul...right? In any case, I hope this narrowly averted tragedy won't discourage you from sharing information with me in the future.
Dialogue: Now, now. No harm, no foul...right? In any case, I hope this narrowly averted tragedy won't discourage you from sharing information with me in the future.

Original: Undercity Resident (1): Hey, everybody! The Angel left another calling card! She's gonna rip off Don Corneo!
Dialogue: Hey, everybody! The Angel left another calling card! She's gonna rip off Don Corneo!

Original: Undercity Resident (2): It's about damn time!
Dialogue: It's about damn time!

Original: Undercity Resident (3): Don Corneo's no easy mark. I can't wait to see how this goes down!
Dialogue: Don Corneo's no easy mark. I can't wait to see how this goes down!

Original: Damon: Excuse me! I'm a reporter for the Daily Buzz and
Dialogue: Excuse me! I'm a reporter for the Daily Buzz and—

Original: Cloud: So much for my reward.
Dialogue: So much for my reward.

Original: Mireille: Here. Why don't you take this? Oh, and no need to thank me. Let's just say it slipped out of that reporter's pocket. (laughs) Can't call it theft if you're just claiming what you're owedam I right? Well done, mister merc. You certainly lived up to your reputation.
Dialogue: Here. Why don't you take this? Oh, and no need to thank me. Let's just say it slipped out of that reporter's pocket. (laughs) Can't call it theft if you're just claiming what you're owed—am I right? Well done, mister merc. You certainly lived up to your reputation.

Original: Old Man: Oh, I know you. You must be that mercenary. I have a problem. It's the anniversary of my wife's death, and I wanted to visit her grave. But I can't because some creatures have turned the graveyard into their nest. Could you do me a favor and go there in my stead? She shouldn't be alone today.
Dialogue: Oh, I know you. You must be that mercenary. I have a problem. It's the anniversary of my wife's death, and I wanted to visit her grave. But I can't because some creatures have turned the graveyard into their nest. Could you do me a favor and go there in my stead? She shouldn't be alone today.

Original: Cloud: It'll cost you.
Dialogue: It'll cost you.

Original: Old Man: That's fine, that's fine. The graveyard's right by the head of the river. But I heard they put a new gate in recently to replace the old broken one. Now that those creatures have moved in, I'm sure it's locked up tight.
Dialogue: That's fine, that's fine. The graveyard's right by the head of the river. But I heard they put a new gate in recently to replace the old broken one. Now that those creatures have moved in, I'm sure it's locked up tight.

Original: Aerith: Didn't we buy a graveyard key off Moggie? I think we did.
Dialogue: Didn't we buy a graveyard key off Moggie? I think we did.

Original: Old Man: You'll find my wife's grave with all the others out by the river's head. But I suspect you're going to need a key to get past the new gate they put in.
Dialogue: You'll find my wife's grave with all the others out by the river's head. But I suspect you're going to need a key to get past the new gate they put in.

Original: Aerith: This must be it.
Dialogue: This must be it.

Original: Aeroth: Hey. You wanna say a prayer too?
Dialogue: Hey. You wanna say a prayer too?

Original: Cloud: No thanks. I think you've got it covered.
Dialogue: No thanks. I think you've got it covered.

Original: On-screen: Return to the old man?
Dialogue: Return to the old man?

Original: Scared Man: I'm really grateful for what you did. Here's your reward. I owe him a lotmaybe more than I can ever repay. And now I owe you a lot too. I know it's not much, but I hope it makes up for it a little bit.
Dialogue: I'm really grateful for what you did. Here's your reward. I owe him a lot—maybe more than I can ever repay. And now I owe you a lot too. I know it's not much, but I hope it makes up for it a little bit.

Original: Aerith: We paid our respects to your wifeand we took care of those creatures.
Dialogue: We paid our respects to your wife—and we took care of those creatures.

Original: Old Man: Oh, that's such a relief to hear. I can't tell you how much it was weighing on my mind. I was beginning to think I might never be able to visit her grave again. With my bad back and my legsmy whole body's a mess, franklyI...I didn't think I could make it past the creatures. But I was prepared to die trying. And then you two came along.
Dialogue: Oh, that's such a relief to hear. I can't tell you how much it was weighing on my mind. I was beginning to think I might never be able to visit her grave again. With my bad back and my legs—my whole body's a mess, frankly—I...I didn't think I could make it past the creatures. But I was prepared to die trying. And then you two came along.

Original: Old Man: Still, I've got to face facts. Creatures or no, I can't keep making these trips...
Dialogue: Still, I've got to face facts. Creatures or no, I can't keep making these trips...

Original: Scared Man: Don't say that.
Dialogue: Don't say that.

Original: Cloud: This is the graveyard key. Run it back to Moggie.
Dialogue: This is the graveyard key. Run it back to Moggie.

Original: Old Man: But...I just told you about my legs...
Dialogue: But...I just told you about my legs...

Original: Scared Man: Why don't you just give it back?
Dialogue: Why don't you just give it back?

Original: Cloud: Okay. It'll cost you five thousand gil though.
Dialogue: Okay. It'll cost you five thousand gil though.

Original: Scared Man: Fivethousand!
Dialogue: Five thousand!

Original: Old Man: It's always money with you people! Hmph. Fine! I won't ask you for anything else! I'll take your damned key and give it to the boy!
Dialogue: It's always money with you people! Hmph. Fine! I won't ask you for anything else! I'll take your damned key and give it to the boy!

Original: Old Man: It's downright depressing. What is the world coming to these days...
Dialogue: It's downright depressing. What is the world coming to these days...

Original: Aerith: Wait a sec.
Dialogue: Wait a sec.

Original: Aerith: So...you coming?
Dialogue: So...you coming?

Original: Cloud: You talking to the...
Dialogue: You talking to the...

Original: Aerith: Shh. So yeah... It was that kind of day.
Dialogue: Shh. So yeah... It was that kind of day.

Original: Aerith: Let's go. Shouldn't keep Mom waiting.
Dialogue: Let's go. Shouldn't keep Mom waiting.

Original: Cloud: Hey... What'd they say?
Dialogue: Hey... What'd they say?

Original: Aerith: "Good work today, guys."
Dialogue: "Good work today, guys."

Original: Aerith: Kidding. They didn't say a word. But you know... Ah...never mind. It's not like you'd believe me after all.
Dialogue: Kidding. They didn't say a word. But you know... Ah...never mind. It's not like you'd believe me after all.

Original: Cloud: ...Probably not.
Dialogue: ...Probably not.

Original: Cloud: Tell me anyway.
Dialogue: Tell me anyway.

Original: Aerith: Really?
Dialogue: Really?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Aerith: It won't be much longer now. The flowers, they...they have something important to tell us. Something they...need to share with us. At least, that's the feeling I get. But...before they can...there's a final step that has to be taken. Otherwise...we won't hear them. Maybe I should just give up. Honestly, it's what I do best.
Dialogue: It won't be much longer now. The flowers, they...they have something important to tell us. Something they...need to share with us. At least, that's the feeling I get. But...before they can...there's a final step that has to be taken. Otherwise...we won't hear them. Maybe I should just give up. Honestly, it's what I do best.

Original: Cloud: Could've fooled me. From what I've seen, you're no quitter.
Dialogue: Could've fooled me. From what I've seen, you're no quitter.

Original: Aerith: Well today's special! That's why I've been working my butt off.
Dialogue: Well today's special! That's why I've been working my butt off.

Original: Cloud: Uh...What's so special about it?
Dialogue: Uh...What's so special about it?

Original: Aerith: (laughs) Okay, time to go!
Dialogue: (laughs) Okay, time to go!

Original: Cloud: Learn to talk to her.
Dialogue: Learn to talk to her.

Original: Aerith: Did the flowers say anything?
Dialogue: Did the flowers say anything?

Original: Cloud: Uh... "Good work today, guys"?
Dialogue: Uh... "Good work today, guys"?

Original: Aerith: (chuckles) That's the spirit!
Dialogue: (chuckles) That's the spirit!

Original: Elmyra: Where have you two been? I've been worried sick.
Dialogue: Where have you two been? I've been worried sick.

Original: Aerith: Sorry. We got a little sidetracked.
Dialogue: Sorry. We got a little sidetracked.

Original: Elmyra: Dinner's ready, in case you're wondering.
Dialogue: Dinner's ready, in case you're wondering.

Original: Aerith: Ah, great!
Dialogue: Ah, great!

Original: Elmyra: But before we sit downI want you to make up the guest room.
Dialogue: But before we sit down—I want you to make up the guest room.

Original: Aerith: Gotcha! Take a load off, okay?
Dialogue: Gotcha! Take a load off, okay?

Original: Elmyra: Judging by those eyes, I'm guessing you're a SOLDIER?
Dialogue: Judging by those eyes, I'm guessing you're a SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud: Ex-SOLDIER.
Dialogue: Ex-SOLDIER.

Original: Elmyra: I hate to ask...but would you leave here tonight? Without any fussno questions? You boys made a tradea normal life for power. You can't have it both ways.
Dialogue: I hate to ask...but would you leave here tonight? Without any fuss—no questions? You boys made a trade—a normal life for power. You can't have it both ways.

Original: Aerith: I'm back!
Dialogue: I'm back!

Original: Elmyra: Good. NowI hope you're hungry.
Dialogue: Good. Now—I hope you're hungry.

Original: Aerith: Starving. Right?
Dialogue: Starving. Right?

Original: Claudia: I've never been so proud. The man you've become... Women must be hounding you day and night.
Dialogue: I've never been so proud. The man you've become... Women must be hounding you day and night.

Original: Cloud: Not really.
Dialogue: Not really.

Original: Claudia: You know, there's all kinds of temptations in the big city. I'd feel a lot better if I knew you'd found a good girlone who'd make sure you didn't get into trouble.
Dialogue: You know, there's all kinds of temptations in the big city. I'd feel a lot better if I knew you'd found a good girl—one who'd make sure you didn't get into trouble.

Original: Cloud: I can take care of myself.
Dialogue: I can take care of myself.

Original: Claudia: An older, more mature girl that could keep you on the straight and narrowand tell you when you're being a silly goose. That's the perfect type for you, I'd say.
Dialogue: An older, more mature girl that could keep you on the straight and narrow—and tell you when you're being a silly goose. That's the perfect type for you, I'd say.

Original: Cloud: Don't want to overstay my welcome.
Dialogue: Don't want to overstay my welcome.

Original: Aerith: What're you doing?
Dialogue: What're you doing?

Original: Cloud: ...Nothing.
Dialogue: ...Nothing.

Original: Aerith: Did you have a bad dream? Don't worry. You'll feel much better in the morning. And I promise to take you straight home.
Dialogue: Did you have a bad dream? Don't worry. You'll feel much better in the morning. And I promise to take you straight home.

Original: Cloud: Uh... Okay.
Dialogue: Uh... Okay.

Original: Cloud: Please don't let her hear me again.
Dialogue: Please don't let her hear me again.

Original: Aerith: You jerk! I thought I told you not to leave your room. Now get back in there!
Dialogue: You jerk! I thought I told you not to leave your room. Now get back in there!

Original: Cloud: Okay...
Dialogue: Okay...

Original: Aerith: No. More. Games.
Dialogue: No. More. Games.

Original: Elmyra: You're leaving.
Dialogue: You're leaving.

Original: Cloud: So, how do I get to Sector 7?
Dialogue: So, how do I get to Sector 7?

Original: Elmyra: It's simple enough. Just cut through Sector 6. It isn't exactly safe, but you should be okay, seeing as you're a SOLDIER.
Dialogue: It's simple enough. Just cut through Sector 6. It isn't exactly safe, but you should be okay, seeing as you're a SOLDIER.

Original: Cloud: Was one.
Dialogue: Was one.

Original: Elmyra: Promise me. You'll never talk to Aerith again. Please.
Dialogue: Promise me. You'll never talk to Aerith again. Please.

Original: Cloud: You got it.
Dialogue: You got it.

Original: Elmyra: Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Elmyra: I'm sorry.
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Original: Housemother: If it isn't the new florist! I appreciate you helping the kids out today. Thank you. They won't stop talking about the SOLDIER who "saved the day." And make sure to give my thanks to Aerith too.
Dialogue: If it isn't the new florist! I appreciate you helping the kids out today. Thank you. They won't stop talking about the SOLDIER who "saved the day." And make sure to give my thanks to Aerith too.

Original: Cloud: Sure.
Dialogue: Sure.

Original: Aerith: Well, look who it is. Talk about a coincidence.
Dialogue: Well, look who it is. Talk about a coincidence.

Original: Cloud: What're you doing here?
Dialogue: What're you doing here?

Original: Aerith: Waiting.
Dialogue: Waiting.

Original: Cloud: Why?
Dialogue: Why?

Original: Aerith: Because I'm not sick of you yet.
Dialogue: Because I'm not sick of you yet.

Original: Cloud: Lead on, then.
Dialogue: Lead on, then.

Original: Aerith: With pleasure. (hums)
Dialogue: With pleasure. (hums)

Original: Aerith: Cloud? Is something wrong?
Dialogue: Cloud? Is something wrong?

Original: Cloud: It's nothing.
Dialogue: It's nothing.

Original: Cloud: You can see the sky.
Dialogue: You can see the sky.

Original: Aerith: They're still working on the new plate. I don't like this part of Midgar. Back when they were still building Midgar, there was an accident, and the plate fell. People had only just started moving in, so there weren't a lot living there at the time, but...
Dialogue: They're still working on the new plate. I don't like this part of Midgar. Back when they were still building Midgar, there was an accident, and the plate fell. People had only just started moving in, so there weren't a lot living there at the time, but...

Original: Cloud: And that's...?
Dialogue: And that's...?

Original: Aerith: The underside of Sector 6. "Wall Market." A realspecialplace. But...I'm sure you already knew that, right?
Dialogue: The underside of Sector 6. "Wall Market." A real special place. But...I'm sure you already knew that, right?

Original: Cloud: I didn't tell you? I enlisted pretty much right after I left home. Dunno much about this place, or any of the slums.
Dialogue: I didn't tell you? I enlisted pretty much right after I left home. Dunno much about this place, or any of the slums.

Original: Aerith: Well, it took a lot of people to build Midgar. And they all needed to blow off steam. So some traders built an entertainment district. Inns, shops, bars, the works. Folks started pouring in from all over. Business was booming, money was flowing... Which attracted the attention of some guys who...didn't much care for the law.
Dialogue: Well, it took a lot of people to build Midgar. And they all needed to blow off steam. So some traders built an entertainment district. Inns, shops, bars, the works. Folks started pouring in from all over. Business was booming, money was flowing... Which attracted the attention of some guys who...didn't much care for the law.

Original: Cloud: And now there isn't any.
Dialogue: And now there isn't any.

Original: Aerith: Right. But instead of trying to solve the problem, the government decided to just wall it in. And that's how Wall Market began. "Out of sight, out of mind," as the old saying goes. For the folks in charge, there's no better way to deal with it.
Dialogue: Right. But instead of trying to solve the problem, the government decided to just wall it in. And that's how Wall Market began. "Out of sight, out of mind," as the old saying goes. For the folks in charge, there's no better way to deal with it.

Original: Cloud: So it's like a giant veil.
Dialogue: So it's like a giant veil.

Original: Aerith: Yeah. Wanna see what's behind it?
Dialogue: Yeah. Wanna see what's behind it?

Original: Cloud: Not really.
Dialogue: Not really.

Original: Aerith: That's good'cause I know a better way to get to Sector 7. One thattragicallydoesn't go through Wall Market. And it's just through this tunnel here. At least it was, back when I was a kid.
Dialogue: That's good—'cause I know a better way to get to Sector 7. One that—tragically—doesn't go through Wall Market. And it's just through this tunnel here. At least it was, back when I was a kid.

Original: On-screen: Sector 6 Slums - Collapsed Expressway
Dialogue: Sector 6 Slums - Collapsed Expressway

Original: Aerith: It's been like this, you know. Ever since the plate fell.
Dialogue: It's been like this, you know. Ever since the plate fell.

Original: Cloud: And there's no other way?
Dialogue: And there's no other way?

Original: Aerith: It'll be an adventure.
Dialogue: It'll be an adventure.

Original: Cloud: What's that?
Dialogue: What's that?

Original: Aerith: A big arm. Kinda cute, don't you think?
Dialogue: A big arm. Kinda cute, don't you think?

Original: Aerith: Oh, great. Someone's pulled up the ladder.
Dialogue: Oh, great. Someone's pulled up the ladder.

Original: Aerith: I wonder if we can use this.
Dialogue: I wonder if we can use this.

Original: Aerith: Here's an idea. I'll hop on, and you give me a ride.
Dialogue: Here's an idea. I'll hop on, and you give me a ride.

Original: Cloud: You serious?
Dialogue: You serious?

Original: Aerith: Absolutely! I'll throw down the ladder for you to climb up after.
Dialogue: Absolutely! I'll throw down the ladder for you to climb up after.

Original: Aerith: Piece of cake! Gimme a sec.
Dialogue: Piece of cake! Gimme a sec.

Original: Aerith: And here comes the ladder.
Dialogue: And here comes the ladder.

Original: Aerith: Well? What did I tell ya?
Dialogue: Well? What did I tell ya?

Original: Aerith: You did it!
Dialogue: You did it!

Original: Cloud: Yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah...

Original: Aerith: Hm?
Dialogue: Hm?

Original: Aerith: Alright, good enough. Let's keep on truckin'!
Dialogue: Alright, good enough. Let's keep on truckin'!

Original: Cloud: Stop.
Dialogue: Stop.

Original: Aerith: Did we wake it up?
Dialogue: Did we wake it up?

Original: Aerith: Huh, that's weird. Used to be a way through here.
Dialogue: Huh, that's weird. Used to be a way through here.

Original: Aerith: I wonder if someone blocked it off because of all the monsters that kept showing up.
Dialogue: I wonder if someone blocked it off because of all the monsters that kept showing up.

Original: Cloud: Pretty dangerous place for kids to play.
Dialogue: Pretty dangerous place for kids to play.

Original: Aerith: Raised in the slums, remember?
Dialogue: Raised in the slums, remember?

Original: Cloud: You're tough.
Dialogue: You're tough.

Original: Aerith: Hmm, that supposed to be a compliment?
Dialogue: Hmm, that supposed to be a compliment?

Original: Aerith: Looks like a dead end.
Dialogue: Looks like a dead end.

Original: Aerith: Hey, I bet you can grab that container with the arm.
Dialogue: Hey, I bet you can grab that container with the arm.

Original: Aerith: Not half bad! So, do you moonlight as a crane operator or something?
Dialogue: Not half bad! So, do you moonlight as a crane operator or something?

Original: Aerith: Yeah?
Dialogue: Yeah?

Original: Aerith: Uhhh...
Dialogue: Uhhh...

Original: Aerith: Aw, no. Look. Why's it always gotta be so tough? Lucky for me, you'll make this easier.
Dialogue: Aw, no. Look. Why's it always gotta be so tough? Lucky for me, you'll make this easier.

Original: Cloud: Yes, ma'am.
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am.

Original: Aerith: Well then, I'm gonna head down.
Dialogue: Well then, I'm gonna head down.

Original: Aerith: Okay, Cloud! Ready!
Dialogue: Okay, Cloud! Ready!

Original: Aerith: Hold on a second.
Dialogue: Hold on a second.

Original: Aerith: Gotcha!
Dialogue: Gotcha!

Original: Aerith: Okay, right there! Hold on while I drop the ladder!
Dialogue: Okay, right there! Hold on while I drop the ladder!

Original: Aerith: Cloud, over here!
Dialogue: Cloud, over here!

Original: Aerith: Whoa. Not too fast, okay?
Dialogue: Whoa. Not too fast, okay?

Original: Cloud: Got it.
Dialogue: Got it.

Original: Aerith: Well, jumping's not an option, that's for sure.
Dialogue: Well, jumping's not an option, that's for sure.

Original: Cloud: Look.
Dialogue: Look.

Original: Aerith: Someone made a campfire.
Dialogue: Someone made a campfire.

Original: Cloud: If they found a way down, so can we.
Dialogue: If they found a way down, so can we.

Original: Aerith: Anybody around?
Dialogue: Anybody around?

Original: Aerith: Guess it's just us.
Dialogue: Guess it's just us.

Original: Cloud: It's still warm.
Dialogue: It's still warm.

Original: Aerith: Should we relight it? Have our own campfire?
Dialogue: Should we relight it? Have our own campfire?

Original: Cloud: I need to get back. Besides
Dialogue: I need to get back. Besides—

Original: Beck: Lookie here, boys! Caught us some burglars!
Dialogue: Lookie here, boys! Caught us some burglars!

Original: Burke: Comin' into our homes and stealing out shitdoin' crimes!
Dialogue: Comin' into our homes and stealing out shit—doin' crimes!

Original: Beck: I'd say we're owed "compensatory damages"!
Dialogue: I'd say we're owed "compensatory damages"!

Original: Butch: (laughs) Yeah! Complementaryuh, composite Uh, I don't get it.
Dialogue: (laughs) Yeah! Complementary—uh, composite— Uh, I don't get it.

Original: Beck: How stupid can you be? It's crazy simple! Compensatory damages is like, uh... It's like...compensation... For damages!
Dialogue: How stupid can you be? It's crazy simple! Compensatory damages is like, uh... It's like...compensation... For damages!

Original: Burke: Oh yeah! (laughs) That's what you get when you...no, when somebody else! Uh...
Dialogue: Oh yeah! (laughs) That's what you get when you...no, when somebody else! Uh...

Original: Cloud: We haven't done anything wrong.
Dialogue: We haven't done anything wrong.

Original: Aerith: Yeah. We were just passing through.
Dialogue: Yeah. We were just passing through.

Original: Burke: Ohhh? A likely story.
Dialogue: Ohhh? A likely story.

Original: Aerith: Okay, what do you want?
Dialogue: Okay, what do you want?

Original: Beck: Nothing but our due recompensethat's all!
Dialogue: Nothing but our due recompense—that's all!

Original: Burke: Due recompense! Due recompense!
Dialogue: Due recompense! Due recompense!

Original: Butch: Wait...what? Due wreck-em-pants!?
Dialogue: Wait...what? Due wreck-em-pants!?

Original: Beck: No, shit-for-brains! "Due recompense"! It's like...uh... It's like...uh... Compensatory damages!
Dialogue: No, shit-for-brains! "Due recompense"! It's like...uh... It's like...uh... Compensatory damages!

Original: Butch: Oh! So damage is recompense! I get it!
Dialogue: Oh! So damage is recompense! I get it!

Original: Beck: Simple as that!
Dialogue: Simple as that!

Original: Aerith: I think we've heard enough.
Dialogue: I think we've heard enough.

Original: Beck: Okay, guys. Whatever you do...don't move...
Dialogue: Okay, guys. Whatever you do...don't move...

Original: Burke: Don't look... Just don't look...
Dialogue: Don't look... Just don't look...

Original: Butch: I'm dead... I'm super dead...
Dialogue: I'm dead... I'm super dead...

Original: Beck: Shit! Let's get the hell outta here!
Dialogue: Shit! Let's get the hell outta here!

Original: Butch: Wait, you guys! Don't leave me! I'm coming!
Dialogue: Wait, you guys! Don't leave me! I'm coming!

Original: Aerith: Random question, but...why did you quit being a SOLDIER?
Dialogue: Random question, but...why did you quit being a SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud: That is random.
Dialogue: That is random.

Original: Aerith: You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.
Dialogue: You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.

Original: Aerith: Um, did you have any SOLDIER friends? Any war buddies?
Dialogue: Um, did you have any SOLDIER friends? Any war buddies?

Original: Cloud: No...not really.
Dialogue: No...not really.

Original: Aerith: Oh, okay.
Dialogue: Oh, okay.

Original: Bandit (1): Huh!? What we got here?
Dialogue: Huh!? What we got here?

Original: Bandit (2): Fresh meat to test our new toy on, that's what!
Dialogue: Fresh meat to test our new toy on, that's what!

Original: Aerith: Stupid ladders. Always out of reach... Okay Cloud, heading down. You're in charge of the arm, got it?
Dialogue: Stupid ladders. Always out of reach... Okay Cloud, heading down. You're in charge of the arm, got it?

Original: Aerith: Gotcha.
Dialogue: Gotcha.

Original: Aerith: Cloud?!
Dialogue: Cloud?!

Original: Aerith: That went pretty well.
Dialogue: That went pretty well.

Original: Cloud: Sure did.
Dialogue: Sure did.

Original: Aerith: Hm? Wait a minute, did you just...?
Dialogue: Hm? Wait a minute, did you just...?

Original: Cloud: Nope.
Dialogue: Nope.

Original: Aerith: Don't worry, we'll be on the same page next time.
Dialogue: Don't worry, we'll be on the same page next time.

Original: Cloud: What are you talking about?
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Original: Aerith: I'm sorry, okay!
Dialogue: I'm sorry, okay!

Original: Bandit (1): Hold it right there, lovebirds!
Dialogue: Hold it right there, lovebirds!

Original: Bandit (2): You wanna pass through our territory, then you gotta pay the toll!
Dialogue: You wanna pass through our territory, then you gotta pay the toll!

Original: Aerith: We made it! Smell the fresh air?
Dialogue: We made it! Smell the fresh air?

Original: Aerith: Cloud. Up top.
Dialogue: Cloud. Up top.

Original: On-screen: Sector 6 Slums - Evergreen Park.
Dialogue: Sector 6 Slums - Evergreen Park.

Original: Aerith: Alright, there it is. The gate to Sector 7.
Dialogue: Alright, there it is. The gate to Sector 7.

Original: Cloud: Looks shut. How do we open it?
Dialogue: Looks shut. How do we open it?

Original: Aerith: More importantly, how about we take a break? Sound good?
Dialogue: More importantly, how about we take a break? Sound good?

Original: Cloud: No. I don't have time for
Dialogue: No. I don't have time for—

Original: Aerith: Up there looks nice.
Dialogue: Up there looks nice.

Original: Aerith: C'mon!
Dialogue: C'mon!

Original: Aerith: You know, a long time ago, I used to sell flowers here.
Dialogue: You know, a long time ago, I used to sell flowers here.

Original: Cloud: Oh yeah?
Dialogue: Oh yeah?

Original: Aerith: So, Cloud... You were a SOLDIER: First Class, right?
Dialogue: So, Cloud... You were a SOLDIER First Class, right?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Aerith: Weird.
Dialogue: Weird.

Original: Cloud: Really? What's weird about it?
Dialogue: Really? What's weird about it?

Original: Aerith: Nothing. Just that you were the same rank.
Dialogue: Nothing. Just that you were the same rank.

Original: Cloud: As who?
Dialogue: As who?

Original: Aerith: The first guy I ever loved.
Dialogue: The first guy I ever loved.

Original: Cloud: What's his name? I probably know him.
Dialogue: What's his name? I probably know him.

Original: Aerith: Are you okay?
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Original: Aerith: Wow... Your eyes.
Dialogue: Wow... Your eyes.

Original: Cloud': Oh. It's 'cause of the mako. All SOLDIERs have 'em.
Dialogue: Oh. It's 'cause of the mako. All SOLDIERs have 'em.

Original: Aerith: Yeah... I know. Sorry, I'm bumming you out. We should go.
Dialogue: Yeah... I know. Sorry, I'm bumming you out. We should go.

Original: Aerith: Gotta look forward, not back.
Dialogue: Gotta look forward, not back.

Original: Aerith: Here. This won't take long.
Dialogue: Here. This won't take long.

Original: Aerith: Ready! Wanna get to Sector 7 in style? This is the passageway for you.
Dialogue: Ready! Wanna get to Sector 7 in style? This is the passageway for you.

Original: Cloud & Aerith: So...
Dialogue: So...

Original: Aerith: (chuckles) Go ahead.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Go ahead.

Original: Cloud: You gonna be okay getting home?
Dialogue: You gonna be okay getting home?

Original: Aerith: And if I said I wasn't?
Dialogue: And if I said I wasn't?

Original: Cloud: I'll go with you.
Dialogue: I'll go with you.

Original: Aerith: Thought you needed to get back? (chuckles) Don't worry. I have a backup route for emergencies. And it's safer too.
Dialogue: Thought you needed to get back? (chuckles) Don't worry. I have a backup route for emergencies. And it's safer too.

Original: Aerith: Guess this is it, then. Ready?
Dialogue: Guess this is it, then. Ready?

Original: On-screen: Head to the Sector 7 slums?
Dialogue: Head to the Sector 7 slums?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Cloud: No.
Dialogue: No.

Original: Aerith: Aww, you big softie. Gonna miss me?
Dialogue: Aww, you big softie. Gonna miss me?

Original: Aerith: Shall we?
Dialogue: Shall we?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Cloud: No...
Dialogue: No...

Original: Aerith: Nothing wrong with taking a little break.
Dialogue: Nothing wrong with taking a little break.

Original: Cloud: Tifa!?
Dialogue: Tifa!?

Original: Tifa: Cloud! You're alive! I thought we'd lost you!
Dialogue: Cloud! You're alive! I thought we'd lost you!

Original: Cloud: What's going on?
Dialogue: What's going on?

Original: Tifa: Shh. I'll explain everything later. But now, I'm on my way to see Don Corneo. You should head back to Seventh Heaven, meet up with the gang.
Dialogue: Shh. I'll explain everything later. But now, I'm on my way to see Don Corneo. You should head back to Seventh Heaven, meet up with the gang.

Original: Cloud: But
Dialogue: But—

Original: Tifa: I'll be fine. You've seen how much ass I can kick.
Dialogue: I'll be fine. You've seen how much ass I can kick.

Original: Cloud: I have...
Dialogue: I have...

Original: Aerith: Oh no you don't. You're going after her.
Dialogue: Oh no you don't. You're going after her.

Original: Cloud: She's a big girl. She can handle the likes of him. And worse.
Dialogue: She's a big girl. She can handle the likes of him. And worse.

Original: Aerith: Uh-uh. You don't know Corneo. It doesn't matter how strong or smart you think you are. He'll find a way to turn it against you. And where's she going to meet him? A mansion filled with his goons. Come on. Aren't you worried what might happen in there? You have to help her!
Dialogue: Uh-uh. You don't know Corneo. It doesn't matter how strong or smart you think you are. He'll find a way to turn it against you. And where's she going to meet him? A mansion filled with his goons. Come on. Aren't you worried what might happen in there? You have to help her!

Original: Aerith: Come on!
Dialogue: Come on!

Original: Cloud: 'Kay.
Dialogue: Kay.

Original: Aerith: Come on, Cloud. We gotta hurry!
Dialogue: Come on, Cloud. We gotta hurry!

Original: Stablehand: Hey there! Where you headed?
Dialogue: Hey there! Where you headed?

Original: Aerith: You gave a ride to a girl earlier. Do you have any idea where she went?
Dialogue: You gave a ride to a girl earlier. Do you have any idea where she went?

Original: Stablehand: No, and if you don't need a ride, then get the hell outta here. Can't you see I'm trying to work?
Dialogue: No, and if you don't need a ride, then get the hell outta here. Can't you see I'm trying to work?

Original: Cloud: Can't say I can, no.
Dialogue: Can't say I can, no.

Original: Stablehand: What'd you say to me, you little
Dialogue: What'd you say to me, you little—

Original: Sam: What's all the ruckus out here? Hmm... I don't know you. What's your story?
Dialogue: What's all the ruckus out here? Hmm... I don't know you. What's your story?

Original: Aerith: We're looking for a girl who took one of your carriages. Can you help us find her?
Dialogue: We're looking for a girl who took one of your carriages. Can you help us find her?

Original: Sam: Depends. What d'you want with this girl of yours?
Dialogue: Depends. What d'you want with this girl of yours?

Original: Cloud: Guess. We want to save
Dialogue: Guess. We want to save—

Original: Aerith: Save her from a life without this handsome guy!
Dialogue: Save her from a life without this handsome guy!

Original: Sam: So that's how it is, huh? Well, I get a lotta customers. Hard to keep track of 'em all. This girl, what's she look like?
Dialogue: So that's how it is, huh? Well, I get a lotta customers. Hard to keep track of 'em all. This girl, what's she look like?

Original: Cloud: Well...
Dialogue: Well...

Original: On-screen: The girl we're looking for...
Dialogue: The girl we're looking for...

Original: Cloud: She's in great shape.
Dialogue: She's in great shape.

Original: Aerith: Is that really important?
Dialogue: Is that really important?

Original: Cloud: Um...she's a great fighter.
Dialogue: Um...she's a great fighter.

Original: Aerith: I'm not sure that helps.
Dialogue: I'm not sure that helps.

Original: Cloud: She's...great at handling the books.
Dialogue: She's...great at handling the books.

Original: Aerith: Cloud, I really don't think that'll help.
Dialogue: Cloud, I really don't think that'll help.

Original: Sam: Wait a minute, you talking about Tifa?
Dialogue: Wait a minute, you talking about Tifa?

Original: Cloud: That's her.
Dialogue: That's her.

Original: Sam: Oho, looks like someone's got a bit of a crush! Hate to break your heart, kid, but it's gonna be a long while before she sees the light of day again.
Dialogue: Oho, looks like someone's got a bit of a crush! Hate to break your heart, kid, but it's gonna be a long while before she sees the light of day again.

Original: Cloud: What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Sam: She's a real pretty girl. Corneo's hosting another audition, and Tifa was chosen as a candidate.
Dialogue: She's a real pretty girl. Corneo's hosting another audition, and Tifa was chosen as a candidate.

Original: Aerith: An audition for what?
Dialogue: An audition for what?

Original: Sam: For the title of the next Mrs. Corneo. She's what he likes, all rolled into one sweet package. Having scouted girls for so long, I know his tastes better than my own. And considering those tastes, I can guarantee you this: she won't be walking out of that mansion anytime soon...if at all.
Dialogue: For the title of the next Mrs. Corneo. She's what he likes, all rolled into one sweet package. Having scouted girls for so long, I know his tastes better than my own. And considering those tastes, I can guarantee you this she won't be walking out of that mansion anytime soon...if at all.

Original: Cloud: So where can we find this Don Corneo?
Dialogue: So where can we find this Don Corneo?

Original: Sam: What're you asking for? Thinking of raising holy hell or something? Do what you gotta, but leave me out of it. I told you what you wanna knownow take a walk.
Dialogue: What're you asking for? Thinking of raising holy hell or something? Do what you gotta, but leave me out of it. I told you what you wanna know—now take a walk.

Original: Aerith: And there goes our best lead yet. Maybe we'll have better luck in town. Let's check it out.
Dialogue: And there goes our best lead yet. Maybe we'll have better luck in town. Let's check it out.

Original: On-screen: Wall Market
Dialogue: Wall Market

Original: Barker: Welcome to Wall Market, the pleasure capital of Midgar that's got everything for everybody! Couple, huh? S'all good! Play together, do your own thingearn a little scratch on the side, evenwhatever you're into, we got you. Got a special onetime limited offer
Dialogue: Welcome to Wall Market, the pleasure capital of Midgar that's got everything for everybody! Couple, huh? S'all good! Play together, do your own thing—earn a little scratch on the side, even—whatever you're into, we got you. Got a special onetime limited offer—

Original: Aerith: No, thank you! Come on, Cloudlet's go!
Dialogue: No, thank you! Come on, Cloud—let's go!

Original: Barker: You two! Yes, you! Do you have a place to stay this enchanted evening? We have the perfect room for a sweet-looking couple like you!
Dialogue: You two! Yes, you! Do you have a place to stay this enchanted evening? We have the perfect room for a sweet-looking couple like you!

Original: On-screen: Stay the night?
Dialogue: Stay the night?

Original: Cloud: ...No thanks.
Dialogue: ...No thanks.

Original: Aerith: But you thought about it, didn't you?
Dialogue: But you thought about it, didn't you?

Original: Cloud: How much?
Dialogue: How much?

Original: Aerith: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Cloud: Back off.
Dialogue: Back off.

Original: Aerith: Sorry. We're in a rush.
Dialogue: Sorry. We're in a rush.

Original: Barker: (laughs) Just give me a holler when you change your mind.
