Dialogue: (laughs) Just give me a holler when you change your mind.

Original: Innkeeper: Welcome. Are you in need of accommodations?
Dialogue: Welcome. Are you in need of accommodations?

Original: On-screen: Stay the night?
Dialogue: Stay the night?

Original: Innkeeper: Have a safe trip.
Dialogue: Have a safe trip.

Original: Aerith: Maybe it's broken?
Dialogue: Maybe it's broken?

Original: Pharmacist: Hey there. We're a pharmacy, but we stock other stuff too.
Dialogue: Hey there. We're a pharmacy, but we stock other stuff too.

Original: Pharmacist: Thanks a bunch.
Dialogue: Thanks a bunch.

Original: Restaurant Owner: Hey there, friend! Grab a seat, any that's open.
Dialogue: Hey there, friend! Grab a seat, any that's open.

Original: Restaurant Owner: So, what will it be?
Dialogue: So, what will it be?

Original: Materia Vendor: See the sign out front? All I got is materia.
Dialogue: See the sign out front? All I got is materia.

Original: Materia Vendor: Thanks, buddy.
Dialogue: Thanks, buddy.

Original: Chadley: Cloud! I will go wherever my research leads me, but the success of my endeavors rests entirely upon you. Your assistance would be much appreciated.
Dialogue: Cloud! I will go wherever my research leads me, but the success of my endeavors rests entirely upon you. Your assistance would be much appreciated.

Original: Chadley: Cloud, I've registered a new summons battle intel request. Please take a look. I need you to defeat the summoned entity so I can complete the materia.
Dialogue: Cloud, I've registered a new summons battle intel request. Please take a look. I need you to defeat the summoned entity so I can complete the materia.

Original: Chadley: Truly amazing work, Cloud! This is incontrovertible proof that the universe has a sense of humor. Now that you have a fun new partner in Fat Chocobo, you can work together to squash Shinra like a bug.
Dialogue: Truly amazing work, Cloud! This is incontrovertible proof that the universe has a sense of humor. Now that you have a fun new partner in Fat Chocobo, you can work together to squash Shinra like a bug.

Original: Cowgirl: I can't believe I bought the same disc twice. Excuse me, sir. If you like, you can have it.
Dialogue: I can't believe I bought the same disc twice. Excuse me, sir. If you like, you can have it.

Original: Cowgirl: Even if you love the artist, you don't need more than one copy.
Dialogue: Even if you love the artist, you don't need more than one copy.

Original: Ms. Folia: ...What?
Dialogue: ...What?

Original: Cloud: Aren't you that Leaf House
Dialogue: Aren't you that Leaf House—

Original: Ms. Folia: Hey! What the hell, merc!? Digging into people's personal affairs in this town is a huge no-no!
Dialogue: Hey! What the hell, merc!? Digging into people's personal affairs in this town is a huge no-no!

Original: Cloud: What are you doing here?
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Original: Ms. Folia: Well, if you must know...I've wanted to be a dancer ever since I was a little girl. I come here at night to live the dream. I'd appreciate it if you didn't tell the children, okay?
Dialogue: Well, if you must know...I've wanted to be a dancer ever since I was a little girl. I come here at night to live the dream. I'd appreciate it if you didn't tell the children, okay?

Original: Honeygirl: Um are you a customer? In case you can't tell, I'm on a break. If you're looking for a good time, I'm sure you can find it inside.
Dialogue: Um are you a customer? In case you can't tell, I'm on a break. If you're looking for a good time, I'm sure you can find it inside.

Original: Honeygirl: Sorry, buddy, but I'm on a break right now.
Dialogue: Sorry, buddy, but I'm on a break right now.

Original: Undercity Resident (1): Hey. You hear 'bout that real narrow street just over there...?
Dialogue: Hey. You hear 'bout that real narrow street just over there...?

Original: Undercity Resident (2): You're not still wasting your gil at the Honeybee Inn, are ya?
Dialogue: You're not still wasting your gil at the Honeybee Inn, are ya?

Original: Undercity Resident (1): You bet I am. Found me a secret route in, one nobody don't know about. Only trouble is, it's filled with drunks 'n' garbage!
Dialogue: You bet I am. Found me a secret route in, one nobody don't know about. Only trouble is, it's filled with drunks 'n' garbage!

Original: Man in Line: Shit! These are high stakes, man!
Dialogue: Shit! These are high stakes, man!

Original: Patient: I feel like shit.
Dialogue: I feel like shit.

Original: Singer: Thank you. I signed with Shinra Records a while back, but I'm still looking for my first big hit. It's been seven years now. Not easy, but you gotta do what you loveand I love to sing. This is a new song of mine. Maybe it'll be that number one.
Dialogue: Thank you. I signed with Shinra Records a while back, but I'm still looking for my first big hit. It's been seven years now. Not easy, but you gotta do what you love—and I love to sing. This is a new song of mine. Maybe it'll be that number one.

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Dig a hole and throw me in. I'm already dead.
Dialogue: Dig a hole and throw me in. I'm already dead.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Welcome to Wall Market's premier weapons shop!
Dialogue: Welcome to Wall Market's premier weapons shop!

Original: Aerith: Check it out! I think we might've found our man...and he's a gaudy one.
Dialogue: Check it out! I think we might've found our man...and he's a gaudy one.

Original: Cloud: Yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah...

Original: Leslie: Not so fast, buddy. Back it up. Got no need for pretty boys here.
Dialogue: Not so fast, buddy. Back it up. Got no need for pretty boys here.

Original: Cloud: We're looking for someone.
Dialogue: We're looking for someone.

Original: Leslie: Lemme guess. First time in Wall Market.
Dialogue: Lemme guess. First time in Wall Market.

Original: Cloud: Yeah, so?
Dialogue: Yeah, so?

Original: Leslie: So people can't just walk through the don's front door. Especially men.
Dialogue: So people can't just walk through the don's front door. Especially men.

Original: Aerith: How 'bout me, then? Can I go inside?
Dialogue: How 'bout me, then? Can I go inside?

Original: Leslie: Maybe, but you're gonna wish you didn't.
Dialogue: Maybe, but you're gonna wish you didn't.

Original: Corneo Lackey (1): Y'know, Leslie, she's kinda cute. Homely, but cute.
Dialogue: Y'know, Leslie, she's kinda cute. Homely, but cute.

Original: Aerith: Excuse you?
Dialogue: Excuse you?

Original: Leslie: "Kinda cute" is not gonna cut it.
Dialogue: "Kinda cute" is not gonna cut it.

Original: Aerith: Come on, can't you help us out?
Dialogue: Come on, can't you help us out?

Original: Leslie: Do you have any idea what you're getting yourself into?
Dialogue: Do you have any idea what you're getting yourself into?

Original: Cloud: Aerith.
Dialogue: Aerith.

Original: Corneo Lackey (2): Seriously, Les, she's not half bad! With a little work, I bet she'd clean up real nice.
Dialogue: Seriously, Les, she's not half bad! With a little work, I bet she'd clean up real nice.

Original: Aerith: Cloud...requesting permission to kill.
Dialogue: Cloud...requesting permission to kill.

Original: Cloud: Denied.
Dialogue: Denied.

Original: Leslie: If you're really sure you wanna join an audition, then you're gonna need to get official approval.
Dialogue: If you're really sure you wanna join an audition, then you're gonna need to get official approval.

Original: Aerith: And who can give us that?
Dialogue: And who can give us that?

Original: Leslie: The Triothe only ones in town who're considered authorities on Corneo's particular tastes. First, there's Chocobo Sam. And then there's Madam M, over at the massage parlor. Last but not least, there's the Honeybee Inn's Andrea Rhodea. They're an eccentric bunch, to put it mildly, and you should know they don't recommend just any girl stupid enough to come knocking.
Dialogue: The Trio—the only ones in town who're considered authorities on Corneo's particular tastes. First, there's Chocobo Sam. And then there's Madam M, over at the massage parlor. Last but not least, there's the Honeybee Inn's Andrea Rhodea. They're an eccentric bunch, to put it mildly, and you should know they don't recommend just any girl stupid enough to come knocking.

Original: Aerith: Hmm, duly noted. Thanks for the info. We'll be back soon.
Dialogue: Hmm, duly noted. Thanks for the info. We'll be back soon.

Original: Leslie: If you're hell-bent on getting in, then go bother the Trio.
Dialogue: If you're hell-bent on getting in, then go bother the Trio.

Original: Johnny: Warmth, relaxation, the sweet embrace of pretty ladies! That's what I need!
Dialogue: Warmth, relaxation, the sweet embrace of pretty ladies! That's what I need!

Original: Johnny: To enter, or not to enter.Thatis the question. Wherefore does this philosophical quandary torment me!? You totally get where I'm coming from, right?
Dialogue: To enter, or not to enter. That is the question. Wherefore does this philosophical quandary torment me!? You totally get where I'm coming from, right?

Original: On-screen: Agree with Johnny?
Dialogue: Agree with Johnny?

Original: Johnny: Hah! Iknewit! Let me guessafter you've had your fun, you fall into a spiral of shame and self-loathing. But it only lasts a moment, doesn't it? Next thing you know, you're right back here again... Huh? Gotta question for me?
Dialogue: Hah! I knew it! Let me guess—after you've had your fun, you fall into a spiral of shame and self-loathing. But it only lasts a moment, doesn't it? Next thing you know, you're right back here again... Huh? Gotta question for me?

Original: Johnny: Yeah, I should've figured. You're not the philosophical introspective type like me. That soft, naive face. I know your kind well, bro. You're just another musclehead who uses violence to work through your inner demons. It's sad, really. Huh? Yeah, what's up?
Dialogue: Yeah, I should've figured. You're not the philosophical introspective type like me. That soft, naive face. I know your kind well, bro. You're just another musclehead who uses violence to work through your inner demons. It's sad, really. Huh? Yeah, what's up?

Original: Cloud: Seen Tifa around?
Dialogue: Seen Tifa around?

Original: Johnny: Tifa? My love, my light!? Who are you, and how do you know her!? No, shut up. I don't care! Tifa's here? Why!? Tell me why! Oh god, no. I did this to her, didn't I. She came looking for me, to beg me not to leave her! Snap out of it, Johnny. Your Tifa needs you! TifaI'm coming, baby!
Dialogue: Tifa? My love, my light!? Who are you, and how do you know her!? No, shut up. I don't care! Tifa's here? Why!? Tell me why! Oh god, no. I did this to her, didn't I. She came looking for me, to beg me not to leave her! Snap out of it, Johnny. Your Tifa needs you! Tifa—I'm coming, baby!

Original: Aerith: Who was that...?
Dialogue: Who was that...?

Original: Cloud: Nobody you want or need to know.
Dialogue: Nobody you want or need to know.

Original: Cloud: Aerith. You sure about this?
Dialogue: Aerith. You sure about this?

Original: Aerith: If you've got any better ideas...
Dialogue: If you've got any better ideas...

Original: Cloud: Not really.
Dialogue: Not really.

Original: Johnny: So that's the way it is, hmmm? Tifa's been invited invited into the don's estate...
Dialogue: So that's the way it is, hmmm? Tifa's been invited invited into the don's estate...

Original: Aerith: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Johnny: But! To earn such a privilege, you must first win the approval of one of the Trio. Right? Meaning! I now know what I must do to save her! Stay strong, Tifa! Help is on the way! Johnny's comin', baby!
Dialogue: But! To earn such a privilege, you must first win the approval of one of the Trio. Right? Meaning! I now know what I must do to save her! Stay strong, Tifa! Help is on the way! Johnny's comin', baby!

Original: Aerith: Not the sharpest tool in the shed, is he?
Dialogue: Not the sharpest tool in the shed, is he?

Original: Cloud: Nope.
Dialogue: Nope.

Original: Johnny: What were you thinking!? Stupid, stupid, stupid! Crawl into a hole and die!
Dialogue: What were you thinking!? Stupid, stupid, stupid! Crawl into a hole and die!

Original: Sam: Not you two again. Told you once, I'll tell you a thousand timesgot nothin' for you. Now scram.
Dialogue: Not you two again. Told you once, I'll tell you a thousand times—got nothin' for you. Now scram.

Original: Aerith: Wait, hear us out. You're one of the Trio, right? I want you to get me into the audition.
Dialogue: Wait, hear us out. You're one of the Trio, right? I want you to get me into the audition.

Original: Sam: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Aerith: Pretty please?
Dialogue: Pretty please?

Original: Sam: Why not.
Dialogue: Why not.

Original: Aerith: Really!?
Dialogue: Really!?

Original: Sam: Sure. Next time an audition comes round, I'll put your name in the hat.
Dialogue: Sure. Next time an audition comes round, I'll put your name in the hat.

Original: Aerith: Next time will be too late. Can't you get me into this one?
Dialogue: Next time will be too late. Can't you get me into this one?

Original: Sam: You want in now? No can do, sweetheart. I already recommended Tifa, and she's got this in the bag.
Dialogue: You want in now? No can do, sweetheart. I already recommended Tifa, and she's got this in the bag.

Original: Aerith: How can you be so sure Corneo will pick Tifa? You never know. He might pick me.
Dialogue: How can you be so sure Corneo will pick Tifa? You never know. He might pick me.

Original: Sam: Damn, you really do want in, don't you?
Dialogue: Damn, you really do want in, don't you?

Original: Aerith: Sure do!
Dialogue: Sure do!

Original: Sam: Then how's about we play for it? Call it, missy. Heads or tails. Guess right, and I'll grant you your wish. Guess wrong, and you'll leave me in peace.
Dialogue: Then how's about we play for it? Call it, missy. Heads or tails. Guess right, and I'll grant you your wish. Guess wrong, and you'll leave me in peace.

Original: On-screen: Heads or tails?
Dialogue: Heads or tails?

Original: Cloud: Heads.
Dialogue: Heads.

Original: Sam: Tails. You lose.
Dialogue: Tails. You lose.

Original: Cloud: Tails.
Dialogue: Tails.

Original: Sam: Heads. You lose.
Dialogue: Heads. You lose.

Original: Cloud: No thanks.
Dialogue: No thanks.

Original: Sam: Oh? Not a gambler, huh?
Dialogue: Oh? Not a gambler, huh?

Original: Aerith: I am! Heads!
Dialogue: I am! Heads!

Original: Sam: Tails. You lose.
Dialogue: Tails. You lose.

Original: Sam: Hey, don't look so glum. You're a pretty enough gal, just...not quite Corneo's cup of tea. But if only the don will do, try convincing one of the other two. That's why it's a Trio, and not just the me-oh. Now skedaddle.
Dialogue: Hey, don't look so glum. You're a pretty enough gal, just...not quite Corneo's cup of tea. But if only the don will do, try convincing one of the other two. That's why it's a Trio, and not just the me-oh. Now skedaddle.

Original: Cloud: Wait. Mind if I see that coin of yours?
Dialogue: Wait. Mind if I see that coin of yours?

Original: Cloud: Trick coin. I had a hunch.
Dialogue: Trick coin. I had a hunch.

Original: Aerith: That's cheating!
Dialogue: That's cheating!

Original: Cloud: And that's the Wall Market way. Lesson learned.
Dialogue: And that's the Wall Market way. Lesson learned.

Original: Aerith: Still cheating.
Dialogue: Still cheating.

Original: Johnny: Damn, man... It wasn't supposed to go down like this. I-I just wanted to see Andrea. Curse my weak will... But... It was like whoa...
Dialogue: Damn, man... It wasn't supposed to go down like this. I-I just wanted to see Andrea. Curse my weak will... But... It was like whoa...

Original: Cloud: This the place?
Dialogue: This the place?

Original: Aerith: Think so.
Dialogue: Think so.

Original: Cloud: Lemme handle this. You wait out here, okay?
Dialogue: Lemme handle this. You wait out here, okay?

Original: Aerith: And why would I do that? No, I'm coming with.
Dialogue: And why would I do that? No, I'm coming with.

Original: Cloud: I'm not really sure that
Dialogue: I'm not really sure that—

Original: Aerith: You're a man of many talents, but "talking" isn't one of them.
Dialogue: You're a man of many talents, but "talking" isn't one of them.

Original: Johnny: I mean, shit...
Dialogue: I mean, shit...

Original: Aerith: Whoa... (chuckles)
Dialogue: Whoa... (chuckles)

Original: Receptionist: Good evening.
Dialogue: Good evening.

Original: Aerith: Heya.
Dialogue: Heya.

Original: Receptionist: Welcome to the heart and soul of Wall Marketthe Honeybee Inn. Is there a honeyboy or girl whose company you desire?
Dialogue: Welcome to the heart and soul of Wall Market—the Honeybee Inn. Is there a honeyboy or girl whose company you desire?

Original: Cloud: We're here to see Andrea Rhodea.
Dialogue: We're here to see Andrea Rhodea.

Original: Receptionist: Ahhh, the shining star of the Honeybee Inn. Now, are you the one who made the appointment, sir? Can I have your name?
Dialogue: Ahhh, the shining star of the Honeybee Inn. Now, are you the one who made the appointment, sir? Can I have your name?

Original: Cloud: Oh, we don't have an appointment.
Dialogue: Oh, we don't have an appointment.

Original: Receptionist: I see...I'm terribly sorry, sir. An appointment is required, and the earliest available slot is three years from now.
Dialogue: I see...I'm terribly sorry, sir. An appointment is required, and the earliest available slot is three years from now.

Original: Aerith: Three years!?
Dialogue: Three years!?

Original: Cloud: All we want is five minutes. He can spare that.
Dialogue: All we want is five minutes. He can spare that.

Original: Aerith: I need his help for the Corneo audition.
Dialogue: I need his help for the Corneo audition.

Original: Receptionist: Yes, well, regardless of the circumstances, you cannot meet him without an appointment.
Dialogue: Yes, well, regardless of the circumstances, you cannot meet him without an appointment.

Original: Aerith: Is there really no other way?
Dialogue: Is there really no other way?

Original: Receptionist: It is rare, but Mr. Rhodea does occasionally extend invitations to individuals who catch his eye. Otherwise, I'm sorry, but there really is nothing that can be done.
Dialogue: It is rare, but Mr. Rhodea does occasionally extend invitations to individuals who catch his eye. Otherwise, I'm sorry, but there really is nothing that can be done.

Original: Aerith: I guess that's that, then. Ah well. Let's try someone else.
Dialogue: I guess that's that, then. Ah well. Let's try someone else.

Original: Receptionist: I'm sorry that I couldn't be of more help to you.
Dialogue: I'm sorry that I couldn't be of more help to you.

Original: Aerith: I guess they're closed right now?
Dialogue: I guess they're closed right now?

Original: Johnny: The hell is this bullshit? I ain't payin' that much!
Dialogue: The hell is this bullshit? I ain't payin' that much!

Original: Madam M: Well this ain't a charityso if you don't have the gil to pay, then get the hell out!
Dialogue: Well this ain't a charity—so if you don't have the gil to pay, then get the hell out!

Original: Madam M: Welcome, welcome. Just the two of you? Step right up. Now then, what manner of massage do you desire?
Dialogue: Welcome, welcome. Just the two of you? Step right up. Now then, what manner of massage do you desire?

Original: Aerith: Say what?
Dialogue: Say what?

Original: Madam M: This your first time in our establishment? We are a hand-massage parlor. An excess of fatigue and tension can make even the simplest task a terrible strain. It is our pleasure to relieve our patrons of that tension. (chuckles) And what better way to seek relief than through the skilled ministrations of a professional? So now that we understand each other, what manner of massage do you desire?
Dialogue: This your first time in our establishment? We are a hand-massage parlor. An excess of fatigue and tension can make even the simplest task a terrible strain. It is our pleasure to relieve our patrons of that tension. (chuckles) And what better way to seek relief than through the skilled ministrations of a professional? So now that we understand each other, what manner of massage do you desire?

Original: Cloud: We're not customers.
Dialogue: We're not customers.

Original: Madam M: Then you are...?
Dialogue: Then you are...?

Original: Aerith: Hoping you can help us get an invite to an audition with Don C
Dialogue: Hoping you can help us get an invite to an audition with Don C—

Original: Madam M: Oh for the love of Say another word and I'll shove this fan right down your throat!
Dialogue: Oh for the love of— Say another word and I'll shove this fan right down your throat!

Original: Madam M: This is the last thing I need. You're young and stupid, and I suppose that means you think I'll let you off easy. So you want what? A favor? Well, here's the thing... This is a massage parlora respectable establishment. But if you don't require our services... Then tell me! Is there any reason I shouldn't have you dragged outside and shot for wasting my valuable time!? Well!?
Dialogue: This is the last thing I need. You're young and stupid, and I suppose that means you think I'll let you off easy. So you want what? A favor? Well, here's the thing... This is a massage parlor—a respectable establishment. But if you don't require our services... Then tell me! Is there any reason I shouldn't have you dragged outside and shot for wasting my valuable time!? Well!?

Original: Madam M: Hm. Name?
Dialogue: Hm. Name?

Original: Cloud: ...Cloud Strife.
Dialogue: ...Cloud Strife.

Original: Madam M: Hand.
Dialogue: Hand.

Original: Cloud: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Madam M: Give it to me!
Dialogue: Give it to me!

Original: Madam M: The strong, firm hands of a fighter...yet they possess a certain elegance and grace. Okay, Cloud. Let's see what you're made of. After that...we'll talk.
Dialogue: The strong, firm hands of a fighter...yet they possess a certain elegance and grace. Okay, Cloud. Let's see what you're made of. After that...we'll talk.

Original: Madam M: So. Which course will it be?
Dialogue: So. Which course will it be?

Original: On-screen: Choose which course?
Dialogue: Choose which course?

Original: Madam M: Hmph! If you're not a customer, then get out.
Dialogue: Hmph! If you're not a customer, then get out.

Original: Madam M: Ready to take the plunge, are we.
Dialogue: Ready to take the plunge, are we.

Original: Madam M: Hey! You don't have enough for that. Why don't you choose a course you can actually afford?
Dialogue: Hey! You don't have enough for that. Why don't you choose a course you can actually afford?

Original: Madam M: (chuckles) Then make your way to the room in the back...and wait.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Then make your way to the room in the back...and wait.

Original: Aerith: Cloud...
Dialogue: Cloud...

Original: Madam M: This exclusive treatment is reserved for our most well-to-do patrons... First...the hand cream... A generous coating for each and every one of your richly deserving fingers...
Dialogue: This exclusive treatment is reserved for our most well-to-do patrons... First...the hand cream... A generous coating for each and every one of your richly deserving fingers...

Original: Madam M: Let's start...with the tips... That's it. Relax. I'm only here to help.
Dialogue: Let's start...with the tips... That's it. Relax. I'm only here to help.

Original: Madam M: Oh? Did that hurt?
Dialogue: Oh? Did that hurt?

Original: Cloud: No...
Dialogue: No...

Original: Madam M: Then I'll move on...to the base of the fingers... Let's see if we can't improve your circulation. Get that blood flowing.
Dialogue: Then I'll move on...to the base of the fingers... Let's see if we can't improve your circulation. Get that blood flowing.

Original: Madam M: No, don't fight it. Stress is poison to the body. And finally...some gentle simulation for the palm. No more than a touch. Just like this.
Dialogue: No, don't fight it. Stress is poison to the body. And finally...some gentle simulation for the palm. No more than a touch. Just like this.

Original: Madam M: Oh? What was that? A cry of pleasure? Is this how you like it? How about this? Or maybe this?
Dialogue: Oh? What was that? A cry of pleasure? Is this how you like it? How about this? Or maybe this?

Original: Madam M: If that was to your liking, do come again.
Dialogue: If that was to your liking, do come again.

Original: Cloud: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Madam M: Well then. It should go without saying that you get what you pay for. All four fingers at once. Quick and to the point.
Dialogue: Well then. It should go without saying that you get what you pay for. All four fingers at once. Quick and to the point.

Original: Cloud: Little rough.
Dialogue: Little rough.

Original: Madam M: Hm? I can stop at any time if it's too much to handle.
Dialogue: Hm? I can stop at any time if it's too much to handle.

Original: Madam M: Try flexing the muscles. You'll feel the difference.
Dialogue: Try flexing the muscles. You'll feel the difference.

Original: Madam M: Loose and limber. Am I right?
Dialogue: Loose and limber. Am I right?

Original: Cloud: Actually... Yeah...
Dialogue: Actually... Yeah...

Original: Madam M: I should warn you. This technique has certain risks. It's somewhat...experimental. You may find it extremely pleasurable and rewarding. Or the opposite.
Dialogue: I should warn you. This technique has certain risks. It's somewhat...experimental. You may find it extremely pleasurable and rewarding. Or the opposite.

Original: Cloud: Wait!
Dialogue: Wait!

Original: Madam M: Absolutely not. You asked for this, now take it like a man!
Dialogue: Absolutely not. You asked for this, now take it like a man!

Original: Cloud: Everything...hurts...
Dialogue: Everything...hurts...

Original: Aerith: How was it?
Dialogue: How was it?

Original: Cloud: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Aerith: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Cloud: Yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah...

Original: Aerith: You're acting weird, Cloud.
Dialogue: You're acting weird, Cloud.

Original: Cloud: I am?
Dialogue: I am?

Original: Aerith: Really weird.
Dialogue: Really weird.

Original: Cloud: S'alright, I guess.
Dialogue: S'alright, I guess.

Original: Aerith: What are you doing?
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Original: Cloud: Flexing.
Dialogue: Flexing.

Original: Aerith: Flex-ing...?
Dialogue: Flex-ing...?

Original: Cloud: Uh... Never mind.
Dialogue: Uh... Never mind.

Original: Cloud: Not now. Maybe not ever.
Dialogue: Not now. Maybe not ever.

Original: Aerith: Did something happen to you in there?
Dialogue: Did something happen to you in there?

Original: Cloud: Just...just give me a sec.
Dialogue: Just...just give me a sec.

Original: Aerith: Just one?
Dialogue: Just one?

Original: Cloud: Maybe a few minutes.
Dialogue: Maybe a few minutes.

Original: Madam M: Think you'll make a habit of it?
Dialogue: Think you'll make a habit of it?

Original: Madam M: All right then. I think I've seen everything I need to see.
Dialogue: All right then. I think I've seen everything I need to see.

Original: Aerith: So...
Dialogue: So...

Original: Madam M: Tell me what you want and we'll take it from there.
Dialogue: Tell me what you want and we'll take it from there.

Original: Aerith: You're one of the Trio, right? I want to get into Corneo's next audition.
Dialogue: You're one of the Trio, right? I want to get into Corneo's next audition.

Original: Madam M: And why in the world would you want to do that? Hmmm... Okay.
Dialogue: And why in the world would you want to do that? Hmmm... Okay.

Original: Aerith: Really!?
Dialogue: Really!?

Original: Madam M: But. You cannot go dressed like that.
Dialogue: But. You cannot go dressed like that.

Original: Aerith: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Madam M: I could never send Corneo a candidate wearing such a plain-looking getup. Doing so would call my position as one of the Trio into question.
Dialogue: I could never send Corneo a candidate wearing such a plain-looking getup. Doing so would call my position as one of the Trio into question.

Original: Aerith: Is something wrong with my outfit?
Dialogue: Is something wrong with my outfit?

Original: On-screen: How is Aerith's outfit?
Dialogue: How is Aerith's outfit?

Original: Cloud: It's alright, I guess.
Dialogue: It's alright, I guess.

Original: Aerith: (chuckles) Oh, you.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Oh, you.

Original: Cloud: It's comfortable, isn't it?
Dialogue: It's comfortable, isn't it?

Original: Aerith: Cloud, the fashion critic.
Dialogue: Cloud, the fashion critic.

Original: Cloud: It matter what I think?
Dialogue: It matter what I think?

Original: Aerith: Well I think it's pretty cool.
Dialogue: Well I think it's pretty cool.

Original: Madam M: Look, just...take it outside the parlor, would you?
Dialogue: Look, just...take it outside the parlor, would you?

Original: Aerith: Sorry, we'll stop. So...what should I do about the outfit?
Dialogue: Sorry, we'll stop. So...what should I do about the outfit?

Original: Madam M: You just leave that to me. I'll put you in a dress so fabulous, you'll look like a million gil. So long as you can afford it.
Dialogue: You just leave that to me. I'll put you in a dress so fabulous, you'll look like a million gil. So long as you can afford it.

Original: Cloud: How much?
Dialogue: How much?

Original: Madam M: What I said. But don't worry. It's obvious you can't afford a dress with that kind of price tag. So listen. I have an idea. There's an underground colosseum in this town. Up for a fight, Cloud? Good, because I'm getting you into that arena. If you win the tournament, I'll transform Aerith into a drop-dead gorgeous beauty.
Dialogue: What I said. But don't worry. It's obvious you can't afford a dress with that kind of price tag. So listen. I have an idea. There's an underground colosseum in this town. Up for a fight, Cloud? Good, because I'm getting you into that arena. If you win the tournament, I'll transform Aerith into a drop-dead gorgeous beauty.

Original: Cloud: There any prize money?
Dialogue: There any prize money?

Original: Madam M: Yesfor the person who got you in. So? What do you say?
Dialogue: Yes—for the person who got you in. So? What do you say?

Original: Cloud: All right.
Dialogue: All right.

Original: Madam M: That's what I like to hear. You'll need this. They're already letting fighters inside. You should hurry, run along.
Dialogue: That's what I like to hear. You'll need this. They're already letting fighters inside. You should hurry, run along.

Original: Madam M: Remember: you are going to win me that money.
Dialogue: Remember you are going to win me that money.

Original: Aerith: What have we gotten ourselves into?
Dialogue: What have we gotten ourselves into?

Original: Cloud: Nothing good. I wouldn't expect a fair fight in this town...
Dialogue: Nothing good. I wouldn't expect a fair fight in this town...

Original: Aerith: Think we can win it all?
Dialogue: Think we can win it all?

Original: Cloud: That's one thing I'm definitely sure of.
Dialogue: That's one thing I'm definitely sure of.

Original: Aerith: I appreciate the confidence, just...don't get too cocky, okay?
Dialogue: I appreciate the confidence, just...don't get too cocky, okay?

Original: Staff: Spectators, please enter from the right, and contenders from the left.
Dialogue: Spectators, please enter from the right, and contenders from the left.

Original: Johnny's Father: Wall Market really is one helluva town, isn't it? I'm sure my son Johnny learned a lot of lessons about life right here. The hard way, of course. Oh, my beautiful boy! As your father, and as someone who's been where you are, I look forward to seeing the man you become.
Dialogue: Wall Market really is one helluva town, isn't it? I'm sure my son Johnny learned a lot of lessons about life right here. The hard way, of course. Oh, my beautiful boy! As your father, and as someone who's been where you are, I look forward to seeing the man you become.

Original: Johnny's Father: I heard there was some sort of tournament going on. That must be why it's so crowded. It almost made me miss a chance to get a ticket to my favorite place. What's that? Oh, I could never tell!
Dialogue: I heard there was some sort of tournament going on. That must be why it's so crowded. It almost made me miss a chance to get a ticket to my favorite place. What's that? Oh, I could never tell!

Original: Staff: What's this? You're here to compete? I hope you know you're cutting it really close. Sothe two of you are a team?
Dialogue: What's this? You're here to compete? I hope you know you're cutting it really close. So—the two of you are a team?

Original: Cloud: Team? No, it's just me
Dialogue: Team? No, it's just me—

Original: Aerith: Yes! The two of us are a team!
Dialogue: Yes! The two of us are a team!

Original: Aerith: I need to get into that audition, but I won't let anyone else fight my battles for me. That includes you, mister.
Dialogue: I need to get into that audition, but I won't let anyone else fight my battles for me. That includes you, mister.

Original: Staff: All right, team it is. Head to the waiting area down below.
Dialogue: All right, team it is. Head to the waiting area down below.

Original: Staff: You need to take the elevator down. Don't keep 'em waiting.
Dialogue: You need to take the elevator down. Don't keep 'em waiting.

Original: Aerith: Down, down, down we go.
Dialogue: Down, down, down we go.

Original: Aerith: So how deep does this thing go, you think?
Dialogue: So how deep does this thing go, you think?

Original: Aerith: I wonder how many people are fighting.
Dialogue: I wonder how many people are fighting.

Original: Aerith: Hey, you're not nervous, are you?
Dialogue: Hey, you're not nervous, are you?

Original: Cloud: Nope.
Dialogue: Nope.

Original: Aerith: Really? You're even more quiet than usual.
Dialogue: Really? You're even more quiet than usual.

Original: Cloud: Just trying to focus. Like you should.
Dialogue: Just trying to focus. Like you should.

Original: Staff: Hey, lovebirds! Over here!
Dialogue: Hey, lovebirds! Over here!

Original: Scotch: In the city that never sleeps!
Dialogue: In the city that never sleeps!

Original: Kotch: In the paradise of debauchery and sinof pain and pleasure!
Dialogue: In the paradise of debauchery and sin—of pain and pleasure!

Original: Scotch: Where your every desire can be indulged for the right priceWall Market!
Dialogue: Where your every desire can be indulged for the right price—Wall Market!

Original: Kotch: To you esteemed connoisseurs of chaos and bloodshedwe bid you the warmest of welcomes!
Dialogue: To you esteemed connoisseurs of chaos and bloodshed—we bid you the warmest of welcomes!

Original: Scotch: Are you sitting comfortably? For tonight, the most gruesome spectacle anywhere in Wall Market or beyond shall be yours to witness! Here in the Corneo Colosseum!
Dialogue: Are you sitting comfortably? For tonight, the most gruesome spectacle anywhere in Wall Market or beyond shall be yours to witness! Here in the Corneo Colosseum!

Original: Kotch: Tonight's grand prize is no less than one million gil! And there is only one way to get it: brutalize your opponent!
Dialogue: Tonight's grand prize is no less than one million gil! And there is only one way to get it brutalize your opponent!

Original: Scotch: Thoroughly and utterly!
Dialogue: Thoroughly and utterly!

Original: Kotch: Viciously!
Dialogue: Viciously!

Original: Scotch: Without mercy!
Dialogue: Without mercy!

Original: Kotch: Until they vomit blood!
Dialogue: Until they vomit blood!

Original: Scotch: Only the most ruthless fighters
Dialogue: Only the most ruthless fighters—

Original: Kotch: The savages still standing here at the end
Dialogue: The savages still standing here at the end—

Original: Scotch: Shall claim the gil and the glory!
Dialogue: Shall claim the gil and the glory!

Original: Kotch: And now, the long-awaited event in which the blood-starved beasts will battle for your amusement is upon us!
Dialogue: And now, the long-awaited event in which the blood-starved beasts will battle for your amusement is upon us!

Original: Scotch: Warriors of every shape and size will fight to the death before your very eyes! In tonight's Corneooo Cuuup!
Dialogue: Warriors of every shape and size will fight to the death before your very eyes! In tonight's Corneooo Cuuup!

Original: Aerith: Wow, this place is really something.
Dialogue: Wow, this place is really something.

Original: Staff: You twowait here until it's time.
Dialogue: You two—wait here until it's time.

Original: Gatekeeper: Uh, it's not your turn yet. Your names will be announced over the speaker. Just wait until then.
Dialogue: Uh, it's not your turn yet. Your names will be announced over the speaker. Just wait until then.

Original: Johnny: Oh... You again.
Dialogue: Oh... You again.

Original: Aerith: Ouch! What happened to your face?
Dialogue: Ouch! What happened to your face?

Original: Johnny: I just needed a little scratch, you know? So I signed up for the preliminaries, and well... I hope you guys realize what you're getting into. I don't wanna scare you but if you can make a run for it, you should.
Dialogue: I just needed a little scratch, you know? So I signed up for the preliminaries, and well... I hope you guys realize what you're getting into. I don't wanna scare you but if you can make a run for it, you should.

Original: Announcer: Cloud and Aerith. Your match will begin shortly. Please make your way to the gate.
Dialogue: Cloud and Aerith. Your match will begin shortly. Please make your way to the gate.

Original: Aerith: We're in way too deep to back out now.
Dialogue: We're in way too deep to back out now.

Original: Johnny: Never been more scared in my entire life.
Dialogue: Never been more scared in my entire life.

Original: Johnny: It's a gift from Don Corneo. Drink it, and they say you'll be raring to go for hours on end. If I had, maybe things would've gone differently for me. Maybe you should. It's yours if you want.
Dialogue: It's a gift from Don Corneo. Drink it, and they say you'll be raring to go for hours on end. If I had, maybe things would've gone differently for me. Maybe you should. It's yours if you want.

Original: On-screen: Taste mystery drink?
Dialogue: Taste mystery drink?

Original: Aerith: How is it?
Dialogue: How is it?

Original: Cloud: It's thick...
Dialogue: It's thick...

Original: Aerith: But you...like it so much you couldn't possibly share, right?
Dialogue: But you...like it so much you couldn't possibly share, right?

Original: Gatekeeper: You two ready?
Dialogue: You two ready?

Original: On-screen: Participate in the first round?
Dialogue: Participate in the first round?

Original: Gatekeeper: Come on! Hurry it up!
Dialogue: Come on! Hurry it up!

Original: Gatekeeper: Try not to get yourselves killed.
Dialogue: Try not to get yourselves killed.

Original: Scotch: For our next match, we welcome two fightersa young couple, no less!
Dialogue: For our next match, we welcome two fighters—a young couple, no less!

Original: Kotch: Talk about a bad date!
Dialogue: Talk about a bad date!

Original: Scotch: This is their first tournmanet!
Dialogue: This is their first tournmanet!

Original: Kotch: A bad first date!
Dialogue: A bad first date!

Original: Scotch: And most likely their last, inexperienced as they areor are they!? Give it up for Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: And most likely their last, inexperienced as they are—or are they!? Give it up for Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Kotch: Booo! Get lost! Go home! You suck!
Dialogue: Booo! Get lost! Go home! You suck!

Original: Spectator (1): "Couple"!? Get outta here with that lovey-dovey bullshit!
Dialogue: "Couple"!? Get outta here with that lovey-dovey bullshit!

Original: Spectator (2): 'Sup with the pole!? Gonna do a little dance for us, baby girl?
Dialogue: Sup with the pole!? Gonna do a little dance for us, baby girl?

Original: Aerith: Okay. Now I'm mad.
Dialogue: Okay. Now I'm mad.

Original: Kotch: Their opponentone of Wall Market's own, a renowned master of beasts! Will his pets make a meal of our two challenges before our very eyes?
Dialogue: Their opponent—one of Wall Market's own, a renowned master of beasts! Will his pets make a meal of our two challenges before our very eyes?

Original: Scotch: They've already been given their appetizer!
Dialogue: They've already been given their appetizer!

Original: Kotch: Their hunger for flesh and fear is unquenchablethe demon dogs of hell, the Sanguine Stalkers!
Dialogue: Their hunger for flesh and fear is unquenchable—the demon dogs of hell, the Sanguine Stalkers!

Original: Staff: No, please!
Dialogue: No, please!

Original: Beastmaster: Feast!
Dialogue: Feast!

Original: Aerith: You brought animals?
Dialogue: You brought animals?

Original: Beastmaster: Oh? First-timers, huh? There's no rule that says you gotta fight man-to-man.
Dialogue: Oh? First-timers, huh? There's no rule that says you gotta fight man-to-man.

Original: Scotch: We're in for a treat, ladies and gentlemen! Who will prevail in this brutal contest between man and beast!? This could be over in an instant, so don't even blink! Without further ado, the fourth match of the first round...begins now!
Dialogue: We're in for a treat, ladies and gentlemen! Who will prevail in this brutal contest between man and beast!? This could be over in an instant, so don't even blink! Without further ado, the fourth match of the first round...begins now!

Original: Scotch: Can you believe it!? I don't think anyone saw this coming!
Dialogue: Can you believe it!? I don't think anyone saw this coming!

Original: Kotch: What a completely unexpected turn of events!
Dialogue: What a completely unexpected turn of events!

Original: Scotch: And the winners of our match are...Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: And the winners of our match are...Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Announcer: Contenders, please return to your waiting room.
Dialogue: Contenders, please return to your waiting room.

Original: Aerith: Well that's one win down. Go team!
Dialogue: Well that's one win down. Go team!

Original: Aerith: What's wrong?
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Original: Cloud: The rules don't make sense.
Dialogue: The rules don't make sense.

Original: Aerith: Yeah, true. But maybe it'll be better in the next match?
Dialogue: Yeah, true. But maybe it'll be better in the next match?

Original: Cloud: Nah, wouldn't bet on it. Better to expect the worst.
Dialogue: Nah, wouldn't bet on it. Better to expect the worst.

Original: Announcer: Cloud and Aerith. Your match will begin shortly. Please make your way to the gate.
Dialogue: Cloud and Aerith. Your match will begin shortly. Please make your way to the gate.

Original: Gatekeeper: That's what they call beginner's luck. But the next match won't be so easy. Ready to rock?
Dialogue: That's what they call beginner's luck. But the next match won't be so easy. Ready to rock?

Original: On-screen: Participate in the semifinals?
Dialogue: Participate in the semifinals?

Original: Gatekeeper: You gonna take all day?
Dialogue: You gonna take all day?

Original: Gatekeeper: Ready to rock?
Dialogue: Ready to rock?

Original: Gatekeeper: Just remember: try not to die.
Dialogue: Just remember try not to die.

Original: Scotch: For the second match in our spectacular semifinals... Fresh from their first date with death, I present...the lucky couple!
Dialogue: For the second match in our spectacular semifinals... Fresh from their first date with death, I present...the lucky couple!

Original: Kotch: More like "unlucky" for the rest of us!
Dialogue: More like "unlucky" for the rest of us!

Original: Scotch: Give it up once again for Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: Give it up once again for Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Spectator (1): "Couple" my ass! The hell you two tryin' to pull!?
Dialogue: "Couple" my ass! The hell you two tryin' to pull!?

Original: Spectator (2): You assholes cost me a fortune!
Dialogue: You assholes cost me a fortune!

Original: Kotch: Their opponentsreavers of the scrapyard, thieves and killers through and through! Too criminal for common criminalsthe worst of the worst!
Dialogue: Their opponents—reavers of the scrapyard, thieves and killers through and through! Too criminal for common criminals—the worst of the worst!

Original: Scotch: Ladies and gentlemen, check your pockets, because they may have already robbed you blind!
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, check your pockets, because they may have already robbed you blind!

Original: Kotch: The most contemptible sons of bitches this side of Wall MarketBeck's Badasses!
Dialogue: The most contemptible sons of bitches this side of Wall Market—Beck's Badasses!

Original: Aerith: Hey, it's those guys.
Dialogue: Hey, it's those guys.

Original: Burke: Hey... It's those guys!
Dialogue: Hey... It's those guys!

Original: Beck: Well, hot damn! Been fixin' to feed you two your just desserts! So open wide, 'cause we're gonna serve up a heapin' helpin'!
Dialogue: Well, hot damn! Been fixin' to feed you two your just desserts! So open wide, 'cause we're gonna serve up a heapin' helpin'!

Original: Butch: Hey, what do "just desserts" taste like?
Dialogue: Hey, what do "just desserts" taste like?

Original: Beck: Likejustice! Likepayback!
Dialogue: Like justice! Like payback!

Original: Aerith: Huh? More of 'em?
Dialogue: Huh? More of 'em?

Original: Scotch: And who are these unscrupulous-looking gentlemen?
Dialogue: And who are these unscrupulous-looking gentlemen?

Original: Kotch: It would seem that there are actually eight members of Beck's Badasses!
Dialogue: It would seem that there are actually eight members of Beck's Badasses!

Original: Aerith: Hey! That's cheating!
Dialogue: Hey! That's cheating!

Original: Beck: The only rule here is that there are no rules! If Corneo says it's okay, then you gotta suck it up!
Dialogue: The only rule here is that there are no rules! If Corneo says it's okay, then you gotta suck it up!

Original: Kotch: The don has granted his approval!
Dialogue: The don has granted his approval!

Original: Aerith: This is ridiculous!
Dialogue: This is ridiculous!

Original: Kotch: The odds are overwhelmingly stacked against them!
Dialogue: The odds are overwhelmingly stacked against them!

Original: Scotch: This could be a real bloodbath! So I implore you, ladies and gentlemendon't look away, or you may miss the best part!
Dialogue: This could be a real bloodbath! So I implore you, ladies and gentlemen—don't look away, or you may miss the best part!

Original: Kotch: The second match of the Corneo Cup's semifinals...begins now!
Dialogue: The second match of the Corneo Cup's semifinals...begins now!

Original: Kotch: Un-freaking-believable! What the hell did I just see!?
Dialogue: Un-freaking-believable! What the hell did I just see!?

Original: Scotch: It was two against, uh, I don't remember who many exactly, but a lot! But somehow, the winners of our match are... Once again! Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: It was two against, uh, I don't remember who many exactly, but a lot! But somehow, the winners of our match are... Once again! Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Sam: That kid's really something.
Dialogue: That kid's really something.

Original: Madam M: Well, of course he is. I did give him a massage you know. His palm told quite the tale. He's cheated death more than a few times...
Dialogue: Well, of course he is. I did give him a massage you know. His palm told quite the tale. He's cheated death more than a few times...

Original: Sam: So have half the people in this town. Anyway, we're both still alive. Call it?
Dialogue: So have half the people in this town. Anyway, we're both still alive. Call it?

Original: Madam M: There you go again. One of these days your "luck" is going to run out.
Dialogue: There you go again. One of these days your "luck" is going to run out.

Original: Sam: When I fall from grace, maybe I'll land in your parlor once more.
Dialogue: When I fall from grace, maybe I'll land in your parlor once more.

Original: Madam M: That is one mistake I willneverrepeat.
Dialogue: That is one mistake I will never repeat.

Original: Honeygirl: You gotta admit, Andithe way he moves istotally amazing!
Dialogue: You gotta admit, Andi—the way he moves is totally amazing!

Original: Honeygirls: Andi!
Dialogue: Andi!

Original: Aerith: Next up: the big finale.
Dialogue: Next up the big finale.

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Aerith: I thought you'd be happier.
Dialogue: I thought you'd be happier.

Original: Cloud: Just thinking about what we might face next.
Dialogue: Just thinking about what we might face next.

Original: Aerith: But you know, we've made it this far. I'm sure we can handle anything they throw at us.
Dialogue: But you know, we've made it this far. I'm sure we can handle anything they throw at us.

Original: Butch: Does...this mean I don't gots to play dead no more?
Dialogue: Does...this mean I don't gots to play dead no more?

Original: Beck: Damn, you two arereallysomethin' else. I could use that kinda muscle in my gang.
Dialogue: Damn, you two are really somethin' else. I could use that kinda muscle in my gang.

Original: Burke: So...hungry.
Dialogue: So...hungry.

Original: Announcer: Cloud and Aerith. The final match will begin shortly. Please make your way to the gate.
Dialogue: Cloud and Aerith. The final match will begin shortly. Please make your way to the gate.

Original: Gatekeeper: Man, you proved me wrong! You guys are pretty good! It's the final match! You good to go?
Dialogue: Man, you proved me wrong! You guys are pretty good! It's the final match! You good to go?

Original: On-screen: Participate in the finals?
Dialogue: Participate in the finals?

Original: Gatekeeper: Hey, it's the finals. Take all the time you need.
Dialogue: Hey, it's the finals. Take all the time you need.

Original: Gatekeeper: It's the final match! You good to go?
Dialogue: It's the final match! You good to go?

Original: Gatekeeper: I've got a lotta money riding on you two. Win it for me!
Dialogue: I've got a lotta money riding on you two. Win it for me!

Original: Kotch: Ladies and gentlemen, our time together is almost over!
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, our time together is almost over!

Original: Scotch: Tonight's thrilling Corneo Cupfilled with unprecedented upsets and dramahas only one match to go!
Dialogue: Tonight's thrilling Corneo Cup–filled with unprecedented upsets and drama—has only one match to go!

Original: Kotch: We knowwe're just as disappointed as you are! But ladies and gentlemen, all good things must come to an end! So let's celebrate by getting so damn loudthey'll hear us up on the plaaate!
Dialogue: We know—we're just as disappointed as you are! But ladies and gentlemen, all good things must come to an end! So let's celebrate by getting so damn loud—they'll hear us up on the plaaate!

Original: Scotch: Once morethe sweethearts who've surprised us with upset after spectacular upset! The power couple with a boundless love for bloodshed! The champions of Madam MCloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: Once more—the sweethearts who've surprised us with upset after spectacular upset! The power couple with a boundless love for bloodshed! The champions of Madam M—Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Kotch: Yeah! Come on, now! Come on, you can do better than that! And nowfive-time winners of the Corneo Cup! Murder machines with countless kills to their names!
Dialogue: Yeah! Come on, now! Come on, you can do better than that! And now—five-time winners of the Corneo Cup! Murder machines with countless kills to their names!

Original: Scotch: Along with a handful of maimings.
Dialogue: Along with a handful of maimings.

Original: Kotch: The deadly duo that takes out the trashwith a vengeance!
Dialogue: The deadly duo that takes out the trash—with a vengeance!

Original: Scotch: The electric executioners... Chocobo Sam's champions... Cutty and Sweepy!
Dialogue: The electric executioners... Chocobo Sam's champions... Cutty and Sweepy!

Original: Kotch: Come on out!
Dialogue: Come on out!

Original: Aerith: Robots!?
Dialogue: Robots!?

Original: Cloud: More like Shinra armor.
Dialogue: More like Shinra armor.

Original: Aerith: More like cheating!
Dialogue: More like cheating!

Original: Scotch: Who will walk away with the one-million-gil prize!? Get ready for a fight guaranteed to go down in history!
Dialogue: Who will walk away with the one-million-gil prize!? Get ready for a fight guaranteed to go down in history!

Original: Kotch & Scotch: The final match of the Corneo Cup...begins now!
Dialogue: The final match of the Corneo Cup...begins now!

Original: Kotch: This has never! I can't believe it! And the winners of the Corneo Cupthe deadly and dynamic duo, Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: This has never—! I can't believe it! And the winners of the Corneo Cup—the deadly and dynamic duo, Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Madam M: My condolences.
Dialogue: My condolences.

Original: Sam: Hmph.
Dialogue: Hmph.

Original: Madam M: Oh! You're taking this rather well. I was looking forward to a little temper tantrum.
Dialogue: Oh! You're taking this rather well. I was looking forward to a little temper tantrum.

Original: Sam: When you bet it all on a toss, sometimes you get burned by lady luck. Every coin has two sides.
Dialogue: When you bet it all on a toss, sometimes you get burned by lady luck. Every coin has two sides.

Original: Madam M: You're right of courseeven if they are both the same.
Dialogue: You're right of course—even if they are both the same.

Original: Sam: Later.
Dialogue: Later.

Original: Madam M: And now, I believe I have a prize to collect.
Dialogue: And now, I believe I have a prize to collect.

Original: Leslie: Sorrythe madam will have to wait. The don's demanding that we tack on one more match, it seems.
Dialogue: Sorry—the madam will have to wait. The don's demanding that we tack on one more match, it seems.

Original: Madam M: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Leslie: If they win out, then you get paid in full.
Dialogue: If they win out, then you get paid in full.

Original: Madam M: Now hold on just a goddamn minute!
Dialogue: Now hold on just a goddamn minute!

Original: Leslie: His call, not mine.
Dialogue: His call, not mine.

Original: Aerith: Now that that's over, we can go save Tifa.
Dialogue: Now that that's over, we can go save Tifa.

Original: Cloud: So we'll head back to Madam M's, get you changed, and then it's off to Corneo's.
Dialogue: So we'll head back to Madam M's, get you changed, and then it's off to Corneo's.

Original: Aerith: Right!
Dialogue: Right!

Original: Madam M: Sorry to be the bearer of bad news. But...you still have one fight left.
Dialogue: Sorry to be the bearer of bad news. But...you still have one fight left.

Original: Aerith: What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Madam M: The crowd loved your show a little too much. People were placing hefty bets, much heftier than you can possibly imagine. Corneo's going to milk this for as much as he can.
Dialogue: The crowd loved your show a little too much. People were placing hefty bets, much heftier than you can possibly imagine. Corneo's going to milk this for as much as he can.

Original: Cloud: Meaning what?
Dialogue: Meaning what?

Original: Madam M: You face and defeat Corneo's fighter of choice, and only then will you be declared winners of the tournament.
Dialogue: You face and defeat Corneo's fighter of choice, and only then will you be declared winners of the tournament.

Original: Aerith: Hey! That wasn't the deal!
Dialogue: Hey! That wasn't the deal!

Original: Madam M: Don't you think I know that!? (groans) You greedy bastard! Scum-sucking piece of shit festering asshole!
Dialogue: Don't you think I know that!? (groans) You greedy bastard! Scum-sucking piece of shit festering asshole!

Original: Madam M: (sighs) But that's the way it is. Corneo's the one who makes the rules around here. But if you win this match, Corneo will have to accept your victory. And the crowd will make sure he does.
Dialogue: (sighs) But that's the way it is. Corneo's the one who makes the rules around here. But if you win this match, Corneo will have to accept your victory. And the crowd will make sure he does.

Original: Cloud: So this is the last one?
Dialogue: So this is the last one?

Original: Madam M: I sure hope so.
Dialogue: I sure hope so.

Original: Madam M: Go on, now. That prize money is going to pay for your dress.
Dialogue: Go on, now. That prize money is going to pay for your dress.

Original: Gatekeeper: Watching you guys fight gave me goose bumps. Hope your next match is even better than the last! Ready to kick ass!?
Dialogue: Watching you guys fight gave me goose bumps. Hope your next match is even better than the last! Ready to kick ass!?

Original: On-screen: Participate in the bonus match?
Dialogue: Participate in the bonus match?

Original: Gatekeeper: Hey, consecutive matches are tough. Take all the time you need to rest.
Dialogue: Hey, consecutive matches are tough. Take all the time you need to rest.

Original: Gatekeeper: Ready to kick ass!?
Dialogue: Ready to kick ass!?

Original: Gatekeeper: It's not even about the money anymore, man. I just want you guys to win it all! Show 'em what you got!
Dialogue: It's not even about the money anymore, man. I just want you guys to win it all! Show 'em what you got!

Original: Scotch: Tonight's Corneo Cup has been a spectacle like no other. And we shared your disappointment, ladies and gentlemen, when we told you that it was coming to an end.
Dialogue: Tonight's Corneo Cup has been a spectacle like no other. And we shared your disappointment, ladies and gentlemen, when we told you that it was coming to an end.

Original: Kotch: But nobody felt it more keenly than one Don Corneo...who has decided that a bonus match is in order!
Dialogue: But nobody felt it more keenly than one Don Corneo...who has decided that a bonus match is in order!

Original: Scotch: Participating in this match will be this evening's leading lightsthe dynamic duo that has crushed all competition thus far! Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: Participating in this match will be this evening's leading lights—the dynamic duo that has crushed all competition thus far! Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Spectator (1): Cloud! Cloud! Over here! Look at them! They're so adorable!
Dialogue: Cloud! Cloud! Over here! Look at them! They're so adorable!

Original: Spectator (2): You're the man, Cloud!
Dialogue: You're the man, Cloud!

Original: Spectator (3): Aerith! I love you! Marry me!
Dialogue: Aerith! I love you! Marry me!

Original: Kotch: Their opponent! Buried in the bowels of the colosseum... An unspeakable horror, long imprisoned, set free tonight for your entertainment!
Dialogue: Their opponent! Buried in the bowels of the colosseum... An unspeakable horror, long imprisoned, set free tonight for your entertainment!

Original: Scotch: The secret star of Don Corneo's stellar stable!
Dialogue: The secret star of Don Corneo's stellar stable!

Original: Kotch & Scotch: Enter: the Hell House!
Dialogue: Enter the Hell House!

Original: Aerith: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Aerith: It's just...a house.
Dialogue: It's just...a house.

Original: Cloud: That's no ordinary house!
Dialogue: That's no ordinary house!

Original: Kotch: The manifestation of pure evil versus the most badass couple this side of Midgarhave you ever seen a fight more incredible, more epic!?
Dialogue: The manifestation of pure evil versus the most badass couple this side of Midgar—have you ever seen a fight more incredible, more epic!?

Original: Scotch: You have not! No sir, you have not!
Dialogue: You have not! No sir, you have not!

Original: Kotch: They'll be singing songs about tonight for generations to come!
Dialogue: They'll be singing songs about tonight for generations to come!

Original: Scotch: Keep your eyes glued to the action, ladies and gentlemen!
Dialogue: Keep your eyes glued to the action, ladies and gentlemen!

Original: Kotch: The Cup's final, final battle...
Dialogue: The Cup's final, final battle...

Original: Kotch & Scotch: Begins...now!
Dialogue: Begins...now!

Original: Kotch: The battle is joined, and already I can tell you this bonus match will not disappoint!
Dialogue: The battle is joined, and already I can tell you this bonus match will not disappoint!

Original: Scotch: This couple has fought the toughest of the tough, the meanest of the mean, but can they handle the horror of the Hell House!?
Dialogue: This couple has fought the toughest of the tough, the meanest of the mean, but can they handle the horror of the Hell House!?

Original: Kotch: Who will come out on top!? Strap yourselves in, folks, 'cause this show is only getting started!
Dialogue: Who will come out on top!? Strap yourselves in, folks, 'cause this show is only getting started!

Original: Kotch: That had to hurt! Has our dynamic duo already found this house's major design flaw!?
Dialogue: That had to hurt! Has our dynamic duo already found this house's major design flaw!?

Original: Kotch: A heroic move by Aerith as she provides support for her partner! Savor that healing wind!
Dialogue: A heroic move by Aerith as she provides support for her partner! Savor that healing wind!

Original: Scotch: Let it wash over yourestore you inside and out!
Dialogue: Let it wash over you—restore you inside and out!

Original: Kotch: We have a special guest that wants to kick things up a notch! But don't get too closeyou can't handle his heat!
Dialogue: We have a special guest that wants to kick things up a notch! But don't get too close—you can't handle his heat!

Original: Scotch: Feel that raging fire! Can the Hell House weather the inferno!?
Dialogue: Feel that raging fire! Can the Hell House weather the inferno!?

Original: Kotch: Tearing through the colosseum like a tornado, a moogle and chocobo!
Dialogue: Tearing through the colosseum like a tornado, a moogle and chocobo!

Original: Scotch: Don't be fooled by their cute looks, because they're here to kick ass and take names!
Dialogue: Don't be fooled by their cute looks, because they're here to kick ass and take names!

Original: Kotch: Grab your coats, folks! You're gonna wanna bundle up for this! We've got the queen of ice herself coming in for a meet and greet. What a beauty!
Dialogue: Grab your coats, folks! You're gonna wanna bundle up for this! We've got the queen of ice herself coming in for a meet and greet. What a beauty!

Original: Scotch: That frosty stare could strike a man dead where he stands. Maybe I'll be the lucky victim!
Dialogue: That frosty stare could strike a man dead where he stands. Maybe I'll be the lucky victim!

Original: Kotch: A fat chocobo from the heavyweight division joins the combatants in the arena! I think the feathers are about to fly!
Dialogue: A fat chocobo from the heavyweight division joins the combatants in the arena! I think the feathers are about to fly!

Original: Scotch: Will our big-boned birdie make a meal of the Hell House? Will he gobble it right up? Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!
Dialogue: Will our big-boned birdie make a meal of the Hell House? Will he gobble it right up? Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!

Original: Kotch: The spiteful dragon of the sea is here in the arena! I'm warning you folks: youwillget wet!
Dialogue: The spiteful dragon of the sea is here in the arena! I'm warning you folks you will get wet!

Original: Scotch: Hold on tight, ladies and gentlemen, for the fury of the ocean might swallow you whole!
Dialogue: Hold on tight, ladies and gentlemen, for the fury of the ocean might swallow you whole!

Original: Kotch: What? Do my eyes deceive me? The king of dragons has graced us with his royal presence!
Dialogue: What? Do my eyes deceive me? The king of dragons has graced us with his royal presence!

Original: Scotch: I hope you have insurance, because safety isnotguaranteed. None of us may make it out of here alive!
Dialogue: I hope you have insurance, because safety is not guaranteed. None of us may make it out of here alive!

Original: Kotch: Cloud is shakenand stirred! I bet he's not gonna be standing for much longer!
Dialogue: Cloud is shaken—and stirred! I bet he's not gonna be standing for much longer!

Original: Scotch: Cloud has seen better days! Can he keep fighting the good fight or is he ready to throw in the towel!?
Dialogue: Cloud has seen better days! Can he keep fighting the good fight or is he ready to throw in the towel!?

Original: Scotch: Ouch, that's gotta hurt. Aerith gets a double dose of neighborly hatred!
Dialogue: Ouch, that's gotta hurt. Aerith gets a double dose of neighborly hatred!

Original: Scotch: And Aerith is down for the count!
Dialogue: And Aerith is down for the count!

Original: Kotch: Can you hear that, Midgar? Aerith fans are not happy!
Dialogue: Can you hear that, Midgar? Aerith fans are not happy!

Original: Scotch: And Aerith is down for the count!
Dialogue: And Aerith is down for the count!

Original: Kotch: Aerith is down for the count!
Dialogue: Aerith is down for the count!

Original: Kotch: This housewarming party is putting their love to the test! Are they strong enough to pull through?
Dialogue: This housewarming party is putting their love to the test! Are they strong enough to pull through?

Original: Scotch: I'm sorry, ladies and gentlemen, but this is painful to watch!
Dialogue: I'm sorry, ladies and gentlemen, but this is painful to watch!

Original: Scotch: Batten down the hatches, folks, because a storm is brewing on the horizon!
Dialogue: Batten down the hatches, folks, because a storm is brewing on the horizon!

Original: Scotch: And the winner, the man-eating monstrosity, the horror, the Hell House!
Dialogue: And the winner, the man-eating monstrosity, the horror, the Hell House!

Original: Kotch: The babe and beautiful Cloud and Aerith would be champions reduced to food for the beast. We will never forget your sacrifice!
Dialogue: The babe and beautiful Cloud and Aerith would be champions reduced to food for the beast. We will never forget your sacrifice!

Original: Scotch: Oof, that color is a dead giveaway! The architect must've had one too many when he designed this thing!
Dialogue: Oof, that color is a dead giveaway! The architect must've had one too many when he designed this thing!

Original: Kotch: The Hell House is d-d-d-down! Cloud is taking control of the fight and is really showing this building who's boss!
Dialogue: The Hell House is d-d-d-down! Cloud is taking control of the fight and is really showing this building who's boss!

Original: Kotch: Whoa! And in a stunning turn of events, the Hell House has come to a complete stop!
Dialogue: Whoa! And in a stunning turn of events, the Hell House has come to a complete stop!

Original: Kotch: And the Hell House is down! Will this be the end for our quaint living space of evil?
Dialogue: And the Hell House is down! Will this be the end for our quaint living space of evil?

Original: Cloud: Wait!
Dialogue: Wait!

Original: Madam M: It's almost disappointing.
Dialogue: It's almost disappointing.

Original: Andrea: No. Not yet...
Dialogue: No. Not yet...

Original: Scotch: Ladies and gentlemen! What is happening!?
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen! What is happening!?

Original: Aerith: What the
Dialogue: What the—

Original: Cloud: Look out!
Dialogue: Look out!

Original: Kotch: Just try and call this house warm and inviting now! We dare ya! We double-dog dare ya!
Dialogue: Just try and call this house warm and inviting now! We dare ya! We double-dog dare ya!

Original: Scotch: The Hell House is showing us itstruepaint job! How will Aerith and Cloud adapt?
Dialogue: The Hell House is showing us its true paint job! How will Aerith and Cloud adapt?

Original: Kotch: Who has been caught in the Hell House's sights!?
Dialogue: Who has been caught in the Hell House's sights!?

Original: Scotch: If you wanna know what's in the box, you'll just have to open it up and see!
Dialogue: If you wanna know what's in the box, you'll just have to open it up and see!

Original: Kotch: The Hell House has welcomed its first guest! What kind of party is it!? I don't know, but I'm glad I wasn't invited!
Dialogue: The Hell House has welcomed its first guest! What kind of party is it!? I don't know, but I'm glad I wasn't invited!

Original: Kotch: And with that, the gateway to hell slams shut!
Dialogue: And with that, the gateway to hell slams shut!

Original: Kotch: This house is hungry, and it's about to chow down on the competition!
Dialogue: This house is hungry, and it's about to chow down on the competition!

Original: Scotch: What is going on in there!? Only time will tell, but I'm not sure we wanna know!
Dialogue: What is going on in there!? Only time will tell, but I'm not sure we wanna know!

Original: Kotch: A miraculous escape from our courageous contender! But from the looks of it, they had a pretty wild time in there!
Dialogue: A miraculous escape from our courageous contender! But from the looks of it, they had a pretty wild time in there!

Original: Kotch: And Cloud is back with us once again...or is he!? The masticating mansion did a real number on the man!
Dialogue: And Cloud is back with us once again...or is he!? The masticating mansion did a real number on the man!

Original: Kotch: The Hell House is ready to shove its message of hate down their throats!
Dialogue: The Hell House is ready to shove its message of hate down their throats!

Original: Kotch: Oh, man! Did anyone get the number of that house!?
Dialogue: Oh, man! Did anyone get the number of that house!?

Original: Scotch: The Hell House isn't afraid to fight dirty!
Dialogue: The Hell House isn't afraid to fight dirty!

Original: Scotch: Now that had to hurt, folks! Are these moves even legal!?
Dialogue: Now that had to hurt, folks! Are these moves even legal!?

Original: Kotch: What a brutal hit by the Hell House! There's no way that didn't hurt!
Dialogue: What a brutal hit by the Hell House! There's no way that didn't hurt!

Original: Kotch: Talk about making an impact! The Hell House is absolutely tearing it up tonight!
Dialogue: Talk about making an impact! The Hell House is absolutely tearing it up tonight!

Original: Kotch: Cloud and Aerith with a stunning reversal! The Hell House is dead in the water!
Dialogue: Cloud and Aerith with a stunning reversal! The Hell House is dead in the water!

Original: Scotch: Nowthatis the price you pay for daring to get in the way of true love!
Dialogue: Now that is the price you pay for daring to get in the way of true love!

Original: Scotch: The Hell House isn't afraid to fight dirty!
Dialogue: The Hell House isn't afraid to fight dirty!

Original: Kotch: The lovebirds are going hard at the house, but they'll have to do better than that if they wanna razethisroof!
Dialogue: The lovebirds are going hard at the house, but they'll have to do better than that if they wanna raze this roof!

Original: Kotch: Well, that sure ain't workin'!
Dialogue: Well, that sure ain't workin'!

Original: Kotch: Nope! Not gonna cut it!
Dialogue: Nope! Not gonna cut it!

Original: Kotch: Not even so much as a flinch!
Dialogue: Not even so much as a flinch!

Original: Kotch: The barrier's still holding! Does our dynamic duo have what it takes to defeat the security of this high-tech home!?
Dialogue: The barrier's still holding! Does our dynamic duo have what it takes to defeat the security of this high-tech home!?

Original: Kotch: Our favorite couple is about to get a face full of flame! Is there any way to escape the heat!?
Dialogue: Our favorite couple is about to get a face full of flame! Is there any way to escape the heat!?

Original: Kotch: Here comes the windup, folks! Brace for impact!
Dialogue: Here comes the windup, folks! Brace for impact!

Original: Scotch: There'll be no coming back from this one!
Dialogue: There'll be no coming back from this one!

Original: Kotch: Looks like our couple's in for another round of musical chairs!
Dialogue: Looks like our couple's in for another round of musical chairs!

Original: Scotch: Another barrage of chaos coming in hot, folks! Will this turn the tide against them!?
Dialogue: Another barrage of chaos coming in hot, folks! Will this turn the tide against them!?

Original: Scotch: Where'd these chairs come from? Who do they belong to? Who needs all those chairs? I have so many questions!
Dialogue: Where'd these chairs come from? Who do they belong to? Who needs all those chairs? I have so many questions!

Original: Kotch: Stuffed animals are available at the colosseum gift shop. The perfect present for friends and family! Available only while supplies last so act fast!
Dialogue: Stuffed animals are available at the colosseum gift shop. The perfect present for friends and family! Available only while supplies last so act fast!

Original: Kotch: Liftoff! We have liftoff! Ladies and gentlemen, are you seeing this!? The world's first flying house!
Dialogue: Liftoff! We have liftoff! Ladies and gentlemen, are you seeing this!? The world's first flying house!

Original: Scotch: What's this? The ol' switcheroo? As usual, the Hell House is up to no good!
Dialogue: What's this? The ol' switcheroo? As usual, the Hell House is up to no good!

Original: Kotch: This house has had enough of the neighborhood riffraff!
Dialogue: This house has had enough of the neighborhood riffraff!

Original: Kotch: Our tremendous twosome has put on their hard hats! They know exactly what they need to do to make this house come crashing down!
Dialogue: Our tremendous twosome has put on their hard hats! They know exactly what they need to do to make this house come crashing down!

Original: Scotch: They're bringing that high-flying house back down to earth!
Dialogue: They're bringing that high-flying house back down to earth!

Original: Kotch: Well, wouldja look at this! A gift from the selfless and generous Don Corneo himself!
Dialogue: Well, wouldja look at this! A gift from the selfless and generous Don Corneo himself!

Original: Scotch: Cloud and Aeriththey stand poised to win it all!
Dialogue: Cloud and Aerith—they stand poised to win it all!

Original: Kotch: The crowd is going wild, but no amount of applause is gonna bring this house down!
Dialogue: The crowd is going wild, but no amount of applause is gonna bring this house down!

Original: Kotch: Are we witnessing the final moments of the wicked Hell House!?
Dialogue: Are we witnessing the final moments of the wicked Hell House!?

Original: Aerith: We did it!
Dialogue: We did it!

Original: Kotch: And the winners
Dialogue: And the winners—

Original: Scotch: And champions
Dialogue: And champions—

Original: Kotch & Scotch: Cloud and Aerith!
Dialogue: Cloud and Aerith!

Original: Madam M: Yay! Yes!
Dialogue: Yay! Yes!

Original: Andrea: That boy...
Dialogue: That boy...

Original: Madam M: Awfully rare, you showing an interest in someone. What will you do?
Dialogue: Awfully rare, you showing an interest in someone. What will you do?

Original: Gatekeeper: There you are. I've been looking for you two. So Madam M wanted me to give you a message. She says you guys did pretty damn good, and that you should swing by her shop when you're done here. Got it? I was also hoping you might be interested in a few more matches here at the colosseum. Big events like the Corneo Cup are pretty sporadic, but there's always action if you wanna get a piece.
Dialogue: There you are. I've been looking for you two. So Madam M wanted me to give you a message. She says you guys did pretty damn good, and that you should swing by her shop when you're done here. Got it? I was also hoping you might be interested in a few more matches here at the colosseum. Big events like the Corneo Cup are pretty sporadic, but there's always action if you wanna get a piece.

Original: Gatekeeper: Huh? You wanna take me up on my offer now? Cool! Then I'll see you down below.
Dialogue: Huh? You wanna take me up on my offer now? Cool! Then I'll see you down below.

Original: Gatekeeper: Hey, been waiting for ya. Sowhat're ya in the mood to fight?
Dialogue: Hey, been waiting for ya. So—what're ya in the mood to fight?

Original: Souvenir Shop Owner: With these babies, you can send intruders flying! I guarantee this is the only home protection you'll ever need!
Dialogue: With these babies, you can send intruders flying! I guarantee this is the only home protection you'll ever need!

Original: Souvenir Shop Owner: Only a few left. Get yours while you can!
Dialogue: Only a few left. Get yours while you can!

Original: Staff (1): Why didn't you tell me you guys were gonna kick so much ass! Can I get your autographs?
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me you guys were gonna kick so much ass! Can I get your autographs?

Original: Staff (2): Congratulations on the win! You know tonight's tournament is going down in history!
Dialogue: Congratulations on the win! You know tonight's tournament is going down in history!

Original: Staff (3): Watching you win was so inspiring! It made me want to fight too!
Dialogue: Watching you win was so inspiring! It made me want to fight too!

Original: Madam M: You're here. Good. I have everything I need to get started. Just one thing before we do. You'retheCloud, right? Cloud the merc?
Dialogue: You're here. Good. I have everything I need to get started. Just one thing before we do. You're the Cloud, right? Cloud the merc?

Original: Madam M: Hah! Well that's what you call yourself I'm told, but what've you actually done for the people of Sector 5, hmm? There's this little thing called karma. How a person treats others dictates how they themselves should be treated. And believe meI'll get you the dress that you earned.
Dialogue: Hah! Well that's what you call yourself I'm told, but what've you actually done for the people of Sector 5, hmm? There's this little thing called karma. How a person treats others dictates how they themselves should be treated. And believe me—I'll get you the dress that you earned.

Original: Madam M: I've heard a few stories about you helping out the people of Sector 5. If you don't mind me saying so, though, you could be doing a little bit more. The rule of karma is highly respected in the slums. A somewhat decent person deserves a somewhat decent dress. But really, let's not kid ourselves. Corneo's not even gonna look at what she's wearing.
Dialogue: I've heard a few stories about you helping out the people of Sector 5. If you don't mind me saying so, though, you could be doing a little bit more. The rule of karma is highly respected in the slums. A somewhat decent person deserves a somewhat decent dress. But really, let's not kid ourselves. Corneo's not even gonna look at what she's wearing.

Original: Madam M: I'm told you did a wonderful job helping the people of Sector 5. You have a very impressive work ethic. It's like they say, "Good things come to those who work." What goes around, comes aroundand in ways that might surprise you. I'm gonna put Aerith in the most gorgeous dress you've ever seen. It'll be a real jaw-dropper.
Dialogue: I'm told you did a wonderful job helping the people of Sector 5. You have a very impressive work ethic. It's like they say, "Good things come to those who work." What goes around, comes around—and in ways that might surprise you. I'm gonna put Aerith in the most gorgeous dress you've ever seen. It'll be a real jaw-dropper.
