Original: Madam M: All right. Now that that's out of the way... Once you change, you won't be able to leave town. Are you sure you're ready?
Dialogue: All right. Now that that's out of the way... Once you change, you won't be able to leave town. Are you sure you're ready?

Original: On-screen: Have Aerith get changed?
Dialogue: Have Aerith get changed?

Original: Madam M: All right, then. Let's get started. Beauty takes a lot of work and preparation, far more than you'd know. In the meantime, let me see, let me think...
Dialogue: All right, then. Let's get started. Beauty takes a lot of work and preparation, far more than you'd know. In the meantime, let me see, let me think...

Original: Madam M: Huh!? Don't waste my time! If you have things to do, then get out there and do them!
Dialogue: Huh!? Don't waste my time! If you have things to do, then get out there and do them!

Original: Madam M: Like I said, once you change, you won't be able to leave town. Are you sure you're ready now?
Dialogue: Like I said, once you change, you won't be able to leave town. Are you sure you're ready now?

Original: Madam M: Hurry. It. Up!
Dialogue: Hurry. It. Up!

Original: Madam M: There oughta be things you can only do without your friend. Now's your chance to get out and have some fun. I can tell you're already beginning to feel at home here. Though being so new to it I assumed you still wouldn't know how to enjoy yourself properly. So I went and had a chat with Sam. He said he'd be happy to help you out.
Dialogue: There oughta be things you can only do without your friend. Now's your chance to get out and have some fun. I can tell you're already beginning to feel at home here. Though being so new to it I assumed you still wouldn't know how to enjoy yourself properly. So I went and had a chat with Sam. He said he'd be happy to help you out.

Original: Cloud: Hey. No one asked you to do that.
Dialogue: Hey. No one asked you to do that.

Original: Madam M: But there's so much you don't know! This is the perfect opportunity for you to learn the ways of the world and man the hell up!
Dialogue: But there's so much you don't know! This is the perfect opportunity for you to learn the ways of the world and man the hell up!

Original: Madam M: You look like you haven't experienced the best of what this town has to offer. That really won't do.
Dialogue: You look like you haven't experienced the best of what this town has to offer. That really won't do.

Original: Cloud: Not interested.
Dialogue: Not interested.

Original: Madam M: Then maybe you can show the town what you have to offer instead. Which is to say, why don't you try putting those finely honed mercenary skills of yours to good use here in Wall Market? I have a few little requests that you might be able to help out with. I gave that hand extra-special treatment. Now get out there and show me what you can do with it.
Dialogue: Then maybe you can show the town what you have to offer instead. Which is to say, why don't you try putting those finely honed mercenary skills of yours to good use here in Wall Market? I have a few little requests that you might be able to help out with. I gave that hand extra-special treatment. Now get out there and show me what you can do with it.

Original: Madam M: And that's enough of that. Aerith, come with me.
Dialogue: And that's enough of that. Aerith, come with me.

Original: Aerith: Oh boy! I can't wait to see the dress!
Dialogue: Oh boy! I can't wait to see the dress!

Original: Madam M: The dress is part of it, sure...but we'll also need to do something about that plain-Jane makeup and hairdo. This is gonna take some work.
Dialogue: The dress is part of it, sure...but we'll also need to do something about that plain-Jane makeup and hairdo. This is gonna take some work.

Original: Aerith: Ouch! Well, I'll see you later, Cloud!
Dialogue: Ouch! Well, I'll see you later, Cloud!

Original: Madam: Peek and I'll poke out your eyes.
Dialogue: Peek and I'll poke out your eyes.

Original: Sam: Howdy. Madam M said you'd be swinging by. Lemme see if I've got this straight. You ditched your lady friend and fellow champion to have a boy's night out in Wall Market?
Dialogue: Howdy. Madam M said you'd be swinging by. Lemme see if I've got this straight. You ditched your lady friend and fellow champion to have a boy's night out in Wall Market?

Original: Sam: Kidding! If I know the madamand I dothis was all her idea. I can see why. There's no denying you're skilled with a sword, but when it comes to damn near anything else, well...can't help but have my doubts. Ain't nothing wrong with that, but then there's nothing wrong with expanding your horizons neither. Seeking new experiences. Knowing the ways of this here world will help you to better protect her while you're in it. Reckon I've got a few solid gigs for you. Whaddya say? You game?
Dialogue: Kidding! If I know the madam—and I do—this was all her idea. I can see why. There's no denying you're skilled with a sword, but when it comes to damn near anything else, well...can't help but have my doubts. Ain't nothing wrong with that, but then there's nothing wrong with expanding your horizons neither. Seeking new experiences. Knowing the ways of this here world will help you to better protect her while you're in it. Reckon I've got a few solid gigs for you. Whaddya say? You game?

Original: Cloud: ...Yeah, why not.
Dialogue: ...Yeah, why not.

Original: Sam: (chuckles) That's the spirit. You have yourself a grand time tonight, mister merc.
Dialogue: (chuckles) That's the spirit. You have yourself a grand time tonight, mister merc.

Original: Ronnie: Never seen you before.
Dialogue: Never seen you before.

Original: Jay: Here to work out? Put some muscle on that bony frame of yours?
Dialogue: Here to work out? Put some muscle on that bony frame of yours?

Original: Jules: Cloud! Been waitin' for you to show up. Thanks for coming, and welcome to our humble training hall. Juleshead trainer. If you've got some time to spare, how about a little bit of fun? Wanna try taking on one of our guys?
Dialogue: Cloud! Been waitin' for you to show up. Thanks for coming, and welcome to our humble training hall. Jules—head trainer. If you've got some time to spare, how about a little bit of fun? Wanna try taking on one of our guys?

Original: Ronnie: Hah! You're not serious, are you? Look at him! He's a scrawny little thing. I could snap him like a twig!
Dialogue: Hah! You're not serious, are you? Look at him! He's a scrawny little thing. I could snap him like a twig!

Original: Jules: Now, nowI wouldn't judge this one by his muscle mass. What do you say, Cloud? If you wanna give it a go, just let me know.
Dialogue: Now, now—I wouldn't judge this one by his muscle mass. What do you say, Cloud? If you wanna give it a go, just let me know.

Original: Jules: So? You up for a round?
Dialogue: So? You up for a round?

Original: On-screen: Squats: Trainee
Dialogue: Squats Trainee

Original: Ronnie: Ha! You're taking me on? You look like a dried-up old terpsicolt left out in the sun. You got no idea what you're getting into, little man.
Dialogue: Ha! You're taking me on? You look like a dried-up old terpsicolt left out in the sun. You got no idea what you're getting into, little man.

Original: Jules: All right, enough talk. We'll settle this the tried-and-true traditional way: a squat-off. Now, let's all see what you've got.
Dialogue: All right, enough talk. We'll settle this the tried-and-true traditional way a squat-off. Now, let's all see what you've got.

Original: Ronnie: Now don't go crying to mommy.
Dialogue: Now don't go crying to mommy.

Original: Ronnie: How? How the hell did I lose to this scrawny little kid who looks like he doesn't even consume his daily recommended amount of protein?
Dialogue: How—? How the hell did I lose to this scrawny little kid who looks like he doesn't even consume his daily recommended amount of protein?

Original: Jules: Ronnieyou know it's all about quality, not mass. You're too quick to judge people by their build. That, and your overtrained ego are the main reasons you lost to our bold challenger here!
Dialogue: Ronnie—you know it's all about quality, not mass. You're too quick to judge people by their build. That, and your overtrained ego are the main reasons you lost to our bold challenger here!

Original: Jules: Thanks for helping me teach my boys a valuable lesson. And sorry for dragging you into it. Cloud, we're all one big family here at this gym, and now you're part of it. If you're ever up for training, our doors are always open to you. Let's work together to maintain healthy mindsandbodies.
Dialogue: Thanks for helping me teach my boys a valuable lesson. And sorry for dragging you into it. Cloud, we're all one big family here at this gym, and now you're part of it. If you're ever up for training, our doors are always open to you. Let's work together to maintain healthy minds and bodies.

Original: Jules: If you're ever in the mood for another workout, just talk to Jay or Ronnie.
Dialogue: If you're ever in the mood for another workout, just talk to Jay or Ronnie.

Original: Jay: You wanna go, do ya? All right then, bring it on!
Dialogue: You wanna go, do ya? All right then, bring it on!

Original: On-screen: Squats: Amateur
Dialogue: Squats Amateur

Original: Jay: Bringing everything I've got.
Dialogue: Bringing everything I've got.

Original: Jay: No!
Dialogue: No!

Original: Jay: You did it, you really beat me. You gotta be in incredible shape!
Dialogue: You did it, you really beat me. You gotta be in incredible shape!

Original: Jules: (laughs) It's unfair that you guys are having all the fun. What do you say? May I have this squat?
Dialogue: (laughs) It's unfair that you guys are having all the fun. What do you say? May I have this squat?

Original: On-screen: Squats: Pro
Dialogue: Squats Pro

Original: Jules: I won't go easy on you.
Dialogue: I won't go easy on you.

Original: Ronnie: Just how much training do you do!?
Dialogue: Just how much training do you do!?

Original: Ronnie: You're better than I thought!
Dialogue: You're better than I thought!

Original: Jay: You are in the zone!
Dialogue: You are in the zone!

Original: Jay: Poetry in motion!
Dialogue: Poetry in motion!

Original: Jay: Slow and steady! One-two, one-two!
Dialogue: Slow and steady! One-two, one-two!

Original: Jay: I can't get enough of those beautiful muscles!
Dialogue: I can't get enough of those beautiful muscles!

Original: Jay: You can do it, Jules! We're rooting for you!
Dialogue: You can do it, Jules! We're rooting for you!

Original: Ronnie: I believe in you!
Dialogue: I believe in you!

Original: Jay: Who'da thought it'd bethisclose?
Dialogue: Who'da thought it'd be this close?

Original: Ronnie: Oh, man! Who's gonna win this one? It's too close to tell!
Dialogue: Oh, man! Who's gonna win this one? It's too close to tell!

Original: Jules: You gotta loosen up. You're way too tense.
Dialogue: You gotta loosen up. You're way too tense.

Original: Jules: I had no idea how strong you really were. You truly are something, aren't you?
Dialogue: I had no idea how strong you really were. You truly are something, aren't you?

Original: Jules: Listen up, everyone. We can be stronger, better. Let's hit those weights!
Dialogue: Listen up, everyone. We can be stronger, better. Let's hit those weights!

Original: Gym Members: You got it, Jules!
Dialogue: You got it, Jules!

Original: Johnny: Wait up, Cloud! Sam caught me up on everything. He said you're gonna go rescue Tifa. And to do that, you're trying to learn all about Wall Market. Bro, I know this town like the back of my hand, so I can answer all of your questions! Now, let's go knock this one out! The bar's this way, Cloud.
Dialogue: Wait up, Cloud! Sam caught me up on everything. He said you're gonna go rescue Tifa. And to do that, you're trying to learn all about Wall Market. Bro, I know this town like the back of my hand, so I can answer all of your questions! Now, let's go knock this one out! The bar's this way, Cloud.

Original: Johnny: Drunkards', here we go!
Dialogue: Drunkards', here we go!

Original: Johnny: Uh, are we even allowed to walk through the door? I'm getting a "regulars only" kinda vibe.
Dialogue: Uh, are we even allowed to walk through the door? I'm getting a "regulars only" kinda vibe.

Original: Johnny: It's mostly the same folks every night, so... Whoa! You can't just waltz in there uninvited! Listen, there are rules for this kind of
Dialogue: It's mostly the same folks every night, so... Whoa! You can't just waltz in there uninvited! Listen, there are rules for this kind of—

Original: Johnny: Hey! Old dude!
Dialogue: Hey! Old dude!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Huh...? Son, is that you? Did you always look so...moronic?
Dialogue: Huh...? Son, is that you? Did you always look so...moronic?

Original: Johnny: Wha? Well, right back at ya! Ugh, whatever. We're here to take you back to the store.
Dialogue: Wha—? Well, right back at ya! Ugh, whatever. We're here to take you back to the store.

Original: Clothing Store Owner: I'm not going back! Not ever! My life is ruined. It's over. Kill me now!
Dialogue: I'm not going back! Not ever! My life is ruined. It's over. Kill me now!

Original: Johnny: Come on, there's no need to talk like that, old dude! I'll help you out with whatever you need!
Dialogue: Come on, there's no need to talk like that, old dude! I'll help you out with whatever you need!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Really? Oh, thank you, son! See, I made this bet with the materia merchanta sure thingbut then I lost... And so I had no choice but to steel my heart and surrender my precious inspiration!
Dialogue: Really? Oh, thank you, son! See, I made this bet with the materia merchant—a sure thing—but then I lost... And so I had no choice but to steel my heart and surrender my precious inspiration!

Original: Johnny: Your precious inspir-who with the what now?
Dialogue: Your precious inspir-who with the what now?

Original: Clothing Store Owner: INSPIRATION! Without it, there's simply no point in me ever going back to the store...
Dialogue: INSPIRATION! Without it, there's simply no point in me ever going back to the store...

Original: Johnny: Got it! I mean, I don't got it, but... I just need to get your inspiration back, right? Whatever the hell that is. Leave it to me, old dude!
Dialogue: Got it! I mean, I don't got it, but... I just need to get your inspiration back, right? Whatever the hell that is. Leave it to me, old dude!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Uh, hey... Aren't you gonna go with your friend?
Dialogue: Uh, hey... Aren't you gonna go with your friend?

Original: Johnny: I've never actually been inside, now that I think about it.
Dialogue: I've never actually been inside, now that I think about it.

Original: Johnny: I don't even really know how people use materia. They're just, like, huge orbs of...something.
Dialogue: I don't even really know how people use materia. They're just, like, huge orbs of...something.

Original: Johny: This place looks kinda creepy, don't you think? Like maybe they practice ritual sacrifice or...
Dialogue: This place looks kinda creepy, don't you think? Like maybe they practice ritual sacrifice or...

Original: Johnny: Hey, wait for me!
Dialogue: Hey, wait for me!

Original: Johnny: Sooo...this is it, huh?
Dialogue: Sooo...this is it, huh?

Original: Materia Vendor: And wadda you two want?
Dialogue: And wadda you two want?

Original: Johnny: I'm here for the "precious inspiration" you took from the old dude.
Dialogue: I'm here for the "precious inspiration" you took from the old dude.

Original: Materia Vendor: Inspiration...? Oh, that thing. But I didn't "take" it, I won it fair and square. It's mine by rights now.
Dialogue: Inspiration...? Oh, that thing. But I didn't "take" it, I won it fair and square. It's mine by rights now.

Original: Johnny: Well, that's true!
Dialogue: Well, that's true!

Original: Materia Vendor: But I tell you what. I'll consider giving it back in exchange for...a favor.
Dialogue: But I tell you what. I'll consider giving it back in exchange for...a favor.

Original: Johnny: ...Whatcha need?
Dialogue: ...Whatcha need?

Original: Materia Vendor: Something only..."real men" can deliver. I need you to go and get me something from the vending machine at the inn. You know what. You know!
Dialogue: Something only..."real men" can deliver. I need you to go and get me something from the vending machine at the inn. You know what. You know!

Original: Johny: No, I don't think I... Wait. The Sauce!
Dialogue: No, I don't think I... Wait. The Sauce!

Original: Cloud: The Sauce?
Dialogue: The Sauce?

Original: Materia Vendor: Stop saying "the Sauce!" ...Anyway. Good luck.
Dialogue: Stop saying "the Sauce!" ...Anyway. Good luck.

Original: Johnny: The time has come...for me to wield my powers of assessment!
Dialogue: The time has come...for me to wield my powers of assessment!

Original: Materia Vendor: Wait, you haven't even gone there yet? Well, I guess I can't force you to go...
Dialogue: Wait, you haven't even gone there yet? Well, I guess I can't force you to go...

Original: Barker: I have the perfect room for the both of you! Just say the word, and I'll show you to it!
Dialogue: I have the perfect room for the both of you! Just say the word, and I'll show you to it!

Original: Johnny: Huh!? No no no, we're not here for that!
Dialogue: Huh!? No no no, we're not here for that!

Original: Barker: Say what? If you don't need a room, then what the hell do you want?
Dialogue: Say what? If you don't need a room, then what the hell do you want?

Original: Johnny: I wish I was here with Tifa. No offense, bro.
Dialogue: I wish I was here with Tifa. No offense, bro.

Original: Johnny: That's it. That's the one! It looks like a regular old vending machine, right? But wait! You ready for this? All right. This particular model has secret buttons.
Dialogue: That's it. That's the one! It looks like a regular old vending machine, right? But wait! You ready for this? All right. This particular model has secret buttons.

Original: Cloud: Where?
Dialogue: Where?

Original: Johnny: Well...I can't tell youit's a secret! You just need to tap into your knowledge and expertiselike, grab it and whip it out! And then you'll be able to see everything?
Dialogue: Well...I can't tell you—it's a secret! You just need to tap into your knowledge and expertise—like, grab it and whip it out! And then you'll be able to see everything?

Original: On-screen: Use Assess to find the secret buttons? (The higher the materia usage, the luckier you may be.)
Dialogue: Use Assess to find the secret buttons? (The higher the materia usage, the luckier you may be.)

Original: Cloud: I don't need to "whip it out." I've done this before. Watch this.
Dialogue: I don't need to "whip it out." I've done this before. Watch this.

Original: Johnny: Whoa, look at you, bro!
Dialogue: Whoa, look at you, bro!

Original: Johnny: Huh? Is this the Sauce? I dunno... Come on, bro! You know there are more hidden buttons waiting to be pushed!
Dialogue: Huh? Is this the Sauce? I dunno... Come on, bro! You know there are more hidden buttons waiting to be pushed!

Original: Johnny: Oh... So this is the Sauce. Neato... It-it's time. The last button...
Dialogue: Oh... So this is the Sauce. Neato... It-it's time. The last button...

Original: Johnny: The Sauce! P-put it away! Put it away before someone sees you! No one can know that we have it!
Dialogue: The Sauce! P-put it away! Put it away before someone sees you! No one can know that we have it!

Original: Vending Machine: You're the grand prize winner! Have a special prize!
Dialogue: You're the grand prize winner! Have a special prize!

Original: Johnny: (screams) Don't scare me like that! Whatever! We got what we came here for. Let's get outta here and head to the materia guy!
Dialogue: (screams) Don't scare me like that! Whatever! We got what we came here for. Let's get outta here and head to the materia guy!

Original: Johnny: Uh, is it me, or is everyone looking at us...? So this is what it feels like to be a champ.
Dialogue: Uh, is it me, or is everyone looking at us...? So this is what it feels like to be a champ.

Original: Johnny: Come on, bro! Hurry up! Let's show him what we brought back from our little trip into the weird!
Dialogue: Come on, bro! Hurry up! Let's show him what we brought back from our little trip into the weird!

Original: Materia Vendor: Ohh! It's you two!
Dialogue: Ohh! It's you two!

Original: Johnny: It's time, bro! The Sauce.
Dialogue: It's time, bro! The Sauce.

Original: Materia Vendor: Could it be...? It is! The Sauce! The Sauce! Whoa... Never thought I'd live to see the day...
Dialogue: Could it be...? It is! The Sauce! The Sauce! Whoa... Never thought I'd live to see the day...

Original: Cloud: It's just sauce. No big deal.
Dialogue: It's just sauce. No big deal.

Original: Materia Vendor: Don't sell yourself short! This is only given to one who is truly a man among men.
Dialogue: Don't sell yourself short! This is only given to one who is truly a man among men.

Original: Cloud: I know.
Dialogue: I know.

Original: Johnny: Damn, bro! That's why you're such an awesome dude!
Dialogue: Damn, bro! That's why you're such an awesome dude!

Original: Materia Vendor: Oh, right... Hate to break it to you, but that thing you were looking for? Not here. It's long, long gone.
Dialogue: Oh, right... Hate to break it to you, but that thing you were looking for? Not here. It's long, long gone.

Original: Johnny: You shittin' me!?
Dialogue: You shittin' me!?

Original: Materia Vendor: Nope. Sorry. As I recall...the guy who runs the restaurant should have it.
Dialogue: Nope. Sorry. As I recall...the guy who runs the restaurant should have it.

Original: Johnny: Ugh... Well, I guess we know where we're headed next. Come on, bro!
Dialogue: Ugh... Well, I guess we know where we're headed next. Come on, bro!

Original: Materia Vendor: Well, that's that. Time to polish the ol' orbs, give them a spit shine so they positively sparkle!
Dialogue: Well, that's that. Time to polish the ol' orbs, give them a spit shine so they positively sparkle!

Original: Johnny: Restaurant up next, huh? Getting kinda hungry, actually. Do you smell that? I think it's coming from over there.
Dialogue: Restaurant up next, huh? Getting kinda hungry, actually. Do you smell that? I think it's coming from over there.

Original: Materia Vendor: Oh! An honor as always, sir!
Dialogue: Oh! An honor as always, sir!

Original: Johnny: Let's see what's on the menu today. Meat, fish, and...ooh, that special looks good.
Dialogue: Let's see what's on the menu today. Meat, fish, and...ooh, that special looks good.

Original: Johnny: Man, I like seriously don't know which one to get! I'm a decisive, but when it comes to food, it's a different story.
Dialogue: Man, I like seriously don't know which one to get! I'm a decisive, but when it comes to food, it's a different story.

Original: Johnny: Hey, wait for me! I still don't know what I wanna order yet!
Dialogue: Hey, wait for me! I still don't know what I wanna order yet!

Original: Restaurant Owner: Welcome! Feel free to take any open seats.
Dialogue: Welcome! Feel free to take any open seats.

Original: Johnny: Sorry, we're not here to eat. The materia guy gave you something, yeah? We want it.
Dialogue: Sorry, we're not here to eat. The materia guy gave you something, yeah? We want it.

Original: Restaurant Owner: Materia guy? Ohhh, you're here forthat. I'm surpriseddidn't take you for the type. Lemme ask you something. Either of you know anything about cooking?
Dialogue: Materia guy? Ohhh, you're here for that. I'm surprised—didn't take you for the type. Lemme ask you something. Either of you know anything about cooking?

Original: Johnny: Nope. Never cooked once.
Dialogue: Nope. Never cooked once.

Original: Restaurant Owner: That's too bad. For some reason, my food doesn't taste nearly as good as it used to. I was hoping one of you two might be able to help me figure it out. I've narrowed it down to the fridge, the stove, or the power supply, but I'm not sure what's to blame.
Dialogue: That's too bad. For some reason, my food doesn't taste nearly as good as it used to. I was hoping one of you two might be able to help me figure it out. I've narrowed it down to the fridge, the stove, or the power supply, but I'm not sure what's to blame.

Original: On-screen: Give him advice? (The higher level your magic materia, the better advice you'll give.)
Dialogue: Give him advice? (The higher level your magic materia, the better advice you'll give.)

Original: Johnny: Man, I seriously have no idea what it could be. This sucks.
Dialogue: Man, I seriously have no idea what it could be. This sucks.

Original: On-screen: The problem is... (Give advice based on your strongest magic materia.)
Dialogue: The problem is... (Give advice based on your strongest magic materia.)

Original: Johnny: You know...your fridge might be broken. Maybe it's not keeping the ingredients cold enough.
Dialogue: You know...your fridge might be broken. Maybe it's not keeping the ingredients cold enough.

Original: Restaurant Owner: That so? You're an expert on all things ice? Okay then. Let's see if we can't fix this by fiddling with the temperature.
Dialogue: That so? You're an expert on all things ice? Okay then. Let's see if we can't fix this by fiddling with the temperature.

Original: Restaurant Owner: Hmm... At a glance everything looks fine to me.
Dialogue: Hmm... At a glance everything looks fine to me.

Original: Restaurant Owner: Here! Eat up!
Dialogue: Here! Eat up!

Original: Johnny: Man, this looks great!
Dialogue: Man, this looks great!

Original: Johnny: I can't...
Dialogue: I can't...

Original: Restaurant Owner: What a shame. He seemed to be enjoying the meal so I wanted to ask him what he thought. Maybe next time. Anyway, thanks for your help. Ohand here's a voucher with my apologies. Get the poor guy some medicine, will ya?
Dialogue: What a shame. He seemed to be enjoying the meal so I wanted to ask him what he thought. Maybe next time. Anyway, thanks for your help. Oh—and here's a voucher with my apologies. Get the poor guy some medicine, will ya?

Original: Johnny: Drugs...I need all the drugs right now! Outta the way! Outta the goddamn way! N-no... Can't go...
Dialogue: Drugs...I need all the drugs right now! Outta the way! Outta the goddamn way! N-no... Can't go...

Original: Cloud: Hey. About that thing we're looking for...
Dialogue: Hey. About that thing we're looking for...

Original: Restaurant Owner: Maybe I should fine-tune the flavor moregive it something extra to punch it up? Now what did I do with those spices I ordered from Wutai? I know there's some left...
Dialogue: Maybe I should fine-tune the flavor more—give it something extra to punch it up? Now what did I do with those spices I ordered from Wutai? I know there's some left...

Original: Cloud: I should help Johnny first.
Dialogue: I should help Johnny first.

Original: Johnny: Goodbye, cruel world...
Dialogue: Goodbye, cruel world...

Original: Pharmacist: Hey! Off my doorstep, you bum! You're scaring away my customers.
Dialogue: Hey! Off my doorstep, you bum! You're scaring away my customers.

Original: Johnny: Sanctuary...
Dialogue: Sanctuary...

Original: Pharmacist: Hey, you. This yours?
Dialogue: Hey, you. This yours?

Original: Cloud: Well...
Dialogue: Well...

Original: Pharmacist: Oh, that a voucher you got there? Should've said something sooner. Come on in.
Dialogue: Oh, that a voucher you got there? Should've said something sooner. Come on in.

Original: Pharmacist: What is it with today? People are dropping like flies.
Dialogue: What is it with today? People are dropping like flies.

Original: Cloud: Besides this dumbass?
Dialogue: Besides this dumbass?

Original: Pharmacist: Loads of 'em. I got enough outstanding orders to fill a book. I was about to leave and make some deliveries, but...
Dialogue: Loads of 'em. I got enough outstanding orders to fill a book. I was about to leave and make some deliveries, but...

Original: Johnny: I'm gonna hurl...
Dialogue: I'm gonna hurl...

Original: Pharmacist: Can't very well leave him alone now, can I? Hey, you're not doing much. Maybe you can deliver that medicine for me. You're, what, military or something, right? Then you must know a thing or two about dealing with the sick and injured.
Dialogue: Can't very well leave him alone now, can I? Hey, you're not doing much. Maybe you can deliver that medicine for me. You're, what, military or something, right? Then you must know a thing or two about dealing with the sick and injured.

Original: On-screen: Deliver the medicine? (The higher level your cleansing materia, the more help you'll be.)
Dialogue: Deliver the medicine? (The higher level your cleansing materia, the more help you'll be.)

Original: Pharmacist: You're a lifesaverliterally. So, lemme see, what needs delivering... Hereneed you to deliver this to someone. You'll probably find this guy sprawled out on the ground somewhere. But make sure you check his symptoms before giving him meds.
Dialogue: You're a lifesaver—literally. So, lemme see, what needs delivering... Here—need you to deliver this to someone. You'll probably find this guy sprawled out on the ground somewhere. But make sure you check his symptoms before giving him meds.

Original: Johnny: Can't...go on...
Dialogue: Can't...go on...

Original: Patient: It was poisoned, I tell ya. The sick sonuvabitch puts poison in his food...
Dialogue: It was poisoned, I tell ya. The sick sonuvabitch puts poison in his food...

Original: Cloud: I've got meds. Lemme take a look at you.
Dialogue: I've got meds. Lemme take a look at you.

Original: Patient: Thanks, buddy! You saved my life. Here, it's not much, but it's yours. ...I'm grateful for your help but...do you think a guy could get a little privacy?
Dialogue: Thanks, buddy! You saved my life. Here, it's not much, but it's yours. ...I'm grateful for your help but...do you think a guy could get a little privacy?

Original: Cloud: Should probably head back.
Dialogue: Should probably head back.

Original: Johnny: And then there was this crazy-looking house, right? And it was all like trying to kill 'em! But then Cloud was all like bing, bang, boom!
Dialogue: And then there was this crazy-looking house, right? And it was all like trying to kill 'em! But then Cloud was all like bing, bang, boom!

Original: Pharmacist: Your friend fought...a house? A house?
Dialogue: Your friend fought...a house? A house?

Original: Johnny: Oh, hey! Welcome back, bro.
Dialogue: Oh, hey! Welcome back, bro.

Original: Cloud: Better already?
Dialogue: Better already?

Original: Pharmacist: Yeah, and now he won't shut up. Anyway, how'd the deliveries go?
Dialogue: Yeah, and now he won't shut up. Anyway, how'd the deliveries go?

Original: Cloud: I did about as much as I could.
Dialogue: I did about as much as I could.

Original: Pharmacist: Thanks for the help. And great work. Anyway, I promised it'd be worth your while. Here, Iv'e got something you're definitely gonna like.
Dialogue: Thanks for the help. And great work. Anyway, I promised it'd be worth your while. Here, Iv'e got something you're definitely gonna like.

Original: Johnny: What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: Pharmacist: Well, it belonged to the owner of the clothing store first. Heard from the cook that you boys been running all over town looking for this, am I right?
Dialogue: Well, it belonged to the owner of the clothing store first. Heard from the cook that you boys been running all over town looking for this, am I right?

Original: Johnny: Wait, we have? Hold up. What were we doing before all this? Oh shit! The inspiration!
Dialogue: Wait, we have? Hold up. What were we doing before all this? Oh shit! The inspiration!

Original: Pharmacist: Bingo. Y'see, all us Wall Market entrepreneurs go way back. We get together for a game every night, bet all kinds of stuff. This found its way into the pool, and eventually into my possession. And now it's yours, 'cause heywhy the hell not. It's a VIP card, highly coveted and extremely rare. They're only given to a select few. Not that having it's gonna do you much good, but...
Dialogue: Bingo. Y'see, all us Wall Market entrepreneurs go way back. We get together for a game every night, bet all kinds of stuff. This found its way into the pool, and eventually into my possession. And now it's yours, 'cause hey—why the hell not. It's a VIP card, highly coveted and extremely rare. They're only given to a select few. Not that having it's gonna do you much good, but...

Original: Johnny: Holy mother of... No way! Bro! We gotta get to the Honeyer, um, I mean Drunkards' on the double!
Dialogue: Holy mother of... No way! Bro! We gotta get to the Honey—er, um, I mean Drunkards' on the double!

Original: Pharmacist: Tell the old man I said hi!
Dialogue: Tell the old man I said hi!

Original: Johnny: C'mon, bro. Get a move on!
Dialogue: C'mon, bro. Get a move on!

Original: Johnny: C'mon, c'mon, c'mon! I gotta know!
Dialogue: C'mon, c'mon, c'mon! I gotta know!

Original: Johnny: You still got the inspiration, right? You didn't lose it!?
Dialogue: You still got the inspiration, right? You didn't lose it!?

Original: Johnny: My heart is beating so fast, bro. Like it's gonna burst right outta my chest!
Dialogue: My heart is beating so fast, bro. Like it's gonna burst right outta my chest!

Original: Johnny: Hey, old dude. We're back!
Dialogue: Hey, old dude. We're back!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Huh? Who're you? You're no son of mine. I think.
Dialogue: Huh? Who're you? You're no son of mine. I think.

Original: Johnny: Special deliveryjust for you.
Dialogue: Special delivery—just for you.

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Hoho! My inspiration! You've returned to me at long last!
Dialogue: Hoho! My inspiration! You've returned to me at long last!

Original: Johnny: Yo, is that...what I think it is...?
Dialogue: Yo, is that...what I think it is...?

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Oh you bet it is. And it was hard won! I sewed dresses day and night for those ladies, until I got what I was after. A Honeybee Inn VIP card!
Dialogue: Oh you bet it is. And it was hard won! I sewed dresses day and night for those ladies, until I got what I was after. A Honeybee Inn VIP card!

Original: Johnny: I knew it!
Dialogue: I knew it!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Now make way for the VIP, boys. I don't wanna keep my ladies waiting any longer! But firstI should pick up a gift dress!
Dialogue: Now make way for the VIP, boys. I don't wanna keep my ladies waiting any longer! But first—I should pick up a gift dress!

Original: Johnny: Lead the way, old dude. We are comin'!
Dialogue: Lead the way, old dude. We are comin'!

Original: Johnny: Hey, how's about this?
Dialogue: Hey, how's about this?

Original: Clothing Store Owner's Son: Well, thanks for bringing him back. Can't imagine what you went through. Here, you earned it.
Dialogue: Well, thanks for bringing him back. Can't imagine what you went through. Here, you earned it.

Original: Johnny: Heyyou're coming, right bro? Get ready for arealWall Market education!
Dialogue: Hey—you're coming, right bro? Get ready for a real Wall Market education!

Original: Cloud: I'm done with this. Youyou can do whatever the hell you want.
Dialogue: I'm done with this. You—you can do whatever the hell you want.

Original: Johnny: I get it, bro. You're scared. It's only natural for people to fear the unknown. It's a pity you're not gonna join us, but I swear to you, bro, as an aspiring Wall Market connoisseur... I'm gonna go in there and get as much inspiration as I can handle. For you, bro! For you! Because Cloudyou are my one true bro. Honeybee Inn, here I come!
Dialogue: I get it, bro. You're scared. It's only natural for people to fear the unknown. It's a pity you're not gonna join us, but I swear to you, bro, as an aspiring Wall Market connoisseur... I'm gonna go in there and get as much inspiration as I can handle. For you, bro! For you! Because Cloud—you are my one true bro. Honeybee Inn, here I come!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Inspiration, here I come!
Dialogue: Inspiration, here I come!

Original: Clothing Store Owner's Son: Perfect example of how age has absolutely nothing to do with maturity.
Dialogue: Perfect example of how age has absolutely nothing to do with maturity.

Original: Cloud: Couldn't agree more. Should probably go see Sam again.
Dialogue: Couldn't agree more. Should probably go see Sam again.

Original: Clothing Store Owner's Son: My dad is one amazing designer! At least, he would be if he ever actually did some work.
Dialogue: My dad is one amazing designer! At least, he would be if he ever actually did some work.

Original: Johnny: Hey, how's about this?
Dialogue: Hey, how's about this?

Original: Clothing Store Owner: What're you, crazy? This one's much better!
Dialogue: What're you, crazy? This one's much better!

Original: Johnny: Hot damn, old dude. Y-you made this one, too?
Dialogue: Hot damn, old dude. Y-you made this one, too?

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Now you see why all the ladies love and adore me? Tonight, you're with the VIP. I'll teach you all the right moves, all the ways to make 'em swoon!
Dialogue: Now you see why all the ladies love and adore me? Tonight, you're with the VIP. I'll teach you all the right moves, all the ways to make 'em swoon!

Original: Johnny: Yessir! I'll be your most loyal pupil, I swear it!
Dialogue: Yessir! I'll be your most loyal pupil, I swear it!

Original: Clothing Store Owner: Huh? You wanna help us pick a dress? Alrighty, what d'you think of this real skimpy one here?
Dialogue: Huh? You wanna help us pick a dress? Alrighty, what d'you think of this real skimpy one here?

Original: Johnny: This silky one over here's kinda nice, too!
Dialogue: This silky one over here's kinda nice, too!

Original: Sam: So, tell me. What'd you see in our little enclave of sin and debauchery? Bet it was an eye-opening experience.
Dialogue: So, tell me. What'd you see in our little enclave of sin and debauchery? Bet it was an eye-opening experience.

Original: Cloud: Nothing I haven't seen before. That it for jobs?
Dialogue: Nothing I haven't seen before. That it for jobs?

Original: Sam: Not exactly. I got one more favor to ask. You wanna get Tifa out, right?
Dialogue: Not exactly. I got one more favor to ask. You wanna get Tifa out, right?

Original: Cloud: What's your angle?
Dialogue: What's your angle?

Original: Sam: Heh, just get your ass to the colosseum. You'll see.
Dialogue: Heh, just get your ass to the colosseum. You'll see.

Original: Sam: Heh, just get your ass to the colosseum. You'll see.
Dialogue: Heh, just get your ass to the colosseum. You'll see.

Original: Gatekeeper: We've been waiting for you, champ!
Dialogue: We've been waiting for you, champ!

Original: On-screen: Take on which challenge?
Dialogue: Take on which challenge?

Original: Gatekeeper: Stands are packed, thanks to you! Now get out there and give 'em a show!
Dialogue: Stands are packed, thanks to you! Now get out there and give 'em a show!

Original: Gatekeeper: Lovers of bloodshed and mayhem! Your favorite champion, Cloud, is back in the ring! Right now, this boy may be hot, hot, hot... But look out, folks, 'cause these dynamite challengers may just blow the champ clean off his throne! I hope you brought shades because you're about to see some fireworks! Fighters...begin!
Dialogue: Lovers of bloodshed and mayhem! Your favorite champion, Cloud, is back in the ring! Right now, this boy may be hot, hot, hot... But look out, folks, 'cause these dynamite challengers may just blow the champ clean off his throne! I hope you brought shades because you're about to see some fireworks! Fighters...begin!

Original: Gatekeeper: The reigning champ does it again! Was that hot enough for you, fight fans? Did the champ bring the heat!? Indeed he didhe proved there's nothing more explosive than the guns he's packing!
Dialogue: The reigning champ does it again! Was that hot enough for you, fight fans? Did the champ bring the heat!? Indeed he did—he proved there's nothing more explosive than the guns he's packing!

Original: Sam: Nice going, champ. You were in fine form today. Here's your cut. You earned it.
Dialogue: Nice going, champ. You were in fine form today. Here's your cut. You earned it.

Original: Cloud: Not here for the cash. Tell me about Tifa.
Dialogue: Not here for the cash. Tell me about Tifa.

Original: Sam: Ahh, Tifa... She's something of a bombshell herself, huh? Girl keeps in shape, and boy does it show.
Dialogue: Ahh, Tifa... She's something of a bombshell herself, huh? Girl keeps in shape, and boy does it show.

Original: Cloud: Hey.
Dialogue: Hey.

Original: Sam: Just making an observation, that's all. Anyway, seems like you're serious about getting the poor girl out of her predicament. I could tell easy enough by the way you fought back there.
Dialogue: Just making an observation, that's all. Anyway, seems like you're serious about getting the poor girl out of her predicament. I could tell easy enough by the way you fought back there.

Original: Cloud: Cut to the chase. Well? You helping or not?
Dialogue: Cut to the chase. Well? You helping or not?

Original: Sam: Never said I wouldopposite, even. Getting mixed up in other people's business isn't my way. Plus... As you are now, I reckon you could ride to her rescue without anybody's help. And that's the truth. You've changed since you first rolled into this here town. For the better.
Dialogue: Never said I would—opposite, even. Getting mixed up in other people's business isn't my way. Plus... As you are now, I reckon you could ride to her rescue without anybody's help. And that's the truth. You've changed since you first rolled into this here town. For the better.

Original: Sam: At any rate, I've said all I'm gonna say. Your lady friend oughta be done changing by now, am I right? She ain't no Tifa, but she is a firecracker. Keep her waiting too long and she might just blow up in your face.
Dialogue: At any rate, I've said all I'm gonna say. Your lady friend oughta be done changing by now, am I right? She ain't no Tifa, but she is a firecracker. Keep her waiting too long and she might just blow up in your face.

Original: Stablehand: The Angel of the Slums strikes again! It even says so on the card!
Dialogue: The Angel of the Slums strikes again! It even says so on the card!

Original: Mireille: Oh, don't be an idiot! The Angel would never stoop so low as to steal from children! I'm telling you, I saw the real culprits.
Dialogue: Oh, don't be an idiot! The Angel would never stoop so low as to steal from children! I'm telling you, I saw the real culprits.

Original: Stablehand: You're saying there's multiple Angels on the loose?
Dialogue: You're saying there's multiple Angels on the loose?

Original: Mireille: What? No there's not!
Dialogue: What? No there's not!

Original: Stablehand: Then the Angel of the Slums is their leader!?
Dialogue: Then the Angel of the Slums is their leader!?

Original: Mireille: Hell no!
Dialogue: Hell no!

Original: Stablehand: Hmph! How can you be so sure?
Dialogue: Hmph! How can you be so sure?

Original: Mireille: How can you!?
Dialogue: How can you!?

Original: Mireille: Madam M told me about a merc. That you? Maybe you can help us sort this out. Some criminals have stolen a shipment of donations bound for the Leaf House. The fiends!
Dialogue: Madam M told me about a merc. That you? Maybe you can help us sort this out. Some criminals have stolen a shipment of donations bound for the Leaf House. The fiends!

Original: Stablehand: The culprit is none other than the notorious Angel of the Slums. People worship her as some kind of folk hero, but there's no denying she's the one that done did it! I mean, look at this calling card. "The Garden Angle Three"...? Well they must've meant to write "Guardian Angel"!
Dialogue: The culprit is none other than the notorious Angel of the Slums. People worship her as some kind of folk hero, but there's no denying she's the one that done did it! I mean, look at this calling card. "The Garden Angle Three"...? Well they must've meant to write "Guardian Angel"!

Original: Mireille: Oh, come on! "Garden angle"!? Listen to me. I guarantee this is not the work of the Angel. I saw it with my own eyes. Three shady-looking types wandering around, scouting their mark I bet.
Dialogue: Oh, come on! "Garden angle"!? Listen to me. I guarantee this is not the work of the Angel. I saw it with my own eyes. Three shady-looking types wandering around, scouting their mark I bet.

Original: Stablehand: Well if you're so sure then bring 'em here! Prove to me this wasn't the work of your beloved "Guardian Angel"!
Dialogue: Well if you're so sure then bring 'em here! Prove to me this wasn't the work of your beloved "Guardian Angel"!

Original: Mireille: You heard the man, merc. I've got to find those thieves to clear the Angel's nameand I need your help to do it. She would never, ever, do anything to harm the less fortunate. Find the three I saw and bring them here to me. They ran off toward the old expressway on the other side of Evergreen Park.
Dialogue: You heard the man, merc. I've got to find those thieves to clear the Angel's name—and I need your help to do it. She would never, ever, do anything to harm the less fortunate. Find the three I saw and bring them here to me. They ran off toward the old expressway on the other side of Evergreen Park.

Original: Mireille: The expressway's just past Evergreen Park. Hurrythose thieves've got a head start. They won't catch themselves!
Dialogue: The expressway's just past Evergreen Park. Hurry—those thieves've got a head start. They won't catch themselves!

Original: Beck: (laughs) The garden angel strikes again! Suckers! And all it took was one fake card. Too easy! (laughs)
Dialogue: (laughs) The garden angel strikes again! Suckers! And all it took was one fake card. Too easy! (laughs)

Original: Burke: Sucks to be you, Miss Angel, but we're stealing your name and all that sweet loot!
Dialogue: Sucks to be you, Miss Angel, but we're stealing your name and all that sweet loot!

Original: Beck: Hey! It's you!
Dialogue: Hey! It's you!

Original: Burke: The hell you doin' comin' after us!?
Dialogue: The hell you doin' comin' after us!?

Original: Butch: Shit! Um...play dead. Play dead!
Dialogue: Shit! Um...play dead. Play dead!

Original: Beck: Shuddup! It's too late for that. Bring it. We're ready for you this time! Wakey wakey! Time to shine.
Dialogue: Shuddup! It's too late for that. Bring it. We're ready for you this time! Wakey wakey! Time to shine.

Original: Beck: Check out this brick shithouse! We picked him up at the colosseum! Gonna pay you back doublenah, quadruple for what you done to us!
Dialogue: Check out this brick shithouse! We picked him up at the colosseum! Gonna pay you back double—nah, quadruple for what you done to us!

Original: Butch: What's a droople? I, uh...what are we doing!?
Dialogue: What's a droople? I, uh...what are we doing!?

Original: Burke: Uh... Sh-shut up! We're kicking blondie's ass for bein' an ass!
Dialogue: Uh... Sh-shut up! We're kicking blondie's ass for bein' an ass!

Original: Cloud: You're coming with me.
Dialogue: You're coming with me.

Original: Stablehand: These are the Angels of the Slums...?
Dialogue: These are the Angels of the Slums...?

Original: Butch: Oh man, you're real stupid! We're the garden angels! Get it right!
Dialogue: Oh man, you're real stupid! We're the garden angels! Get it right!

Original: Beck: Shut your trap, moron!
Dialogue: Shut your trap, moron!

Original: Mireille: Hmph, you don't honestly thing that the beloved Angel of the Slums could be any of these three idiots, do you?
Dialogue: Hmph, you don't honestly thing that the beloved Angel of the Slums could be any of these three idiots, do you?

Original: Stablehand: Nah, I recognize the masks. These guys're just small-time crooks who've been pestering folks around here for a minute. Should've listened to you earlier. Sorry about this.
Dialogue: Nah, I recognize the masks. These guys're just small-time crooks who've been pestering folks around here for a minute. Should've listened to you earlier. Sorry about this.

Original: Mireille: Well, you should be sorry. I'll consider us square once you've taught these boys a lesson.
Dialogue: Well, you should be sorry. I'll consider us square once you've taught these boys a lesson.

Original: Stablehand: Deal. All right. Get moving!
Dialogue: Deal. All right. Get moving!

Original: Beck: Hey, watch it! Not so rough, you lummox.
Dialogue: Hey, watch it! Not so rough, you lummox.

Original: Butch: Yeah, you lummox! You lum...mucks?
Dialogue: Yeah, you lummox! You lum...mucks?

Original: Cloud: So what about the donations? Do you need help taking them to the Leaf House?
Dialogue: So what about the donations? Do you need help taking them to the Leaf House?

Original: Mireille: Kind of you to offer, but I can manage on my own. I know these streets like the back of my hand. Better, even.
Dialogue: Kind of you to offer, but I can manage on my own. I know these streets like the back of my hand. Better, even.

Original: Staff: It's the Angel of the Slums! She took the don's stuff! He's gonna be pissed!
Dialogue: It's the Angel of the Slums! She took the don's stuff! He's gonna be pissed!

Original: Mireille: Well, I'll be seeing ya. Thanks to you, we can put this mess behind us. I'm grateful.
Dialogue: Well, I'll be seeing ya. Thanks to you, we can put this mess behind us. I'm grateful.

Original: Cloud: "The Guardian Angel of the Slums, radiant defender of the downtrodden"...? Huh. Wonder if I'm an accomplice.
Dialogue: "The Guardian Angel of the Slums, radiant defender of the downtrodden"...? Huh. Wonder if I'm an accomplice.

Original: Cloud: That's enough of that. Should head on back to Madam M.
Dialogue: That's enough of that. Should head on back to Madam M.

Original: Gatekeeper: Why hey there, champ! Got word from Madam M. She said you had time to kill before Aerith's ready for the big event. So, uh...whaddya say to taking on a little extra work while you're waiting around? We've got a helluva lotta fans clamoring to see their favorite champ go another round or ten. And something tells me they're not gonna rest until they see you kick ass again. Now get on down to the colosseum ASAP!
Dialogue: Why hey there, champ! Got word from Madam M. She said you had time to kill before Aerith's ready for the big event. So, uh...whaddya say to taking on a little extra work while you're waiting around? We've got a helluva lotta fans clamoring to see their favorite champ go another round or ten. And something tells me they're not gonna rest until they see you kick ass again. Now get on down to the colosseum ASAP!

Original: Gatekeeper: Here he is, the man of the hour!
Dialogue: Here he is, the man of the hour!

Original: On-screen: Take on which challenge?
Dialogue: Take on which challenge?

Original: Gatekeeper: Stands are packed, thanks to you! Now get out there and give 'em a show!
Dialogue: Stands are packed, thanks to you! Now get out there and give 'em a show!

Original: Gatekeeper: This challenger wanted another bite at the champ! One of Sam's favorite machines of mayhem, Cutty! He's been sharpening his blades and dreaming of payback! Can our champ come out on top again? Fighters...begin!
Dialogue: This challenger wanted another bite at the champ! One of Sam's favorite machines of mayhem, Cutty! He's been sharpening his blades and dreaming of payback! Can our champ come out on top again? Fighters...begin!

Original: Gatekeeper: Our champ stands victorious once more! Cloud wins! Cutty's quest for sweet revenge has ended in bitter defeat!
Dialogue: Our champ stands victorious once more! Cloud wins! Cutty's quest for sweet revenge has ended in bitter defeat!

Original: Madam M: Very nicely done! (chuckles) Here's your cutyou earned it.
Dialogue: Very nicely done! (chuckles) Here's your cut—you earned it.

Original: Cloud: Wait, you're here? What about Aerith?
Dialogue: Wait, you're here? What about Aerith?

Original: Madam M: My people are working on her hair right now. I thought I'd take the opportunity to drop by and watch your match. (laughs) I have to admit, I never get tired of seeing Sam's precious toys take a beating.
Dialogue: My people are working on her hair right now. I thought I'd take the opportunity to drop by and watch your match. (laughs) I have to admit, I never get tired of seeing Sam's precious toys take a beating.

Original: Cloud: ...That right?
Dialogue: ...That right?

Original: Madam M: I can tell by your hands you've come a long way. They're the hands of a fighter...who has found new purpose. A woman...or two? I wonder...
Dialogue: I can tell by your hands you've come a long way. They're the hands of a fighter...who has found new purpose. A woman...or two? I wonder...

Original: Cloud: Just doing what I've always done.
Dialogue: Just doing what I've always done.

Original: Madam M: (chuckles) Anyway, Aerith should be finishing up soon. I'll go on ahead to check on her. Whenever you're ready, come back to the parlor.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Anyway, Aerith should be finishing up soon. I'll go on ahead to check on her. Whenever you're ready, come back to the parlor.

Original: On-screen: Check in on Aerith?
Dialogue: Check in on Aerith?

Original: Johnny: Nooo!
Dialogue: Nooo!

Original: Johnny: Cloud! Finally! Tifa! SheI Tifa! She-she'sI don't
Dialogue: Cloud! Finally! Tifa! She—I— Tifa! She-she's—I don't—

Original: Cloud: Take a deep breath. What about Tifa?
Dialogue: Take a deep breath. What about Tifa?

Original: Johnny: I heard Corneo was gonna audition new girls soon, and Tifa's...Tifa's gonna be I just...I-I don't know what to do.
Dialogue: I heard Corneo was gonna audition new girls soon, and Tifa's...Tifa's gonna be— I just...I-I don't know what to do.

Original: Cloud: Well I do.
Dialogue: Well I do.

Original: Johnny: I'll come too!
Dialogue: I'll come too!

Original: Johnny: Hey Cloud! Bro! I can call you bro, right?
Dialogue: Hey Cloud! Bro! I can call you bro, right?

Original: Cloud: Nope.
Dialogue: Nope.

Original: Johnny: Just wanna say, bro, that I'm totally relieved that you're looking out for Tifa. So like, how'd you get so strong anyway, bro?
Dialogue: Just wanna say, bro, that I'm totally relieved that you're looking out for Tifa. So like, how'd you get so strong anyway, bro?

Original: Cloud: I said
Dialogue: I said—

Original: Johnny: The way you fight, bro, is like poetry and violence! "Bam! Bam! Whoosh whoosh!" You know? I really wish I could be just like you. My problem is that I tend to overthink and overanalyze everything. Sobro, do you have any advice for a smart, stand-up guy like myself?
Dialogue: The way you fight, bro, is like poetry and violence! "Bam! Bam! Whoosh whoosh!" You know? I really wish I could be just like you. My problem is that I tend to overthink and overanalyze everything. So—bro, do you have any advice for a smart, stand-up guy like myself?

Original: Cloud: No.
Dialogue: No.

Original: Johnny: Well, this is it for me. Call me crazy, but...I have a feeling that I'll just be getting in the way.
Dialogue: Well, this is it for me. Call me crazy, but...I have a feeling that I'll just be getting in the way.

Original: Cloud: Go find Aerith at Madam M's. Tell her to wait for me there once she's done. Think you can handle that?
Dialogue: Go find Aerith at Madam M's. Tell her to wait for me there once she's done. Think you can handle that?

Original: Johnny: Yessir!
Dialogue: Yessir!

Original: Leslie: You again.
Dialogue: You again.

Original: Leslie: You know that's only good for women, right?
Dialogue: You know that's only good for women, right?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. It's for Aerith.
Dialogue: Yeah. It's for Aerith.

Original: Leslie: Who? Oh, that girl you were with. Sorry to hear that. Well, either way, you're stuck out here, pal. I can't let you in.
Dialogue: Who? Oh, that girl you were with. Sorry to hear that. Well, either way, you're stuck out here, pal. I can't let you in.

Original: Cloud: I wasn't asking for permission.
Dialogue: I wasn't asking for permission.

Original: Leslie: Wouldn't try it if I were you. Trust me, you don't wanna screw with the don. If you even think about causing trouble, he'll make sure someone pays for it. And that "someone" might wind up being the girl you're trying so hard to break out. Or it could wind up being someone you've never even met before. Get it? You're in the don's world now. Anyway, you've got some time. The audition won't start for a while. If you're sure you wanna go through with this, then bring the girl and the letter. But...if I were you, I wouldn't.
Dialogue: Wouldn't try it if I were you. Trust me, you don't wanna screw with the don. If you even think about causing trouble, he'll make sure someone pays for it. And that "someone" might wind up being the girl you're trying so hard to break out. Or it could wind up being someone you've never even met before. Get it? You're in the don's world now. Anyway, you've got some time. The audition won't start for a while. If you're sure you wanna go through with this, then bring the girl and the letter. But...if I were you, I wouldn't.

Original: Leslie: Go on, get outta here.
Dialogue: Go on, get outta here.

Original: Johnny: Hey, get outta the way! Quit gawking! Move it, move it! C'mon! Yo, clear the road!
Dialogue: Hey, get outta the way! Quit gawking! Move it, move it! C'mon! Yo, clear the road!

Original: Johnny: Ma'am.
Dialogue: Ma'am.

Original: Aerith: Heya...
Dialogue: Heya...

Original: Cloud: Uh, Aerith? What are you wearing?
Dialogue: Uh, Aerith? What are you wearing?

Original: Aerith: I know right? It's bad. Like, super bad. I've been trying to figure out if there was anything more I could've done with it, but...
Dialogue: I know right? It's bad. Like, super bad. I've been trying to figure out if there was anything more I could've done with it, but...

Original: Cloud: Doesn't really matter if you get picked or not anyway.
Dialogue: Doesn't really matter if you get picked or not anyway.

Original: Aerith: Yeah, but still... You put a lot of work into this.
Dialogue: Yeah, but still... You put a lot of work into this.

Original: Aerith: ...Did you put a lot of work into this?
Dialogue: ...Did you put a lot of work into this?

Original: Aerith: Heya.
Dialogue: Heya.

Original: Cloud: Hey. What are you wearing?
Dialogue: Hey. What are you wearing?

Original: Aerith: I hear Corneo likes his girls super-duper girly and dolled up. But I thought he might appreciate something a little more down to earth for a change.
Dialogue: I hear Corneo likes his girls super-duper girly and dolled up. But I thought he might appreciate something a little more down to earth for a change.

Original: Aerith: What, you don't like it?
Dialogue: What, you don't like it?

Original: Cloud: I...didn't say that.
Dialogue: I...didn't say that.

Original: Aerith: Then...does that mean you do like it?
Dialogue: Then...does that mean you do like it?

Original: Cloud: Uh...
Dialogue: Uh...

Original: Aerith: Heya.
Dialogue: Heya.

Original: Cloud: That's really...
Dialogue: That's really...

Original: Aerith: Yeah. Corneo's got certain...tastes. This dress is so gaudy and impossible to move in...
Dialogue: Yeah. Corneo's got certain...tastes. This dress is so gaudy and impossible to move in...

Original: Cloud: Y-yeah...
Dialogue: Y-yeah...

Original: Aerith: Cloud!?
Dialogue: Cloud!?

Original: Cloud: 'Scuse me.
Dialogue: Scuse me.

Original: Cloud: Hey, wait a minute. Did Johnny forget to give you my message?
Dialogue: Hey, wait a minute. Did Johnny forget to give you my message?

Original: Aerith: The one asking me to stay put? No, I got it. I was worried about you.
Dialogue: The one asking me to stay put? No, I got it. I was worried about you.

Original: Cloud: I'm starting to think this place is more dangerous than we thought. Who knows what they'll ask you to do in this "audition." No way in hell I'll let you go in there by yourself.
Dialogue: I'm starting to think this place is more dangerous than we thought. Who knows what they'll ask you to do in this "audition." No way in hell I'll let you go in there by yourself.

Original: Aerith: By myself? Oh, don't worry, I wasn't gonna. Come on. You'll see.
Dialogue: By myself? Oh, don't worry, I wasn't gonna. Come on. You'll see.

Original: Cloud: See what, exactly?
Dialogue: See what, exactly?

Original: Aerith: According to Madam M, you've caught the eye of a certain fabulous someone, and they'd like to meet in person.
Dialogue: According to Madam M, you've caught the eye of a certain fabulous someone, and they'd like to meet in person.

Original: Cloud: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Loitering Man: Look at you all dolled up and fabulous. Where are you headed tonight?
Dialogue: Look at you all dolled up and fabulous. Where are you headed tonight?

Original: Sweet Old Man: Well, what do we have here? You're quite the pretty little lady.
Dialogue: Well, what do we have here? You're quite the pretty little lady.

Original: Man in Love: Huh. She's not bad at all.
Dialogue: Huh. She's not bad at all.

Original: Woman in Love: What? Say that again.
Dialogue: What? Say that again.

Original: Man in Love: Don't be like that. You're still the most beautiful girl in the world. And I'm lucky to be with you.
Dialogue: Don't be like that. You're still the most beautiful girl in the world. And I'm lucky to be with you.

Original: Woman in Love: Ohh, I can never stay mad at you!
Dialogue: Ohh, I can never stay mad at you!

Original: Womanizer: Hey there, cutie. Where you headed? Why don't you let me buy you a cup of coffee?
Dialogue: Hey there, cutie. Where you headed? Why don't you let me buy you a cup of coffee?

Original: Critical Woman: Hmm... I give her a B for effort.
Dialogue: Hmm... I give her a B for effort.

Original: Sharp-Tongued Woman: That dress is completely overshadowing her. She's got a lot to learn.
Dialogue: That dress is completely overshadowing her. She's got a lot to learn.

Original: Poet: You are like the beautiful flower that blooms under the brilliant moonlight.
Dialogue: You are like the beautiful flower that blooms under the brilliant moonlight.

Original: Cloud: Why are we here?
Dialogue: Why are we here?

Original: Aerith: To see the Honeybee Inn's Andrea Rhodea, and convince him to give you his stamp of approval. You said you didn't want me going alone, right? Well, with Andrea's help, you can join me. It'll be fun! And honestly, I think you'll look pretty cute in a dress.
Dialogue: To see the Honeybee Inn's Andrea Rhodea, and convince him to give you his stamp of approval. You said you didn't want me going alone, right? Well, with Andrea's help, you can join me. It'll be fun! And honestly, I think you'll look pretty cute in a dress.

Original: Cloud: What!?
Dialogue: What!?

Original: Aerith: It's pretty rare for Andrea to take a personal interest in someone. At least, that's what Madam M said. Trust me, this is gonna work out great.
Dialogue: It's pretty rare for Andrea to take a personal interest in someone. At least, that's what Madam M said. Trust me, this is gonna work out great.

Original: Cloud: Uhh...
Dialogue: Uhh...

Original: Aerith: C'mon. Don't you wanna save Tifa?
Dialogue: C'mon. Don't you wanna save Tifa?

Original: Cloud: Wait
Dialogue: Wait—

Original: Aerith: No can do, Cloud. This is our plan, and you'll learn to love it. So! Here's how I think we should approach him. Madam M said Andrea was a man who'd give anyone a fair chance to win him over. So I say we march right up to him, explain the situation, and see where that gets us. Sound good?
Dialogue: No can do, Cloud. This is our plan, and you'll learn to love it. So! Here's how I think we should approach him. Madam M said Andrea was a man who'd give anyone a fair chance to win him over. So I say we march right up to him, explain the situation, and see where that gets us. Sound good?

Original: Aerith: C'mon. Don't you wanna save Tifa?
Dialogue: C'mon. Don't you wanna save Tifa?

Original: Receptionist: Good evening. Welcome to the entertainment extravaganza that is the Honeybee Inn.
Dialogue: Good evening. Welcome to the entertainment extravaganza that is the Honeybee Inn.

Original: Cloud: We're here to see Andrea Rhodea.
Dialogue: We're here to see Andrea Rhodea.

Original: Receptionist: You must be Mr. Cloud. He's waiting for you.
Dialogue: You must be Mr. Cloud. He's waiting for you.

Original: Cloud: "Mr. Cloud"?
Dialogue: "Mr. Cloud"?

Original: Receptionist: I've been instructed to send you through without delay, sir. Please make your way to the stage in the back.
Dialogue: I've been instructed to send you through without delay, sir. Please make your way to the stage in the back.

Original: Cloud: What stage?
Dialogue: What stage?

Original: Receptionist: The one in the back, sir. Straight through those doors and down the hall.
Dialogue: The one in the back, sir. Straight through those doors and down the hall.

Original: Honeygirl: Watch the stinger, sweetie. What shape am I making?
Dialogue: Watch the stinger, sweetie. What shape am I making?

Original: Johnny's Father: Hmm... It's a circle.
Dialogue: Hmm... It's a circle.

Original: Johnny's Father: Huh? Who's there? Eh, whatever... I'm havin' trouble seein' straight. What's the answer?
Dialogue: Huh? Who's there? Eh, whatever... I'm havin' trouble seein' straight. What's the answer?

Original: On-screen: The shape is a...
Dialogue: The shape is a...

Original: Honeygirl: Ding ding ding ding ding! That's a right answer, baby!
Dialogue: Ding ding ding ding ding! That's a right answer, baby!

Original: Johnny's Father: Ya did it, boyo! I'm so damn proyd of ya.
Dialogue: Ya did it, boyo! I'm so damn proyd of ya.

Original: Honeygirl: Aww, that's a wrong answer, sweetie!
Dialogue: Aww, that's a wrong answer, sweetie!

Original: Johnny's Father: Man... You know what? You're useless...
Dialogue: Man... You know what? You're useless...

Original: Johnny's Father: Oh, I getcha. Ya wanna go for round two!
Dialogue: Oh, I getcha. Ya wanna go for round two!

Original: On-screen: Try again?
Dialogue: Try again?

Original: Johnny's Father: Huh? You're still here? But...why...?
Dialogue: Huh? You're still here? But...why...?

Original: Palmer: I'm gonna getcha!
Dialogue: I'm gonna getcha!

Original: Customer: Oh yeah, right there. That's the stuff!
Dialogue: Oh yeah, right there. That's the stuff!

Original: Honeygirl: Hey there, dollface! We've been waiting for ya! Come on in, have a seat!
Dialogue: Hey there, dollface! We've been waiting for ya! Come on in, have a seat!

Original: Cloud: No, I'm not here for
Dialogue: No, I'm not here for—

Original: Honeygirl: Huh? ...Oh, wait a minute. I think you might've wandered into the wrong room by mistake.
Dialogue: Huh? ...Oh, wait a minute. I think you might've wandered into the wrong room by mistake.

Original: Honeygirl (1): And here's the man of the hour!
Dialogue: And here's the man of the hour!

Original: Honeygirl (2): Chosen by Andrea himself.
Dialogue: Chosen by Andrea himself.

Original: Honeygirl (3): Our honored guest!
Dialogue: Our honored guest!

Original: On-screen: Head to the stage?
Dialogue: Head to the stage?

Original: Honeygirl (1): This is your first time, right? It's okay. Do you want to practice your dance moves first?
Dialogue: This is your first time, right? It's okay. Do you want to practice your dance moves first?

Original: Cloud: Why would I want do that?
Dialogue: Why would I want do that?

Original: Honeygirl (2): Andrea thought it might be a good idea.
Dialogue: Andrea thought it might be a good idea.

Original: Honeygirl (3): Over here, c'mon now!
Dialogue: Over here, c'mon now!

Original: Cloud: Hey! Hold on!
Dialogue: Hey! Hold on!

Original: Honeygirl: You've got real rhythm, mister. Move over girls, a new dancer's come to town!
Dialogue: You've got real rhythm, mister. Move over girls, a new dancer's come to town!

Original: Honeygirl: Well, you weren't...awful, I guess
Dialogue: Well, you weren't...awful, I guess

Original: On-screen: Practice again?
Dialogue: Practice again?

Original: Honeygirl: C'mon, c'monthe show's about to start!
Dialogue: C'mon, c'mon—the show's about to start!

Original: Madam M: My, my! Is that Cloud? Darling! I had no idea.
Dialogue: My, my! Is that Cloud? Darling! I had no idea.

Original: Honeygirl: Now you just sit tight until Andrea takes the stage!
Dialogue: Now you just sit tight until Andrea takes the stage!

Original: Andrea: Welcome to the Honeybee Inn...Cloud. You seek my approval, do you? I understand. But those who crave my favor must first prove that they know how to move.
Dialogue: Welcome to the Honeybee Inn...Cloud. You seek my approval, do you? I understand. But those who crave my favor must first prove that they know how to move.

Original: Aerith: Woohoo!
Dialogue: Woohoo!

Original: Andrea: Think you can follow my lead?
Dialogue: Think you can follow my lead?

Original: Aerith: Woohoo! You're a start!
Dialogue: Woohoo! You're a start!

Original: Aerith: (laughs) Keep it up, Cloud! Work it!
Dialogue: (laughs) Keep it up, Cloud! Work it!

Original: Aerith: C'mon Cloud! Get into it!
Dialogue: C'mon Cloud! Get into it!

Original: Aerith: Uh, umm...
Dialogue: Uh, umm...

Original: Aerith: Nice moves! (laughs) I love it!
Dialogue: Nice moves! (laughs) I love it!

Original: Aerith: Well, you tried...?
Dialogue: Well, you tried...?

Original: Andrea: Honey...I'm in love. Yes. Yes, I will transform you into a vision of beauty. Now, without further ado, let us begin!
Dialogue: Honey...I'm in love. Yes. Yes, I will transform you into a vision of beauty. Now, without further ado, let us begin!

Original: Honeyboy: You werebornfor this.
Dialogue: You were born for this.

Original: Andrea: Come.
Dialogue: Come.

Original: Andrea: Perfection! True beauty is an expression of the heart. A thing without shame, to which notions of gender don't apply. Don't ever be afraid, Cloud.
Dialogue: Perfection! True beauty is an expression of the heart. A thing without shame, to which notions of gender don't apply. Don't ever be afraid, Cloud.

Original: Cloud: Please don't.
Dialogue: Please don't.

Original: Cloud: Not a word.
Dialogue: Not a word.

Original: Aerith: Not even one?
Dialogue: Not even one?

Original: Cloud: No!
Dialogue: No!

Original: Aerith: But you're so pretty!
Dialogue: But you're so pretty!

Original: Aerith: Hey! Watch the way you walk.
Dialogue: Hey! Watch the way you walk.

Original: Aerith: No time to dillydally-let's go!
Dialogue: No time to dillydally-let's go!

Original: Honeygirl (1): Promise to come back soon?
Dialogue: Promise to come back soon?

Original: Honeygirl (2): Don't be a stranger!
Dialogue: Don't be a stranger!

Original: Honeygirl (3): After all, we honeybees need fresh flowers topollinate!
Dialogue: After all, we honeybees need fresh flowers to pollinate!

Original: Critical Woman: Hey, you. We're looking for new hires. Wanna come work with us?
Dialogue: Hey, you. We're looking for new hires. Wanna come work with us?

Original: Sharp-Tongued Woman: With your looks, you could be the best in Wall Market. No, the best in Midgar if you wanted to!
Dialogue: With your looks, you could be the best in Wall Market. No, the best in Midgar if you wanted to!

Original: Critical Woman: We hope you decide to join us!
Dialogue: We hope you decide to join us!

Original: Sharp-Tongued Woman: You could conquer the world with those cheekbones of yours!
Dialogue: You could conquer the world with those cheekbones of yours!

Original: Chadley: Ohhh... Ahem. Forgive me, miss, but the way you're staring at me is rather... O-oh goodness... I'm experiencing an emotional response...
Dialogue: Ohhh... Ahem. Forgive me, miss, but the way you're staring at me is rather... O-oh goodness... I'm experiencing an emotional response...

Original: Chadley: What is this emotional response...?
Dialogue: What is this emotional response...?

Original: Man in Love: Whoa! She is the most beautiful girl in the world.
Dialogue: Whoa! She is the most beautiful girl in the world.

Original: Woman in Love: Wait a minute! I thought you said that I was the most beautiful girl.
Dialogue: Wait a minute! I thought you said that I was the most beautiful girl.

Original: Man in Love: All right, thenyou'rethe most beautiful girl in the world. Butshe'sthe most beautiful girl in the entire universe!
Dialogue: All right, then you're the most beautiful girl in the world. But she's the most beautiful girl in the entire universe!

Original: Woman in Love: You are such anasshole!
Dialogue: You are such an asshole!

Original: Man in Love: I'd like to take this moment to officially declare to you my undying love!
Dialogue: I'd like to take this moment to officially declare to you my undying love!

Original: Woman in Love: What the hell did I ever see in you!?
Dialogue: What the hell did I ever see in you!?

Original: Madam M: Don't we look absolutely stunning in our dress? Not that I ever had any doubt you would, darling. I was a little pressed for time since Andrea didn't give me much notice, but I did my humble best. How could I not go the extra mile for the merc who's done so very much for me and mine. What's one more dress between friends?
Dialogue: Don't we look absolutely stunning in our dress? Not that I ever had any doubt you would, darling. I was a little pressed for time since Andrea didn't give me much notice, but I did my humble best. How could I not go the extra mile for the merc who's done so very much for me and mine. What's one more dress between friends?

Original: Sam: Can't say I ever understood the appeal of going to so much trouble to gussy yourself up.
Dialogue: Can't say I ever understood the appeal of going to so much trouble to gussy yourself up.

Original: Madam M: No, you certainly do not, and I doubt that you ever will.
Dialogue: No, you certainly do not, and I doubt that you ever will.

Original: Sam: Wh...what's with the attitude?
Dialogue: Wh...what's with the attitude?

Original: Barker: Hey there, ladies! Would you be interested in making alottamoney? You get to eat, drink, and have loads of fun! How does that sound to you!
Dialogue: Hey there, ladies! Would you be interested in making a lotta money? You get to eat, drink, and have loads of fun! How does that sound to you!

Original: Mireille: I owe you for your help. Here. I'm no fashionista, but I'm sure this'll go great with that dress of yours.
Dialogue: I owe you for your help. Here. I'm no fashionista, but I'm sure this'll go great with that dress of yours.

Original: Mireille: Oh, too good for my gifts, huh? Come on, just take it already, would you? Got these things comin' out of my ears as it is. Now get goin'. Teach that greasy slime ball a lesson he won't soon forget.
Dialogue: Oh, too good for my gifts, huh? Come on, just take it already, would you? Got these things comin' out of my ears as it is. Now get goin'. Teach that greasy slime ball a lesson he won't soon forget.

Original: Clothing Store Owner's Son: Hmm... You just might be the perfect "inspiration" my dad's been missing...
Dialogue: Hmm... You just might be the perfect "inspiration" my dad's been missing...

Original: Jules: Came running when I heard you were putting on a show. I didn't know you were such an amazing dancer! I wouldn't recommend lifting in that outfit, but if you need to work up a sweat later, feel free to pop into the gym!
Dialogue: Came running when I heard you were putting on a show. I didn't know you were such an amazing dancer! I wouldn't recommend lifting in that outfit, but if you need to work up a sweat later, feel free to pop into the gym!

Original: Sweet Old Man: Am I dead? Did these beauitful angels come for me?
Dialogue: Am I dead? Did these beauitful angels come for me?

Original: Kind Old Man: Are you one of them models? The ones who wear those pretty clothes?
Dialogue: Are you one of them models? The ones who wear those pretty clothes?

Original: Sweet Old Man: I feel blessed just seeing them.
Dialogue: I feel blessed just seeing them.

Original: Kind Old Man: I've got butterflies in my stomach! It's been a while since I felt like this.
Dialogue: I've got butterflies in my stomach! It's been a while since I felt like this.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Your beauty is deadlier than anything I have here in my store!
Dialogue: Your beauty is deadlier than anything I have here in my store!

Original: Johnny: Bro, look at you. So...how's the dress workin' out for ya? I wanted to help out. Do my part, you know? After Andrea told me the plan, I ran all over looking for...something. But, like, I don't got a lotta money...
Dialogue: Bro, look at you. So...how's the dress workin' out for ya? I wanted to help out. Do my part, you know? After Andrea told me the plan, I ran all over looking for...something. But, like, I don't got a lotta money...

Original: Johnny: Don't worry bro. You got this!
Dialogue: Don't worry bro. You got this!

Original: Leslie: No way.
Dialogue: No way.

Original: Aerith: Here you areletters from Andrea Rhodea and Madam M. That ought to do the trick, right?
Dialogue: Here you are—letters from Andrea Rhodea and Madam M. That ought to do the trick, right?

Original: Leslie: You serious?
Dialogue: You serious?

Original: Aerith: Is there a problem?
Dialogue: Is there a problem?

Original: Leslie: I hope you know what you're in for.
Dialogue: I hope you know what you're in for.

Original: Aerith: Oh, we'll be fine.
Dialogue: Oh, we'll be fine.

Original: Leslie: If you say so. Come on.
Dialogue: If you say so. Come on.

Original: Corneo Lackey: The two of you here for the audition? Second floor, at the very end of the walk. And don't go pokin' your nose in where it doesn't belong!
Dialogue: The two of you here for the audition? Second floor, at the very end of the walk. And don't go pokin' your nose in where it doesn't belong!

Original: Corneo Lackey: Welcome to the mansion of the esteemed Don Corneo.
Dialogue: Welcome to the mansion of the esteemed Don Corneo.

Original: Corneo Lackey: Room's on the second floor, at the very end of the walk.
Dialogue: Room's on the second floor, at the very end of the walk.

Original: Corneo Lackey: That one's Madam M's girl, ain't it? Man, she's hot.
Dialogue: That one's Madam M's girl, ain't it? Man, she's hot.

Original: Corneo Lackey: We've been waitin' for ya to show.
Dialogue: We've been waitin' for ya to show.

Original: Corneo Lackey: That Andrea's girl? I'd let her do things to me.
Dialogue: That Andrea's girl? I'd let her do things to me.

Original: Corneo Lackey: Go to your room and wait. Quietly.
Dialogue: Go to your room and wait. Quietly.

Original: Corneo Lackey: Room's at the end. Keep walking!
Dialogue: Room's at the end. Keep walking!

Original: Aerith: What's that weird, sweet smell? And why do I feel so dizzy?
Dialogue: What's that weird, sweet smell? And why do I feel so dizzy?

Original: Cloud: Gas. Come on.
Dialogue: Gas. Come on.

Original: Cloud: Dammit.
Dialogue: Dammit.

Original: Aerith: Cloud...
Dialogue: Cloud...

Original: Corneo Lackey (1): Wassup? How you pretty ladies doin'? Feeling a little light-headed? Well, we can't have that. What say we escort you to the parlor, so you can make yourselves more comfortable?
