Dialogue: I've made up my mind. I'm not gonna do this job for Shinra anymore. I'm an officer of the people now!

Original: New Recruit: We need to think about supplies and shelter and food for all these people. I work for the people now, not some corporation.
Dialogue: We need to think about supplies and shelter and food for all these people. I work for the people now, not some corporation.

Original: Senior Officer: You know, you've given me a lot to think about. I can't let rules and orders dictate my life.
Dialogue: You know, you've given me a lot to think about. I can't let rules and orders dictate my life.

Original: Barret: I saidwhere you going?
Dialogue: I said—where you going?

Original: Cloud: Aerith's house. It's in the Sector 5 slums.
Dialogue: Aerith's house. It's in the Sector 5 slums.

Original: Barret: And that's where Marlene is?
Dialogue: And that's where Marlene is?

Original: Cloud: Where we hope she is.
Dialogue: Where we hope she is.

Original: Barret: Tell me she is! Give me something to hang on to! Even if she's not. I won't blame you for it, I swear!
Dialogue: Tell me she is! Give me something to hang on to! Even if she's not. I won't blame you for it, I swear!

Original: Barret: Who am I kidding. I'd probably try to tear your head off.
Dialogue: Who am I kidding. I'd probably try to tear your head off.

Original: Cloud: Hey, Tifa. Know anything about "Ancients"?
Dialogue: Hey, Tifa. Know anything about "Ancients"?

Original: Tifa: I know I've heard of them at least.
Dialogue: I know I've heard of them at least.

Original: Barret: They come up in planetology books. Meant to be the original stewards of the planet. Could even "commune" with it. Talk to it and stuff.
Dialogue: They come up in planetology books. Meant to be the original stewards of the planet. Could even "commune" with it. Talk to it and stuff.

Original: Cloud: That must be why the Turks wanted her so badly.
Dialogue: That must be why the Turks wanted her so badly.

Original: Sephiroth (in Cloud's memory): Within my veins flows the blood of Ancients. This planet...is my birthright.
Dialogue: Within my veins flows the blood of Ancients. This planet...is my birthright.

Original: Sephiroth (vision): You have failed again, I see.
Dialogue: You have failed again, I see.

Original: Sephiroth (vision): But through suffering, you will grow strong. Isn't that what you want?
Dialogue: But through suffering, you will grow strong. Isn't that what you want?

Original: Tifa: Cloud?
Dialogue: Cloud?

Original: Cloud: It's nothing. Let's go.
Dialogue: It's nothing. Let's go.

Original: Sam: Hey. Pretty crazy, huh? Can you believe this mess?
Dialogue: Hey. Pretty crazy, huh? Can you believe this mess?

Original: Cloud: You doing all right?
Dialogue: You doing all right?

Original: Sam: I am, but I can't say the same 'bout my birds. Poor things're scared half to death.
Dialogue: I am, but I can't say the same 'bout my birds. Poor things're scared half to death.

Original: Cloud: Wait. Over there.
Dialogue: Wait. Over there.

Original: Barret: What the hell are they doing here?
Dialogue: What the hell are they doing here?

Original: Cloud: Their jobs, probably. Just focus on seeing Marlene again. Nothing else.
Dialogue: Their jobs, probably. Just focus on seeing Marlene again. Nothing else.

Original: Security Officer (1): Found 'em?
Dialogue: Found 'em?

Original: Security Officer (2): We're searching the compound as we speak, sir.
Dialogue: We're searching the compound as we speak, sir.

Original: Andrea: Did you find what you were looking for?
Dialogue: Did you find what you were looking for?

Original: Cloud: Thanks to you I did.
Dialogue: Thanks to you I did.

Original: Andrea: Good. Now never let it go again.
Dialogue: Good. Now never let it go again.

Original: Madam M: Well, this is a fine mess...
Dialogue: Well, this is a fine mess...

Original: Cloud: How bad is it here?
Dialogue: How bad is it here?

Original: Madam M: Compared to Sector 7, we're doing fine. But that's hardly an accomplishment.
Dialogue: Compared to Sector 7, we're doing fine. But that's hardly an accomplishment.

Original: Barret: You guys run into Jessie at the pillar?
Dialogue: You guys run into Jessie at the pillar?

Original: Tifa: Yeah...Biggs too. They were both in pretty bad shape. But Wedge wasn't up there with 'em. He got out.
Dialogue: Yeah...Biggs too. They were both in pretty bad shape. But Wedge wasn't up there with 'em. He got out.

Original: Barret: All right.
Dialogue: All right.

Original: Stablehand: Come on now, there's no need to be afraid. We're all scared...
Dialogue: Come on now, there's no need to be afraid. We're all scared...

Original: Barret: I've been thinking, y'all... We gotta go find the others.
Dialogue: I've been thinking, y'all... We gotta go find the others.

Original: Tifa: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Barret: If we don't look for them, who will?
Dialogue: If we don't look for them, who will?

Original: Tifa: ...Right.
Dialogue: ...Right.

Original: Barret: Hey, Cloud. Gonna need your help with it too.
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud. Gonna need your help with it too.

Original: Cloud: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: On-screen: Sector 5 Slums - Center District
Dialogue: Sector 5 Slums - Center District

Original: Barret: This is Sector 5, right? So where's this place you said Marlene is?
Dialogue: This is Sector 5, right? So where's this place you said Marlene is?

Original: Cloud: Where I think she is. It's a house on the other side of town.
Dialogue: Where I think she is. It's a house on the other side of town.

Original: Barret: Well, come on then, pick up the pace!
Dialogue: Well, come on then, pick up the pace!

Original: Cloud: I'm going as fast as you are.
Dialogue: I'm going as fast as you are.

Original: Chadley: Cloud! I'm glad to see that you're okay. In these trying times I hope to develop new materia to help us endure.
Dialogue: Cloud! I'm glad to see that you're okay. In these trying times I hope to develop new materia to help us endure.

Original: Cloud: That's the house.
Dialogue: That's the house.

Original: Barret: Marlene! Marlene!
Dialogue: Marlene! Marlene!

Original: Barret: Where's Marlene!? Is she here!?
Dialogue: Where's Marlene!? Is she here!?

Original: Cloud: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: Sorry. I'm Barret. Marlene's my little girl. Marleneshe's got short hair. She's cute as a button, with the heart of an angel. She was wearing... Uh...pink! She was wearing a pink dress today!
Dialogue: Sorry. I'm Barret. Marlene's my little girl. Marlene—she's got short hair. She's cute as a button, with the heart of an angel. She was wearing... Uh...pink! She was wearing a pink dress today!

Original: Elmyra: She's sleeping upstairs.
Dialogue: She's sleeping upstairs.

Original: Elmyra: I said she's sleeping!
Dialogue: I said she's sleeping!

Original: Tifa: I wanna see her too. C'mon. Let's go look in on her.
Dialogue: I wanna see her too. C'mon. Let's go look in on her.

Original: Elmyra: Keep it down. Don't wake her.
Dialogue: Keep it down. Don't wake her.

Original: Barret: Marlene...my baby. Thank god.
Dialogue: Marlene...my baby. Thank god.

Original: Tifa: Sh.
Dialogue: Sh.

Original: Elmyra: Shinra has my daughter now.
Dialogue: Shinra has my daughter now.

Original: Cloud: I'm sorry.
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Original: Tifa: No. I'm the one who asked her to go get Marlene. We'd only just met, but she was so kind and helpful. I...took advantage of her.
Dialogue: No. I'm the one who asked her to go get Marlene. We'd only just met, but she was so kind and helpful. I...took advantage of her.

Original: Elmyra: It's not your fault. It was only a matter of time before she ended up back there.
Dialogue: It's not your fault. It was only a matter of time before she ended up back there.

Original: Cloud: Because she's an Ancient. That it?
Dialogue: Because she's an Ancient. That it?

Original: Elmyra: So she told you about that? She must trust you all a great deal...
Dialogue: So she told you about that? She must trust you all a great deal...

Original: Elmyra: Yes. Aerith is an Ancient. Probably the last one living. She's not my daughter. Not by blood, I mean. If that's what you were wondering...
Dialogue: Yes. Aerith is an Ancient. Probably the last one living. She's not my daughter. Not by blood, I mean. If that's what you were wondering...

Original: Elmyra: About fifteen years ago... My husband, he'd been shipped off to fight on the front lines. But then I received a letter saying he'd be home for a bit. So when the day came, I went to the station to meet him... But...he didn't come. I couldn't help fearing the worst, even then...but I told myself his leave must've been postponed, that he'd been delayed. Every day I went, to wait, and to pray...
Dialogue: About fifteen years ago... My husband, he'd been shipped off to fight on the front lines. But then I received a letter saying he'd be home for a bit. So when the day came, I went to the station to meet him... But...he didn't come. I couldn't help fearing the worst, even then...but I told myself his leave must've been postponed, that he'd been delayed. Every day I went, to wait, and to pray...

Original: Elmyra: And that's how I met her. Her and her mother. I thought maybe they'd run away from Wall Market. Or that they were topsiders fallen on hard times. I'd seen that sort of thing a lot. "Take Aerith somewhere safe." Those were her mother's dying words. My husband had been away for so long, and I was lonely. So I convinced myself the safest place for the girl was with me.
Dialogue: And that's how I met her. Her and her mother. I thought maybe they'd run away from Wall Market. Or that they were topsiders fallen on hard times. I'd seen that sort of thing a lot. "Take Aerith somewhere safe." Those were her mother's dying words. My husband had been away for so long, and I was lonely. So I convinced myself the safest place for the girl was with me.

Original: Elmyra: It took no time at all for her to start feeling like family. She was a real chatterbox. She told me strange stories... Like how she and her mother had escaped from some sort of facility... And how she wasn't sad because her mother had just..."returned to their planet."
Dialogue: It took no time at all for her to start feeling like family. She was a real chatterbox. She told me strange stories... Like how she and her mother had escaped from some sort of facility... And how she wasn't sad because her mother had just..."returned to their planet."

Original: Barret: Their planet, huh? Yeah, that sounds about right.
Dialogue: Their planet, huh? Yeah, that sounds about right.

Original: Elmyra: I didn't understand any of it at the time. When I asked if she meant one in the sky... She said no, this one. Right here. I mean...what can you say to that...?
Dialogue: I didn't understand any of it at the time. When I asked if she meant one in the sky... She said no, this one. Right here. I mean...what can you say to that...?

Original: Aerith (flashback): Mommy, don't be sad.
Dialogue: Mommy, don't be sad.

Original: Elmyra: That's what she said to me one day, out of the blue.
Dialogue: That's what she said to me one day, out of the blue.

Original: Elmyra: So I asked her, "What's wrong?"
Dialogue: So I asked her, "What's wrong?"

Original: Aerith (flashback): A man you really, really love just died. His heart came a long way to say goodbye. But he couldn't stay, 'cause he had to return to the planet.
Dialogue: A man you really, really love just died. His heart came a long way to say goodbye. But he couldn't stay, 'cause he had to return to the planet.

Original: Elmyra: I didn't believe her, of course. And then, a few days later, I received a letter saying my husband had been killed in action. Things like that, she'd just know. It was a lot to deal with, but we were happy. And then came the knock.
Dialogue: I didn't believe her, of course. And then, a few days later, I received a letter saying my husband had been killed in action. Things like that, she'd just know. It was a lot to deal with, but we were happy. And then came the knock.

Original: Aerith (flashback): Coming!
Dialogue: Coming!

Original: Aerith (flashback): No... Go away!
Dialogue: No... Go away!

Original: Tseng (flashback): Aerith... You know you're not just any little girl. You're a descendant of the Ancients.
Dialogue: Aerith... You know you're not just any little girl. You're a descendant of the Ancients.

Original: Elmyra: I had no idea what he meant, so I said, "Who are the Ancients?"
Dialogue: I had no idea what he meant, so I said, "Who are the Ancients?"

Original: Tseng (flashback): They were the original stewards of the planet whose boundless knowledge and wisdom shall guide us to the promised land. Some believe the promised land to be a myth. Others, an allegory of sorts. But we take the words of the scriptures at face value, and believe it to be quite real. Which is why Shinra would like very much for Aerith to help us
Dialogue: They were the original stewards of the planet whose boundless knowledge and wisdom shall guide us to the promised land. Some believe the promised land to be a myth. Others, an allegory of sorts. But we take the words of the scriptures at face value, and believe it to be quite real. Which is why Shinra would like very much for Aerith to help us—

Original: Aerith (flashback): You're wrong! I'm not an Ancient!
Dialogue: You're wrong! I'm not an Ancient!

Original: Tseng (flashback): But Aerith... Even when you're all alone, don't you hear voices whispering secrets?
Dialogue: But Aerith... Even when you're all alone, don't you hear voices whispering secrets?

Original: Aerith (flashback): No, never!
Dialogue: No, never!

Original: Elmyra: But all three of us knew that wasn't true. That man knew exactly who Aerith was, where she'd come from, and what she could do.
Dialogue: But all three of us knew that wasn't true. That man knew exactly who Aerith was, where she'd come from, and what she could do.

Original: Cloud: They knew where she was, but they didn't just take her? Doesn't sound like the Turks I know.
Dialogue: They knew where she was, but they didn't just take her? Doesn't sound like the Turks I know.

Original: Elmyra: She had to come willingly, otherwise it wouldn't work, they said. That's why...even if they did take her away, I'm sure she's still being treated like a guest... And that they'll send her straight back home once they get what they need.
Dialogue: She had to come willingly, otherwise it wouldn't work, they said. That's why...even if they did take her away, I'm sure she's still being treated like a guest... And that they'll send her straight back home once they get what they need.

Original: Cloud: I doubt it.
Dialogue: I doubt it.

Original: Elmyra: You're not planning anything, are you? Don't make things worse than they already are. If I lost her too, I don't know if I could... if I could ever... Just don't.
Dialogue: You're not planning anything, are you? Don't make things worse than they already are. If I lost her too, I don't know if I could... if I could ever... Just don't.

Original: Tifa: Cloud. Maybe she's right about this. Maybe they'll let Aerith go when it's all over. Maybe...we'd be better off waiting a little while.
Dialogue: Cloud. Maybe she's right about this. Maybe they'll let Aerith go when it's all over. Maybe...we'd be better off waiting a little while.

Original: Barret: Let's head back to Sector 7. Got things to take care of. Like...checking up on the bar.
Dialogue: Let's head back to Sector 7. Got things to take care of. Like...checking up on the bar.

Original: Tifa: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Cloud: Okay.
Dialogue: Okay.

Original: Elmyra: Take care of yourselves now.
Dialogue: Take care of yourselves now.

Original: Barret: We're gonna win this fight. I promise.
Dialogue: We're gonna win this fight. I promise.

Original: Tifa: The main entrance to Sector 7 is buried under rubble now. So how are we supposed to get back inside?
Dialogue: The main entrance to Sector 7 is buried under rubble now. So how are we supposed to get back inside?

Original: Cloud: Underground passage in the park.
Dialogue: Underground passage in the park.

Original: Barret: Ah, good plan.
Dialogue: Ah, good plan.

Original: Tifa: But how do we get to the park?
Dialogue: But how do we get to the park?

Original: Cloud: I know another way to get there. Aerith showed me before.
Dialogue: I know another way to get there. Aerith showed me before.

Original: Barret: Heh. This Ancient girl knows her stuff. Didn't mean anythin' by it.
Dialogue: Heh. This Ancient girl knows her stuff. Didn't mean anythin' by it.

Original: On-screen: Sector 6 Slums - Collapsed Expressway
Dialogue: Sector 6 Slums - Collapsed Expressway

Original: Barret: Aight, let's keep moving.
Dialogue: Aight, let's keep moving.

Original: On-screen: Collapsed Expressway
Dialogue: Collapsed Expressway

Original: Bandit: Get the bastards!
Dialogue: Get the bastards!

Original: Beck: Not so fast! You wanna come through here, you'll need to provide due compens You again!?
Dialogue: Not so fast! You wanna come through here, you'll need to provide due compens— You again!?

Original: Burke: Oh shit!
Dialogue: Oh shit!

Original: Barret: Friends of yours!
Dialogue: Friends of yours!

Original: Beck: Stop lying! We go way back!
Dialogue: Stop lying! We go way back!

Original: Tifa: Over there!
Dialogue: Over there!

Original: Barret: Huh? That a way out?
Dialogue: Huh? That a way out?

Original: Tifa: I'm almost afraid to go back. To see it with my own eyes...
Dialogue: I'm almost afraid to go back. To see it with my own eyes...

Original: Cloud: Tifa...
Dialogue: Tifa...

Original: Tifa: Come on.
Dialogue: Come on.

Original: Barret: Wymer! You're alive!
Dialogue: Wymer! You're alive!

Original: Wymer: Still in one piece.
Dialogue: Still in one piece.

Original: Barret: Who else made it out?
Dialogue: Who else made it out?

Original: Wymer: I wish I knew... Sorry.
Dialogue: I wish I knew... Sorry.

Original: Tifa: It's fine.
Dialogue: It's fine.

Original: Barret: I'm just glad you survived. Gives me hope for the others.
Dialogue: I'm just glad you survived. Gives me hope for the others.

Original: Wymer: This is bad.
Dialogue: This is bad.

Original: Betty: I really hope that all my friends are okay.
Dialogue: I really hope that all my friends are okay.

Original: Betty's Dad: I'm sure they are, honey. Don't worry.
Dialogue: I'm sure they are, honey. Don't worry.

Original: Item Store Owner: Never know what you're gonna run into out there. Best be prepared.
Dialogue: Never know what you're gonna run into out there. Best be prepared.

Original: Item Store Owner: Careful out there.
Dialogue: Careful out there.

Original: Weapons Vendor: Sector 7, huh?
Dialogue: Sector 7, huh?

Original: Barret: Yeah... Left a few things behind.
Dialogue: Yeah... Left a few things behind.

Original: Weapons Vendor: I see. I know it's not much, but it's all I got.
Dialogue: I see. I know it's not much, but it's all I got.

Original: On-screen: Head underground?
Dialogue: Head underground?

Original: On-screen: S7-6 Service Tunnel
Dialogue: S7-6 Service Tunnel

Original: Barret: Okay. Let's see what's on the other side.
Dialogue: Okay. Let's see what's on the other side.

Original: Barret: Again!?
Dialogue: Again!?

Original: Cloud: That one was a lot closer.
Dialogue: That one was a lot closer.

Original: On-screen: Sector 7 Slums
Dialogue: Sector 7 Slums

Original: Barret: My god...
Dialogue: My god...

Original: Marle: Just a little more! Come on! C'mon!
Dialogue: Just a little more! Come on! C'mon!

Original: Neighborhood Watch Member: It won't budge!
Dialogue: It won't budge!

Original: Barret: Make room!
Dialogue: Make room!

Original: Tifa: Marle!
Dialogue: Marle!

Original: Marle: You're alive!
Dialogue: You're alive!

Original: Cloud: With me. Ready and
Dialogue: With me. Ready and—

Original: Barret: Great job, guys.
Dialogue: Great job, guys.

Original: Undercity Resident: Thank you. (cries)
Dialogue: Thank you. (cries)

Original: Marle: I can't tell you how relieved I am to see you. So. What now?
Dialogue: I can't tell you how relieved I am to see you. So. What now?

Original: Barret: Don't know. Find somethinganythingto do.
Dialogue: Don't know. Find something—anything—to do.

Original: Marle: Been back to the bar yet?
Dialogue: Been back to the bar yet?

Original: Barret: No.
Dialogue: No.

Original: Marle: Maybe you should go take a look.
Dialogue: Maybe you should go take a look.

Original: Barret: Okay. First the bar...then the rest.
Dialogue: Okay. First the bar...then the rest.

Original: Marle: Careful. The roads are a mess. Watch your step or you'll wind up in a hole!
Dialogue: Careful. The roads are a mess. Watch your step or you'll wind up in a hole!

Original: Barret: Hello! Anybody out there!? If you can hear me, say something!
Dialogue: Hello! Anybody out there!? If you can hear me, say something!

Original: Cloud: Tifa.
Dialogue: Tifa.

Original: Cloud: Get back!
Dialogue: Get back!

Original: Barret: Shit!
Dialogue: Shit!

Original: Tifa: Hear that?
Dialogue: Hear that?

Original: Cloud: That's Wedge's cat.
Dialogue: That's Wedge's cat.

Original: Barret: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Tifa: Let's follow it.
Dialogue: Let's follow it.

Original: Barret: Ready? One, two, three!
Dialogue: Ready? One, two, three!

Original: Tifa: Is this all that's left of Wedge's place?
Dialogue: Is this all that's left of Wedge's place?

Original: Barret: Hey! We're coming down! Stay right where you are!
Dialogue: Hey! We're coming down! Stay right where you are!

Original: Barret: Hmph. This place reeks of Shinra.
Dialogue: Hmph. This place reeks of Shinra.

Original: Tifa: Wedge?
Dialogue: Wedge?

Original: Barret: Wedge!
Dialogue: Wedge!

Original: Barret: Of all the times! (screams)
Dialogue: Of all the times! (screams)

Original: On-screen: Shinra Underground Test Site
Dialogue: Shinra Underground Test Site

Original: Barret: Tifa! Cloud! Shout if you can hear me! Hey!
Dialogue: Tifa! Cloud! Shout if you can hear me! Hey!

Original: Barret: If there's no path, you gotta make one.
Dialogue: If there's no path, you gotta make one.

Original: Barret: Must be a secret Shinra facility.
Dialogue: Must be a secret Shinra facility.

Original: Barret: How long it take 'em to build all this beneath our feet?
Dialogue: How long it take 'em to build all this beneath our feet?

Original: Barret: Man...you'd think they dug halfway to hell.
Dialogue: Man...you'd think they dug halfway to hell.

Original: Barret: Just no escapin' them, is there?
Dialogue: Just no escapin' them, is there?

Original: Barret: I'm really gonna enjoy burning it all down.
Dialogue: I'm really gonna enjoy burning it all down.

Original: Barret: Tifa! Hey, Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa! Hey, Tifa!

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Tifa: To tell you the truth, not really. I think there's a nest around here somewhere. Can you take care of it?
Dialogue: To tell you the truth, not really. I think there's a nest around here somewhere. Can you take care of it?

Original: Barret: I gotcha!
Dialogue: I gotcha!

Original: Barret: Sorry.
Dialogue: Sorry.

Original: Baret: Tifa! Where's Cloud?
Dialogue: Tifa! Where's Cloud?

Original: Tifa: I don't know.
Dialogue: I don't know.

Original: Barret: Well, he can take care of himself. We've got bigger issues.
Dialogue: Well, he can take care of himself. We've got bigger issues.

Original: Barret: Are you all right?
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Original: Tifa: Yeah, I'm good, thanks.
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm good, thanks.

Original: Barret: All right. Gotta go find Wedge. Come on.
Dialogue: All right. Gotta go find Wedge. Come on.

Original: Tifa: I'm afraid to ask, but did you just shoot your way in here?
Dialogue: I'm afraid to ask, but did you just shoot your way in here?

Original: Barret: Well, yeah. Worked, didn't it?
Dialogue: Well, yeah. Worked, didn't it?

Original: Barret: If I gotta climb another damn ladder...
Dialogue: If I gotta climb another damn ladder...

Original: Tifa: Hey. You think Wedge is holding up okay?
Dialogue: Hey. You think Wedge is holding up okay?

Original: Barret: Of course he is. He's a lot tougher than people think. Probably sleeping soundly, dreaming about his cats.
Dialogue: Of course he is. He's a lot tougher than people think. Probably sleeping soundly, dreaming about his cats.

Original: Tifa: You're right. We should treat him to a nice meal when he gets back. His choice.
Dialogue: You're right. We should treat him to a nice meal when he gets back. His choice.

Original: Barret: Gotta stay on my toes if I'm gonna make it outta here alive.
Dialogue: Gotta stay on my toes if I'm gonna make it outta here alive.

Original: Barret: Wedge!
Dialogue: Wedge!

Original: Tifa: He's okay.
Dialogue: He's okay.

Original: Barret: You sure?
Dialogue: You sure?

Original: Barret: (chuckles) Making me worry like that. I'd kick your ass if you didn't look like shit! Thank god.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Making me worry like that. I'd kick your ass if you didn't look like shit! Thank god.

Original: Tifa: Thank you!
Dialogue: Thank you!

Original: Tifa: Okay. Let's go.
Dialogue: Okay. Let's go.

Original: Barret: Uhsure!
Dialogue: Uh—sure!

Original: Barret: Yup...it's you all right.
Dialogue: Yup...it's you all right.

Original: Tifa: What is this...?
Dialogue: What is this...?

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: The hell is this now!?
Dialogue: The hell is this now!?

Original: Barret: Where were you freaks hiding!?
Dialogue: Where were you freaks hiding!?

Original: Tifa: Are they Shinra experiments!?
Dialogue: Are they Shinra experiments!?

Original: Barret: Hah! Well if that's the case, then it's only right we put the bastards down!
Dialogue: Hah! Well if that's the case, then it's only right we put the bastards down!

Original: Barret: Ah, of course there's more.
Dialogue: Ah, of course there's more.

Original: Tifa: You good?
Dialogue: You good?

Original: Barret: Like you even gotta ask!
Dialogue: Like you even gotta ask!

Original: Barret: Gettin' real tired of this shit!
Dialogue: Gettin' real tired of this shit!

Original: Tifa: This is ridiculous.
Dialogue: This is ridiculous.

Original: Barret: We gotta close that duct. Tifa, you're up!
Dialogue: We gotta close that duct. Tifa, you're up!

Original: Tifa: Okay! Cover me!
Dialogue: Okay! Cover me!

Original: Barret: Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa!

Original: Tifa: Seriously!?
Dialogue: Seriously!?

Original: Tifa: It's using its friends as weapons!?
Dialogue: It's using its friends as weapons!?

Original: Barret: Hey, Tifa! Heads up!
Dialogue: Hey, Tifa! Heads up!

Original: Barret: Huh! Getting tired?
Dialogue: Huh! Getting tired?

Original: Tifa: Look!
Dialogue: Look!

Original: Barret: (laughs) Well, that sure looks like a weak point to me!
Dialogue: (laughs) Well, that sure looks like a weak point to me!

Original: Barret: All that's left is to deal with these freaks!
Dialogue: All that's left is to deal with these freaks!

Original: Tifa: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Barret: 'Bout time, merc.
Dialogue: Bout time, merc.

Original: Cloud: You're up.
Dialogue: You're up.

Original: Barret: Late to the party and you're givingmeorders?
Dialogue: Late to the party and you're giving me orders?

Original: Barret: Hell yeah!
Dialogue: Hell yeah!

Original: Barret: So how'd you manage to track us down?
Dialogue: So how'd you manage to track us down?

Original: Cloud: Followed the trail of bullet holes. There's nobody else I know who'd leave that kinda mess.
Dialogue: Followed the trail of bullet holes. There's nobody else I know who'd leave that kinda mess.

Original: Tifa: Oh, god...were those...
Dialogue: Oh, god...were those...

Original: Barret: People?
Dialogue: People?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. That's the Shinra I know.
Dialogue: Yeah. That's the Shinra I know.

Original: Tifa: Cloud?
Dialogue: Cloud?

Original: Barret: What the hell was that?
Dialogue: What the hell was that?

Original: Tifa: We need to get him somewhere safe. Everything else can wait until after.
Dialogue: We need to get him somewhere safe. Everything else can wait until after.

Original: Barret: Agreed. Let's go.
Dialogue: Agreed. Let's go.

Original: Tifa: Cloud.
Dialogue: Cloud.

Original: Cloud: Good kitty.
Dialogue: Good kitty.

Original: Barret: I want you to take Wedge back for me. I'm gonna look around for the others. He made it, didn't he? They could still be alive.
Dialogue: I want you to take Wedge back for me. I'm gonna look around for the others. He made it, didn't he? They could still be alive.

Original: Cloud: I saw them both at the pillar... Jessie and Biggs. Saw...how bad they were hurt. I'm sorry, but...
Dialogue: I saw them both at the pillar... Jessie and Biggs. Saw...how bad they were hurt. I'm sorry, but...

Original: Barret: Don't.
Dialogue: Don't.

Original: Tifa: They've returned to the planet.
Dialogue: They've returned to the planet.

Original: Barret: They...they were supposed to return tous.
Dialogue: They...they were supposed to return to us.

Original: Barret: But if we stop now...they'll never let us live it down. So...we carry that weight.
Dialogue: But if we stop now...they'll never let us live it down. So...we carry that weight.

Original: Barret: I'm sorry. I truly am. We had no other place to go and...
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I truly am. We had no other place to go and...

Original: Elmyra: I would never leave a wounded man out on the street.
Dialogue: I would never leave a wounded man out on the street.

Original: Cloud: Elmyra. I know what you said, but you have to let us go after Aerith.
Dialogue: Elmyra. I know what you said, but you have to let us go after Aerith.

Original: Elmyra: Not this again.
Dialogue: Not this again.

Original: Cloud: We found an underground Shinra lab where they've done human testing. This wasn't the first time and it won't be the last. I know these people, and I know they're never gonna let Aerith go. She's the last living Ancient on the planet. Think about what that means to Shinra's scientists. Especially to that son of a bitch Hojo. We're all just numbers and meat to him.
Dialogue: We found an underground Shinra lab where they've done human testing. This wasn't the first time and it won't be the last. I know these people, and I know they're never gonna let Aerith go. She's the last living Ancient on the planet. Think about what that means to Shinra's scientists. Especially to that son of a bitch Hojo. We're all just numbers and meat to him.

Original: Elmyra: Enough!
Dialogue: Enough!

Original: Cloud: But
Dialogue: But—

Original: Elmyra: Please. I need some time to think. You've all had a long day. Why don't you go upstairs and get some rest.
Dialogue: Please. I need some time to think. You've all had a long day. Why don't you go upstairs and get some rest.

Original: Barret: You should rest up while you can.
Dialogue: You should rest up while you can.

Original: Cloud: Likewise.
Dialogue: Likewise.

Original: Barret: Nah, I'm goodreal good. 'Sides, when I close my eyes, I start thinking 'bout things. 'Bout people. Like Finn. Lazy little punk. Kid would do damn near anything 'cept what you told him. But ask him to paint you a picture and boy howdy. Those Stamps in the tunnels? Finn's work. Every one.
Dialogue: Nah, I'm good—real good. 'Sides, when I close my eyes, I start thinking 'bout things. 'Bout people. Like Finn. Lazy little punk. Kid would do damn near anything 'cept what you told him. But ask him to paint you a picture and boy howdy. Those Stamps in the tunnels? Finn's work. Every one.

Original: Barret: Then there's Al. Intel guy. He had these tricks for stealing codes I still don't understand. Stole his share of hearts, too. But, when it came to the ladies, he just had the one trick. Bouquet of flowers hidden behind his back. Funny to think, some of 'em might've even come from here. He pulled the flower trick on Tifa once, believe it or not. She told him where to stick 'em.
Dialogue: Then there's Al. Intel guy. He had these tricks for stealing codes I still don't understand. Stole his share of hearts, too. But, when it came to the ladies, he just had the one trick. Bouquet of flowers hidden behind his back. Funny to think, some of 'em might've even come from here. He pulled the flower trick on Tifa once, believe it or not. She told him where to stick 'em.

Original: Cloud: 'Course she did.
Dialogue: Course she did.

Original: Barret: Our quartermaster, Nellie, had a good laugh at that. She was tight with Jessie. People sometimes took 'em for sisters even. They'd say "No way!" and get upset, but then they'd start giggling and you knew...
Dialogue: Our quartermaster, Nellie, had a good laugh at that. She was tight with Jessie. People sometimes took 'em for sisters even. They'd say "No way!" and get upset, but then they'd start giggling and you knew...

Original: Barret: Yeah... They'll all be fine. They're strong. They're tough. Like me. After we save Aerith, I'll introduce you to them.
Dialogue: Yeah... They'll all be fine. They're strong. They're tough. Like me. After we save Aerith, I'll introduce you to them.

Original: Cloud: Sounds good.
Dialogue: Sounds good.

Original: Barret: Never thought I'd feel better after talking with your hard-boiled ass.
Dialogue: Never thought I'd feel better after talking with your hard-boiled ass.

Original: Cloud: Think you can sleep now?
Dialogue: Think you can sleep now?

Original: Barret: Oh yeah. Like a baby.
Dialogue: Oh yeah. Like a baby.

Original: Cloud: Can't sleep?
Dialogue: Can't sleep?

Original: Tifa: No. You too?
Dialogue: No. You too?

Original: Cloud: I heard footsteps.
Dialogue: I heard footsteps.

Original: Tifa: Sorry. Didn't mean to wake you.
Dialogue: Sorry. Didn't mean to wake you.

Original: Cloud: I'm a light sleeper. It's a SOLDIER thing.
Dialogue: I'm a light sleeper. It's a SOLDIER thing.

Original: Tifa: That flower you gave me the other night. That was from Aerith, wasn't it?
Dialogue: That flower you gave me the other night. That was from Aerith, wasn't it?

Original: Tifa: I knew there was something weird going on. You, buying flowers. They symbolize reunion, believe it or not. I was curious, so I looked it up. I tried to keep it alive as long as I could. But now...it's dead and buried.
Dialogue: I knew there was something weird going on. You, buying flowers. They symbolize reunion, believe it or not. I was curious, so I looked it up. I tried to keep it alive as long as I could. But now...it's dead and buried.

Original: Tifa: Like the bar...our home...and everything else.
Dialogue: Like the bar...our home...and everything else.

Original: Tifa: They took everything from us. Again. (cries)
Dialogue: They took everything from us. Again. (cries)

Original: Tifa: Cloud... Cloud, you're hurting me.
Dialogue: Cloud... Cloud, you're hurting me.

Original: Tifa: It's stupid. I know that crying's a waste of time.
Dialogue: It's stupid. I know that crying's a waste of time.

Original: Cloud: That's not true.
Dialogue: That's not true.

Original: Tifa: Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Cloud: How is this...? Is this a dream?
Dialogue: How is this...? Is this a dream?

Original: Aerith: Maybe. You tell me.
Dialogue: Maybe. You tell me.

Original: Cloud: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Aerith: Don't I look it? I used to live in the Shinra Building, back when I was really little.
Dialogue: Don't I look it? I used to live in the Shinra Building, back when I was really little.

Original: Cloud: Your mom told us.
Dialogue: Your mom told us.

Original: Aerith: Right. So it kinda feels like I've gone back to my childhood home, you know? Honestly, it's not that bad.
Dialogue: Right. So it kinda feels like I've gone back to my childhood home, you know? Honestly, it's not that bad.

Original: Cloud: So what, you wanna stay?
Dialogue: So what, you wanna stay?

Original: Aerith: C'mon, Cloud. Don't be silly.
Dialogue: C'mon, Cloud. Don't be silly.

Original: Cloud: Your mom's really worried too.
Dialogue: Your mom's really worried too.

Original: Aerith: "Too"? So you're worried about me?
Dialogue: "Too"? So you're worried about me?

Original: Cloud: Of course I am.
Dialogue: Of course I am.

Original: Aerith: I'm sorry about that. Really.
Dialogue: I'm sorry about that. Really.

Original: Cloud: Is that...?
Dialogue: Is that...?

Original: Aerith: Everyone dies eventually.
Dialogue: Everyone dies eventually.

Original: Cloud: I suppose.
Dialogue: I suppose.

Original: Aerith: So we need to make the most of the time we haveto live our lives the way we wanna live. Every minute...every moment, matters.
Dialogue: So we need to make the most of the time we have—to live our lives the way we wanna live. Every minute...every moment, matters.

Original: Cloud: I'll remember that.
Dialogue: I'll remember that.

Original: Aerith: Good. So...
Dialogue: Good. So...

Original: Cloud: You need to embrace this moment. Right?
Dialogue: You need to embrace this moment. Right?

Original: Aerith: I'm glad I met you, Cloud. I really am. I'm grateful for all the words we've shared. For all the moments and the memories. You've made me more happy than you know. And I'll always cherish what you've given me. But... But whatever happens, you can't fall in love with me. Even if you think you have...it's not real.
Dialogue: I'm glad I met you, Cloud. I really am. I'm grateful for all the words we've shared. For all the moments and the memories. You've made me more happy than you know. And I'll always cherish what you've given me. But... But whatever happens, you can't fall in love with me. Even if you think you have...it's not real.

Original: Cloud: Do I get a say in all this?
Dialogue: Do I get a say in all this?

Original: Aerith: It's almost morning. Time to go.
Dialogue: It's almost morning. Time to go.

Original: Cloud: I'm coming for you.
Dialogue: I'm coming for you.

Original: Aerith: If that's what you want. Thank you.
Dialogue: If that's what you want. Thank you.

Original: Barret: You've done more for us than we deserve. I won't forget this. If you ever need anything, all you gotta do is holler.
Dialogue: You've done more for us than we deserve. I won't forget this. If you ever need anything, all you gotta do is holler.

Original: Elmyra: Happy to help out however I can.
Dialogue: Happy to help out however I can.

Original: Cloud: Elmyra.
Dialogue: Elmyra.

Original: Elmyra: ...I've been thinking about what you said.
Dialogue: ...I've been thinking about what you said.

Original: Cloud: She's calling out to me. I can feel it.
Dialogue: She's calling out to me. I can feel it.

Original: Tifa: We all can. So please. She's our friend. We have to help her.
Dialogue: We all can. So please. She's our friend. We have to help her.

Original: Barret: Mm.
Dialogue: Mm.

Original: Elmyra: I always knew it was coming. Knew that one day I'd have to say goodbye to my baby girl. But not yet. Pleasebring her back to me.
Dialogue: I always knew it was coming. Knew that one day I'd have to say goodbye to my baby girl. But not yet. Please—bring her back to me.

Original: Marlene: Daddy!
Dialogue: Daddy!

Original: Barret: Marlene...
Dialogue: Marlene...

Original: Marlene: Are you going?
Dialogue: Are you going?

Original: Barret: I'm sorry, honey. I wish I didn't have to. I wish I could be with you all the time. I really do. But if I stay here, I can't fight out there.
Dialogue: I'm sorry, honey. I wish I didn't have to. I wish I could be with you all the time. I really do. But if I stay here, I can't fight out there.

Original: Marlene: Hm?
Dialogue: Hm?

Original: Barret: Some bad people are...trying to hurt the planet. And Daddy...Daddy and his friends are trying to stop those bad people. The slums, your friends, the whole planetit's Daddy's job to protect it.
Dialogue: Some bad people are...trying to hurt the planet. And Daddy...Daddy and his friends are trying to stop those bad people. The slums, your friends, the whole planet—it's Daddy's job to protect it.

Original: Barret: And that's why I've gotta go. You remember that nice girl who came to find you? Well, now we have to go find her. And when we bring her home, you ned to say thank you, okay?
Dialogue: And that's why I've gotta go. You remember that nice girl who came to find you? Well, now we have to go find her. And when we bring her home, you ned to say thank you, okay?

Original: Marlene: 'Kay! That girl... She was kinda...
Dialogue: Kay! That girl... She was kinda...

Original: Barret: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Marlene: Nothing. You should help her.
Dialogue: Nothing. You should help her.

Original: Barret: We will.
Dialogue: We will.

Original: Marlene: You'll come back...right?
Dialogue: You'll come back...right?

Original: Barret: Of course, I promise.
Dialogue: Of course, I promise.

Original: Marlene: Okay. You can go!
Dialogue: Okay. You can go!

Original: Tifa: Barret...
Dialogue: Barret...

Original: Barret: She's tougher than me.
Dialogue: She's tougher than me.

Original: Barret: Aight! Time to get some payback.
Dialogue: Aight! Time to get some payback.

Original: Cloud: Don't forget why we're doing this.
Dialogue: Don't forget why we're doing this.

Original: Barret: I know, I know. To rescue Aerith.
Dialogue: I know, I know. To rescue Aerith.

Original: Tifa: So, how're we supposed to get topside? With everything that's happened, the trains still aren't running.
Dialogue: So, how're we supposed to get topside? With everything that's happened, the trains still aren't running.

Original: Barret: Well, we could walk along the tracks.
Dialogue: Well, we could walk along the tracks.

Original: Cloud: The city's on high alert. All the roads and public transit have probably been locked down by now.
Dialogue: The city's on high alert. All the roads and public transit have probably been locked down by now.

Original: Barret: So what's the plan then? You know another way up?
Dialogue: So what's the plan then? You know another way up?

Original: Tifa: No, but I think I know someone who might.
Dialogue: No, but I think I know someone who might.

Original: Cloud: You mean Corneo.
Dialogue: You mean Corneo.

Original: Kyrie: My fellow grounders, listen up, because boy, do I have some news for you! And it's assured to knock your socks all the way into next week! Gather round, 'cause this is the good stuff!
Dialogue: My fellow grounders, listen up, because boy, do I have some news for you! And it's assured to knock your socks all the way into next week! Gather round, 'cause this is the good stuff!

Original: Kyrie: So, after bombing Reactors 1 and 5, what do the eco-terrorists do? They go for the trifecta and take out Mako Reactor 7! Another attack by amateurs who don't care about collateral damage. The sky is falling and Avalanche is to blame! But wait! Did you know Wutai is the one funding their activities!? For all their claims about fighting for the slums...they're nothing more than pawns of Wutaipuppets dancing to the tune of their foreign masters! And that's the truth! Topside news delivered straight to your ears! That'll be five gil. Five gilcome on!
Dialogue: So, after bombing Reactors 1 and 5, what do the eco-terrorists do? They go for the trifecta and take out Mako Reactor 7! Another attack by amateurs who don't care about collateral damage. The sky is falling and Avalanche is to blame! But wait! Did you know Wutai is the one funding their activities!? For all their claims about fighting for the slums...they're nothing more than pawns of Wutai—puppets dancing to the tune of their foreign masters! And that's the truth! Topside news delivered straight to your ears! That'll be five gil. Five gil—come on!

Original: Undercity Resident (1): Damn, man! Knew we couldn't trust Wutai to leave us alone.
Dialogue: Damn, man! Knew we couldn't trust Wutai to leave us alone.

Original: Undercity Resident (2): It's the reactors. They want 'em, we got 'em.
Dialogue: It's the reactors. They want 'em, we got 'em.

Original: Undercity Resident (3): Does this mean there'll be another war?
Dialogue: Does this mean there'll be another war?

Original: Undercity Resident (1): After what they've done? What choice do we have?
Dialogue: After what they've done? What choice do we have?

Original: Kyrie: Five gil apiececough it up! The truth ain't free, you know!
Dialogue: Five gil apiece—cough it up! The truth ain't free, you know!

Original: Barret: We ain't no damn pawns of Wutai! I couldn't care less about the rest, but that shit?
Dialogue: We ain't no damn pawns of Wutai! I couldn't care less about the rest, but that shit?

Original: Tifa: No one will listen to us. There's no point in even trying.
Dialogue: No one will listen to us. There's no point in even trying.

Original: Tifa: I'm sorry.
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Original: Barret: Hey... Hey Tifa, listen. There's no room in this for regrets or what-ifs or any of that. All we can do is keep moving forward. Keep following this path we chose. Wherever, so we can say we did all we could.
Dialogue: Hey... Hey Tifa, listen. There's no room in this for regrets or what-ifs or any of that. All we can do is keep moving forward. Keep following this path we chose. Wherever, so we can say we did all we could.

Original: Tifa: I know. But...right now...instead of looking forward, you need to look around. Everyone here is terrified. So I'm asking you...don't.
Dialogue: I know. But...right now...instead of looking forward, you need to look around. Everyone here is terrified. So I'm asking you...don't.

Original: Tifa: I know we're short on time, but let's try to help out wherever we can.
Dialogue: I know we're short on time, but let's try to help out wherever we can.

Original: Chadley: Marvelous! Leviathan, the patron deity of Wutai, is not an enemy to be trifled with. Together, you can cleanse the world of the Shinra scourge.
Dialogue: Marvelous! Leviathan, the patron deity of Wutai, is not an enemy to be trifled with. Together, you can cleanse the world of the Shinra scourge.

Original: (Upon defeating Bahamut in Chadley's VR Combat Simulator.)Chadley: Now that was a battle! What an impressive feat to hold your own against one of the most exalted summons known to man. Together with the legendary Bahamut, I have every confidence you can expunge Shinra from existence. Such bravery... incredible!
Dialogue: Now that was a battle! What an impressive feat to hold your own against one of the most exalted summons known to man. Together with the legendary Bahamut, I have every confidence you can expunge Shinra from existence. Such bravery... incredible!

Original: Tifa: Do we really have to deal with Corneo again?
Dialogue: Do we really have to deal with Corneo again?

Original: Cloud: Got no other choice.
Dialogue: Got no other choice.

Original: Barret: What? Did you guys get into it with him or something?
Dialogue: What? Did you guys get into it with him or something?

Original: Tifa: I don't wanna talk about it.
Dialogue: I don't wanna talk about it.

Original: Barret: Huh? Hey, Cloud, what ha
Dialogue: Huh? Hey, Cloud, what ha—

Original: Cloud: Don't recall.
Dialogue: Don't recall.

Original: Innkeeper: It's quite crowded at the moment, but I'll see what I can do.
Dialogue: It's quite crowded at the moment, but I'll see what I can do.

Original: On-screen: Stay the night?
Dialogue: Stay the night?

Original: Innkeeper: Have a safe trip.
Dialogue: Have a safe trip.

Original: Souvenir Shop Owner: With these babies, you can send intruders flying! I guarantee this is the only home protection you'll ever need!
Dialogue: With these babies, you can send intruders flying! I guarantee this is the only home protection you'll ever need!

Original: Souvenir Shop Owner: Only a few left. Get yours while you can!
Dialogue: Only a few left. Get yours while you can!

Original: Gatekeeper: Hey, been waiting for ya. Sowhat're ya in the mood to fight?
Dialogue: Hey, been waiting for ya. So—what're ya in the mood to fight?

Original: Barret: No one's home.
Dialogue: No one's home.

Original: Kotch: Help, somebody! Hey!
Dialogue: Help, somebody! Hey!

Original: Kotch: You mother Uh, I mean... Hey, there. Would you mind helping me out? I'm kind of in a bind, as you can see...
Dialogue: You mother— Uh, I mean... Hey, there. Would you mind helping me out? I'm kind of in a bind, as you can see...

Original: Kotch: Thanks, you guys! Man, these jerks from Shinra showed up outta nowhere! Accused me of leaking information and called me "useless." And, well, the rest is history. Well, anyway, thanks for helping me out. Peace out!
Dialogue: Thanks, you guys! Man, these jerks from Shinra showed up outta nowhere! Accused me of leaking information and called me "useless." And, well, the rest is history. Well, anyway, thanks for helping me out. Peace out!

Original: Leslie: Long time no see. What brings you back here?
Dialogue: Long time no see. What brings you back here?

Original: Tifa: Well, we need to find a way to get topside as quickly as possible, and we figured Corneo oughta know one.
Dialogue: Well, we need to find a way to get topside as quickly as possible, and we figured Corneo oughta know one.

Original: Leslie: Is that so... In that case, I can help.
Dialogue: Is that so... In that case, I can help.

Original: Barret: You serious? Then tell us!
Dialogue: You serious? Then tell us!

Original: Leslie: Follow me.
Dialogue: Follow me.

Original: Cloud: Let's just hear him out.
Dialogue: Let's just hear him out.

Original: Barret: So...what's the deal with the hole?
Dialogue: So...what's the deal with the hole?

Original: Leslie: Unfinished business. If you three give me a hand with it, I'll give you what you need to get topside.
Dialogue: Unfinished business. If you three give me a hand with it, I'll give you what you need to get topside.

Original: Tifa: You want us to go back into the sewers with you? What's down there?
Dialogue: You want us to go back into the sewers with you? What's down there?

Original: Leslie: Corneo's hidey-hole. That's where I'm headed.
Dialogue: Corneo's hidey-hole. That's where I'm headed.

Original: Barret: You're not gonna try to screw us over, are you?
Dialogue: You're not gonna try to screw us over, are you?

Original: Leslie: If that's what you think, walk away. I'll find somebody else to work with. And you'll have to find another way to get topside.
Dialogue: If that's what you think, walk away. I'll find somebody else to work with. And you'll have to find another way to get topside.

Original: Cloud: All right. We're in.
Dialogue: All right. We're in.

Original: Barret: Say what?
Dialogue: Say what?

Original: Cloud: He betrays us, he dies.
Dialogue: He betrays us, he dies.

Original: Leslie: Fine by me.
Dialogue: Fine by me.

Original: Tifa: He means it.
Dialogue: He means it.

Original: Leslie: I'll tell you more after we've climbed down. When you're good to go, let me know.
Dialogue: I'll tell you more after we've climbed down. When you're good to go, let me know.

Original: Leslie: You guys ready?
Dialogue: You guys ready?

Original: On-screen: Head into the sewer?
Dialogue: Head into the sewer?

Original: Leslie: Okay. Follow me.
Dialogue: Okay. Follow me.

Original: Barret: Seriouslywhat's the deal with the hole?
Dialogue: Seriously—what's the deal with the hole?

Original: Cloud: It's a trop for the don's enemies.
Dialogue: It's a trop for the don's enemies.

Original: Barret: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Leslie: No one's ever gotten out alive. Well. Until recently that is.
Dialogue: No one's ever gotten out alive. Well. Until recently that is.

Original: Ms. Folia: How far could they have gone?
Dialogue: How far could they have gone?

Original: Ms. Folia: Oh, Cloud! Have you seen the kids around by any chance? I haven't seen them since they left to do their patrols. I knew I should've told them to stay inside today. If you do happen to run into them somewhere, could you tell them to come back right away? I can describe them if it'd help
Dialogue: Oh, Cloud! Have you seen the kids around by any chance? I haven't seen them since they left to do their patrols. I knew I should've told them to stay inside today. If you do happen to run into them somewhere, could you tell them to come back right away? I can describe them if it'd help—

Original: Cloud: Don't worry. I'll know.
Dialogue: Don't worry. I'll know.

Original: Barret: Just stay calm and wait here. Never knowthey might come back on their own. Okay?
Dialogue: Just stay calm and wait here. Never know—they might come back on their own. Okay?

Original: Ms. Folia: Yes, of course. Thank you so very much.
Dialogue: Yes, of course. Thank you so very much.

Original: Oates: Hey, Cloud.
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud.

Original: Barret: Hmm. Gotta be one of them lost kids.
Dialogue: Hmm. Gotta be one of them lost kids.

Original: Oates: Lost? Who said we were lost? Stupid old man.
Dialogue: Lost? Who said we were lost? Stupid old man.

Original: Barret: What'd you say?
Dialogue: What'd you say?

Original: Cloud: What're you doing out here? And where's everyone else?
Dialogue: What're you doing out here? And where's everyone else?

Original: Oates: Well, we saw a bunch of tombstones lying on the ground, so we decided to stand them back up. And then I heard laughing coming from somewhere, and when I turned around, everyone was gone. I was alone.
Dialogue: Well, we saw a bunch of tombstones lying on the ground, so we decided to stand them back up. And then I heard laughing coming from somewhere, and when I turned around, everyone was gone. I was alone.

Original: Oates: That! I heard that and everyone disappeared.
Dialogue: That! I heard that and everyone disappeared.

Original: Cloud: Heads up!
Dialogue: Heads up!

Original: Oates: Guys!
Dialogue: Guys!

Original: Boy (1): Oates!
Dialogue: Oates!

Original: Boy (2): Look! Cloud's here too!
Dialogue: Look! Cloud's here too!

Original: Barret: So why'd you kids come out all this way?
Dialogue: So why'd you kids come out all this way?

Original: Oates: This is where our parents are. They're resting, but we wanted to say hi. Sometimes you just wanna do that, you know?
Dialogue: This is where our parents are. They're resting, but we wanted to say hi. Sometimes you just wanna do that, you know?

Original: Barret: ...I do.
Dialogue: ...I do.

Original: Oates: Thanks so much for coming to find us! That's another one I owe ya! We're gonna head back to the House now. Ms. Folia's probably pretty worried.
Dialogue: Thanks so much for coming to find us! That's another one I owe ya! We're gonna head back to the House now. Ms. Folia's probably pretty worried.

Original: Boy (2): Hey Cloud, I found this on the ground. You should take it. I think it might come in handy!
Dialogue: Hey Cloud, I found this on the ground. You should take it. I think it might come in handy!

Original: Barret: Buncha little smart-asses... With good hearts.
Dialogue: Buncha little smart-asses... With good hearts.

Original: Stablehand: Hey, you! Cloud, right? Man, am I glad I caught you. Samhe told me who you are. Said you're a merc, and a former SOLDIER at that! Listen, I hate to ask, but we've got a few runaway birds. Mind helping us find them? Poor things were so startled by that plate coming down, they just up and bolted. I'm sure they're around here somewhere, frightened and hungry. My poor birds...
Dialogue: Hey, you! Cloud, right? Man, am I glad I caught you. Sam—he told me who you are. Said you're a merc, and a former SOLDIER at that! Listen, I hate to ask, but we've got a few runaway birds. Mind helping us find them? Poor things were so startled by that plate coming down, they just up and bolted. I'm sure they're around here somewhere, frightened and hungry. My poor birds...

Original: Barret: Worried about 'em huh? All right. I think we can help you out.
Dialogue: Worried about 'em huh? All right. I think we can help you out.

Original: Stablehand: Oh, thank you! When you find them, feed them this. THere's there missing all told, and their names are Coco, Lolo, and Momo. They'll come on home once they got some food in their bellies. Good luck. I'm counting on y'all.
Dialogue: Oh, thank you! When you find them, feed them this. THere's there missing all told, and their names are Coco, Lolo, and Momo. They'll come on home once they got some food in their bellies. Good luck. I'm counting on y'all.

Original: Stablehand: Oh, thank goodness! Been looking for y'all. You gotta help me. It's the chocobos... They've escaped, wouldn't you know!
Dialogue: Oh, thank goodness! Been looking for y'all. You gotta help me. It's the chocobos... They've escaped, wouldn't you know!

Original: Sam: Thanks for agreeing to find my birds. You're a real saint. Someone said they heard a chocobo warking in one of them Sector 5 back alleys. Heard there's a chocobo out by the collapsed expressway. A chocobo was spotted near the old church. That's about all that's reached my ears. I'd bet good money those wandering birds are mine.
Dialogue: Thanks for agreeing to find my birds. You're a real saint. Someone said they heard a chocobo warking in one of them Sector 5 back alleys. Heard there's a chocobo out by the collapsed expressway. A chocobo was spotted near the old church. That's about all that's reached my ears. I'd bet good money those wandering birds are mine.

Original: Chocobo: Kweh kweh.
Dialogue: Kweh kweh.

Original: Chocobo: Kweh...? Kweh!
Dialogue: Kweh...? Kweh!

Original: Chocobo: Wark wark. Kweh kweh.
Dialogue: Wark wark. Kweh kweh.

Original: Barret: Okay then! That makes three.
Dialogue: Okay then! That makes three.

Original: Cloud: We'd better check in at Sam's.
Dialogue: We'd better check in at Sam's.

Original: On-screen: Return to Sam?
Dialogue: Return to Sam?

Original: Sam: There's the champ with a heard of gold! My babies are all back home, safe and sound. Now I can finally get back to the busienss of business. Thanks, partner. Here, y'all earned this. It's a pass that'll get you a ride on one of my carriages whenever you need itfree of charge, of course. Not bad, am I right?
Dialogue: There's the champ with a heard of gold! My babies are all back home, safe and sound. Now I can finally get back to the busienss of business. Thanks, partner. Here, y'all earned this. It's a pass that'll get you a ride on one of my carriages whenever you need it—free of charge, of course. Not bad, am I right?

Original: Sam: Chocobos're somethin' else. You can ride 'em, pet 'em, befriend 'em. What would we do without 'em? They're the reason a guy like me can keep a roof over his head in a town like thisand that's no lie. I wouldn't blame ya for doubting that coming from me, but it is what it is.
Dialogue: Chocobos're somethin' else. You can ride 'em, pet 'em, befriend 'em. What would we do without 'em? They're the reason a guy like me can keep a roof over his head in a town like this—and that's no lie. I wouldn't blame ya for doubting that coming from me, but it is what it is.

Original: Madam M: If it isn't Cloud.
Dialogue: If it isn't Cloud.

Original: Cloud: We're looking for a way topside. Know one?
Dialogue: We're looking for a way topside. Know one?

Original: Madam M: Good luck with that. Security's so tight these days that not even a gnat could slip through. Wall Market's in a sorry state, too. Corneo's men are turning it upside down looking for Avalanche.
Dialogue: Good luck with that. Security's so tight these days that not even a gnat could slip through. Wall Market's in a sorry state, too. Corneo's men are turning it upside down looking for Avalanche.

Original: Madam M: Hmm? The man with a gun for an arm...
Dialogue: Hmm? The man with a gun for an arm...

Original: Barret: What? Got a problem?
Dialogue: What? Got a problem?

Original: Madam M: No, but you might. Corneo's men are searching high and low for an Avalanche member who fits your description. Shinra has placed a very impressive bounty on you and your friends' heads. And a lot of people are looking to get rich.
Dialogue: No, but you might. Corneo's men are searching high and low for an Avalanche member who fits your description. Shinra has placed a very impressive bounty on you and your friends' heads. And a lot of people are looking to get rich.

Original: Barret: Ain't these fools got anything better to do?
Dialogue: Ain't these fools got anything better to do?

Original: Madam M: You should also know that you and that arm of yours were spotted in the Sector 5 slums. Apparently, you were loitering in a rather lovely flower garden?
Dialogue: You should also know that you and that arm of yours were spotted in the Sector 5 slums. Apparently, you were loitering in a rather lovely flower garden?

Original: Barret: Oh yeah...? Wait!
Dialogue: Oh yeah...? Wait!

Original: Tifa: This is bad. Really bad.
Dialogue: This is bad. Really bad.

Original: Barret: Let's move!
Dialogue: Let's move!

Original: Madam M: Do be careful on your way back to the slums.
Dialogue: Do be careful on your way back to the slums.

Original: Housemother: Oh Cloud! Thank goodness you're here. A group of Corneo's men just came throughheaded for Aerith's place.
Dialogue: Oh Cloud! Thank goodness you're here. A group of Corneo's men just came through—headed for Aerith's place.

Original: Housemother: I don't know what business they have with Aerith, but I know it can't be anything good.
Dialogue: I don't know what business they have with Aerith, but I know it can't be anything good.

Original: Corneo Lackey: I dunno... You really think this gun-arm dude'll come back instead of running?
Dialogue: I dunno... You really think this gun-arm dude'll come back instead of running?

Original: Hoodlum: Oh, you bet your ass he'll come back. Now shut up and keep your eyes peeled.
Dialogue: Oh, you bet your ass he'll come back. Now shut up and keep your eyes peeled.

Original: Corneo Lackey: Yeah, yeah. Well, not like we're goin' anywhere with this thing, anyway.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. Well, not like we're goin' anywhere with this thing, anyway.

Original: Hoodlum: How's he holdin' up?
Dialogue: How's he holdin' up?

Original: Corneo Lackey: Beats me. His face creeps me out.
Dialogue: Beats me. His face creeps me out.

Original: Corneo Lackey: Better watch where he points that thing.
Dialogue: Better watch where he points that thing.

Original: Hoodlum: Better watch your mouth, bitch. You don't wanna give him a reason to hold a grudge, ya know?
Dialogue: Better watch your mouth, bitch. You don't wanna give him a reason to hold a grudge, ya know?

Original: Corneo Lackey: Hey, it's him! Gun-arm!
Dialogue: Hey, it's him! Gun-arm!

Original: Barret: Heard you punks were lookin' for me. Didn't wanna keep you waitin'.
Dialogue: Heard you punks were lookin' for me. Didn't wanna keep you waitin'.

Original: Corneo Lackey: Wait! You!?
Dialogue: Wait! You!?

Original: Hoodlum: Should've known you were one of 'em!
Dialogue: Should've known you were one of 'em!

Original: Cloud: But am I?
Dialogue: But am I?

Original: Hoodlum: Whateverenough of this bullshit! Hey, let 'em loose.
Dialogue: Whatever—enough of this bullshit! Hey, let 'em loose.

Original: Corneo Lackey': Uh, sure!
Dialogue: Uh, sure!

Original: Hoodlum: Hah! Y'all are in for a world of hurt now! Hack 'em to bis, y'hear me! Leave the faces, though. Shinra ain't gonna give us the bounty otherwise!
Dialogue: Hah! Y'all are in for a world of hurt now! Hack 'em to bis, y'hear me! Leave the faces, though. Shinra ain't gonna give us the bounty otherwise!

Original: Hoodlum: We give up, okay!? We won't say a word to no one about you bein' here. Reallyhonest!
Dialogue: We give up, okay!? We won't say a word to no one about you bein' here. Really—honest!

Original: Cloud: That's right. You'll tell everyone we were never herethat the rumors were bullshit. And if we hear about you, or any of your friends, coming round here ever again...
Dialogue: That's right. You'll tell everyone we were never here—that the rumors were bullshit. And if we hear about you, or any of your friends, coming round here ever again...

Original: Tifa: You'll answer to my boot.
Dialogue: You'll answer to my boot.

Original: Hoodlum: Yessir! Er, miss!
Dialogue: Yessir! Er, miss!

Original: Jules: It's been hours nowdon't you think you've done enough? Believe me, I ought to know.
Dialogue: It's been hours now—don't you think you've done enough? Believe me, I ought to know.

Original: Andrea: No...not yet...
Dialogue: No...not yet...

Original: Ronnie: Andi...
Dialogue: Andi...

Original: Andrea: Cloud... How are you?
Dialogue: Cloud... How are you?

Original: Cloud: I was hoping you knew a way we could get topside.
Dialogue: I was hoping you knew a way we could get topside.

Original: Andrea: Hmm... Sorry, but it's...not possible...
Dialogue: Hmm... Sorry, but it's...not possible...

Original: Andrea: Well, well. What do we have here? I can see you're someone who likes to train, to be their very best.
Dialogue: Well, well. What do we have here? I can see you're someone who likes to train, to be their very best.

Original: Tifa: Me?
Dialogue: Me?

Original: Andrea: Your physique: slender, yet toned. And that perfectly balanced symmetry. I can tell from a glance that you learned from the best there is. But your muscles look tight, which can only mean one thingyou're conflicted.
Dialogue: Your physique slender, yet toned. And that perfectly balanced symmetry. I can tell from a glance that you learned from the best there is. But your muscles look tight, which can only mean one thing—you're conflicted.

Original: Cloud: Tifa?
Dialogue: Tifa?

Original: Jules: Excuse me. You're Tifa, right? While you're here, wanna give Andi a run for his money? Work up a sweat, release some endorphins. It's the answer to everything. I promise.
Dialogue: Excuse me. You're Tifa, right? While you're here, wanna give Andi a run for his money? Work up a sweat, release some endorphins. It's the answer to everything. I promise.

Original: Andrea: I'm in...if you are.
Dialogue: I'm in...if you are.

Original: Andrea: All right then. The winner will be the one who does the most pull-ups.
Dialogue: All right then. The winner will be the one who does the most pull-ups.

Original: On-screen: Challenge Andrea?
Dialogue: Challenge Andrea?

Original: Andrea: It's just the two of us now.
Dialogue: It's just the two of us now.

Original: Andrea: Thank you. I had quite a wonderful time.
Dialogue: Thank you. I had quite a wonderful time.

Original: Andrea: You truly are perfection, my dear.
Dialogue: You truly are perfection, my dear.

Original: Andrea: ...It seems you've bested me, Tifa.
Dialogue: ...It seems you've bested me, Tifa.

Original: Tifa: I can't believe I won.
Dialogue: I can't believe I won.

Original: Andrea: Your fiery passion pushed me to my limits and helped me to overcome my lingering stress and fatigue. I'll be taking the stage tonight in the best condition of my life. Thank you.
Dialogue: Your fiery passion pushed me to my limits and helped me to overcome my lingering stress and fatigue. I'll be taking the stage tonight in the best condition of my life. Thank you.

Original: Tifa: No, thank you for...the same!
Dialogue: No, thank you for...the same!

Original: Andrea: To commemorate the evening. I would be honored if you joined me onstage for a perfomance someday. (laughs)
Dialogue: To commemorate the evening. I would be honored if you joined me onstage for a perfomance someday. (laughs)

Original: Jules: There's always time for training.
Dialogue: There's always time for training.

Original: Jay: Are you ready for this?
Dialogue: Are you ready for this?

Original: Jay: No!
Dialogue: No!

Original: Jules: Okaylet's have some fun!
Dialogue: Okay—let's have some fun!

Original: Jules: You know where to find me for a rematch.
Dialogue: You know where to find me for a rematch.

Original: Betty: Everyone's so sad... Think, think...
Dialogue: Everyone's so sad... Think, think...

Original: Betty: Oh, heya!
Dialogue: Oh, heya!

Original: Tifa: Betty. I'm so glad to see you're okay.
Dialogue: Betty. I'm so glad to see you're okay.

Original: Betty: You too! Uh, where's Marlene? Is she okay?
Dialogue: You too! Uh, where's Marlene? Is she okay?

Original: Barret: Don't worry. She's safe.
Dialogue: Don't worry. She's safe.

Original: Betty: Really? I'm so glad! Hey, can you help me with something? I'm looking for music discs for the jukebox. I think some new music might cheer people upmake them happy!
Dialogue: Really? I'm so glad! Hey, can you help me with something? I'm looking for music discs for the jukebox. I think some new music might cheer people up—make them happy!

Original: Tifa: That's a wonderful idea.
Dialogue: That's a wonderful idea.

Original: Barret: Okay! If we find any music discs, we'll bring 'em straight to you. You just promise to crank up the volume, all right?
Dialogue: Okay! If we find any music discs, we'll bring 'em straight to you. You just promise to crank up the volume, all right?

Original: Betty: You know I will! Thanks!
Dialogue: You know I will! Thanks!

Original: Betty: Hmm, I don't think this song's doing it. People still seem kinda sad. I'm still seeing a lot of frowns.
Dialogue: Hmm, I don't think this song's doing it. People still seem kinda sad. I'm still seeing a lot of frowns.

Original: Old Man: It's not right, me getting out...
Dialogue: It's not right, me getting out...

Original: Woman: Hngk...
Dialogue: Hngk...

Original: Man: Th-th-there's nothing left for me now.
Dialogue: Th-th-there's nothing left for me now.

Original: Guest: There's nothing quite like kicking back and letting the music flow through you. What's that? You wanna get in on my flow?
Dialogue: There's nothing quite like kicking back and letting the music flow through you. What's that? You wanna get in on my flow?

Original: Souvenir Shop Owner: With these babies, you can send intruders flying! I guarantee this is the only home protection you'll ever need!
Dialogue: With these babies, you can send intruders flying! I guarantee this is the only home protection you'll ever need!

Original: Woman: Hey, what's up man! You vibing with this jam too? You can have a copy if you want.
Dialogue: Hey, what's up man! You vibing with this jam too? You can have a copy if you want.

Original: Betty: Hmm, I don't think this song's doing it. People still seem kinda sad. I'm still seeing a lot of frowns.
Dialogue: Hmm, I don't think this song's doing it. People still seem kinda sad. I'm still seeing a lot of frowns.

Original: Betty: Ooh, I like this one. It's really peaceful, don't you think?
Dialogue: Ooh, I like this one. It's really peaceful, don't you think?

Original: Woman: Um... Is it okay if I stay and listen for a bit? This song is a favorite of mine.
Dialogue: Um... Is it okay if I stay and listen for a bit? This song is a favorite of mine.

Original: Betty: Sure!
Dialogue: Sure!

Original: Betty: Wow, what a song! It makes me feel like I can do anything!
Dialogue: Wow, what a song! It makes me feel like I can do anything!

Original: Man: Yeah...yeah! I can feel this song calling to my inner warrior. Yeah, I can take on the world! It's time I took action, made a stand!
Dialogue: Yeah...yeah! I can feel this song calling to my inner warrior. Yeah, I can take on the world! It's time I took action, made a stand!

Original: Barret: Hell yeah, that's it! That's the fire we need right now! Be a force for change, brother!
Dialogue: Hell yeah, that's it! That's the fire we need right now! Be a force for change, brother!

Original: Betty: I know this one! Marlene and I danced to it before.
Dialogue: I know this one! Marlene and I danced to it before.

Original: Old Man: That's wrong! Wrong, wrong, wrong! This is how you get down with this jam. I oughta knowit was my favorite back in the day! Pay attention kiddo! It's all in the hips!
Dialogue: That's wrong! Wrong, wrong, wrong! This is how you get down with this jam. I oughta know—it was my favorite back in the day! Pay attention kiddo! It's all in the hips!

Original: Marlene: Wow!
Dialogue: Wow!

Original: Betty: Tell me if you find more music discs!
Dialogue: Tell me if you find more music discs!

Original: Betty: Isn't this great!? Everyone's smiling again. Thanks so much for the help!
Dialogue: Isn't this great!? Everyone's smiling again. Thanks so much for the help!

Original: Tifa: Our pleasure. I think we needed it too.
Dialogue: Our pleasure. I think we needed it too.

Original: Barret: (hums victory fanfare, laughs) Until our victory fanfare rings out through all of Midgar, our battle will rage on! Hey, I'm just kidding.
Dialogue: (hums victory fanfare, laughs) Until our victory fanfare rings out through all of Midgar, our battle will rage on! Hey, I'm just kidding.

Original: Doctor: What am I gonna do now...?
Dialogue: What am I gonna do now...?

Original: Doctor: Hey, I know you. You're Aerith's bodyguard. I could really use her help. She always knew where to find the best herbs, and... You haven't seen her, have you? I used up all my meds treating people injured when the plate fell, you see. I could make more, but not without those herbs.
Dialogue: Hey, I know you. You're Aerith's bodyguard. I could really use her help. She always knew where to find the best herbs, and... You haven't seen her, have you? I used up all my meds treating people injured when the plate fell, you see. I could make more, but not without those herbs.

Original: Cloud: So what do you need?
Dialogue: So what do you need?

Original: Doctor: You mean you're willing to help me out? Oh, thank you! You'd be doing this town a huge favor. Here's a list of everything I'm looking for.
Dialogue: You mean you're willing to help me out? Oh, thank you! You'd be doing this town a huge favor. Here's a list of everything I'm looking for.

Original: On-screen: Return to the doctor?
Dialogue: Return to the doctor?

Original: Doctor: Oh! Did you manage to get everything I needed? Thank you. This oughta be more than enough. I can see why Aerith put her trust in you. Don't worry. I'll take it from here. You've done more than your fair share already. Here, take this. I'm betting it'll come in handy.
Dialogue: Oh! Did you manage to get everything I needed? Thank you. This oughta be more than enough. I can see why Aerith put her trust in you. Don't worry. I'll take it from here. You've done more than your fair share already. Here, take this. I'm betting it'll come in handy.

Original: Doctor: My medicine's gonna help a lot of people.
Dialogue: My medicine's gonna help a lot of people.

Original: Johnny: What were you thinking!? Stupid, stupid, stupid! Crawl into a hole and die!
Dialogue: What were you thinking!? Stupid, stupid, stupid! Crawl into a hole and die!

Original: Johnny: Bro! Tifa! Damn, is it good to see you guys again.
Dialogue: Bro! Tifa! Damn, is it good to see you guys again.

Original: Cloud: I told you to stop calling me that.
Dialogue: I told you to stop calling me that.

Original: Johnny: Bro. I'm in serious need of your expertise. Lend me a hand!
Dialogue: Bro. I'm in serious need of your expertise. Lend me a hand!

Original: Cloud: Fine, what?
Dialogue: Fine, what?

Original: Johnny: Truth is, I'm, uh, trying to get outta town, for, uh, reasons. Yeah, reasons. But the thing is... (cries) I got mugged! She took it. Took it all, man! I tried to chase her down, I really did! But she was real fast-like. Man, what I am gonna do? This could be the end for ol' Johnny boy! I'm beggin' yahelp me out! Come on, bro!
Dialogue: Truth is, I'm, uh, trying to get outta town, for, uh, reasons. Yeah, reasons. But the thing is... (cries) I got mugged! She took it. Took it all, man! I tried to chase her down, I really did! But she was real fast-like. Man, what I am gonna do? This could be the end for ol' Johnny boy! I'm beggin' ya—help me out! Come on, bro!

Original: Cloud: (sighs) What'd she look like?
Dialogue: (sighs) What'd she look like?

Original: Johnny: Bro! Uh, hold on. Lemme thinkwanna get this right. She was a cutie. Black hair. Pretty sure she was wearin' a hat. And...oh yeah! She was wearing these striped stockings too.
Dialogue: Bro! Uh, hold on. Lemme think—wanna get this right. She was a cutie. Black hair. Pretty sure she was wearin' a hat. And...oh yeah! She was wearing these striped stockings too.

Original: Cloud: Kyrie...?
Dialogue: Kyrie...?

Original: Barret: Which way'd she go?
Dialogue: Which way'd she go?

Original: Johnny: Uh, toward the church I think.
Dialogue: Uh, toward the church I think.

Original: Kyrie: What? It wasn't me. You've got the wrong girl! Never committed a crime in my life!
Dialogue: What? It wasn't me. You've got the wrong girl! Never committed a crime in my life!

Original: Cloud: You Kyrie?
Dialogue: You Kyrie?

Original: Kyrie: Kyrie? Who's that? Can't say I know her, but cool name.
Dialogue: Kyrie? Who's that? Can't say I know her, but cool name.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) Someone mugged our friend and took every last gil he had. Sound familiar?
Dialogue: (chuckles) Someone mugged our friend and took every last gil he had. Sound familiar?

Original: Kyrie: Oh, that? I thought I was in actual trouble. Don't scare me like that!
Dialogue: Oh, that? I thought I was in actual trouble. Don't scare me like that!

Original: Barret: Now I remember you. You're that chick. The one who was spreadin' lies in Sector 5.
Dialogue: Now I remember you. You're that chick. The one who was spreadin' lies in Sector 5.

Original: Kyrie: Oh yeah, I did do that. Good times, good times.
Dialogue: Oh yeah, I did do that. Good times, good times.

Original: Kyrie: Hold on. I know you, blondie! You're that merc everyone's talking about! Maybe my luck's not so bad. Shinra's after me. You've gotta help me.
Dialogue: Hold on. I know you, blondie! You're that merc everyone's talking about! Maybe my luck's not so bad. Shinra's after me. You've gotta help me.

Original: Cloud: Stole from them too, did you?
Dialogue: Stole from them too, did you?

Original: Kyrie: No! Well, yes, sortait's complicated. How was I supposed to know they were Shinra? And now those jerks won't leave me alone! Even though all I took was some ugly key. I mean, what's the big deal anyway?
Dialogue: No! Well, yes, sorta—it's complicated. How was I supposed to know they were Shinra? And now those jerks won't leave me alone! Even though all I took was some ugly key. I mean, what's the big deal anyway?

Original: Barret: Wait a minutethat was you!?
Dialogue: Wait a minute—that was you!?

Original: Kyrie: ...Oh greqt. So, everyone's talking about it? Is this the end? Am I a dead woman? Do I have to go on the run? Leave Midgar forever and never look back?
Dialogue: ...Oh greqt. So, everyone's talking about it? Is this the end? Am I a dead woman? Do I have to go on the run? Leave Midgar forever and never look back?

Original: Tifa: Kyrie, please. Just give us the money you stole from our friend, would you? And the key while you're at it.
Dialogue: Kyrie, please. Just give us the money you stole from our friend, would you? And the key while you're at it.

Original: Kyrie: No way. You're gonna split the second I do. And then who'll protect me? I can't handle this on my own...(cries)
Dialogue: No way. You're gonna split the second I do. And then who'll protect me? I can't handle this on my own...(cries)

Original: Cloud: We'll handle Shinra if you give us the key. Deal?
Dialogue: We'll handle Shinra if you give us the key. Deal?
