Original: Kyrie: It's a deal! Right about now, those Shinra creeps should be hanging out at the colosseum. They're waiting for a special match to start, starring yours truly. It's the talk of the town.
Dialogue: It's a deal! Right about now, those Shinra creeps should be hanging out at the colosseum. They're waiting for a special match to start, starring yours truly. It's the talk of the town.

Original: Tifa: You're joking!
Dialogue: You're joking!

Original: Kyrie: Oh, I won't be there. I'm not stupid.
Dialogue: Oh, I won't be there. I'm not stupid.

Original: Barret: It's a miracle you've managed to stay alive this long.
Dialogue: It's a miracle you've managed to stay alive this long.

Original: Kyrie: I'll take that as a compliment. Now run along and clean up my mess.
Dialogue: I'll take that as a compliment. Now run along and clean up my mess.

Original: Gatekeeper: Oh! Champ! Couldn't have picked a better time. This Kyrie chick totally flaked on her match, which means we're down a fighter. And we can't exactly pit the other guy against himself! What d'you say? Mind takin' her spot?
Dialogue: Oh! Champ! Couldn't have picked a better time. This Kyrie chick totally flaked on her match, which means we're down a fighter. And we can't exactly pit the other guy against himself! What d'you say? Mind takin' her spot?

Original: On-screen: Take on which challenge?
Dialogue: Take on which challenge?

Original: Beastmaster: The hell you doin' here!? Where's the girl, Kyrie!? That thievin' little pip-squeak!
Dialogue: The hell you doin' here!? Where's the girl, Kyrie!? That thievin' little pip-squeak!

Original: Barret: Guessin' he's the guy she's runnin' from.
Dialogue: Guessin' he's the guy she's runnin' from.

Original: Cloud: Kyrie's not coming. You'll have to make do with us.
Dialogue: Kyrie's not coming. You'll have to make do with us.

Original: Beastmaster: Whatever. I can roll with it. After all, you and me, we got unfinished business!
Dialogue: Whatever. I can roll with it. After all, you and me, we got unfinished business!

Original: Gatekeeper: In a shocking turn of events, our next bout is now a grudge match! Which of these two will claim victory in today's Angel Cup!? Fighters...begin!
Dialogue: In a shocking turn of events, our next bout is now a grudge match! Which of these two will claim victory in today's Angel Cup!? Fighters...begin!

Original: Gatekeeper: Our reigning champion does it again! Not only does he retain his crown, but now he can add beast whisperer to his list of impressive achievements!
Dialogue: Our reigning champion does it again! Not only does he retain his crown, but now he can add beast whisperer to his list of impressive achievements!

Original: Barret: Hah! That wasn't too much trouble.
Dialogue: Hah! That wasn't too much trouble.

Original: Gatekeeper: Watching you guys fight gave me goose bumps. Hope your next match is even better than the last!
Dialogue: Watching you guys fight gave me goose bumps. Hope your next match is even better than the last!

Original: On-screen: Return to Kyrie?
Dialogue: Return to Kyrie?

Original: Kyrie: So, how'd it go?
Dialogue: So, how'd it go?

Original: Cloud: Well enough. If they're smart, they won't send anyone else.
Dialogue: Well enough. If they're smart, they won't send anyone else.

Original: Kyrie: Really!? (sighs) That is so good to hear!
Dialogue: Really!? (sighs) That is so good to hear!

Original: Barret: Learn your lesson, girl?
Dialogue: Learn your lesson, girl?

Original: Kyrie: Totally! From now on, I only steal from the right people.
Dialogue: Totally! From now on, I only steal from the right people.

Original: Barret: That ain't the lesson.
Dialogue: That ain't the lesson.

Original: Kyrie: (sighs) Talk about a weight off my shoulders. Oh, I completely lost track of time! I'd better get going.
Dialogue: (sighs) Talk about a weight off my shoulders. Oh, I completely lost track of time! I'd better get going.

Original: Mireille: Hold it!
Dialogue: Hold it!

Original: Kyrie: Grandma!? Why're you here?
Dialogue: Grandma!? Why're you here?

Original: Mireille: You, young lady, are gonna hear about this later. Thank you for keeping her out of trouble.
Dialogue: You, young lady, are gonna hear about this later. Thank you for keeping her out of trouble.

Original: Tifa: She say "grandma"?
Dialogue: She say "grandma"?

Original: Mireille: What? Did I forget to mention it to you? Kyrie's my granddaughtermy flesh and blood. See? We even have the same eyes.
Dialogue: What? Did I forget to mention it to you? Kyrie's my granddaughter—my flesh and blood. See? We even have the same eyes.

Original: Mireille: Kyrie, the key. You've kept them waiting long enough.
Dialogue: Kyrie, the key. You've kept them waiting long enough.

Original: Kyrie: Yeah, yeah... What's it for, anyway? Why do you guys want it?
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah... What's it for, anyway? Why do you guys want it?

Original: Mireille: And how's that any of your business, young lady? Learn to wipe your own ass before you start rooting around in other people's shit.
Dialogue: And how's that any of your business, young lady? Learn to wipe your own ass before you start rooting around in other people's shit.

Original: Kyrie: Ugh, Grandma! Cut it out. You're embarrassing me...
Dialogue: Ugh, Grandma! Cut it out. You're embarrassing me...

Original: Mireille: Me embarrass you? Says the girl who steals from anyone. Even a thief needs principles, not to mention the courage of convictions to follow their conscience. Take it from methe Guardian Angel of the Slums.
Dialogue: Me embarrass you? Says the girl who steals from anyone. Even a thief needs principles, not to mention the courage of convictions to follow their conscience. Take it from me—the Guardian Angel of the Slums.

Original: Tifa: Wait a minuteyou're the Angel!?
Dialogue: Wait a minute—you're the Angel!?

Original: Mireille: And you three are Avalanche. There's a fire in you. I can see it flickering in your eyes. That same fire's in me, too. The Guardian Angel of the Slums, Avalanchethey're just names. We are who we choose to be. But you have to decide who that is, and commit. Make the most of your time while you still have it. Right?
Dialogue: And you three are Avalanche. There's a fire in you. I can see it flickering in your eyes. That same fire's in me, too. The Guardian Angel of the Slums, Avalanche—they're just names. We are who we choose to be. But you have to decide who that is, and commit. Make the most of your time while you still have it. Right?

Original: Damon: It's you, my good merc! What brilliant timing you have! Oh, hello thereit is a pleasure to meet you both. I'm a journalist for the Daily Buzz.
Dialogue: It's you, my good merc! What brilliant timing you have! Oh, hello there—it is a pleasure to meet you both. I'm a journalist for the Daily Buzz.

Original: Barret: The Daily Buzz? You mean that trash filled with Shinra fluff pieces?
Dialogue: The Daily Buzz? You mean that trash filled with Shinra fluff pieces?

Original: Damon: Well, yes, that's fairbut we do get a lot of inside information because of our close ties with the company. (laughs) Curious? Here's the scoop. A certain division of Shinrathat shall remain namelesswas planning to seize Corneo's assets. But before they could, the key to his secret vault within which his misbegotten gains were securely tucked away...was stolen! And my sources tell me that the thief...is the undercity's beloved hero: the Angel of the Slums! The unidentified bandit who's been targeting anyone with ties to Shinra or Corneo! Yes, that Angel of the Slums has struck again! Well? Do I have your undivided attention now?
Dialogue: Well, yes, that's fair—but we do get a lot of inside information because of our close ties with the company. (laughs) Curious? Here's the scoop. A certain division of Shinra—that shall remain nameless—was planning to seize Corneo's assets. But before they could, the key to his secret vault within which his misbegotten gains were securely tucked away...was stolen! And my sources tell me that the thief...is the undercity's beloved hero the Angel of the Slums! The unidentified bandit who's been targeting anyone with ties to Shinra or Corneo! Yes, that Angel of the Slums has struck again! Well? Do I have your undivided attention now?

Original: Barret: Kinda, but hurry it up. We don't have time for a three-act play.
Dialogue: Kinda, but hurry it up. We don't have time for a three-act play.

Original: Damon: Then I'll make this quick. So! My good merc. You do remember where the Angel's hideout is, right?
Dialogue: Then I'll make this quick. So! My good merc. You do remember where the Angel's hideout is, right?

Original: Cloud: Do you remember the death threat she left there?
Dialogue: Do you remember the death threat she left there?

Original: Damon: Oh, that. I've decided to seek the silver lining in this case. If the Angel of the Slums deigns to taken an interest in a humble reporter, then that itself would be a story!
Dialogue: Oh, that. I've decided to seek the silver lining in this case. If the Angel of the Slums deigns to taken an interest in a humble reporter, then that itself would be a story!

Original: Cloud: ...What are you asking?
Dialogue: ...What are you asking?

Original: Damon: If you recover the stolen key, feel free to help yourself to the contents of Corneo's vault. All I want is knowledgethe identity of the Angel. So if you happen to learn anything of value, I'd be tremendously grateful to you if you passed it along.
Dialogue: If you recover the stolen key, feel free to help yourself to the contents of Corneo's vault. All I want is knowledge—the identity of the Angel. So if you happen to learn anything of value, I'd be tremendously grateful to you if you passed it along.

Original: On-screen: Former Disposal Area
Dialogue: Former Disposal Area

Original: Barret: Okay then. Y'all think we got everything? Question is: now what? It's not gonna be easy selling this stuff.
Dialogue: Okay then. Y'all think we got everything? Question is now what? It's not gonna be easy selling this stuff.

Original: Tifa: Oh, I know. What about Marle? We could ask her to help. I'm sure she'd be happy to.
Dialogue: Oh, I know. What about Marle? We could ask her to help. I'm sure she'd be happy to.

Original: Marle: Oh, what brings you here?
Dialogue: Oh, what brings you here?

Original: Cloud: Gifts from an angel.
Dialogue: Gifts from an angel.

Original: Tifa: They're to be used to help the people of Sector 7 rebuild.
Dialogue: They're to be used to help the people of Sector 7 rebuild.

Original: Marle: The Angel of the Slums? You didn't meet her, did you? Tell me, what was she like?
Dialogue: The Angel of the Slums? You didn't meet her, did you? Tell me, what was she like?

Original: Cloud: Never met her. Just her go-between.
Dialogue: Never met her. Just her go-between.

Original: Marle: A shame. Bless her sweet soul... I don't know what to say... I'll make sure the funds are put to good use. Here, why don't you take this? Something tells me you can use it more than me.
Dialogue: A shame. Bless her sweet soul... I don't know what to say... I'll make sure the funds are put to good use. Here, why don't you take this? Something tells me you can use it more than me.

Original: Wymer: This is bad.
Dialogue: This is bad.

Original: Wymer: Oh, hey Barret.
Dialogue: Oh, hey Barret.

Original: Barret: Hey, how's it going?
Dialogue: Hey, how's it going?

Original: Wymer: Could be better. I've got a good number of watchmen out looking for survivors. But as much as I'd love to join them, I've got another mess on my hands at the moment. Remember those rumors about a lab? They're true. There is onehidden underground somewhere, and it's full of monsters. So, Cloud...think you can lend us a hand with it? It's only a matter of time before these monsters come calling. I know it's a dangerous job but
Dialogue: Could be better. I've got a good number of watchmen out looking for survivors. But as much as I'd love to join them, I've got another mess on my hands at the moment. Remember those rumors about a lab? They're true. There is one—hidden underground somewhere, and it's full of monsters. So, Cloud...think you can lend us a hand with it? It's only a matter of time before these monsters come calling. I know it's a dangerous job but—

Original: Cloud: But no one else can do it.
Dialogue: But no one else can do it.

Original: Wymer: Well, yeah. So help us out.
Dialogue: Well, yeah. So help us out.

Original: Wymer: I've been hearing reports of howling from deep underground.
Dialogue: I've been hearing reports of howling from deep underground.

Original: Neighborhood Watch Member: We've been getting tremors ever since last night. Roads are collapsing, and sinkholes are opening up all over.
Dialogue: We've been getting tremors ever since last night. Roads are collapsing, and sinkholes are opening up all over.

Original: Barret: Yeah! That's how it's done.
Dialogue: Yeah! That's how it's done.

Original: Wymer: You took care of those monsters? Oh, thank you! That's one less big problem to worry about. We owe you.
Dialogue: You took care of those monsters? Oh, thank you! That's one less big problem to worry about. We owe you.

Original: Barret: I know it's tough right now, but stay strong, y'hear?
Dialogue: I know it's tough right now, but stay strong, y'hear?

Original: Wymer: You too, buddy. But hey, we're grounders. We don't break easy. I know it's not much, but take this, with my thanks.
Dialogue: You too, buddy. But hey, we're grounders. We don't break easy. I know it's not much, but take this, with my thanks.

Original: Johnny: My wallet! My precious wallet! You really did it, bro! I knew I could count on you.
Dialogue: My wallet! My precious wallet! You really did it, bro! I knew I could count on you.

Original: Cloud: For the last time, don't call me that.
Dialogue: For the last time, don't call me that.

Original: Johnny: Thank you. Now I can get outta town.
Dialogue: Thank you. Now I can get outta town.

Original: Tifa: You're leaving?
Dialogue: You're leaving?

Original: Johnny: Hush, Tifa. Don't try to stop me. I'm a wanted man in these parts. If I stayed I'd be a danger to you too.
Dialogue: Hush, Tifa. Don't try to stop me. I'm a wanted man in these parts. If I stayed I'd be a danger to you too.

Original: Tifa: Uh, okay...
Dialogue: Uh, okay...

Original: Johnny: But if you begged me to stay, I could reconsider throwing everything away
Dialogue: But if you begged me to stay, I could reconsider throwing everything away—

Original: Tifa: Good luck out there, Johnny.
Dialogue: Good luck out there, Johnny.

Original: Johnny: Oh, er...okay.
Dialogue: Oh, er...okay.

Original: Tifa: You'll be fine wherever. You're Johnnydon't forget!
Dialogue: You'll be fine wherever. You're Johnny—don't forget!

Original: Johnny: Uh, yeah...hell yeah, I am! I'm your Johnny, Tifa. And nothing's gonna bring me down! Bro, Tifa, keep on shinin'. Johnny out!
Dialogue: Uh, yeah...hell yeah, I am! I'm your Johnny, Tifa. And nothing's gonna bring me down! Bro, Tifa, keep on shinin'. Johnny out!

Original: On-screen: Sewer System
Dialogue: Sewer System

Original: Barret: Youaregonna hold up your end of the bargain, right?
Dialogue: You are gonna hold up your end of the bargain, right?

Original: Leslie: Long as you hold up yoursyeah.
Dialogue: Long as you hold up yours—yeah.

Original: Barret: I don't trust you, and I don't like you. So if you so much as breathe in a suspicious way...I'll turn that face of yours into a honeycomb.
Dialogue: I don't trust you, and I don't like you. So if you so much as breathe in a suspicious way...I'll turn that face of yours into a honeycomb.

Original: Leslie: I'd save your bullets for the monsters if I were you. Some are a lot tougher than you'd think. Hate to say it, but I can barely take 'em on my own. You, on the other, shouldn't have any trouble, am I right?
Dialogue: I'd save your bullets for the monsters if I were you. Some are a lot tougher than you'd think. Hate to say it, but I can barely take 'em on my own. You, on the other, shouldn't have any trouble, am I right?

Original: Cloud: Let's get this over with.
Dialogue: Let's get this over with.

Original: Leslie: Head for the trunk lineit marks the border with Sector 7. You three lead the way. I'll follow a short distance behind.
Dialogue: Head for the trunk line—it marks the border with Sector 7. You three lead the way. I'll follow a short distance behind.

Original: Barret: The mark of Avalanche. Right. Jessie and Biggs stashed a skeleton key down here.
Dialogue: The mark of Avalanche. Right. Jessie and Biggs stashed a skeleton key down here.

Original: Tifa: I never got the chance to thank them for what they did.
Dialogue: I never got the chance to thank them for what they did.

Original: Cloud: Tifa...
Dialogue: Tifa...

Original: Tifa: Let's just keep moving, okay?
Dialogue: Let's just keep moving, okay?

Original: Leslie: Hate to interrupt, but the trunk line's just through that door. The one over there.
Dialogue: Hate to interrupt, but the trunk line's just through that door. The one over there.

Original: Barret: Yeah, we heard you.
Dialogue: Yeah, we heard you.

Original: Barret: Made it. 'Bout time.
Dialogue: Made it. 'Bout time.

Original: Leslie: This way. There should be a door with Corneo's mark on it around here somewhere.
Dialogue: This way. There should be a door with Corneo's mark on it around here somewhere.

Original: Tifa: Hey...wasn't this locked before?
Dialogue: Hey...wasn't this locked before?

Original: Leslie: Your time to shine. Clear the path ahead, would you?
Dialogue: Your time to shine. Clear the path ahead, would you?

Original: Barret: Yeah, yeah...
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah...

Original: Tifa: Can I ask you something? Why did you help us out before? You could've lost everything.
Dialogue: Can I ask you something? Why did you help us out before? You could've lost everything.

Original: Leslie: Andrea. He told me to.
Dialogue: Andrea. He told me to.

Original: Tifa: That really it?
Dialogue: That really it?

Original: Leslie: And I couldn't bring myself to let it happen again...
Dialogue: And I couldn't bring myself to let it happen again...

Original: Tifa: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Leslie: It doesn't matter. Let's go.
Dialogue: It doesn't matter. Let's go.

Original: Leslie: Wait. We're getting close to Corneo's hideout. From here on, I'll take the lead.
Dialogue: Wait. We're getting close to Corneo's hideout. From here on, I'll take the lead.

Original: Barret: This it?
Dialogue: This it?

Original: Leslie: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Cloud: So how we supposed to get topside?
Dialogue: So how we supposed to get topside?

Original: Leslie: Through here.
Dialogue: Through here.

Original: Cloud: Then you're telling me we're not done?
Dialogue: Then you're telling me we're not done?

Original: Leslie: Sorry guys, but it's not that simple
Dialogue: Sorry guys, but it's not that simple—

Original: Leslie: No... Wait! We gotta catch him!
Dialogue: No... Wait! We gotta catch him!

Original: Tifa: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Leslie: He took the key to the door! Without it, we're screwed!
Dialogue: He took the key to the door! Without it, we're screwed!

Original: Cloud: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Barret: Bastard went that way!
Dialogue: Bastard went that way!

Original: Leslie: Shit! Don't lose him!
Dialogue: Shit! Don't lose him!

Original: Leslie: Deal with 'em!
Dialogue: Deal with 'em!

Original: Barret: Where in the hell did that thing run off to?
Dialogue: Where in the hell did that thing run off to?

Original: Leslie: Up. As if this wasn't enough fun already.
Dialogue: Up. As if this wasn't enough fun already.

Original: On-screen: Sewer System - Old Line
Dialogue: Sewer System - Old Line

Original: Leslie: The area up aheadit's that thing's den. Keep your eyes peeled. You never know when its friends're gonna pop up, or where.
Dialogue: The area up ahead—it's that thing's den. Keep your eyes peeled. You never know when its friends're gonna pop up, or where.

Original: Barret: We ain't got time to play hide-and-seek, ya little shit!
Dialogue: We ain't got time to play hide-and-seek, ya little shit!

Original: Barret: (chuckles) Gotcha now! So, gonna make us work for it, are ya! I'm not gonna hurt ya, little fella. So just stay st
Dialogue: (chuckles) Gotcha now! So, gonna make us work for it, are ya! I'm not gonna hurt ya, little fella. So just stay st—

Original: Cloud: Take the right.
Dialogue: Take the right.

Original: Tifa: I'm on it.
Dialogue: I'm on it.

Original: Barret: Your days are numbered, ratboy!
Dialogue: Your days are numbered, ratboy!

Original: Tifa: He's so slippery!
Dialogue: He's so slippery!

Original: Cloud: Just like his owner.
Dialogue: Just like his owner.

Original: Leslie: Give it back!
Dialogue: Give it back!

Original: Leslie: Give it back.
Dialogue: Give it back.

Original: Tifa: That's...
Dialogue: That's...

Original: Leslie: Give it back.
Dialogue: Give it back.

Original: Barret: That's not a key.
Dialogue: That's not a key.

Original: Leslie: Sorry.
Dialogue: Sorry.

Original: Barret: That's not your pendant either. Were they family?
Dialogue: That's not your pendant either. Were they family?

Original: Leslie: No...
Dialogue: No...

Original: Leslie's Fiance (flashback): It was all just a dream, wasn't it... But one day... No. Time to wake up. And forget.
Dialogue: It was all just a dream, wasn't it... But one day... No. Time to wake up. And forget.

Original: Leslie: Six months ago... On that day Corneo picked her as a bride. And on the next she vanished without a trace. But before she did, she gave it back. Salt on the wound. Thing cost me a small fortune.
Dialogue: Six months ago... On that day Corneo picked her as a bride. And on the next she vanished without a trace. But before she did, she gave it back. Salt on the wound. Thing cost me a small fortune.

Original: Tifa: Why did you wanna come down here?
Dialogue: Why did you wanna come down here?

Original: Leslie: Revenge. I know I need to let go, but I can't. I need closure, 'cause without it...I'll never be able to move on.
Dialogue: Revenge. I know I need to let go, but I can't. I need closure, 'cause without it...I'll never be able to move on.

Original: Cloud: It's fine. As long as you get us topside, we're still in.
Dialogue: It's fine. As long as you get us topside, we're still in.

Original: Leslie: Thanks. And don't worry, I got you.
Dialogue: Thanks. And don't worry, I got you.

Original: Barret: You all right.
Dialogue: You all right.

Original: Leslie: I know a shortcut. Follow me.
Dialogue: I know a shortcut. Follow me.

Original: Barret: That twisted piece of shit. I'm gonna enjoy beatin' him to a pulp.
Dialogue: That twisted piece of shit. I'm gonna enjoy beatin' him to a pulp.

Original: Leslie: Corneo's mine, and mine alone.
Dialogue: Corneo's mine, and mine alone.

Original: Barret: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Leslie: Please.
Dialogue: Please.

Original: Cloud: Fine.
Dialogue: Fine.

Original: Leslie: Wait outside.
Dialogue: Wait outside.

Original: Barret: Think the kid's gonna be okay goin' it alone?
Dialogue: Think the kid's gonna be okay goin' it alone?

Original: Leslie: It's Leslie! Got some urgent info for hte don!
Dialogue: It's Leslie! Got some urgent info for hte don!

Original: Don Corneo: Oho? Come alone?
Dialogue: Oho? Come alone?

Original: Leslie: 'Course.
Dialogue: Course.

Original: Don Corneo: Really? Without my little Avalanche kittens? I thought I told you to round them up and bring them to me.
Dialogue: Really? Without my little Avalanche kittens? I thought I told you to round them up and bring them to me.

Original: Leslie: Actuallly...it's them I came to talk about.
Dialogue: Actuallly...it's them I came to talk about.

Original: Don Corneo: Leslie. I don't think I need to remind you why I'm down here. Spilling the beans to those three escape artists was a serious mistake. And now I'm on Shinra's shitlist! The plate stunt was meant to be an unprecedented tragedy claiming countless innocent lives... But those naughty little kittens organized an evacuation and screwed up the plan.
Dialogue: Leslie. I don't think I need to remind you why I'm down here. Spilling the beans to those three escape artists was a serious mistake. And now I'm on Shinra's shitlist! The plate stunt was meant to be an unprecedented tragedy claiming countless innocent lives... But those naughty little kittens organized an evacuation and screwed up the plan.

Original: Don Corneo: I'll let you in on a secret. Shinra's going to abandon Midgar...and build something close to paradise. I was invited to be a part of itdon of a new and improved Wall Market. I'll be lucky to live another week. Leslie... I was gonna let you run your own placegive you a piece of the action. What a shame.
Dialogue: I'll let you in on a secret. Shinra's going to abandon Midgar...and build something close to paradise. I was invited to be a part of it—don of a new and improved Wall Market. I'll be lucky to live another week. Leslie... I was gonna let you run your own place—give you a piece of the action. What a shame.

Original: Don Corneo: Pop quiz time, kiddo! Villains like us only divulge our evil plans...in a certain situation. But what is that situation, hm?
Dialogue: Pop quiz time, kiddo! Villains like us only divulge our evil plans...in a certain situation. But what is that situation, hm?

Original: Leslie: When you think...you've already won.
Dialogue: When you think...you've already won.

Original: Don Corneo: Goodbye.
Dialogue: Goodbye.

Original: Cloud: Think again, Don.
Dialogue: Think again, Don.

Original: Don Corneo: Oho! It's you!
Dialogue: Oho! It's you!

Original: Barret: You were talking 'bout the Sector 7 plan. Keep talking, asshole.
Dialogue: You were talking 'bout the Sector 7 plan. Keep talking, asshole.

Original: Don Corneo: Ahh! Over there! Over there, look!
Dialogue: Ahh! Over there! Over there, look!

Original: Barret: Don't try to bullshit us!
Dialogue: Don't try to bullshit us!

Original: Don Corneo: But that's the thing! It's not technically bullshit when it's true.
Dialogue: But that's the thing! It's not technically bullshit when it's true.

Original: Don Corneo: Good Abzu! Feel free to play with your food! Don out...
Dialogue: Good Abzu! Feel free to play with your food! Don out...

Original: Barret: Bastard...
Dialogue: Bastard...

Original: Cloud: First him, then Cornei.
Dialogue: First him, then Cornei.

Original: Cloud: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Leslie: Where's Corneo?
Dialogue: Where's Corneo?

Original: Barret: Sorry. Bastard got away.
Dialogue: Sorry. Bastard got away.

Original: Leslie: It's fine. I'll track him down eventually. Not like I have anything better to do.
Dialogue: It's fine. I'll track him down eventually. Not like I have anything better to do.

Original: Tifa: You know, I wouldn't be so sure about that. She could still be out there.
Dialogue: You know, I wouldn't be so sure about that. She could still be out there.

Original: Barret: Can never be sure how much someone means to ya till they're gone. Don't give up on her yet.
Dialogue: Can never be sure how much someone means to ya till they're gone. Don't give up on her yet.

Original: Leslie: Was it a message? What was she trying to tell me?
Dialogue: Was it a message? What was she trying to tell me?

Original: Tifa: "We'll meet again."
Dialogue: "We'll meet again."

Original: Leslie: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Tifa: It's a symbol of "reunion."
Dialogue: It's a symbol of "reunion."

Original: Leslie: Then I guess I've got no choice but to find her first. Thanks.
Dialogue: Then I guess I've got no choice but to find her first. Thanks.

Original: Barret: Hold up. I think ya might be forgetting something.
Dialogue: Hold up. I think ya might be forgetting something.

Original: Leslie: I haven't. Found it. Let's get outta here. And then I'll give you what you need.
Dialogue: I haven't. Found it. Let's get outta here. And then I'll give you what you need.

Original: On-screen: Head back up?
Dialogue: Head back up?

Original: Barret: Ahh! Taste that sweet Midgar smog!
Dialogue: Ahh! Taste that sweet Midgar smog!

Original: Leslie: This way.
Dialogue: This way.

Original: Leslie: Grappling guns. You can practically fly with the souped-up motors on these babies. Sector 7 is on the other side of that wall. The guns will get you over and past it, along with any number of other obstacles. Butthey're one-way tickets. So once you start up, there's no coming back. You should probably get your affairs in order. Just in case.
Dialogue: Grappling guns. You can practically fly with the souped-up motors on these babies. Sector 7 is on the other side of that wall. The guns will get you over and past it, along with any number of other obstacles. But—they're one-way tickets. So once you start up, there's no coming back. You should probably get your affairs in order. Just in case.

Original: Tifa: Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Barret: Didn't tell you before, but we're looking for someone too.
Dialogue: Didn't tell you before, but we're looking for someone too.

Original: Leslie: That right? Hope you find 'em.
Dialogue: That right? Hope you find 'em.

Original: Cloud: You too.
Dialogue: You too.

Original: Barret: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Barret: Ready to do this? Once we start up that wall, we won't be comin' back here any time soon.
Dialogue: Ready to do this? Once we start up that wall, we won't be comin' back here any time soon.

Original: On-screen: Climb over the wall?
Dialogue: Climb over the wall?

Original: Barret: We won't be comin' back here anytime soon. Best handle any unfinished business now, okay?
Dialogue: We won't be comin' back here anytime soon. Best handle any unfinished business now, okay?

Original: Barret: Hope you're ready now. No coming back, remember? Last chance to change your mind.
Dialogue: Hope you're ready now. No coming back, remember? Last chance to change your mind.

Original: Barret: So...when this is over, you gonna go on being a merc?
Dialogue: So...when this is over, you gonna go on being a merc?

Original: Cloud: That's the plan.
Dialogue: That's the plan.

Original: Barret: Reckon it suits you.
Dialogue: Reckon it suits you.

Original: Tifa: Yeah, it does.
Dialogue: Yeah, it does.

Original: Barret: Used to think you were a little shit with a big attitude and a bigger inferiority complex. Quite possibly the worst person I have ever met. But that was before I figured you out. All this? It ain't you.
Dialogue: Used to think you were a little shit with a big attitude and a bigger inferiority complex. Quite possibly the worst person I have ever met. But that was before I figured you out. All this? It ain't you.

Original: Tifa: Deep down, you're a pretty nice guy. Didn't see it when we were kids, but...
Dialogue: Deep down, you're a pretty nice guy. Didn't see it when we were kids, but...

Original: Cloud: Don't know about any of that, but kindness is no use on the battlefield. If anything, it's a liability.
Dialogue: Don't know about any of that, but kindness is no use on the battlefield. If anything, it's a liability.

Original: Barret: Hey, no one's asking you to treat Shinra with kid gloves.
Dialogue: Hey, no one's asking you to treat Shinra with kid gloves.

Original: Tifa: Aerith's up there waiting for us.
Dialogue: Aerith's up there waiting for us.

Original: Barret: Then we better get a move on, huh?
Dialogue: Then we better get a move on, huh?

Original: Cloud: Ready?
Dialogue: Ready?

Original: Barret: Two goals! Goal one! Kick some Shinra ass and save the planet! Goal two! Save the girlwhile kicking more Shinra assand get out!
Dialogue: Two goals! Goal one! Kick some Shinra ass and save the planet! Goal two! Save the girl—while kicking more Shinra ass—and get out!

Original: Cloud: Copy.
Dialogue: Copy.

Original: On-screen: Collapsed Sector 7 Plate
Dialogue: Collapsed Sector 7 Plate

Original: Barret: Gotta be careful. No tellin' what's gonna collapse or when.
Dialogue: Gotta be careful. No tellin' what's gonna collapse or when.

Original: Barret: See what I mean?
Dialogue: See what I mean?

Original: Neighborhood Watch Member: Hey, you guys might wanna turn around.
Dialogue: Hey, you guys might wanna turn around.

Original: Tifa: A friend of ours needs help.
Dialogue: A friend of ours needs help.

Original: Neighborhood Watch Member: It's too dangerous.
Dialogue: It's too dangerous.

Original: Cloud: For you, maybe.
Dialogue: For you, maybe.

Original: Neighborhood Watch Member: Do what you gotta...
Dialogue: Do what you gotta...

Original: Tifa: So that's where we have to climb?
Dialogue: So that's where we have to climb?

Original: Barret: If it comes apart while we're up there...(imitates falling and splatting)
Dialogue: If it comes apart while we're up there...(imitates falling and splatting)

Original: Cloud: We've made it through worse, you know.
Dialogue: We've made it through worse, you know.

Original: Barret: Yeah, no kidding. It's a miracle we haven't been killed a dozen times over by now.
Dialogue: Yeah, no kidding. It's a miracle we haven't been killed a dozen times over by now.

Original: Barret: It's a dead end.
Dialogue: It's a dead end.

Original: Tifa: Wonder if this rope belongs to search and rescue.
Dialogue: Wonder if this rope belongs to search and rescue.

Original: Barret: Think we might be able to climb up here.
Dialogue: Think we might be able to climb up here.

Original: Tifa: Time for the grappling guns. Try to aim for that part of the rope that's hanging there.
Dialogue: Time for the grappling guns. Try to aim for that part of the rope that's hanging there.

Original: Barret: Don't screw up and fall. By the way, how well you do with this grappling gun will tell us a whole lot about you.
Dialogue: Don't screw up and fall. By the way, how well you do with this grappling gun will tell us a whole lot about you.

Original: Tifa: (chuckles) Just remember, we can't come back down. Are you ready?
Dialogue: (chuckles) Just remember, we can't come back down. Are you ready?

Original: Barret: I think I see a rope hanging off the top there.
Dialogue: I think I see a rope hanging off the top there.

Original: Barret: Too easy. This keeps up, I'm gonna get bored.
Dialogue: Too easy. This keeps up, I'm gonna get bored.

Original: Cloud: Kill team.
Dialogue: Kill team.

Original: Barret: We can take 'em.
Dialogue: We can take 'em.

Original: Cloud: We need to stay on mission.
Dialogue: We need to stay on mission.

Original: Barret: I know. Saving Aerith is our top priority.
Dialogue: I know. Saving Aerith is our top priority.

Original: 3-C SOLDIER: You... You're Avalanche!
Dialogue: You... You're Avalanche!

Original: Radio: Hunter 2-2! Respond, dammit!
Dialogue: Hunter 2-2! Respond, dammit!

Original: Cloud: This is Hunter 2-2. Just had to put down a few monsters. Over.
Dialogue: This is Hunter 2-2. Just had to put down a few monsters. Over.

Original: Radio: Roger. Friggin' Avalanche making us put in OT... Probably cowering in the dark somewhere. If you find the shitheads, make 'em suffer. 2-3 out.
Dialogue: Roger. Friggin' Avalanche making us put in OT... Probably cowering in the dark somewhere. If you find the shitheads, make 'em suffer. 2-3 out.

Original: Barret: Listen up! We ain't runnin' and we ain't hidin'! Y'all don't know the meaning of sufferin'! But you will!
Dialogue: Listen up! We ain't runnin' and we ain't hidin'! Y'all don't know the meaning of sufferin'! But you will!

Original: Cloud: Call was over.
Dialogue: Call was over.

Original: Barret: Not this guy again!
Dialogue: Not this guy again!

Original: Tifa: Come on! We need to get inside!
Dialogue: Come on! We need to get inside!

Original: Barret: Why don't we use our grappling guns to get up there? Jump over all this shit.
Dialogue: Why don't we use our grappling guns to get up there? Jump over all this shit.

Original: Cloud: Not much choice.
Dialogue: Not much choice.

Original: Security Officer (1): What the!?
Dialogue: What the—!?

Original: Security Officer (2): It's them! Avalanche!
Dialogue: It's them! Avalanche!

Original: Security Officer (1): 2-3, this is 1-4we have contact!
Dialogue: 2-3, this is 1-4—we have contact!

Original: Barret: I guess everybody and their mothers knows we're here now.
Dialogue: I guess everybody and their mothers knows we're here now.

Original: Security Officer (1): Goddamn traitors!
Dialogue: Goddamn traitors!

Original: Security Officer (2): Take 'em down!
Dialogue: Take 'em down!

Original: Security Officer (3): There they are!
Dialogue: There they are!

Original: Security Officer (4): Stop 'em!
Dialogue: Stop 'em!

Original: Security Officer (5): They're over here!
Dialogue: They're over here!

Original: Security Officer (6): Surround 'em!
Dialogue: Surround 'em!

Original: Tifa: They'll be coming for us now.
Dialogue: They'll be coming for us now.

Original: Barret: Well, to hell with being subtle!
Dialogue: Well, to hell with being subtle!

Original: Tifa: What do you think? Can we climb it?
Dialogue: What do you think? Can we climb it?

Original: Barret: Surewith a grappling gun.
Dialogue: Sure—with a grappling gun.

Original: Tifa: I just hope that this time it holds.
Dialogue: I just hope that this time it holds.

Original: Barret: I think I see a rope hanging off the top there.
Dialogue: I think I see a rope hanging off the top there.

Original: Barret: Dammit. If any of this crumbles, we're all going down.
Dialogue: Dammit. If any of this crumbles, we're all going down.

Original: Tifa: No...
Dialogue: No...

Original: Barret: Don't youeverforget this view.
Dialogue: Don't you ever forget this view.

Original: Barret: Just thinkin' about bustin' into Shinra HQ's got me fired up!
Dialogue: Just thinkin' about bustin' into Shinra HQ's got me fired up!

Original: Cloud: Save some for later.
Dialogue: Save some for later.

Original: Barret: No need, son. I've got more than enough to keep me goin' for days.
Dialogue: No need, son. I've got more than enough to keep me goin' for days.

Original: Barret: Don't look down. You can do this. Don't look down. Just keep going. Don't look down. Don't look down!
Dialogue: Don't look down. You can do this. Don't look down. Just keep going. Don't look down. Don't look down!

Original: Cloud: Hide!
Dialogue: Hide!

Original: Barret: That son of a bitch is back!? I thought we lost him!
Dialogue: That son of a bitch is back!? I thought we lost him!

Original: Barret: Dammit! Looks like there's only one way to go.
Dialogue: Dammit! Looks like there's only one way to go.

Original: Cloud: We were headed that way anyway.
Dialogue: We were headed that way anyway.

Original: Barret: You want some of this? Then come get it!
Dialogue: You want some of this? Then come get it!

Original: Tifa: Cloud...
Dialogue: Cloud...

Original: Barret: I guess...we'll build another bar.
Dialogue: I guess...we'll build another bar.

Original: Tifa: Yeah. We will.
Dialogue: Yeah. We will.

Original: Tifa: You'll help too, won't you?
Dialogue: You'll help too, won't you?

Original: Cloud: For a price.
Dialogue: For a price.

Original: Cloud: Run!
Dialogue: Run!

Original: Barret: Run, dammit, run! Move your ass!
Dialogue: Run, dammit, run! Move your ass!

Original: Barret: Shit! Look out!
Dialogue: Shit! Look out!

Original: Barret: Was gettin' tired of playing tag anyway!
Dialogue: Was gettin' tired of playing tag anyway!

Original: Cloud: C'mon!
Dialogue: C'mon!

Original: Cloud: You okay!?
Dialogue: You okay!?

Original: Tifa: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Cloud: Grab on!
Dialogue: Grab on!

Original: Barret: That was close!
Dialogue: That was close!

Original: Cloud: It's not done with us yet.
Dialogue: It's not done with us yet.

Original: Barret: Yeah, I hear ya. Let's blow the bitch outta the sky!
Dialogue: Yeah, I hear ya. Let's blow the bitch outta the sky!

Original: Barret: What the hell!?
Dialogue: What the hell!?

Original: Barret: Oh you gotta be shittin' me.
Dialogue: Oh you gotta be shittin' me.

Original: Cloud: Don't get caught in the open.
Dialogue: Don't get caught in the open.

Original: Barret: (chuckles) We win again. Not that there was ever any doubt! (chuckles)
Dialogue: (chuckles) We win again. Not that there was ever any doubt! (chuckles)

Original: Barret: Now what?
Dialogue: Now what?

Original: Cloud: Shit!
Dialogue: Shit!

Original: Cloud: Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa!

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: There's such a thing as too much excitement.
Dialogue: There's such a thing as too much excitement.

Original: Tifa: Yeah. And there's still more to come.
Dialogue: Yeah. And there's still more to come.

Original: Barret: Guess so.
Dialogue: Guess so.

Original: Cloud: Hope everybody's warmed up.
Dialogue: Hope everybody's warmed up.

Original: Security Officer: That's good.
Dialogue: That's good.

Original: Barret: Rolled out the welcome wagon.
Dialogue: Rolled out the welcome wagon.

Original: Tifa: Gotta say, I can't help but wonder if this is a lost cause.
Dialogue: Gotta say, I can't help but wonder if this is a lost cause.

Original: Barret: Well, ya know, some lose causes are worth fighting for.
Dialogue: Well, ya know, some lose causes are worth fighting for.

Original: Cloud: Let's just think this through.
Dialogue: Let's just think this through.

Original: Barret: So. I got an idea. Frontal assault, guns blazing. Make for a good story.
Dialogue: So. I got an idea. Frontal assault, guns blazing. Make for a good story.

Original: Cloud: Why'd we bring you along again?
Dialogue: Why'd we bring you along again?

Original: Cloud: Rear entrance. We'll get inside via the parking garage.
Dialogue: Rear entrance. We'll get inside via the parking garage.

Original: On-screen: Shinra Building
Dialogue: Shinra Building

Original: Tifa: Security's looking pretty tight.
Dialogue: Security's looking pretty tight.

Original: Barret: Ha! So they know what they're up against.
Dialogue: Ha! So they know what they're up against.

Original: Cloud: Somehow I don't think it's all for us. Could be for Avalanche. Or maybe even Wutai.
Dialogue: Somehow I don't think it's all for us. Could be for Avalanche. Or maybe even Wutai.

Original: Barret: Can't be for Wutai. What about the cease-fire?
Dialogue: Can't be for Wutai. What about the cease-fire?

Original: Cloud: That only put the war on pause.
Dialogue: That only put the war on pause.

Original: Barret: Either way, I'm gonna put the fear of Avalanche in 'em! Their days of sittin' smug in this glass tower are over!
Dialogue: Either way, I'm gonna put the fear of Avalanche in 'em! Their days of sittin' smug in this glass tower are over!

Original: Cloud: We're here to rescue Aerith, remember? We don't need much more attention than what we're gonna get. We need to be smart.
Dialogue: We're here to rescue Aerith, remember? We don't need much more attention than what we're gonna get. We need to be smart.

Original: Barret: Yeah, I hear ya! But my soul's screaming for payback, you know? I'm a tickin' time bomb, and sooner or later, I'mma have to blow up!
Dialogue: Yeah, I hear ya! But my soul's screaming for payback, you know? I'm a tickin' time bomb, and sooner or later, I'mma have to blow up!

Original: Cloud: Well, then make it later.
Dialogue: Well, then make it later.

Original: Tifa: That one therethat's a Shinra truck, isn't it?
Dialogue: That one there—that's a Shinra truck, isn't it?

Original: Cloud: C'mon.
Dialogue: C'mon.

Original: On-screen: Shinra Building - Underground Parking Garage
Dialogue: Shinra Building - Underground Parking Garage

Original: Security Officer (1): How's it looking out there?
Dialogue: How's it looking out there?

Original: Security Officer (2): Anything?
Dialogue: Anything?

Original: Security Officer (1): Nah.
Dialogue: Nah.

Original: Security Officer (2): All clear!
Dialogue: All clear!

Original: Security Officer (1): Roger. Okay, head on in!
Dialogue: Roger. Okay, head on in!

Original: Barret: So far, so good. (screams)
Dialogue: So far, so good. (screams)

Original: Security Officer (1): Where'd you come from!?
Dialogue: Where'd you come from!?

Original: Security Officer (1): Hey, what's going on!?
Dialogue: Hey, what's going on!?

Original: Security Officer (2): Halt! Show me your hands!
Dialogue: Halt! Show me your hands!

Original: Barret: Ha! Bring it on!
Dialogue: Ha! Bring it on!

Original: Cloud: The idea was to not get noticed.
Dialogue: The idea was to not get noticed.

Original: Barret: Stealth ain't my style.
Dialogue: Stealth ain't my style.

Original: Cloud: You never planned to be stealthy in the first place.
Dialogue: You never planned to be stealthy in the first place.

Original: Barret: Don't remember. Maybe, maybe not.
Dialogue: Don't remember. Maybe, maybe not.

Original: Barret: It's feelin' like a proper party now!
Dialogue: It's feelin' like a proper party now!

Original: Cloud: (sighs) Let's keep moving. Should be a service entrance in the back.
Dialogue: (sighs) Let's keep moving. Should be a service entrance in the back.

Original: Security Officer (1): What's the situation?
Dialogue: What's the situation?

Original: Security Officer (2): Can't get in contact with HQ.
Dialogue: Can't get in contact with HQ.

Original: Security Officer (1): Didtheydo this?
Dialogue: Did they do this?

Original: Security Officer (2): No idea.
Dialogue: No idea.

Original: Security Officer: What the!?
Dialogue: What the—!?

Original: SOLDIER: Intruders! Get 'em!
Dialogue: Intruders! Get 'em!

Original: Security Officer: Huh!? Who's that!?
Dialogue: Huh!? Who's that!?

Original: Security Officer: Get them!
Dialogue: Get them!

Original: Security Officer: That's far enough!
Dialogue: That's far enough!

Original: Barret: That's that.
Dialogue: That's that.

Original: Tifa: Sure hope no one else knows we're here.
Dialogue: Sure hope no one else knows we're here.

Original: Cloud: Come on. We need to move.
Dialogue: Come on. We need to move.

Original: On-screen: Shinra Building - Entrance
Dialogue: Shinra Building - Entrance

Original: Barret: Nobody's home.
Dialogue: Nobody's home.

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Tifa: Do you have any idea where they might be holding Aerith?
Dialogue: Do you have any idea where they might be holding Aerith?

Original: Cloud: I'm thinking a research facility. That'd make the most sense.
Dialogue: I'm thinking a research facility. That'd make the most sense.

Original: Barret: And where is that?
Dialogue: And where is that?

Original: Cloud: Upper floors...maybe near the top... That's where you are.
Dialogue: Upper floors...maybe near the top... That's where you are.

Original: Barret: Maybe!?
Dialogue: Maybe!?

Original: Tifa: Maybe we can use the console at the reception desk to find out.
Dialogue: Maybe we can use the console at the reception desk to find out.

Original: Tifa: This building's incredible.
Dialogue: This building's incredible.

Original: Barret: Hah! A shining monument to corporate greed. One of these days I'm gonna tear it down and burn the rubble.
Dialogue: Hah! A shining monument to corporate greed. One of these days I'm gonna tear it down and burn the rubble.

Original: Cloud: But not today.
Dialogue: But not today.

Original: Barret: Yeah, yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

Original: Tifa: I don't know about you, but I don't think we should try touching it.
Dialogue: I don't know about you, but I don't think we should try touching it.

Original: Barret: Shit. Making life hard.
Dialogue: Shit. Making life hard.

Original: Cloud: Let's just keep heading up.
Dialogue: Let's just keep heading up.

Original: Cloud: Either the elevator or the emergency stairwell.
Dialogue: Either the elevator or the emergency stairwell.

Original: Barret: Isn't the lab we're looking for on one of the top floors? I vote we take the elevator.
Dialogue: Isn't the lab we're looking for on one of the top floors? I vote we take the elevator.

Original: Barret: No getting upstairs without a keycard, huh?
Dialogue: No getting upstairs without a keycard, huh?

Original: Tifa: Think we're gonna need a few before this is over.
Dialogue: Think we're gonna need a few before this is over.

Original: Cloud: Pretty sure I saw one lying around.
Dialogue: Pretty sure I saw one lying around.

Original: Barret: The reception desk!
Dialogue: The reception desk!

Original: Cloud: Yeah, but how to get in?
Dialogue: Yeah, but how to get in?

Original: Tifa: Go up and over, maybe?
Dialogue: Go up and over, maybe?

Original: Tifa: Look. Pretty sure we could reach it if we hop across those lights.
Dialogue: Look. Pretty sure we could reach it if we hop across those lights.

Original: Barret: I don't know...
Dialogue: I don't know...

Original: Tifa: I think I'll give it a shot. As the lightest one here, I figure I've got the best chance. You two can sit back and watch.
Dialogue: I think I'll give it a shot. As the lightest one here, I figure I've got the best chance. You two can sit back and watch.

Original: Tifa: Okay, guys. Wish me luck.
Dialogue: Okay, guys. Wish me luck.

Original: Barret: You be careful.
Dialogue: You be careful.

Original: Tifa: Aren't I always?
Dialogue: Aren't I always?

Original: Cloud: Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa!

Original: Barret: Oh shit! Tifa!
Dialogue: Oh shit! Tifa!

Original: Cloud: Are you okay!?
Dialogue: Are you okay!?

Original: Tifa: I thought I was dead for sure!
Dialogue: I thought I was dead for sure!

Original: Tifa: Hand over hand, huh? That's fine, bring it on.
Dialogue: Hand over hand, huh? That's fine, bring it on.

Original: Tifa: This isn't so bad. Pretty close now. Just need to make it over there.
Dialogue: This isn't so bad. Pretty close now. Just need to make it over there.

Original: Tifa: Almost there. Just need to get across those platforms.
Dialogue: Almost there. Just need to get across those platforms.

Original: Barret: That's some fine work.
Dialogue: That's some fine work.

Original: Tifa: Ah! I might be able to disable security from here.
Dialogue: Ah! I might be able to disable security from here.

Original: Tifa: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Barret: Ha! Hot damn, girl.
Dialogue: Ha! Hot damn, girl.

Original: Tifa: But I didn't do anything...
Dialogue: But I didn't do anything...

Original: Barret: Shit, I'll take it. So you can use that to look up what floor the research facility's on?
Dialogue: Shit, I'll take it. So you can use that to look up what floor the research facility's on?

Original: Tifa: I think so. Gimme a sec.
Dialogue: I think so. Gimme a sec.

Original: Tifa: Bingo. Professor Hojo's lab. 65th floor, looks like.
Dialogue: Bingo. Professor Hojo's lab. 65th floor, looks like.

Original: Tifa: Huh. Guess we can only get to the 59th floor via the elevators or stairs. To access any level above that. we need to check in at the Skyview Hall reception.
Dialogue: Huh. Guess we can only get to the 59th floor via the elevators or stairs. To access any level above that. we need to check in at the Skyview Hall reception.

Original: Cloud: 59th floor it is, then.
Dialogue: 59th floor it is, then.

Original: Barret: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Elevator: Going up. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going up. Doors closing.

Original: Barret: So what can we expect further up?
Dialogue: So what can we expect further up?

Original: Cloud: More security and restrictions. It's not gonna get any easier.
Dialogue: More security and restrictions. It's not gonna get any easier.

Original: Barret: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Elevator: 10th floor. Doors opening.
Dialogue: 10th floor. Doors opening.

Original: On-screen: 10th Floor - Administration
Dialogue: 10th Floor - Administration

Original: Barret: Wasn't expectin' that.
Dialogue: Wasn't expectin' that.

Original: Tifa: Think anyone knows we're here?
Dialogue: Think anyone knows we're here?

Original: Cloud: Nah, we took 'em down quick.
Dialogue: Nah, we took 'em down quick.

Original: Elevator: Going up. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going up. Doors closing.

Original: Tifa: Wonder if it'll stop again.
Dialogue: Wonder if it'll stop again.

Original: Barret: People oughta try using the damn stairs sometime!
Dialogue: People oughta try using the damn stairs sometime!

Original: Cloud: If it happens again, we'll deal with it like before. We got this.
Dialogue: If it happens again, we'll deal with it like before. We got this.

Original: Barret: Well that didn't take long, did it?
Dialogue: Well that didn't take long, did it?

Original: Elevator: 20th floor. Doors opening.
Dialogue: 20th floor. Doors opening.

Original: On-screen: 20th Floor - Research and Development
Dialogue: 20th Floor - Research and Development

Original: Elevator: Going up. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going up. Doors closing.

Original: Barret: Straight on up to the top now. C'mon.
Dialogue: Straight on up to the top now. C'mon.

Original: Tifa: We just keep getting waylaid, don't we?
Dialogue: We just keep getting waylaid, don't we?

Original: Cloud: If you wanna take the stairs...
Dialogue: If you wanna take the stairs...

Original: Barret: Now that you mention it... No.
Dialogue: Now that you mention it... No.

Original: Elevator: 30th floor. Doors opening.
Dialogue: 30th floor. Doors opening.

Original: Cloud: Heads up. Could be trouble.
Dialogue: Heads up. Could be trouble.

Original: On-screen: 30th Floor - Urban Planning
Dialogue: 30th Floor - Urban Planning

Original: Elevator: Going up. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going up. Doors closing.

Original: Tifa: Right. Normal people work here too.
Dialogue: Right. Normal people work here too.

Original: Barret: She probably called for help.
Dialogue: She probably called for help.

Original: Elevator: 40th floor.
Dialogue: 40th floor.

Original: Barret: Who's it gonna be next?
Dialogue: Who's it gonna be next?

Original: Elevator: Doors opening.
Dialogue: Doors opening.

Original: On-screen: 40th Floor - Space and Aeronautics
Dialogue: 40th Floor - Space and Aeronautics

Original: Shinra Employee: Yeah... Yeah, we're safe here. What about you, Mom? You okay? Good. That's a relief... ...What? Oh, they gotta be kidding!
Dialogue: Yeah... Yeah, we're safe here. What about you, Mom? You okay? Good. That's a relief... ...What? Oh, they gotta be kidding!

Original: Elevator: Going up. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going up. Doors closing.

Original: Shinra Employee: ...No, we haven't heard anything new yet. But they told us that Avalanche could attack again at any time. Just get somewhere safe, okay? Yeah. About that...
Dialogue: ...No, we haven't heard anything new yet. But they told us that Avalanche could attack again at any time. Just get somewhere safe, okay? Yeah. About that...

Original: On-screen: 45th Floor - Advanced Weaponry
Dialogue: 45th Floor - Advanced Weaponry

Original: Elevator: Going up. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going up. Doors closing.

Original: Tifa: A whole lotta mormal people with families and friends work for Shinra. People just trying to support their loved ones as best they can. I know it's not exactly a revelation, but... It's easy to forget.
Dialogue: A whole lotta mormal people with families and friends work for Shinra. People just trying to support their loved ones as best they can. I know it's not exactly a revelation, but... It's easy to forget.

Original: Barret: A good man who serves a great evil is not without sin. He must recognize and accept his complicity. He must open his eyes to the truththat his corporate masters are profiting from the planet's pain. Only then can he redeem himself. I know you know this.
Dialogue: A good man who serves a great evil is not without sin. He must recognize and accept his complicity. He must open his eyes to the truth—that his corporate masters are profiting from the planet's pain. Only then can he redeem himself. I know you know this.

Original: Tifa: I do.
Dialogue: I do.

Original: Cloud: Tifa. We need to focus on saving Aerith.
Dialogue: Tifa. We need to focus on saving Aerith.

Original: Tifa: I know. I will.
Dialogue: I know. I will.

Original: Elevator: 59th floor. Doors opening.
Dialogue: 59th floor. Doors opening.

Original: Barret: You have got to be shittin' me.
Dialogue: You have got to be shittin' me.

Original: Cloud: Nope. We're a lot less likely to get caught this way.
Dialogue: Nope. We're a lot less likely to get caught this way.

Original: Barret: But a lot more likely to die of boredom.
Dialogue: But a lot more likely to die of boredom.

Original: Cloud: It's only fifty-nine floors.
Dialogue: It's only fifty-nine floors.

Original: Tifa: Nothing to it.
Dialogue: Nothing to it.

Original: Barret: Well, at least it ain't a race. Small blessing.
Dialogue: Well, at least it ain't a race. Small blessing.

Original: Tifa: Wonder what it's like up there.
Dialogue: Wonder what it's like up there.

Original: Cloud: More security and restrictions. It's not gonna get any easier.
Dialogue: More security and restrictions. It's not gonna get any easier.

Original: Barret: We're gonna be exhausted by the time we finally get to the top.
Dialogue: We're gonna be exhausted by the time we finally get to the top.

Original: Cloud: Long as you pace yourself, you'll be fine.
Dialogue: Long as you pace yourself, you'll be fine.

Original: Barret: Maybe we should take a quick break.
Dialogue: Maybe we should take a quick break.

Original: Tifa: C'mon, Barret.
Dialogue: C'mon, Barret.

Original: On-screen: 10th Floor - Administration
Dialogue: 10th Floor - Administration

Original: Barret: You can stop if you want. Can even say it's for me.
Dialogue: You can stop if you want. Can even say it's for me.

Original: Cloud: Just say you can't hack it.
Dialogue: Just say you can't hack it.

Original: Barret: I'll hack you, jackass!
Dialogue: I'll hack you, jackass!

Original: Tifa: That's enough from both of you. Stupid arguments aren't going to get us there faster.
Dialogue: That's enough from both of you. Stupid arguments aren't going to get us there faster.

Original: Cloud: But Tifa, I wasn't
Dialogue: But Tifa, I wasn't—

Original: Tifa: Not now. Save it for the top!
Dialogue: Not now. Save it for the top!

Original: Barret: Guess these labs...and shit...are all the way at the very top?
Dialogue: Guess these labs...and shit...are all the way at the very top?

Original: Cloud: Yep. The very top.
Dialogue: Yep. The very top.

Original: Barret: That's...good to know...
Dialogue: That's...good to know...

Original: On-screen: 20th Floor - Research and Development
Dialogue: 20th Floor - Research and Development

Original: Tifa: Cloud! Keep an eye on Barret!
Dialogue: Cloud! Keep an eye on Barret!

Original: Cloud: Copy.
Dialogue: Copy.

Original: Tifa: What was that? I don't think I heard you. Speak up!
Dialogue: What was that? I don't think I heard you. Speak up!

Original: Cloud: I'll keep an eye on Barret!
Dialogue: I'll keep an eye on Barret!

Original: Barret: Thanks for the assist.
Dialogue: Thanks for the assist.

Original: Cloud: Whatever.
Dialogue: Whatever.

Original: Barret: I said...wait up!
Dialogue: I said...wait up!

Original: Tifa: Hey, guys! Where are you!?
Dialogue: Hey, guys! Where are you!?

Original: Barret: Hey! Just a few floors behind you!
Dialogue: Hey! Just a few floors behind you!

Original: Tifa: Oh? You're sounding better!
Dialogue: Oh? You're sounding better!

Original: Barret: Think I've got, like, a stairclimber's high!
Dialogue: Think I've got, like, a stairclimber's high!

Original: Tifa: Glad to hear it!
Dialogue: Glad to hear it!

Original: On-screen: 30th Floor - Urban Planning
Dialogue: 30th Floor - Urban Planning

Original: Cloud: You tired?
Dialogue: You tired?

Original: Tifa: I was. But I'm feeling okay now.
Dialogue: I was. But I'm feeling okay now.

Original: Barret: Hahhh... Hahhh... Hahhh... Then what're we waitin' for!? Let's roll!
Dialogue: Hahhh... Hahhh... Hahhh... Then what're we waitin' for!? Let's roll!

Original: Tifa: You really are doing better!
Dialogue: You really are doing better!

Original: Barret: Hahhh... We...we gotta keep movin' (laughs)...to keep movin'! Hahhh...
Dialogue: Hahhh... We...we gotta keep movin' (laughs)...to keep movin'! Hahhh...

Original: Tifa: Hard to argue with that. Let's go.
Dialogue: Hard to argue with that. Let's go.

Original: On-screen: 4oth Floor - Space and Aeronautics
Dialogue: 4oth Floor - Space and Aeronautics

Original: Barret: But tell me, these stairs...are these stairs ever gonna end!?
Dialogue: But tell me, these stairs...are these stairs ever gonna end!?

Original: Tifa: I dunno! Ask the stairs!
Dialogue: I dunno! Ask the stairs!

Original: Cloud: I don't think the stairs are talking.
Dialogue: I don't think the stairs are talking.

Original: Barret: Well, duh. I mean...duh.
Dialogue: Well, duh. I mean...duh.

Original: Cloud: I was joking.
Dialogue: I was joking.

Original: Tifa: That's enough from both of you.
Dialogue: That's enough from both of you.

Original: Barret: Worst route ever. Gimme a suicidal last stand. At least At leastat least that'd have an end!
Dialogue: Worst route ever. Gimme a suicidal last stand. At least— At least—at least that'd have an end!

Original: Cloud: Let's shut up.
Dialogue: Let's shut up.

Original: Tifa: Yes, let's.
Dialogue: Yes, let's.

Original: Barret: Why?
Dialogue: Why?

Original: Tifa: Because wishing for trouble might bring it.
Dialogue: Because wishing for trouble might bring it.

Original: Cloud: Yup. And you're in no state to fight anyway.
Dialogue: Yup. And you're in no state to fight anyway.

Original: Barret: So...whatshouldI do?
Dialogue: So...what should I do?

Original: Cloud: Shut up and move.
Dialogue: Shut up and move.

Original: On-screen: 50th Floor - Public Security
Dialogue: 50th Floor - Public Security

Original: Barret: This sucks! I wanna go back!
Dialogue: This sucks! I wanna go back!

Original: Tifa: You wanna go down all those stairs you just climbed?
Dialogue: You wanna go down all those stairs you just climbed?

Original: Barret: Another day, another struggle... Climbing stairs is so much trouble.
Dialogue: Another day, another struggle... Climbing stairs is so much trouble.

Original: Barret: Cloud, slow down!
Dialogue: Cloud, slow down!

Original: Tifa: ...The end.
Dialogue: ...The end.

Original: Barret: Made it.
Dialogue: Made it.

Original: Cloud: The real challenge starts now. Okay. Let's go.
Dialogue: The real challenge starts now. Okay. Let's go.

Original: On-screen: B13 - Materia Research Facility
Dialogue: B13 - Materia Research Facility

Original: Researcher (1): Seventy, eighty, ninety, one hundred percent, one hundred ten... Mako supersaturation confirmed.
Dialogue: Seventy, eighty, ninety, one hundred percent, one hundred ten... Mako supersaturation confirmed.

Original: Researcher (2): Engaging materia cooling to reduce temperature.
Dialogue: Engaging materia cooling to reduce temperature.

Original: Subordinate: Madam Director. You have a meeting shortly.
Dialogue: Madam Director. You have a meeting shortly.

Original: Scarlet: Stop. Your timing is impeccably atrocious.
Dialogue: Stop. Your timing is impeccably atrocious.

Original: Researcher (1): Mako density and materia integrity are both holding steady.
Dialogue: Mako density and materia integrity are both holding steady.

Original: Researcher (2): Registering mass increase in core materia!
Dialogue: Registering mass increase in core materia!

Original: Scarlet: Now... Show me something truly exquisite!
Dialogue: Now... Show me something truly exquisite!

Original: Researcher (2): Contaminants registered!
Dialogue: Contaminants registered!

Original: Scarlet: We're leaving.
Dialogue: We're leaving.

Original: Researcher (2): Materia growth acceleratingoutpacing models! Registering crystallization within the reserve tanks!
Dialogue: Materia growth accelerating—outpacing models! Registering crystallization within the reserve tanks!

Original: Researcher (1): The reaction is out of control! We have to stop it quickly
Dialogue: The reaction is out of control! We have to stop it quickly—

Original: Scarlet: Clean up the mess, would you?
Dialogue: Clean up the mess, would you?

Original: Subordinate: Ma'am.
Dialogue: Ma'am.

Original: On-screen: 59th Floor - Skyview Hall
Dialogue: 59th Floor - Skyview Hall

Original: Barret: So this is the Skyview Hall, huh? Bet this place cost a fortune and then some.
Dialogue: So this is the Skyview Hall, huh? Bet this place cost a fortune and then some.

Original: Cloud: Let's look for reception.
Dialogue: Let's look for reception.

Original: Barret: Hey! Check it out.
Dialogue: Hey! Check it out.

Original: Tifa: Come take a look, Cloud.
Dialogue: Come take a look, Cloud.

Original: Barret: Damn fools.
Dialogue: Damn fools.

Original: Tifa: Hm?
Dialogue: Hm?

Original: Barret: Ones who come here at night to "take in the view." So pretty and marvelous and beautiful! But every little light burning bright runs off her blood. And bit by bit they bleed her, never stoppin' to think how it'll end for them.
Dialogue: Ones who come here at night to "take in the view." So pretty and marvelous and beautiful! But every little light burning bright runs off her blood. And bit by bit they bleed her, never stoppin' to think how it'll end for them.

Original: Tifa: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Barret: Terrible, but beautiful all the same.
Dialogue: Terrible, but beautiful all the same.

Original: On-screen: Go to 3F (Elevator Hall)?
Dialogue: Go to 3F (Elevator Hall)?

Original: Elevator: Going down. Doors closing.
Dialogue: Going down. Doors closing.

Original: Receptionist: You must be here for our grand tour. Visitors have access to floors 60, 61, 62, as well as floor 63. You will proceed in that order. By the exit to each floor, you will find a device that will allow you to update the keycard in your possession...thereby allowing you to access the next floor. And now begins your grand tour. Please enjoy the Shinra experience!
Dialogue: You must be here for our grand tour. Visitors have access to floors 60, 61, 62, as well as floor 63. You will proceed in that order. By the exit to each floor, you will find a device that will allow you to update the keycard in your possession...thereby allowing you to access the next floor. And now begins your grand tour. Please enjoy the Shinra experience!

Original: Barret: Why's this whole thing gotta be such a big pain in the ass?
Dialogue: Why's this whole thing gotta be such a big pain in the ass?

Original: Tifa: I don't know about you, but this is kinda weird.
Dialogue: I don't know about you, but this is kinda weird.

Original: Cloud: You think everything's going too well?
Dialogue: You think everything's going too well?

Original: Tifa: Yeah, I do. Think this is a trap?
Dialogue: Yeah, I do. Think this is a trap?

Original: Barret: Ha! If it is, then bring it on. Let's get this party started!
Dialogue: Ha! If it is, then bring it on. Let's get this party started!

Original: Barret: Man, why we gotta get all these damn keycards just to get anywhere?
Dialogue: Man, why we gotta get all these damn keycards just to get anywhere?

Original: Cloud: This is Shinra HQ. The hell did you expect?
Dialogue: This is Shinra HQ. The hell did you expect?

Original: Barret: Says the former company man himself. Guess you'd know about all the rules, regulations, and red tapeit's like coming home, huh?
Dialogue: Says the former company man himself. Guess you'd know about all the rules, regulations, and red tape—it's like coming home, huh?

Original: On-screen: 63rd Floor - Urban Planning Administration
Dialogue: 63rd Floor - Urban Planning Administration

Original: Reeve: Yes. Every reactor, every pillar. Like I said...a full inspection. There's no telling what kind of damage there might be. If you see anythinganything out of the ordinary, I want to know.
Dialogue: Yes. Every reactor, every pillar. Like I said...a full inspection. There's no telling what kind of damage there might be. If you see anything—anything out of the ordinary, I want to know.

Original: Administrative Assistant: Sorry to bother you, sir...
Dialogue: Sorry to bother you, sir...

Original: Reeve: No, it's fine.
Dialogue: No, it's fine.

Original: Administrative Assistant: I've brought the damage assessment for Sector 7 you requested. Sir...perhaps you should try and get some sleep.
Dialogue: I've brought the damage assessment for Sector 7 you requested. Sir...perhaps you should try and get some sleep.

Original: Reeve: No, not yet. I need to finish preparing my draft of the reconstruction plan before tonight's board meeting. Whatever reasons they might've had, destroying an entire sector is... ...It's beyond the pale.
Dialogue: No, not yet. I need to finish preparing my draft of the reconstruction plan before tonight's board meeting. Whatever reasons they might've had, destroying an entire sector is... ...It's beyond the pale.

Original: Administrative Assistant: Director... I would strongly advise you not to say such things outside this room.
Dialogue: Director... I would strongly advise you not to say such things outside this room.

Original: Reeve: Don't I know it...
Dialogue: Don't I know it...

Original: On-screen: 60th Floor - Memorial Museum
Dialogue: 60th Floor - Memorial Museum

Original: On-screen: President Shinra Exhibit
Dialogue: President Shinra Exhibit

Original: Guide: Welcome to the Shinra Building, our humble home!
Dialogue: Welcome to the Shinra Building, our humble home!

Original: Barret: Oh, hell no.
Dialogue: Oh, hell no.

Original: Guide: Here in the Memorial Museum...you can learn all about our president...as well as the various divisions that make up the company...and of course, the city of Midgar and the miracle of mako energy. Whatever takes your fancy, you're sure to learn something new!
Dialogue: Here in the Memorial Museum...you can learn all about our president...as well as the various divisions that make up the company...and of course, the city of Midgar and the miracle of mako energy. Whatever takes your fancy, you're sure to learn something new!

Original: Barret: Yeah, yeah. Shut up.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. Shut up.

Original: Tifa: I think I just threw up a little.
Dialogue: I think I just threw up a little.

Original: Barret: Man thinks very highly of himself.
Dialogue: Man thinks very highly of himself.

Original: Guide: Hey, everybody! How's the grand tour? I hope you're all enjoying yourselves! Wasn't itfunto learn about Shinra and our esteemed president? And to get a peek at the president's mementosthat was super cool!
Dialogue: Hey, everybody! How's the grand tour? I hope you're all enjoying yourselves! Wasn't it fun to learn about Shinra and our esteemed president? And to get a peek at the president's mementos—that was super cool!

Original: Guide: Now, moving along! The next exhibit will teach you about the important work we do here...by giving you a closer look at each of our divisions! I hope you're ready to be amazed, because you simply won't believe all the exciting adventures we have here!
Dialogue: Now, moving along! The next exhibit will teach you about the important work we do here...by giving you a closer look at each of our divisions! I hope you're ready to be amazed, because you simply won't believe all the exciting adventures we have here!

Original: On-screen: Business Division Exhibit
Dialogue: Business Division Exhibit

Original: Tifa: These all look so familiar.
Dialogue: These all look so familiar.

Original: Barret: 'Cause we've destroyed a bunch of 'em already.
Dialogue: Cause we've destroyed a bunch of 'em already.

Original: Guide: The Advanced Weaponry exhibit is currently undergoing maintenance. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Dialogue: The Advanced Weaponry exhibit is currently undergoing maintenance. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Original: Palmer: What, what? Read this? This paper right here? Give me a moment... "Welcome to the Shinra Building. The Space and Aeronautics Division has taken rocket systems developed for military applications and adapted them to a different purpose: the search for new precious resources in the infinite reaches of space." That being said...since we have plenty of mako at the present, those plans are currently on hold. It's a...bit of a shame, really.
Dialogue: What, what? Read this? This paper right here? Give me a moment... "Welcome to the Shinra Building. The Space and Aeronautics Division has taken rocket systems developed for military applications and adapted them to a different purpose the search for new precious resources in the infinite reaches of space." That being said...since we have plenty of mako at the present, those plans are currently on hold. It's a...bit of a shame, really.

Original: Hojo: (sighs) Uh, welcome to Shinra headquarters. My duties as director of Research and Development are, in all likelihood, far beyond your ability to comprehend. So, there will be no presentation, as it would be a waste of my time and yours. But rest assured, we are making great strides. Albeit not at this particular moment, because I'm filming this rubbish instead. I believe I've wasted enough of my precious time as it is. Science waits for no one, after all. Sogood day.
Dialogue: (sighs) Uh, welcome to Shinra headquarters. My duties as director of Research and Development are, in all likelihood, far beyond your ability to comprehend. So, there will be no presentation, as it would be a waste of my time and yours. But rest assured, we are making great strides. Albeit not at this particular moment, because I'm filming this rubbish instead. I believe I've wasted enough of my precious time as it is. Science waits for no one, after all. So—good day.

Original: Guide: The Public Security exhibit is currently undergoing maintenance. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Dialogue: The Public Security exhibit is currently undergoing maintenance. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Original: Reeve: Welcome to the Shinra Building. Our mission here at Urban Planning is to supply the residents of Midgar with energy created from mako. We also take pride in maintaining public infrastructurethe pillars and railways that run all throughout the city. Currently, we are working to construct an intra-plate expressway. When this project has been completed, it will provide much easier access to numerous locations all across Midgar. We appreciate your patience and understanding in the meantime.
Dialogue: Welcome to the Shinra Building. Our mission here at Urban Planning is to supply the residents of Midgar with energy created from mako. We also take pride in maintaining public infrastructure—the pillars and railways that run all throughout the city. Currently, we are working to construct an intra-plate expressway. When this project has been completed, it will provide much easier access to numerous locations all across Midgar. We appreciate your patience and understanding in the meantime.

Original: Guide: Impressive, wasn't it? I hope you enjoyed learning about our divisions...and the wonderful ideas and solutions that are produced to benefit us all! Here at Shinra, we strive to ensure the safety of all residents around the clock!
Dialogue: Impressive, wasn't it? I hope you enjoyed learning about our divisions...and the wonderful ideas and solutions that are produced to benefit us all! Here at Shinra, we strive to ensure the safety of all residents around the clock!

Original: Guide: Now, moving along! The next exhibit will teach you all about the miracle of mako energy and our reactors...as well as the city of Midgar itself! So come on!
Dialogue: Now, moving along! The next exhibit will teach you all about the miracle of mako energy and our reactors...as well as the city of Midgar itself! So come on!

Original: On-screen: Mako Energy Exhibit
Dialogue: Mako Energy Exhibit

Original: Guide: This is Midgarour homerecreated in 1/10000 scale. As you can see here...the eight mako reactors form a ring around the center of our city...and keep Midgar running day and night. The mako which flows beneath our feet is a truly limitless resource. At Shinra, we have developed technologies to extract it...and transform it into the fuel and electricity that powers everything we do. Thanks to the miracle of mako energy, our lives are richer and better than ever before. Mako keeps our lights on at night, and made Midgar into the city that never sleeps. A triumph of technology and testament to man's potential.
Dialogue: This is Midgar—our home—recreated in 1/10000 scale. As you can see here...the eight mako reactors form a ring around the center of our city...and keep Midgar running day and night. The mako which flows beneath our feet is a truly limitless resource. At Shinra, we have developed technologies to extract it...and transform it into the fuel and electricity that powers everything we do. Thanks to the miracle of mako energy, our lives are richer and better than ever before. Mako keeps our lights on at night, and made Midgar into the city that never sleeps. A triumph of technology and testament to man's potential.

Original: Barret: Nothin' but a buncha lies!
Dialogue: Nothin' but a buncha lies!

Original: Cloud: Except that makohasmade people's lives better.
Dialogue: Except that mako has made people's lives better.

Original: Barret: It's made people blind. Blind to the cold hard truth. Even I used to buy into their bullshit. Rememberin' that...makes me even madder.
Dialogue: It's made people blind. Blind to the cold hard truth. Even I used to buy into their bullshit. Rememberin' that...makes me even madder.

Original: Guide: Congratulations! You can call yourself a proud Shinra scholar! Now, moving along! Next you'll learn about our progress in advanced science and technology. Please proceed to the 61st floor, the Visual Entertainment Hall.
Dialogue: Congratulations! You can call yourself a proud Shinra scholar! Now, moving along! Next you'll learn about our progress in advanced science and technology. Please proceed to the 61st floor, the Visual Entertainment Hall.

Original: Guide: Welcome to the Visual Entertainment Hall, where we showcase Shinra's cutting-edge technology...through an immersive visual and audio experience. Please relax and enjoy the show!
Dialogue: Welcome to the Visual Entertainment Hall, where we showcase Shinra's cutting-edge technology...through an immersive visual and audio experience. Please relax and enjoy the show!

Original: On-screen: 61st Floor - Visual Entertainment Hall
Dialogue: 61st Floor - Visual Entertainment Hall

Original: Guide: Please stay, and enjoy the show!
Dialogue: Please stay, and enjoy the show!

Original: Barret: This place is empty.
Dialogue: This place is empty.

Original: Barret: The hell!?
Dialogue: The hell—!?

Original: Guide: In the distant past, our planet was home to a people we call the Ancients. Many millennia before we discovered mako, these precursors were already pioneering its use. Somehow they learned of the great reservoir of energy pulsing beneath their feet. And once they had...the Ancients developed the means to harness this bountiful energy and bend it to their will. The fruits of their labors have survived to this very day in the form of certain kinds of materia. Their scripture, too, has endured: "We who are born of the planet, with her we speak. Her flesh we shape." "Unto her promised land shall we one day return. By her loving grace and providence may we take our place in paradise."
