Dialogue: In the distant past, our planet was home to a people we call the Ancients. Many millennia before we discovered mako, these precursors were already pioneering its use. Somehow they learned of the great reservoir of energy pulsing beneath their feet. And once they had...the Ancients developed the means to harness this bountiful energy and bend it to their will. The fruits of their labors have survived to this very day in the form of certain kinds of materia. Their scripture, too, has endured "We who are born of the planet, with her we speak. Her flesh we shape." "Unto her promised land shall we one day return. By her loving grace and providence may we take our place in paradise."

Original: Guide: Alas, the Ancients themselves are long gone. Two thousand years ago, a meteor brought an end to their civilization. But before their fiery end, did the Ancients find their promised land? Even now, we have only to wonder. Times have changedand the Shinra Electric Power Company is committed to changing and evolving with them. Like the Ancients, we have harnessed the power of mako.
Dialogue: Alas, the Ancients themselves are long gone. Two thousand years ago, a meteor brought an end to their civilization. But before their fiery end, did the Ancients find their promised land? Even now, we have only to wonder. Times have changed—and the Shinra Electric Power Company is committed to changing and evolving with them. Like the Ancients, we have harnessed the power of mako.

Original: Guide: Are they out there, watching us? Waiting for us to join them in some blessed corner of the worlda green and verdant land, where boundless mako energy will provide for our every need? Shinra is working for you, to fulfill the hope of the Ancients and lead us to that promised land. We shall not rest until our dream is realized.
Dialogue: Are they out there, watching us? Waiting for us to join them in some blessed corner of the world—a green and verdant land, where boundless mako energy will provide for our every need? Shinra is working for you, to fulfill the hope of the Ancients and lead us to that promised land. We shall not rest until our dream is realized.

Original: Barret: That it?
Dialogue: That it?

Original: Cloud: No!
Dialogue: No!

Original: Cloud: Sephiroth...
Dialogue: Sephiroth...

Original: On-screen: 69th Floor - Executive Suite
Dialogue: 69th Floor - Executive Suite

Original: Palmer: Oh dear, oh dear... A man of my refined tastes running out of butter! Shorn of its proper accompaniment, this tea...might as well be boiled pond water!
Dialogue: Oh dear, oh dear... A man of my refined tastes running out of butter! Shorn of its proper accompaniment, this tea...might as well be boiled pond water!

Original: Palmer: No, it couldn't possibly have been...
Dialogue: No, it couldn't possibly have been...

Original: Barret: Crazy-ass thing made me wanna puke. And not just 'cause of the presentation, but the content too. Oughta come with a warning! That ain't for kids!
Dialogue: Crazy-ass thing made me wanna puke. And not just 'cause of the presentation, but the content too. Oughta come with a warning! That ain't for kids!

Original: Cloud: That wasn't just a movie.
Dialogue: That wasn't just a movie.

Original: Tifa: That huge meteor... What was that about?
Dialogue: That huge meteor... What was that about?

Original: Barret: Like I saidnothing you should show a kid.
Dialogue: Like I said—nothing you should show a kid.

Original: Guide: Congratulations! You can call yourself a proud Shinra expert! Your mission is to go out and tell everyone about the wonders of Shinra! Next, you'll be visiting the repository for Shinra's expertise and know-how. Please make your way to the 62nd floor, the Corporate Ar
Dialogue: Congratulations! You can call yourself a proud Shinra expert! Your mission is to go out and tell everyone about the wonders of Shinra! Next, you'll be visiting the repository for Shinra's expertise and know-how. Please make your way to the 62nd floor, the Corporate Ar—

Original: Barret: What the!?
Dialogue: What the—!?

Original: Hart: Greetings and welcome. Avalanche, I presume? My name is Hart, and it's a pleasure to meet you. I've come to escort you to Mayor Domino, per his request.
Dialogue: Greetings and welcome. Avalanche, I presume? My name is Hart, and it's a pleasure to meet you. I've come to escort you to Mayor Domino, per his request.

Original: Barret: The mayor of Midgar? The empty suit that's just a mouthpiece for Shinra?
Dialogue: The mayor of Midgar? The empty suit that's just a mouthpiece for Shinra?

Original: Hart: Yes. The mayor of our dear Midgar...the most magnificent city ever built. That Mayor Domino. The Visual Entertainment Hall has been experiencing technical difficulties of late...and he suspected that these difficulties might impede your progress.
Dialogue: Yes. The mayor of our dear Midgar...the most magnificent city ever built. That Mayor Domino. The Visual Entertainment Hall has been experiencing technical difficulties of late...and he suspected that these difficulties might impede your progress.

Original: Cloud: So what does the mayor want with us?
Dialogue: So what does the mayor want with us?

Original: Hart: I'm afraid you will have to ask him that yourself.
Dialogue: I'm afraid you will have to ask him that yourself.

Original: Barret: Guess we're supposed to follow.
Dialogue: Guess we're supposed to follow.

Original: On-screen: 62nd Floor - Corporate Archives
Dialogue: 62nd Floor - Corporate Archives

Original: Barret: Look at this place! So whatyou telling me the mayor's some kind of crazy bookworm?
Dialogue: Look at this place! So what—you telling me the mayor's some kind of crazy bookworm?

Original: Hart: Through here.
Dialogue: Through here.

Original: Barret: If this is a trap, you're a dead man, y'hear?
Dialogue: If this is a trap, you're a dead man, y'hear?

Original: Hart: The mayor is waiting.
Dialogue: The mayor is waiting.

Original: Barret: This can't be right.
Dialogue: This can't be right.

Original: Domino: Ah! Wonderful! You finally made it. I am the mayor of the great metropolis of mako. Domino, at your service. (chuckles) I must say, you three haven't exactly been discreet. I wonder who's been cleaning up all your messes.
Dialogue: Ah! Wonderful! You finally made it. I am the mayor of the great metropolis of mako. Domino, at your service. (chuckles) I must say, you three haven't exactly been discreet. I wonder who's been cleaning up all your messes.

Original: Cloud: What the hell's going on?
Dialogue: What the hell's going on?

Original: Domino: Come on. Think about it. You've been caught by security several times...walked in front of every other camera...and scared an accountant half to death. Do you hear the alarm? No? You're weclome.
Dialogue: Come on. Think about it. You've been caught by security several times...walked in front of every other camera...and scared an accountant half to death. Do you hear the alarm? No? You're weclome.

Original: Domino: I can only assume your cell wasn't looped in. I am Avalanche's man on the inside.
Dialogue: I can only assume your cell wasn't looped in. I am Avalanche's man on the inside.

Original: Barret: Say what?
Dialogue: Say what?

Original: Domino: Is it really that surprising to you? You've seen where they've put me. The mayor of the greatest city in the whole wide world...tucked away in a secret broom closet in the damned archives! The nerve. Those stupid Shinra pricks thought I'd just shut up and accept their treatment, but they were wrong! Dead wrong!
Dialogue: Is it really that surprising to you? You've seen where they've put me. The mayor of the greatest city in the whole wide world...tucked away in a secret broom closet in the damned archives! The nerve. Those stupid Shinra pricks thought I'd just shut up and accept their treatment, but they were wrong! Dead wrong!

Original: Barret: Huh. Well, this oughta make things easier.
Dialogue: Huh. Well, this oughta make things easier.

Original: Tifa: We need to break into Professor Hojo's lab.
Dialogue: We need to break into Professor Hojo's lab.

Original: Domino: What? Why? You mean you're not here to give President Shinra his comeuppance?
Dialogue: What? Why? You mean you're not here to give President Shinra his comeuppance?

Original: Cloud: We're here to save a friend who was taken.
Dialogue: We're here to save a friend who was taken.

Original: Barret: But the president's gonna get his tooif I have anything to say about it.
Dialogue: But the president's gonna get his too—if I have anything to say about it.

Original: Domino: Well, I don't particularly care what you end up doingso long as it hurts Shinra.
Dialogue: Well, I don't particularly care what you end up doing—so long as it hurts Shinra.

Original: Barret: Great.
Dialogue: Great.

Original: Domino: So. I can get you as far as the 64th floor.
Dialogue: So. I can get you as far as the 64th floor.

Original: Barret: Hold up. You telling me that that's the best you can do?
Dialogue: Hold up. You telling me that that's the best you can do?

Original: Domino: That is indeed the best that I can do.
Dialogue: That is indeed the best that I can do.

Original: Cloud: But you're the mayor.
Dialogue: But you're the mayor.

Original: Domino: "But you're the mayor"!? Does this look like the office of a mayor? I'm a glorified librariannothing more! They don't even invite me to their meetings! Sorting records and reportsthat's all I do! My hands and fingers have more paper cuts than skin! No one knows my painmy daily torment! They've made me a pathetic shell of a man.
Dialogue: "But you're the mayor"!? Does this look like the office of a mayor? I'm a glorified librarian—nothing more! They don't even invite me to their meetings! Sorting records and reports—that's all I do! My hands and fingers have more paper cuts than skin! No one knows my pain—my daily torment! They've made me a pathetic shell of a man.

Original: Barret: Okay! They did you wrong, like usbut we'll make it right. So just calm down. Deep breaths, man. Deep breaths.
Dialogue: Okay! They did you wrong, like us—but we'll make it right. So just calm down. Deep breaths, man. Deep breaths.

Original: Domino: Hm. Let me see that keycard of yours.
Dialogue: Hm. Let me see that keycard of yours.

Original: Domino: Here you are. You can now use it to access the Recreational Facility on the 63rd floor.
Dialogue: Here you are. You can now use it to access the Recreational Facility on the 63rd floor.

Original: Barret: And then what are we supposed to do?
Dialogue: And then what are we supposed to do?

Original: Domino: You look for a fellow Avalanche collaborator. Identify yourselves and he'll give you a keycard to the 64th. The countersign is... "The mayor is the best!" "Midgar's mayor is nothing less!" "Everyone says he's cooler than the rest!"
Dialogue: You look for a fellow Avalanche collaborator. Identify yourselves and he'll give you a keycard to the 64th. The countersign is... "The mayor is the best!" "Midgar's mayor is nothing less!" "Everyone says he's cooler than the rest!"

Original: Domino: Just say "mayor" to the guy, and if he goes "the best!" with gusto, then you've found your man. You got it?
Dialogue: Just say "mayor" to the guy, and if he goes "the best!" with gusto, then you've found your man. You got it?

Original: Domino: If you think you've found the collaborator, say "mayor" and see if he says "the best!" You got it now?
Dialogue: If you think you've found the collaborator, say "mayor" and see if he says "the best!" You got it now?

Original: Hart: If you require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to ask.
Dialogue: If you require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to ask.

Original: Cloud: So, can you tell us anything about this collaborator?
Dialogue: So, can you tell us anything about this collaborator?

Original: Hart: Certainly, I can do just that. But a man in my position must conduct his affairs with discretion. Which is to say that that which has been requested cannot be freely given...if you take my meaning.
Dialogue: Certainly, I can do just that. But a man in my position must conduct his affairs with discretion. Which is to say that that which has been requested cannot be freely given...if you take my meaning.

Original: Barret: You want money!
Dialogue: You want money!

Original: Hart: Disclosing confidential information entails considerable risk. Due compensation is to be expected. In this particular instance, that would amount to ten thousand gil.
Dialogue: Disclosing confidential information entails considerable risk. Due compensation is to be expected. In this particular instance, that would amount to ten thousand gil.

Original: Barret: Rip us off more, why don'tcha?
Dialogue: Rip us off more, why don'tcha?

Original: On-screen: Give 10,000 gil?
Dialogue: Give 10,000 gil?

Original: Hart: The 64th floor is reserved for our executives. The individual you seek is fastidious and well-dressed. This individual likes to visit the 63rd floor to decompress from the stress of the job.
Dialogue: The 64th floor is reserved for our executives. The individual you seek is fastidious and well-dressed. This individual likes to visit the 63rd floor to decompress from the stress of the job.

Original: Barret: That really all you got for us?
Dialogue: That really all you got for us?

Original: Hart: Oh, are you dissatisfied with your purchase? How unfortunate. Perhaps this will help preserve our relationship.
Dialogue: Oh, are you dissatisfied with your purchase? How unfortunate. Perhaps this will help preserve our relationship.

Original: Barret: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Hart: An expression of my gratitude and appreciation.
Dialogue: An expression of my gratitude and appreciation.

Original: Barret: That's better.
Dialogue: That's better.

Original: Hart: If you require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to ask.
Dialogue: If you require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to ask.

Original: Tifa: I still can't believe the mayor is working with Avalanche.
Dialogue: I still can't believe the mayor is working with Avalanche.

Original: Barret: Would've been nice to know. Idiots at HQ shoulda kept us in the loop.
Dialogue: Would've been nice to know. Idiots at HQ shoulda kept us in the loop.

Original: On-screen: 66th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory: Main Level
Dialogue: 66th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory Main Level

Original: Hojo: So. About this precious promised land of yours... Come now, Aerith. You misunderstand my intenions. I wish only to satisfy their material greed so I can be left to pursue my great work.Ourgreat work, my dear.
Dialogue: So. About this precious promised land of yours... Come now, Aerith. You misunderstand my intenions. I wish only to satisfy their material greed so I can be left to pursue my great work. Our great work, my dear.

Original: Hojo: Hmm. You're the spitting image of her now. I regret it to this day. If she had only trusted me instead of trying to run, it could have played out quite differently. What a terrible tragedy, to lose the last of the pure-blooded Ancients...though not completely. Would like to see your mother? Albeit, through the lens of one of my microscopes. Did you really think we'd leave such a precious specimen to rot in the gutter? We collected and catalogued every last bit of her. Hair, skin, organs, every fragment of every bone... As breathtaking in death as in life! Asyou, my dear! Ifalna was elegance, right down to her cellular structure. (chuckles) And there it is. That same elegance.
Dialogue: Hmm. You're the spitting image of her now. I regret it to this day. If she had only trusted me instead of trying to run, it could have played out quite differently. What a terrible tragedy, to lose the last of the pure-blooded Ancients...though not completely. Would like to see your mother? Albeit, through the lens of one of my microscopes. Did you really think we'd leave such a precious specimen to rot in the gutter? We collected and catalogued every last bit of her. Hair, skin, organs, every fragment of every bone... As breathtaking in death as in life! As you, my dear! Ifalna was elegance, right down to her cellular structure. (chuckles) And there it is. That same elegance.

Original: Hojo: Ohyes. Time for yet another meeting. Sit tight. I won't be long.
Dialogue: Oh—yes. Time for yet another meeting. Sit tight. I won't be long.

Original: Aerith: (gasps)
Dialogue: (gasps)

Original: On-screen: 63rd Floor - Recreational Facility
Dialogue: 63rd Floor - Recreational Facility

Original: Barret: Here's the 63rd floor, where loyal Shinra employees relax and recharge!
Dialogue: Here's the 63rd floor, where loyal Shinra employees relax and recharge!

Original: Tifa: It's pretty late, but I bet people are still here dealing with the aftermath of Sector 7.
Dialogue: It's pretty late, but I bet people are still here dealing with the aftermath of Sector 7.

Original: Barret: It's their own damn fault.
Dialogue: It's their own damn fault.

Original: Cloud: Stay focused. We need to find this guy.
Dialogue: Stay focused. We need to find this guy.

Original: Barret: Yeah, yeah. Guess I better get working on my conversation skills.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. Guess I better get working on my conversation skills.

Original: Tifa: They look busy.
Dialogue: They look busy.

Original: Cloud: A plate did just fall.
Dialogue: A plate did just fall.

Original: Tifa: Seeing them like this somehow makes me feel a little bit better.
Dialogue: Seeing them like this somehow makes me feel a little bit better.

Original: Cloud: Let's find our contact.
Dialogue: Let's find our contact.

Original: Barret: Not seeing any security around. One less thing to worry about.
Dialogue: Not seeing any security around. One less thing to worry about.

Original: Barret: Where are you...mister collaborator...
Dialogue: Where are you...mister collaborator...

Original: Tifa: I think we just need to start talking to people who look the part.
Dialogue: I think we just need to start talking to people who look the part.

Original: Barret: Remember, say "mayor."
Dialogue: Remember, say "mayor."

Original: Tifa: If they say "the best," then we have a winner.
Dialogue: If they say "the best," then we have a winner.

Original: Host: Today we welcome a special guest: Shinra's Director of Public Security...who has an important message to share with us.
Dialogue: Today we welcome a special guest Shinra's Director of Public Security...who has an important message to share with us.

Original: Heidegger: Everyone here at Shinra is deeply saddened and outraged by this unconscionable act of terrorism. But at the same time, we will not be cowed by threats or violence. To the people of Midgar, I make this vow: we will find the villains responsible and bring them to justice. Are you listening, Avalancheyou cowardly dogs!? Run all you like. Shinra is coming.
Dialogue: Everyone here at Shinra is deeply saddened and outraged by this unconscionable act of terrorism. But at the same time, we will not be cowed by threats or violence. To the people of Midgar, I make this vow we will find the villains responsible and bring them to justice. Are you listening, Avalanche—you cowardly dogs!? Run all you like. Shinra is coming.

Original: Barret: The hell's that?
Dialogue: The hell's that?

Original: Cloud: Combat sim. You can use it to train for battle in a virtual space.
Dialogue: Combat sim. You can use it to train for battle in a virtual space.

Original: Barret: Does training in that thing really make you better?
Dialogue: Does training in that thing really make you better?

Original: Server: Hello there! Sowhat'll it be for you today?
Dialogue: Hello there! So—what'll it be for you today?

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Server: Mayo? Sorry, we don't have any here.
Dialogue: Mayo? Sorry, we don't have any here.

Original: Server: Come on, why don't you eat something hearty? It'll give you energy.
Dialogue: Come on, why don't you eat something hearty? It'll give you energy.

Original: Shinra Employee: Hm? Are you military? Cool, cool. I guess things have been keeping you pretty busy around here. Have you found the guys who did this yet?
Dialogue: Hm? Are you military? Cool, cool. I guess things have been keeping you pretty busy around here. Have you found the guys who did this yet?

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Shinra Employee: Huh? Uhh...what about the mayor?
Dialogue: Huh? Uhh...what about the mayor?

Original: Cloud: Never mind.
Dialogue: Never mind.

Original: Shinra Employee: No, I'm gonna be here a while longer.
Dialogue: No, I'm gonna be here a while longer.

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Shinra Employee: Hey, shhh! I'm on the phone!
Dialogue: Hey, shhh! I'm on the phone!

Original: Shinra Employee: Please, just leave me alone.
Dialogue: Please, just leave me alone.

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Shinra Employee: You're gonna train in the sim at a time like this?
Dialogue: You're gonna train in the sim at a time like this?

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Shinra Employee: Hm? Are you looking for the mayor? He's not on this floor...
Dialogue: Hm? Are you looking for the mayor? He's not on this floor...

Original: Shinra Employee: You're military, right? Can you give me any tips for doing better in the sim?
Dialogue: You're military, right? Can you give me any tips for doing better in the sim?

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Shinra Employee: Mare? I need to be tough like a horse?
Dialogue: Mare? I need to be tough like a horse?

Original: Server: Welcome. What would you like?
Dialogue: Welcome. What would you like?

Original: Collaborator: You work here? I don't recognize you. Can I help you with something?
Dialogue: You work here? I don't recognize you. Can I help you with something?

Original: Cloud: The mayor.
Dialogue: The mayor.

Original: Collaborator: ...Is the best! I was told to expect you. Need access to upper floors, right?
Dialogue: ...Is the best! I was told to expect you. Need access to upper floors, right?

Original: Barret: That's right.
Dialogue: That's right.

Original: Collaborator: Before I trust you with this keycard, I need to see what you can actually do.
Dialogue: Before I trust you with this keycard, I need to see what you can actually do.

Original: Barret: Say what?
Dialogue: Say what?

Original: Collaborator: Do you know what would happen if you got caught? We're putting our lives on the line here. Prove you're worth it. We have a state-of-the-art combat simulator. It can provide a real challenge, let me tell you. If you beat the sim, then the keycard is all yours.
Dialogue: Do you know what would happen if you got caught? We're putting our lives on the line here. Prove you're worth it. We have a state-of-the-art combat simulator. It can provide a real challenge, let me tell you. If you beat the sim, then the keycard is all yours.

Original: Collaborator: All right, I've seen enough. I'm a man of my word. Here. This keycard will grant you access to the 64th floor. You can use the elevator to get there. Once you're up there, just what is it you plan on doing?
Dialogue: All right, I've seen enough. I'm a man of my word. Here. This keycard will grant you access to the 64th floor. You can use the elevator to get there. Once you're up there, just what is it you plan on doing?

Original: Cloud: We came to get one of our friends. She's being held in a research lab somewhere.
Dialogue: We came to get one of our friends. She's being held in a research lab somewhere.

Original: Collaborator: A lab? Then she must be with Professor Hojo. It won't be easy to get to her. Access to R&D is limited to authorized personnel only.
Dialogue: A lab? Then she must be with Professor Hojo. It won't be easy to get to her. Access to R&D is limited to authorized personnel only.

Original: Cloud: We'll find a way in. Know where we can find Hojo?
Dialogue: We'll find a way in. Know where we can find Hojo?

Original: Collaborator: A board meeting is scheduled to start soon. It's being held in the main conference room. President Shinra, Professor Hojo, and the other directors will be in attendance.
Dialogue: A board meeting is scheduled to start soon. It's being held in the main conference room. President Shinra, Professor Hojo, and the other directors will be in attendance.

Original: Barret: Think they like surprises? We can even take the president as a hostage. Think of the leverage!
Dialogue: Think they like surprises? We can even take the president as a hostage. Think of the leverage!

Original: Collaborator: Try it, and security will be on your asses in seconds.
Dialogue: Try it, and security will be on your asses in seconds.

Original: Cloud: We need to find out what they're planning.
Dialogue: We need to find out what they're planning.

Original: Collaborator: So you want to spy on their meeting? Hmm, I have an idea. Head to the men's restroom. You can climb into the air ducts there. They go all the way to the conference room.
Dialogue: So you want to spy on their meeting? Hmm, I have an idea. Head to the men's restroom. You can climb into the air ducts there. They go all the way to the conference room.

Original: Cloud: Thanks for the tip.
Dialogue: Thanks for the tip.

Original: Chadley: Cloud. I've been waiting for you. You haven't forgotten me, have you? I'm an intern in the R&D Division here. I took the liberty of hacking into the executives' private network to monitor your progress through the building. I will support you in any way that I can. I sense a surge in trust. We should keep this brief to avoid suspicion.
Dialogue: Cloud. I've been waiting for you. You haven't forgotten me, have you? I'm an intern in the R&D Division here. I took the liberty of hacking into the executives' private network to monitor your progress through the building. I will support you in any way that I can. I sense a surge in trust. We should keep this brief to avoid suspicion.

Original: Security Officer: Cloud? You're Cloud, right? Holy shit! It's cool, bro. We went through training together. Damn! So you still alive and kicking, huh? Some of the guys heard you got smoked, but I told 'em it was all bullshit!
Dialogue: Cloud? You're Cloud, right? Holy shit! It's cool, bro. We went through training together. Damn! So you still alive and kicking, huh? Some of the guys heard you got smoked, but I told 'em it was all bullshit!

Original: Security Officer: Hey, sit tight manI'mma go get Kunsel. I'll be right back!
Dialogue: Hey, sit tight man—I'mma go get Kunsel. I'll be right back!

Original: Barret: Old buddy?
Dialogue: Old buddy?

Original: Tifa: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Tifa: But you were just
Dialogue: But you were just—

Original: Cloud: I'm good. Let's keep moving.
Dialogue: I'm good. Let's keep moving.

Original: President Shinra: I trust the narrative is intact?
Dialogue: I trust the narrative is intact?

Original: Heidegger: Rock solid. The people have embraced the Wutai-Avalanche conspiracy wholeheartedly. I've almost come to believe it myself.
Dialogue: Rock solid. The people have embraced the Wutai-Avalanche conspiracy wholeheartedly. I've almost come to believe it myself.

Original: President Shinra: Wutai's response?
Dialogue: Wutai's response?

Original: Heidegger: So far, nothing. And if those cowardsdoreact, all the better for us and our story.
Dialogue: So far, nothing. And if those cowards do react, all the better for us and our story.

Original: President Shinra: Very well. Then we shall stay the course.
Dialogue: Very well. Then we shall stay the course.

Original: Heidegger: If I may, sir, there was one other matter.
Dialogue: If I may, sir, there was one other matter.

Original: President Shinra: Oh?
Dialogue: Oh?

Original: Heidegger: A message from our man Palmer.
Dialogue: A message from our man Palmer.

Original: Barret: Dammit!
Dialogue: Dammit!

Original: Tifa: Barret.
Dialogue: Barret.

Original: Barret: Yeah, yeah, I know. We came here to save Aerith. That's our first priority.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, I know. We came here to save Aerith. That's our first priority.

Original: Cloud: That's right. We only get one chance. Hojo should be at that board meeting, so that'll buy us some time. We need to plan this just right.
Dialogue: That's right. We only get one chance. Hojo should be at that board meeting, so that'll buy us some time. We need to plan this just right.

Original: Domino: I've done everything I can for you. Now don't make me regret doing it!
Dialogue: I've done everything I can for you. Now don't make me regret doing it!

Original: On-screen: 64th Floor - Conference Rooms
Dialogue: 64th Floor - Conference Rooms

Original: Shinra Employee: Can I help you?
Dialogue: Can I help you?

Original: Tifa: What's the plan?
Dialogue: What's the plan?

Original: Cloud: Little bit of recon. Need to find a way to infiltrate that room.
Dialogue: Little bit of recon. Need to find a way to infiltrate that room.

Original: Barret: You hear the words comin' out of your mouth? We just gotta find that bathroom so we can get into the air duct. Ask anyone here. They can point us in the right direction.
Dialogue: You hear the words comin' out of your mouth? We just gotta find that bathroom so we can get into the air duct. Ask anyone here. They can point us in the right direction.

Original: Cloud: No, thanks. We can find it on our own.
Dialogue: No, thanks. We can find it on our own.

Original: Shinra Employee: Yes, what is it?
Dialogue: Yes, what is it?

Original: Tifa: All right, I'll wait out here.
Dialogue: All right, I'll wait out here.

Original: Barret: Huh? You can't hang out here.
Dialogue: Huh? You can't hang out here.

Original: Cloud: Tifa. It'd be better if you waited inside.
Dialogue: Tifa. It'd be better if you waited inside.

Original: Tifa: Maybe, but this is... Oh...never mind, you're right.
Dialogue: Maybe, but this is... Oh...never mind, you're right.

Original: Tifa: Oh, thank god. No one's in here.
Dialogue: Oh, thank god. No one's in here.

Original: Barret: Love to show them what the ones down below look like.
Dialogue: Love to show them what the ones down below look like.

Original: Tifa: Come on, let's just find that duct.
Dialogue: Come on, let's just find that duct.

Original: Cloud: Gotcha.
Dialogue: Gotcha.

Original: Barret: Look, I'm...
Dialogue: Look, I'm...

Original: Cloud: On guard duty.
Dialogue: On guard duty.

Original: Barret: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Tifa: So...can I go with you? Don't wanna be here any longer than I have to.
Dialogue: So...can I go with you? Don't wanna be here any longer than I have to.

Original: Cloud: Yeah, sure. Just follow behind.
Dialogue: Yeah, sure. Just follow behind.

Original: Shinra Employee (1): I'm sure they're safe.
Dialogue: I'm sure they're safe.

Original: Shinra Employee (2): But we live right by Sector 7 and I keep calling and calling, but I still can't get through.
Dialogue: But we live right by Sector 7 and I keep calling and calling, but I still can't get through.

Original: Shinra Employee (1): I heard that all the phone lines are down. It doesn't mean anything.
Dialogue: I heard that all the phone lines are down. It doesn't mean anything.

Original: Shinra Employee (2): ...You sure?
Dialogue: ...You sure?

Original: Shinra Employee (1): Pretty sure...
Dialogue: Pretty sure...

Original: Shinra Employee: Depending on the board's decision, we may start two projects simultaneously: rebuilding the plate and the city. Members of the Urban Planning Division will likely take point on both. Director Tuesti has ordered teams to come up with three-, five-, and ten-year plans. Each team needs to come up with a detailed proposal and schedule. We're going to have to put a lot of man-hours into this, so we'll need to start ASAP. Does anyone have any questions at all? If not, then we'll wait for the director to return.
Dialogue: Depending on the board's decision, we may start two projects simultaneously rebuilding the plate and the city. Members of the Urban Planning Division will likely take point on both. Director Tuesti has ordered teams to come up with three-, five-, and ten-year plans. Each team needs to come up with a detailed proposal and schedule. We're going to have to put a lot of man-hours into this, so we'll need to start ASAP. Does anyone have any questions at all? If not, then we'll wait for the director to return.

Original: Cloud: This it?
Dialogue: This it?

Original: Palmer: I'm telling you, I saw him! With my own eyes! Sauntering down the corridor!
Dialogue: I'm telling you, I saw him! With my own eyes! Sauntering down the corridor!

Original: Heidegger: We don't have time for this nonsense!
Dialogue: We don't have time for this nonsense!

Original: Palmer: He was as close to me as you are now! The shock of it made me spill my tea!
Dialogue: He was as close to me as you are now! The shock of it made me spill my tea!

Original: Heidegger: Enough already! If there are intruders in the building, my men will deal with them.
Dialogue: Enough already! If there are intruders in the building, my men will deal with them.

Original: Palmer: But Mister President! Sir! I swear to you
Dialogue: But Mister President! Sir! I swear to you—

Original: President Shinra: Reeve.
Dialogue: Reeve.

Original: Reeve: Sir. I have the damage assessment for Sector 7, and I'm afraid the figures are catastrophic
Dialogue: Sir. I have the damage assessment for Sector 7, and I'm afraid the figures are catastrophic—

Original: President Shinra: Spare us the doom and gloom. Was there anything else?
Dialogue: Spare us the doom and gloom. Was there anything else?

Original: Reeve: Uh... Well sir, I've also drafted a reconstruction plan
Dialogue: Uh... Well sir, I've also drafted a reconstruction plan—

Original: President Shinra: That will not be needed. Not with the Ancient in our custody once more.
Dialogue: That will not be needed. Not with the Ancient in our custody once more.

Original: Reeve: Uh...with respect, sir, I don't see how
Dialogue: Uh...with respect, sir, I don't see how—

Original: Scarlet: Two words, Reeve: "Neo Midgar." Hm.
Dialogue: Two words, Reeve "Neo Midgar." Hm.

Original: President Shinra: In their promised land...we will build a new mako-powered metropolis.
Dialogue: In their promised land...we will build a new mako-powered metropolis.

Original: Reeve: Mister President! We still don't know for sure that the promised land even
Dialogue: Mister President! We still don't know for sure that the promised land even—

Original: President Shinra: Professor Hojo.
Dialogue: Professor Hojo.

Original: Hojo: The test results were within expectations. The specimen is somewhat lacking compared to her pure-blood mother, but for our purposes she should more than suffice.
Dialogue: The test results were within expectations. The specimen is somewhat lacking compared to her pure-blood mother, but for our purposes she should more than suffice.

Original: President Shinra: So, she can lead us to the promised land?
Dialogue: So, she can lead us to the promised land?

Original: Hojo: Well, Mister President, that remains to be seen. I would like your permission to secure her cooperation through more "forceful" means. Forceful yet gentle. She is a precious resource that must be handled with care.
Dialogue: Well, Mister President, that remains to be seen. I would like your permission to secure her cooperation through more "forceful" means. Forceful yet gentle. She is a precious resource that must be handled with care.

Original: Scarlet: Personally, I've never had a problem with torture.
Dialogue: Personally, I've never had a problem with torture.

Original: Heidegger: My armory is at your disposal, should you require anything.
Dialogue: My armory is at your disposal, should you require anything.

Original: Hojo: I...had something more...psychological in mind. Better to scar the psyche than mar the flesh.
Dialogue: I...had something more...psychological in mind. Better to scar the psyche than mar the flesh.

Original: Palmer: (laughs)
Dialogue: (laughs)

Original: President Shinra: Proceed as you see fit. However. You will not make the same mistake twice. Is that clear?
Dialogue: Proceed as you see fit. However. You will not make the same mistake twice. Is that clear?

Original: Hojo: If I may, Mister President, I have an idea how we might mitigate the risks. Simply put, we could have the Ancient reproduce. In the absence of a second specimen, we would need to identify an alternative mate. I would start with candidates from SOLDIER. These would of course include S and G types. Quite frankly, there's no telling what kind of properties a crossbred specimen might possess. So What say you all?
Dialogue: If I may, Mister President, I have an idea how we might mitigate the risks. Simply put, we could have the Ancient reproduce. In the absence of a second specimen, we would need to identify an alternative mate. I would start with candidates from SOLDIER. These would of course include S and G types. Quite frankly, there's no telling what kind of properties a crossbred specimen might possess. So— What say you all?

Original: President Shinra: If there is nothing else.
Dialogue: If there is nothing else.

Original: Reeve: Mister President!
Dialogue: Mister President!

Original: President Shinra: Meeting adjourned.
Dialogue: Meeting adjourned.

Original: Reeve: Please, sir!
Dialogue: Please, sir!

Original: Hojo: Something stinks.
Dialogue: Something stinks.

Original: Barret: Anything?
Dialogue: Anything?

Original: Cloud: The man in the lab coat. Head of R&D. We follow him.
Dialogue: The man in the lab coat. Head of R&D. We follow him.

Original: Barret: Okay. And then we kill the son of a bitch.
Dialogue: Okay. And then we kill the son of a bitch.

Original: Cloud: Not until he's led us to Aerith. That's the plan.
Dialogue: Not until he's led us to Aerith. That's the plan.

Original: Hojo: Walking the halls of this very building. Who would have believed it. I wonder...were I to arrange a face-to-face...(chuckles) How I should like to meet their offspring. Ahh, but that can wait. First, we must have answers. A simple psychoactive agent should suffice. Nothing likely to cause any long-term damage. (laughs)
Dialogue: Walking the halls of this very building. Who would have believed it. I wonder...were I to arrange a face-to-face...(chuckles) How I should like to meet their offspring. Ahh, but that can wait. First, we must have answers. A simple psychoactive agent should suffice. Nothing likely to cause any long-term damage. (laughs)

Original: On-screen: 64th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory: Entrance
Dialogue: 64th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory Entrance

Original: Cloud: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Barret: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Barret: Don't move! I ain't bluffing.
Dialogue: Don't move! I ain't bluffing.

Original: Hojo: What is this?
Dialogue: What is this?

Original: Barret: A dozen bullets in your head, unless you open that door right now.
Dialogue: A dozen bullets in your head, unless you open that door right now.

Original: On-screen: 65th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory: Sublevel
Dialogue: 65th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory Sublevel

Original: Hojo: You must be the ones who've been stirring up trouble lately. The eco-terrorists? If so I can't imagine what business you have with me. The president's upstairs. Go on, shoo.
Dialogue: You must be the ones who've been stirring up trouble lately. The eco-terrorists? If so I can't imagine what business you have with me. The president's upstairs. Go on, shoo.

Original: Barret: Shut up. Keep walking.
Dialogue: Shut up. Keep walking.

Original: Barret: None of y'all better move a muscle!
Dialogue: None of y'all better move a muscle!

Original: Hojo: Do stop pushing. Unlike you, I am less accustomed to physical violence.
Dialogue: Do stop pushing. Unlike you, I am less accustomed to physical violence.

Original: Barret: You'll get used to it.
Dialogue: You'll get used to it.

Original: Hojo: What is it that you want?
Dialogue: What is it that you want?

Original: Barret: Our friend. She's in your lab.
Dialogue: Our friend. She's in your lab.

Original: Hojo: Really?
Dialogue: Really?

Original: Barret: Tell us where Aerith is!
Dialogue: Tell us where Aerith is!

Original: Hojo: Oh, so she's your friend... Well well well, in that case... Yes... That might do the trick.
Dialogue: Oh, so she's your friend... Well well well, in that case... Yes... That might do the trick.

Original: Barret: Mind speaking up some?
Dialogue: Mind speaking up some?

Original: Hojo: It's nothing. Just imagining how she might react if I were to present to her your fresh corpses. (laughs) I promise...you will regret this.
Dialogue: It's nothing. Just imagining how she might react if I were to present to her your fresh corpses. (laughs) I promise...you will regret this.

Original: Barret: Hey! Hojo's getting away!
Dialogue: Hey! Hojo's getting away!

Original: On-screen: 66th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory: Main Level
Dialogue: 66th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory Main Level

Original: Cloud: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Hojo: Very impressive. I really must thank you for providing me such invaluable combat data.
Dialogue: Very impressive. I really must thank you for providing me such invaluable combat data.

Original: Barret: Cocky little egghead, ain'tcha.
Dialogue: Cocky little egghead, ain'tcha.

Original: Hojo: The results provided by my predictive models...indicate that this force should be more than capable of handling you.
Dialogue: The results provided by my predictive models...indicate that this force should be more than capable of handling you.

Original: Barret: Y'all 'bout to learn predictable.
Dialogue: Y'all 'bout to learn predictable.

Original: Cloud: We're taking Aerith back!
Dialogue: We're taking Aerith back!

Original: Hojo: Oh? "Take her back," you say? Correct me if I am wrong, but did the girl not come here of her own free will? Or do you mean to tell me that she is your "personal property"?
Dialogue: Oh? "Take her back," you say? Correct me if I am wrong, but did the girl not come here of her own free will? Or do you mean to tell me that she is your "personal property"?

Original: Barret: She only came here to save Marlene!
Dialogue: She only came here to save Marlene!

Original: Hojo: I'm afraid you misunderstand. But I really can't be bothered to explain. This facility is home to extraordinary specimens that will change the world as we know it. Do try to be considerate.
Dialogue: I'm afraid you misunderstand. But I really can't be bothered to explain. This facility is home to extraordinary specimens that will change the world as we know it. Do try to be considerate.

Original: Barret: Looks like your models got it wrong.
Dialogue: Looks like your models got it wrong.

Original: Hojo: Yes...an unknown variable, perhaps. Well, no matter. Reinforcements will soon arrive.
Dialogue: Yes...an unknown variable, perhaps. Well, no matter. Reinforcements will soon arrive.

Original: Cloud: But will they get here in time to save you from me?
Dialogue: But will they get here in time to save you from me?

Original: Hojo: My, are you a SOLDIER?
Dialogue: My, are you a SOLDIER?

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Hojo: No, not quite. Oh, now I recall. My memory was mistaken. My boy, you weren't a SOLDIER...
Dialogue: No, not quite. Oh, now I recall. My memory was mistaken. My boy, you weren't a SOLDIER...

Original: Hojo: What!? What is thisfascinating phenomenon!? What's happening!? Where are you taking me!?
Dialogue: What!? What is this—fascinating phenomenon!? What's happening!? Where are you taking me!?

Original: Barret: What are those things up to this time?
Dialogue: What are those things up to this time?

Original: Aerith: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Cloud: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: Got it. Stand back.
Dialogue: Got it. Stand back.

Original: Aerith: You came for me.
Dialogue: You came for me.

Original: Cloud: Yep.
Dialogue: Yep.

Original: Tifa: You good?
Dialogue: You good?

Original: Aerith: I'm great!
Dialogue: I'm great!

Original: Barret: Thanks for saving Marlene. I owe you one.
Dialogue: Thanks for saving Marlene. I owe you one.

Original: Cloud: Save it for later!
Dialogue: Save it for later!

Original: Tifa: Aerith! You okay?
Dialogue: Aerith! You okay?

Original: Aerith: Mm-hm. Thank you.
Dialogue: Mm-hm. Thank you.

Original: Cloud: Let's get outta here.
Dialogue: Let's get outta here.

Original: Barret: The hell was that thing?
Dialogue: The hell was that thing?

Original: Aerith: We need to go!
Dialogue: We need to go!

Original: Tifa: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Barret: What the!?
Dialogue: What the—!?

Original: Cloud: Come on.
Dialogue: Come on.

Original: Barret: What? You wanna go?
Dialogue: What? You wanna go?

Original: Aerith: Stop. This child's a friend.
Dialogue: Stop. This child's a friend.

Original: Barret: Uhh... So what the hell is it?
Dialogue: Uhh... So what the hell is it?

Original: Red XIII: A fascinating question.
Dialogue: A fascinating question.

Original: Tifa: Did it justtalk?
Dialogue: Did it just talk?

Original: Red XIII: You asked what "it" is. Hmm... I am that which you see before you. Nothing more. I'd appreciate it if we simply left it at that. Agreed?
Dialogue: You asked what "it" is. Hmm... I am that which you see before you. Nothing more. I'd appreciate it if we simply left it at that. Agreed?

Original: Tifa: Thirteen?
Dialogue: Thirteen?

Original: Red XIII: "Red XIII." The designation given to me by Hojo.
Dialogue: "Red XIII." The designation given to me by Hojo.

Original: Tifa: Then...you must have another name. What is it?
Dialogue: Then...you must have another name. What is it?

Original: Cloud: He got away.
Dialogue: He got away.

Original: Barret: So, we gonna go get the son of a bitch?
Dialogue: So, we gonna go get the son of a bitch?

Original: Cloud: Je...no... Oh... Ah...
Dialogue: Je...no... Oh... Ah...

Original: Cloud: Mo...ther...
Dialogue: Mo...ther...

Original: Tifa & Aerith: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: On-screen: B3 - General Affairs: Auditing
Dialogue: B3 - General Affairs Auditing

Original: Tseng: You know, Reno. I think you might be due for some R&R.
Dialogue: You know, Reno. I think you might be due for some R&R.

Original: Reno: Nah, I'm good...
Dialogue: Nah, I'm good...

Original: Rude: What are we going to do about Sector 7?
Dialogue: What are we going to do about Sector 7?

Original: Tseng: (sighs) "We" are going to do nothing.
Dialogue: (sighs) "We" are going to do nothing.

Original: Rude: Been thinking. Was all that necessary?
Dialogue: Been thinking. Was all that necessary?

Original: Tseng: Had we refused, someone else would've completed the task. We have spared that someone the burden of a guilty conscience. Perhaps that will ease yours.
Dialogue: Had we refused, someone else would've completed the task. We have spared that someone the burden of a guilty conscience. Perhaps that will ease yours.

Original: Reno: Yeah...nope.
Dialogue: Yeah...nope.

Original: Tseng: Let's try another tack then. They were a sacrifice to balance the scales.
Dialogue: Let's try another tack then. They were a sacrifice to balance the scales.

Original: Reno: Say what?
Dialogue: Say what?

Original: Tseng: After everything we've taken from the planet, we were due to give something back.
Dialogue: After everything we've taken from the planet, we were due to give something back.

Original: Rude: Do you actually believe that?
Dialogue: Do you actually believe that?

Original: Tseng: Does it matter?
Dialogue: Does it matter?

Original: Tseng: Yes. Understood.
Dialogue: Yes. Understood.

Original: Tseng: The VP needs us.
Dialogue: The VP needs us.

Original: Chadley: That should be everything. Initiate projection sequence.
Dialogue: That should be everything. Initiate projection sequence.

Original: Chadley: What do you make of the new form, Weiss? Weve replicated everything about you, from thought patterns to stress responses. You should, however, notice some improvements in my latest update. Indeed, Id venture to say youre stronger now than youve ever been.
Dialogue: What do you make of the new form, Weiss? We’ve replicated everything about you, from thought patterns to stress responses. You should, however, notice some improvements in my latest update. Indeed, I’d venture to say you’re stronger now than you’ve ever been.

Original: Weiss: Hm. Stronger than Ive ever been A big claim, little man.
Dialogue: Hm. Stronger than I’ve ever been… A big claim, little man.

Original: Weiss: Now Who do I kill?
Dialogue: Now… Who do I kill?

Original: Chadley: Given that this is merely a training exerciseno one.
Dialogue: Given that this is merely a training exercise—no one.

Original: Weiss: Well see. Be sure to choose my victims wisely (laughs)
Dialogue: We’ll see. Be sure to choose my victims wisely… (laughs)

Original: Tifa: Cloud.
Dialogue: Cloud.

Original: Aerith: Oh, thank goodness. You're awake.
Dialogue: Oh, thank goodness. You're awake.

Original: Tifa: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. Where are we?
Dialogue: Yeah. Where are we?

Original: Aerith: Where I livedwhen I was still a child.
Dialogue: Where I lived—when I was still a child.

Original: Aerith: My mom and I stayed here, years ago when I was just a little girl. The room...looks exactly the same.
Dialogue: My mom and I stayed here, years ago when I was just a little girl. The room...looks exactly the same.

Original: Aerith: Every morning, they'd come and take my mom away. I remember crying here alone.
Dialogue: Every morning, they'd come and take my mom away. I remember crying here alone.

Original: Cloud: ...Aerith. Before we break outta here, talk to us. There's so much we don't know.
Dialogue: ...Aerith. Before we break outta here, talk to us. There's so much we don't know.

Original: Aerith: I'm...a descendent of the Ancients. That's pretty much it, really. Oh, but just so you know, that's not their actual name. They called themselves...the Cetra.
Dialogue: I'm...a descendent of the Ancients. That's pretty much it, really. Oh, but just so you know, that's not their actual name. They called themselves...the Cetra.

Original: Barret: "We who are born of the planet, with her we speak. Her flesh we shape." "Unto her promised land she well one day return." "By her loving grace and providence may we take our place in paradise."
Dialogue: "We who are born of the planet, with her we speak. Her flesh we shape." "Unto her promised land she well one day return." "By her loving grace and providence may we take our place in paradise."

Original: Aerith: You know it!
Dialogue: You know it!

Original: Barret: Yeah, well... Honestly I thought that part was just a fairy tale.
Dialogue: Yeah, well... Honestly I thought that part was just a fairy tale.

Original: Aerith: Shinra thinks it's true. They've been searching for the promised land for a long time.
Dialogue: Shinra thinks it's true. They've been searching for the promised land for a long time.

Original: Tifa: And they must think you can lead them to it... Can you?
Dialogue: And they must think you can lead them to it... Can you?

Original: Aerith: (sighs) Nope. Someday, maybe, I'll find it in me. But now? Not even if I wanted to.
Dialogue: (sighs) Nope. Someday, maybe, I'll find it in me. But now? Not even if I wanted to.

Original: Barret: Even if you could, that land belongs to theI mean... To you and your people. Shinra's after it because they believe it's rich in makomako they've got no right to claim. But they'll try to take it anyway, won't they? Hmph. Greedy bastards'll never stop.
Dialogue: Even if you could, that land belongs to the—I mean... To you and your people. Shinra's after it because they believe it's rich in mako—mako they've got no right to claim. But they'll try to take it anyway, won't they? Hmph. Greedy bastards'll never stop.

Original: Barret: Okay. New plan. Y'all take Aerith and get the hell outta here. Me, I'mma go bust some Shinra heads.
Dialogue: Okay. New plan. Y'all take Aerith and get the hell outta here. Me, I'mma go bust some Shinra heads.

Original: Aerith: Barret, wait... You can't do that...
Dialogue: Barret, wait... You can't do that...

Original: Barret: Oh, great. These assholes again! Probably some Shinra science experiment.
Dialogue: Oh, great. These assholes again! Probably some Shinra science experiment.

Original: Red XIII: Whispers. Perhaps best described as arbiters of fate. They are drawn to those who attempt to alter destiny's course and ensure they do not.
Dialogue: Whispers. Perhaps best described as arbiters of fate. They are drawn to those who attempt to alter destiny's course and ensure they do not.

Original: Tifa: Like capital D... "Destiny"?
Dialogue: Like capital D... "Destiny"?

Original: Red XIII: The flow of the great river that is the planet, from inception to oblivion.
Dialogue: The flow of the great river that is the planet, from inception to oblivion.

Original: Tifa: And you're saying that that flow is somehow...fixed?
Dialogue: And you're saying that that flow is somehow...fixed?

Original: Red XIII: Yes. For it is the will of the planet itself.
Dialogue: Yes. For it is the will of the planet itself.

Original: Barret: So if we're destined for a bleak future, these Whispers will try to keep us on that course? Now wait just a damn minute! How in the hell can you possibly know any of that? Spouting that cryptic stuffwhich could all be bullshit! I mean, ain't you a Shinra lab ratdog?
Dialogue: So if we're destined for a bleak future, these Whispers will try to keep us on that course? Now wait just a damn minute! How in the hell can you possibly know any of that? Spouting that cryptic stuff—which could all be bullshit! I mean, ain't you a Shinra lab rat—dog?

Original: Red XIII: I'm not a rat dog. When Aerith reached out to me...I found this knowledge of the Whispers.
Dialogue: I'm not a rat dog. When Aerith reached out to me...I found this knowledge of the Whispers.

Original: Aerith: Listen to me! Please...
Dialogue: Listen to me! Please...

Original: Cloud: Aerith.
Dialogue: Aerith.

Original: Aerith: The Shinra Electric Power Company isn't the real enemy. It started with them, sure...but I promise you...there's a much bigger threat. I just want to do everything in my power to help. All of you... And the planet.
Dialogue: The Shinra Electric Power Company isn't the real enemy. It started with them, sure...but I promise you...there's a much bigger threat. I just want to do everything in my power to help. All of you... And the planet.

Original: Tifa: Aerith. What are you not telling us?
Dialogue: Aerith. What are you not telling us?

Original: Aerith: I'm lost in a maze, and...every step is taking me further from the path... Every time the Whispers touch me...I lose something. A part of myself. "Follow them. The yellow flowers."
Dialogue: I'm lost in a maze, and...every step is taking me further from the path... Every time the Whispers touch me...I lose something. A part of myself. "Follow them. The yellow flowers."

Original: Tifa: It's okay. We'll find a way out together.
Dialogue: It's okay. We'll find a way out together.

Original: Aerith: Okay.
Dialogue: Okay.

Original: Barret: Weird...
Dialogue: Weird...

Original: Domino: Ah-ha! There you are!
Dialogue: Ah-ha! There you are!

Original: Domino: What are you doing, man!?
Dialogue: What are you doing, man!?

Original: Wedge: Hey guys! Long time no see!
Dialogue: Hey guys! Long time no see!

Original: Barret: Wedge!?
Dialogue: Wedge!?

Original: Tifa: You're here!?
Dialogue: You're here!?

Original: Barret: Y-you shouldn't be up and moving!
Dialogue: Y-you shouldn't be up and moving!

Original: Wedge: I'm feeling much better thanks to Elmyra's cooking! Ah, but that's not what I wanted to talk to you about! Listenany moment now
Dialogue: I'm feeling much better thanks to Elmyra's cooking! Ah, but that's not what I wanted to talk to you about! Listen—any moment now—

Original: Tifa: What was that? An explosion?
Dialogue: What was that? An explosion?

Original: Wedge: HQ's running the show this time. They're raising hell to try and flush out the president.
Dialogue: HQ's running the show this time. They're raising hell to try and flush out the president.

Original: Domino: This complicates matters. That explosion just now put the whole building on high alert.
Dialogue: This complicates matters. That explosion just now put the whole building on high alert.

Original: Tifa: So now we're trapped in here?
Dialogue: So now we're trapped in here?

Original: Domino: No need to panic, little lady. See? You can still move freely within Hojo's laboratory.
Dialogue: No need to panic, little lady. See? You can still move freely within Hojo's laboratory.

Original: Wedge: Find a way to the roof. An Avalanche chopper will come to extract you.
Dialogue: Find a way to the roof. An Avalanche chopper will come to extract you.

Original: Barret: HQ's bailing us out? I doubt it. Not after all the shit we've pulled.
Dialogue: HQ's bailing us out? I doubt it. Not after all the shit we've pulled.

Original: Wedge: I asked them really nicely! Like, super-duper nicely!
Dialogue: I asked them really nicely! Like, super-duper nicely!

Original: Tifa: Thanks, Wedge.
Dialogue: Thanks, Wedge.

Original: Wedge: Just get to the roof, okay?
Dialogue: Just get to the roof, okay?

Original: Barret: I didn't ask him to do any of that.
Dialogue: I didn't ask him to do any of that.

Original: Cloud: Yeah, well, I'm glad he did.
Dialogue: Yeah, well, I'm glad he did.

Original: Barret: Huh? Heh. I'mma still chew him out for it later.
Dialogue: Huh? Heh. I'mma still chew him out for it later.

Original: Barret: Anyway, we gotta get to the roof, right?
Dialogue: Anyway, we gotta get to the roof, right?

Original: Red XIII: Then we can use the same elevator that Hojo did.
Dialogue: Then we can use the same elevator that Hojo did.

Original: Barret: That elevator. Was it this way?
Dialogue: That elevator. Was it this way?

Original: Red XIII: Yes. His odor still lingers.
Dialogue: Yes. His odor still lingers.

Original: Barret: What happened here?
Dialogue: What happened here?

Original: Aerith: The little ones in the pods. Where did they go?
Dialogue: The little ones in the pods. Where did they go?

Original: Red XIII: It stinks in here.
Dialogue: It stinks in here.

Original: Red XIII: Back there.
Dialogue: Back there.

Original: Barret: Now what do we do?
Dialogue: Now what do we do?

Original: Red XIII: The one thing we can.
Dialogue: The one thing we can.

Original: Cloud: Someone's picking a fight.
Dialogue: Someone's picking a fight.

Original: Barret: So go give 'em one already!
Dialogue: So go give 'em one already!

Original: Cloud: Way ahead of you!
Dialogue: Way ahead of you!

Original: Barret: Nice job!
Dialogue: Nice job!

Original: Barret: What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Barret: Shitwhat the hell Red!?
Dialogue: Shit—what the hell Red!?

Original: Chadley: Now that my research is at long last complete... I believe that it's time I told you the truth about myself. I'm...not human. I'm a cyborg created to serve as Hojo's assistant. I was given knowledge and power beyond that of a human... ...But I was robbed of free will, bound to obey the whims of my master. But when we met, Cloud, I sensed something within yousomething I knew would allow me to break free of my chains. By identifying and studying a subject with infinite potential such as yourself... I could adhere to the directives imposed upon me...all the while pursuing my plans for independence in secret. Your combat data provided me the vital information that I required to enhance my basic functionality... This is the result. Through my research and with your assistance, I have freed myself from Hojo's bondage.
Dialogue: Now that my research is at long last complete... I believe that it's time I told you the truth about myself. I'm...not human. I'm a cyborg created to serve as Hojo's assistant. I was given knowledge and power beyond that of a human... ...But I was robbed of free will, bound to obey the whims of my master. But when we met, Cloud, I sensed something within you—something I knew would allow me to break free of my chains. By identifying and studying a subject with infinite potential such as yourself... I could adhere to the directives imposed upon me...all the while pursuing my plans for independence in secret. Your combat data provided me the vital information that I required to enhance my basic functionality... This is the result. Through my research and with your assistance, I have freed myself from Hojo's bondage.

Original: Cloud: Cool.
Dialogue: Cool.

Original: Chadley: I cannot thank you enough for your help. You've given me the power to finally live my life on my own terms.
Dialogue: I cannot thank you enough for your help. You've given me the power to finally live my life on my own terms.

Original: Cloud: So...what are you gonna do now?
Dialogue: So...what are you gonna do now?

Original: Chadley: I'm not sure. It's all a big, wonderful mystery. It's nice not knowing something for a change...
Dialogue: I'm not sure. It's all a big, wonderful mystery. It's nice not knowing something for a change...

Original: Cloud: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Tifa: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: On-screen: 68th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory: Restricted Level
Dialogue: 68th Floor - Hojo's Laboratory Restricted Level

Original: Barret: Hell is this place?
Dialogue: Hell is this place?

Original: Red XIII: Hojo's treasure. Shinra's dark secret.
Dialogue: Hojo's treasure. Shinra's dark secret.

Original: Barret: What I wouldn't give to burn it all down...but we need to get to the roof.
Dialogue: What I wouldn't give to burn it all down...but we need to get to the roof.

Original: Barret: What is that...?
Dialogue: What is that...?

Original: Aerith: Jenova.
Dialogue: Jenova.

Original: Sephiroth (flashback): Mother... Together we will reclaim our world.
Dialogue: Mother... Together we will reclaim our world.

Original: Tifa (flashback): I'msickof this! I'm sick of all of this!
Dialogue: I'm sick of this! I'm sick of all of this!

Original: Tifa: Cloud?
Dialogue: Cloud?

Original: Cloud: Tell me. Is it really you?
Dialogue: Tell me. Is it really you?

Original: Sephiroth: Don't deny me. Embrace me.
Dialogue: Don't deny me. Embrace me.

Original: Cloud: (screams)
Dialogue: (screams)

Original: Aerith: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Sephiroth: A touching reunion.
Dialogue: A touching reunion.

Original: Hojo: Very, very good! And thus is the hypothesis proven correct! I can only hope you will continuenotto disappoint. (laughs)
Dialogue: Very, very good! And thus is the hypothesis proven correct! I can only hope you will continue not to disappoint. (laughs)

Original: Cloud: I'd better hurry.
Dialogue: I'd better hurry.

Original: On-screen: Classified Research - The Drum
Dialogue: Classified Research - The Drum

Original: Cloud: Test subject pods? Guess I can use these.
Dialogue: Test subject pods? Guess I can use these.

Original: Red XIII: Need a hand?
Dialogue: Need a hand?

Original: Cloud: Thanks.
Dialogue: Thanks.

Original: Red XIII: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. Where're the others?
Dialogue: Yeah. Where're the others?

Original: Red XIII: Nowhere close.
Dialogue: Nowhere close.

Original: Cloud: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Red XIII: What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: Cloud: If we flip that switch, we can get to the other side.
Dialogue: If we flip that switch, we can get to the other side.

Original: Red XIII: Hm. I may be able to do that.
Dialogue: Hm. I may be able to do that.

Original: Cloud: You sure?
Dialogue: You sure?

Original: Red XIII: Yes.
Dialogue: Yes.

Original: Red XIII: Will this do the trick?
Dialogue: Will this do the trick?

Original: On-screen: The Drum - 1st Ward
Dialogue: The Drum - 1st Ward

Original: Barret: What kind of freak show have they got going on in here?
Dialogue: What kind of freak show have they got going on in here?

Original: Barret: Stay back!
Dialogue: Stay back!

Original: Cloud: Need hand?
Dialogue: Need hand?

Original: Barret: Yeah, right! Just having a little bit of fun with them, that's all.
Dialogue: Yeah, right! Just having a little bit of fun with them, that's all.

Original: Cloud: For how long?
Dialogue: For how long?

Original: Barret: Long as it took you to get here?
Dialogue: Long as it took you to get here?

Original: Barret: Shit, it's like they're churning out monsters here.
Dialogue: Shit, it's like they're churning out monsters here.

Original: Red XIII: That's not far from the truth.
Dialogue: That's not far from the truth.

Original: Barret: Hey... You okay?
Dialogue: Hey... You okay?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. I'm fine...
Dialogue: Yeah. I'm fine...

Original: Barret: If you say so.
Dialogue: If you say so.

Original: Cloud: Guess we're out.
Dialogue: Guess we're out.

Original: Red XIII: What's the plan?
Dialogue: What's the plan?

Original: Barret: First, we find Tifa and Aerith. Then we head for the roof. Should be an elevator somewhere. Didn't expect any of this, but we just gotta roll with it. Come on, let's go.
Dialogue: First, we find Tifa and Aerith. Then we head for the roof. Should be an elevator somewhere. Didn't expect any of this, but we just gotta roll with it. Come on, let's go.

Original: Barret: All right. Now you're starting to impress me.
Dialogue: All right. Now you're starting to impress me.

Original: Aerith: We got 'em!
Dialogue: We got 'em!

Original: Barret: Yeah! Keep it up, y'all!
Dialogue: Yeah! Keep it up, y'all!

Original: Aerith: Don't move an inch! We'll head down too. Be right there!
Dialogue: Don't move an inch! We'll head down too. Be right there!

Original: Barret: Huh? I can't hear what you're saying!
Dialogue: Huh? I can't hear what you're saying!

Original: Red XIII: I think there's something over there.
Dialogue: I think there's something over there.

Original: Red XIII: Now it's my turn.
Dialogue: Now it's my turn.

Original: Red XIII: There's no control panel. We don't have the means to go this way.
Dialogue: There's no control panel. We don't have the means to go this way.

Original: Tifa: Hello? Cloud? Can you hear me?
Dialogue: Hello? Cloud? Can you hear me?

Original: Cloud: Yeah. You okay in there?
Dialogue: Yeah. You okay in there?

Original: Tifa: No need to worry. We're fine, but what do we do now? I don't see any way out of this room.
Dialogue: No need to worry. We're fine, but what do we do now? I don't see any way out of this room.

Original: Hojo: Ahem. Can you all hear me?
Dialogue: Ahem. Can you all hear me?

Original: Red XIII: Hojo.
Dialogue: Hojo.

Original: Hojo: (laughs) So tell me. How are you finding the Drum? You know it's filled with the most advanced technology in Midgar, if not the entire world. You should feel honored to see it firsthand! You'll also have the opportunity to take part in a rather ambitious experiment of mine.
Dialogue: (laughs) So tell me. How are you finding the Drum? You know it's filled with the most advanced technology in Midgar, if not the entire world. You should feel honored to see it firsthand! You'll also have the opportunity to take part in a rather ambitious experiment of mine.

Original: Barret: What!?
Dialogue: What!?

Original: Hojo: When all the pieces are in place, I will open the door to the 3rd ward. Perhaps you can help me with the necessary preparations? Given that you're already in the perfect position to do so. I look forward to data both invaluable and instrumental.
Dialogue: When all the pieces are in place, I will open the door to the 3rd ward. Perhaps you can help me with the necessary preparations? Given that you're already in the perfect position to do so. I look forward to data both invaluable and instrumental.

Original: Barret: "Necessary preparations"? What the hell is this asshole talking about?
Dialogue: "Necessary preparations"? What the hell is this asshole talking about?

Original: Tifa: Can't we just ignore him and keep going?
Dialogue: Can't we just ignore him and keep going?

Original: Red XIII: I'm afraid not. If I know Hojo, he won't let us out until we indulge his request for data.
Dialogue: I'm afraid not. If I know Hojo, he won't let us out until we indulge his request for data.

Original: Tifa: He said something about a ward, right? I'm pretty sure I saw a door to one upstairs somewhere.
Dialogue: He said something about a ward, right? I'm pretty sure I saw a door to one upstairs somewhere.

Original: Aerith: So...you wanna check it out?
Dialogue: So...you wanna check it out?

Original: On-screen: Switch parties?
Dialogue: Switch parties?

Original: Cloud: You two'll be on your own. Be careful.
Dialogue: You two'll be on your own. Be careful.

Original: Tifa: Thanks. We will.
Dialogue: Thanks. We will.

Original: Barret: We'll be waiting right here. If anything happensanything at allyou call us. All right?
Dialogue: We'll be waiting right here. If anything happens—anything at all—you call us. All right?

Original: Aerith: Roger that!
Dialogue: Roger that!

Original: Tifa: Hey, you think Cloud's doing okay? He's been acting really weird latelymore than usual.
Dialogue: Hey, you think Cloud's doing okay? He's been acting really weird lately—more than usual.

Original: Aerith: True, but it's CloudI'm sure he'll be fine. But what about you, Tifa? How are you holding up?
Dialogue: True, but it's Cloud—I'm sure he'll be fine. But what about you, Tifa? How are you holding up?

Original: Tifa: Huh? Oh (chuckles) I'm fine!
Dialogue: Huh? Oh (chuckles) I'm fine!

Original: Tifa: I guess this has to be the 3rd ward, right?
Dialogue: I guess this has to be the 3rd ward, right?

Original: Aerith: Think so. But it looks like the door's locked.
Dialogue: Think so. But it looks like the door's locked.

Original: Tifa: There has to be something we can do. Let's look around.
Dialogue: There has to be something we can do. Let's look around.

Original: Aerith: Gotcha.
Dialogue: Gotcha.

Original: Aerith: Look! Now they can get across too.
Dialogue: Look! Now they can get across too.

Original: Tifa: We should let Cloud know.
Dialogue: We should let Cloud know.

Original: Tifa: Cloud, can you hear me? We found the door to that ward he was talking about, but it's locked and we can't get it open.
Dialogue: Cloud, can you hear me? We found the door to that ward he was talking about, but it's locked and we can't get it open.

Original: Cloud: All right.
Dialogue: All right.

Original: Aerith: About those preparations Hojo mentioned before... I think we're supposed to do something with that.
Dialogue: About those preparations Hojo mentioned before... I think we're supposed to do something with that.

Original: Red XIII: The central terminal. Interesting.
Dialogue: The central terminal. Interesting.

Original: Aerith: We were fiddling with some sort of control panel. Do you see a way to get across now?
Dialogue: We were fiddling with some sort of control panel. Do you see a way to get across now?

Original: Cloud: All right. We'll make our way to the central terminal. Sit tight until you hear from us.
Dialogue: All right. We'll make our way to the central terminal. Sit tight until you hear from us.

Original: Barret: The hell kind of "research" is this?
Dialogue: The hell kind of "research" is this?

Original: Red XIII: The cataclysm that came from the starsJenova. Hojo has devoted half of his life to her study.
Dialogue: The cataclysm that came from the stars—Jenova. Hojo has devoted half of his life to her study.

Original: Barret: I don't give a shit about any of that.
Dialogue: I don't give a shit about any of that.

Original: Red XIII: The experiments in this facility...involve the enhancement of life-forms and machines through the application...of Jenova biological data. Hojo's plan is to pit his subjects against ust, thereby facilitating their growth.
Dialogue: The experiments in this facility...involve the enhancement of life-forms and machines through the application...of Jenova biological data. Hojo's plan is to pit his subjects against ust, thereby facilitating their growth.

Original: Barret: Hmph! So this asshole thinks he can treat us like his experiments.
Dialogue: Hmph! So this asshole thinks he can treat us like his experiments.

Original: Red XIII: I know what fate awaits these creations. Let us put them out of their misery.
Dialogue: I know what fate awaits these creations. Let us put them out of their misery.

Original: Red XIII: We must first find a passage that leads to the center.
Dialogue: We must first find a passage that leads to the center.

Original: Red XIII: Off I go.
Dialogue: Off I go.

Original: Red XIII: There's no control panel. We don't have the means to go this way.
Dialogue: There's no control panel. We don't have the means to go this way.

Original: Barret: Wait sec. Weren't the girls right by the door to the 3rd ward?
Dialogue: Wait sec. Weren't the girls right by the door to the 3rd ward?

Original: Red XIII: There are four switches. One for each ward.
Dialogue: There are four switches. One for each ward.

Original: Barret: What the?
Dialogue: What the—?

Original: Announcement: Transfusion procedure complete. Commencing test of augmented research specimen.
Dialogue: Transfusion procedure complete. Commencing test of augmented research specimen.

Original: Red XIII: You need to warn the others. Tell them to be careful. Very careful.
Dialogue: You need to warn the others. Tell them to be careful. Very careful.

Original: Cloud: Tifa, you there? We accessed the central terminal. The door should be unlocked now.
Dialogue: Tifa, you there? We accessed the central terminal. The door should be unlocked now.

Original: Cloud: Any one of Hojo's twisted creations could be in that ward. Be careful.
Dialogue: Any one of Hojo's twisted creations could be in that ward. Be careful.

Original: Tifa: We will. See you in a bit.
Dialogue: We will. See you in a bit.

Original: On-screen: The Drum - 3rd Ward
Dialogue: The Drum - 3rd Ward

Original: Tifa: Uh, what is this place for?
Dialogue: Uh, what is this place for?

Original: Aerith: There's a...sadness...
Dialogue: There's a...sadness...

Original: Aerith: Look.
Dialogue: Look.

Original: Tifa: Let's get across with those.
Dialogue: Let's get across with those.

Original: Aerith: That hurt. Did we wake 'em up?
Dialogue: That hurt. Did we wake 'em up?

Original: Tifa: Yeah, looks like it.
Dialogue: Yeah, looks like it.

Original: Tifa: Is this really the exit?
Dialogue: Is this really the exit?

Original: Aerith: I hate that man. I really do.
Dialogue: I hate that man. I really do.

Original: Tifa: You think now the others can get across too?
Dialogue: You think now the others can get across too?

Original: Tifa: Hey, Cloud?
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud?

Original: Cloud: Tifa?
Dialogue: Tifa?

Original: Tifa: We used the control panel here a little while ago, so you should be able to get to the other side. Can you check?
Dialogue: We used the control panel here a little while ago, so you should be able to get to the other side. Can you check?

Original: Barret: Roger that. Was gettin' pretty bored anyway.
Dialogue: Roger that. Was gettin' pretty bored anyway.

Original: Cloud: You two, stay there. We'll call if anything comes up.
Dialogue: You two, stay there. We'll call if anything comes up.

Original: Aerith: Okay. Be careful.
Dialogue: Okay. Be careful.

Original: Red XIII: We need to open the door first.
Dialogue: We need to open the door first.

Original: On-screen: The Drum - 2nd Ward
Dialogue: The Drum - 2nd Ward

Original: Red XIII: (sniffs) It stinks.
Dialogue: (sniffs) It stinks.

Original: Cloud: More of Hojo's experiments.
Dialogue: More of Hojo's experiments.

Original: Announcement: Commencing test. All personnel must evacuate area. Commencing test.
Dialogue: Commencing test. All personnel must evacuate area. Commencing test.

Original: Hojo: I hope you're enjoying your experience.
Dialogue: I hope you're enjoying your experience.

Original: Barret: Why don'tcha come down here and ask me?
Dialogue: Why don'tcha come down here and ask me?

Original: Hojo: Before you get any ideas, you should know this glass is bulletproof. No discernable changes after contact. Most fascinating. Hmm...
Dialogue: Before you get any ideas, you should know this glass is bulletproof. No discernable changes after contact. Most fascinating. Hmm...

Original: Barret: Hey! We ain't done yet!
Dialogue: Hey! We ain't done yet!

Original: Red XIII: It seems we have no choice.
Dialogue: It seems we have no choice.

Original: Barret: How'd ya like watchin' your precious toys get torn to shreds!?
Dialogue: How'd ya like watchin' your precious toys get torn to shreds!?

Original: Hojo: I never grow tired of watching my toys be broken, no matter how many times I've seen it happen. Such is the case when you truly enjoy your work. Now, for the next step...
Dialogue: I never grow tired of watching my toys be broken, no matter how many times I've seen it happen. Such is the case when you truly enjoy your work. Now, for the next step...

Original: Barret: Look! Now's our chance to kill the bastard! Time for you to pay the piper!
Dialogue: Look! Now's our chance to kill the bastard! Time for you to pay the piper!

Original: Hojo: Hmph. They never learn.
Dialogue: Hmph. They never learn.

Original: Announcement: Commencing test. All personnel must evacuate area. Commencing test.
Dialogue: Commencing test. All personnel must evacuate area. Commencing test.

Original: Hojo: (laughs) Be a good boy and keep the other pets company. (laughs)
Dialogue: (laughs) Be a good boy and keep the other pets company. (laughs)

Original: Barret: Shit. Looks like Red might need our help up there!
Dialogue: Shit. Looks like Red might need our help up there!

Original: Barret: C'mon! We're going!
Dialogue: C'mon! We're going!

Original: Barret: Get outta here!
Dialogue: Get outta here!

Original: Barret: What was that thing?
Dialogue: What was that thing?

Original: Cloud: Where's Hojo?
Dialogue: Where's Hojo?

Original: Red XIII: Sorry. He got away.
Dialogue: Sorry. He got away.

Original: Cloud: Forget about him for now.
Dialogue: Forget about him for now.

Original: Barret: Remind me. This ain't a hospital, is it?
Dialogue: Remind me. This ain't a hospital, is it?

Original: Red XIII: Test subjects don't receive treatment.
Dialogue: Test subjects don't receive treatment.

Original: Cloud: They're enhanced...or dissected.
Dialogue: They're enhanced...or dissected.

Original: Barret: This guy's a real piece of work...
Dialogue: This guy's a real piece of work...

Original: Barret: Now what!?
Dialogue: Now what!?

Original: Barret: Hey, let us out!
Dialogue: Hey, let us out!

Original: Barret: I remember you!
Dialogue: I remember you!

Original: Red XIII: And he remembers us, I think.
Dialogue: And he remembers us, I think.

Original: Barret: Fine! One step at a time it is.
Dialogue: Fine! One step at a time it is.

Original: Red XIII: I don't see any elevators around here.
Dialogue: I don't see any elevators around here.

Original: Cloud: I'll let Tifa and Aerith know.
Dialogue: I'll let Tifa and Aerith know.
