Original: Barret: Huh, whaddya know. That's the door to the 4th ward.
Dialogue: Huh, whaddya know. That's the door to the 4th ward.

Original: Red XIII: If we want to get in, we'll need to go all the way back to the central terminal.
Dialogue: If we want to get in, we'll need to go all the way back to the central terminal.

Original: Barret: But the door we used to get here is shut. So what now?
Dialogue: But the door we used to get here is shut. So what now?

Original: Cloud: The passages have to be connected somehow.
Dialogue: The passages have to be connected somehow.

Original: Cloud: Please.
Dialogue: Please.

Original: Barret: It's a PHS terminal. Call up Tifa, see if they can get to the central terminal.
Dialogue: It's a PHS terminal. Call up Tifa, see if they can get to the central terminal.

Original: Barret: Hey! You okay down there?
Dialogue: Hey! You okay down there?

Original: Red XIII: Dammit!
Dialogue: Dammit!

Original: Cloud: Red!
Dialogue: Red!

Original: Barret: Shit! He can't hold them off forever!
Dialogue: Shit! He can't hold them off forever!

Original: Barret: You should call Tifa.
Dialogue: You should call Tifa.

Original: Cloud: Right. On it.
Dialogue: Right. On it.

Original: Cloud: Tifa, you there?
Dialogue: Tifa, you there?

Original: Tifa: Is something wrong?
Dialogue: Is something wrong?

Original: Cloud: Red fell to your level. Can you try to get to him?
Dialogue: Red fell to your level. Can you try to get to him?

Original: Aerith: Oh, no!
Dialogue: Oh, no!

Original: Tifa: Come on!
Dialogue: Come on!

Original: Aerith: Sorry for the wait!
Dialogue: Sorry for the wait!

Original: Tifa: Now, let's get this over with!
Dialogue: Now, let's get this over with!

Original: Tifa: Let's finish this!
Dialogue: Let's finish this!

Original: Tifa: You okay?
Dialogue: You okay?

Original: Red XIII: I am now.
Dialogue: I am now.

Original: Barret: Nice one!
Dialogue: Nice one!

Original: Tifa: Have Cloud and Barret found anything?
Dialogue: Have Cloud and Barret found anything?

Original: Red XIII: Actually, they just found the entrance to the 4th ward. But to unlock it, they have to access the central terminalwhich they cannot do from their position.
Dialogue: Actually, they just found the entrance to the 4th ward. But to unlock it, they have to access the central terminal—which they cannot do from their position.

Original: Aerith: Maybe we can get to it instead.
Dialogue: Maybe we can get to it instead.

Original: Tifa: Yeah, let's try.
Dialogue: Yeah, let's try.

Original: Red XIII: Now it's my turn.
Dialogue: Now it's my turn.

Original: Aerith: Look! An elevator!
Dialogue: Look! An elevator!

Original: Aerith: ...And it's not moving.
Dialogue: ...And it's not moving.

Original: Red XIII: The professor still has plans for us, I presume.
Dialogue: The professor still has plans for us, I presume.

Original: Aerith: For the record, I don't like this one bit.
Dialogue: For the record, I don't like this one bit.

Original: Red XIII: All that remains is the 4th ward. We must trust in Cloud and Barret to see it through.
Dialogue: All that remains is the 4th ward. We must trust in Cloud and Barret to see it through.

Original: Tifa: This was a good idea...right?
Dialogue: This was a good idea...right?

Original: Aerith: Yep! Let's go give the others the news.
Dialogue: Yep! Let's go give the others the news.

Original: Cloud: That you?
Dialogue: That you?

Original: Tifa: Yeah. We found an elevator on our side.
Dialogue: Yeah. We found an elevator on our side.

Original: Cloud: Good. Glad to hear it.
Dialogue: Good. Glad to hear it.

Original: Tifa: But...we can't use it for some reason.
Dialogue: But...we can't use it for some reason.

Original: Aerith: Hojo did something. I know it.
Dialogue: Hojo did something. I know it.

Original: Red XIII: There's only one thing we can do. We need to head to the 4th ward, just like he wants.
Dialogue: There's only one thing we can do. We need to head to the 4th ward, just like he wants.

Original: Tifa: We unlocked it on our side. You should be able to get in.
Dialogue: We unlocked it on our side. You should be able to get in.

Original: Cloud: Thanks. Wait for us there.
Dialogue: Thanks. Wait for us there.

Original: Barret: Right. Now we head back to that door.
Dialogue: Right. Now we head back to that door.

Original: On-screen: The Drum - 4th Ward
Dialogue: The Drum - 4th Ward

Original: Barret: We, uh, made Wedge wait a while to be rescued.
Dialogue: We, uh, made Wedge wait a while to be rescued.

Original: Cloud: Guess so.
Dialogue: Guess so.

Original: Barret: You know, he really likes you.
Dialogue: You know, he really likes you.

Original: Cloud: Maybe.
Dialogue: Maybe.

Original: Barret: Friendly guy, but he has a hard time opening up to people.
Dialogue: Friendly guy, but he has a hard time opening up to people.

Original: Cloud: Well...that makes two of us.
Dialogue: Well...that makes two of us.

Original: Barret: He's got your back, though. Heh...makes two of us.
Dialogue: He's got your back, though. Heh...makes two of us.

Original: \Barret: Huh. You hear that?
Dialogue: Huh. You hear that?

Original: Cloud: Run!
Dialogue: Run!

Original: Barret: Flyin' fishbot here's trying to turn us into mincemeat!
Dialogue: Flyin' fishbot here's trying to turn us into mincemeat!

Original: Barret: It's outta control!
Dialogue: It's outta control!

Original: Cloud: Dammit!
Dialogue: Dammit!

Original: Tifa: What the!?
Dialogue: What the—!?

Original: Aerith: I think it's coming this way!
Dialogue: I think it's coming this way!

Original: Aerith: That's enough.
Dialogue: That's enough.

Original: Hojo: Again you triumph! (laughs) I'd be disappointed if you didn't! Yes... I believe I have just about all the data that I require. Then we are ready to proceed to the next stage.
Dialogue: Again you triumph! (laughs) I'd be disappointed if you didn't! Yes... I believe I have just about all the data that I require. Then we are ready to proceed to the next stage.

Original: Aerith: Yes! We got it to work.
Dialogue: Yes! We got it to work.

Original: Tifa: Could this be a trap?
Dialogue: Could this be a trap?

Original: Aerith: Don't worry. The elevators are safe.
Dialogue: Don't worry. The elevators are safe.

Original: Tifa: All right. If you say so.
Dialogue: All right. If you say so.

Original: Tifa: Huh? Are we there already?
Dialogue: Huh? Are we there already?

Original: Aerith: No, something tells me that we aren't. Call it a hunch.
Dialogue: No, something tells me that we aren't. Call it a hunch.

Original: Red XIII: I hear something.
Dialogue: I hear something.

Original: Barret: We don't have all day, you know.
Dialogue: We don't have all day, you know.

Original: Tifa: I think it might be locked from this side.
Dialogue: I think it might be locked from this side.

Original: Aerith: Should we open it up then?
Dialogue: Should we open it up then?

Original: Barret: Uh... Cloud...
Dialogue: Uh... Cloud...

Original: Aerith: Heya, guys!
Dialogue: Heya, guys!

Original: Barret: Oh...hey. Band's back together. Past time we got outta here and made our way to the roof.
Dialogue: Oh...hey. Band's back together. Past time we got outta here and made our way to the roof.

Original: Red XIII: There's an elevator just over there. But it will move only at Hojo's discretion.
Dialogue: There's an elevator just over there. But it will move only at Hojo's discretion.

Original: Tifa: Well, okay then. Looks like the elevator's working.
Dialogue: Well, okay then. Looks like the elevator's working.

Original: Red XIII: It appears Hojo's done having his fun.
Dialogue: It appears Hojo's done having his fun.

Original: Barret: (laughs) Glad to hear he enjoyed the show.
Dialogue: (laughs) Glad to hear he enjoyed the show.

Original: Tifa: We're back...again.
Dialogue: We're back...again.

Original: Cloud: Yeah.
Dialogue: Yeah.

Original: Barret: Hey.
Dialogue: Hey.

Original: Barret: What the hell's going on?
Dialogue: What the hell's going on?

Original: Tifa: Who would...?
Dialogue: Who would...?

Original: Red XIII: We may find out soon.
Dialogue: We may find out soon.

Original: Cloud: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Barret: So what's above this floor?
Dialogue: So what's above this floor?

Original: Red XIII: The president's office. And then the roof.
Dialogue: The president's office. And then the roof.

Original: Aerith: Wait. Once we get in that elevator, there's no turning back.
Dialogue: Wait. Once we get in that elevator, there's no turning back.

Original: Tifa: We're ready...right?
Dialogue: We're ready...right?

Original: Cloud: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Red XIII: The elevator back there can take us down to the central terminal again. Now's the time for any unfinished business.
Dialogue: The elevator back there can take us down to the central terminal again. Now's the time for any unfinished business.

Original: On-screen: Head for the roof?
Dialogue: Head for the roof?

Original: Cloud: I'm ready to do this. Let's go.
Dialogue: I'm ready to do this. Let's go.

Original: On-screen;: 69th Floor - Executive Suite
Dialogue: 69th Floor - Executive Suite

Original: On-screen: 70th Floor - President's Office
Dialogue: 70th Floor - President's Office

Original: Barret: Where the hell is that bastard hiding?
Dialogue: Where the hell is that bastard hiding?

Original: Tifa: And Sephiroth?
Dialogue: And Sephiroth?

Original: Red XIII: Wait. I can hear something.
Dialogue: Wait. I can hear something.

Original: President Shinra: Help me...
Dialogue: Help me...

Original: Barret: Well, well, well...
Dialogue: Well, well, well...

Original: President Shinra: Pull me up! I'll give you all the money you want! I have gil! Plenty of it!
Dialogue: Pull me up! I'll give you all the money you want! I have gil! Plenty of it!

Original: Barret: Thing is, I don't want your money.
Dialogue: Thing is, I don't want your money.

Original: President Shinra: Please!
Dialogue: Please!

Original: President Shinra: Just let me live. Everything you want can be yours.
Dialogue: Just let me live. Everything you want can be yours.

Original: Barret: I'm a man of modest dreams. Dropping you from seventy stories up would get me damn near to good.
Dialogue: I'm a man of modest dreams. Dropping you from seventy stories up would get me damn near to good.

Original: President Shinra: But not all the way. You want somethingmore, don't you!?
Dialogue: But not all the way. You want something more, don't you!?

Original: Barret: More than this right here? Talk to me again like you know me.
Dialogue: More than this right here? Talk to me again like you know me.

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Aerith: Stop it!
Dialogue: Stop it!

Original: Barret: You're gonna get on TV and tell 'em. Tell 'em what you did to Sector 7that it was you who killed all those people! Then, you're gonna tell them the truth about Avalanche. That Avalanche ain't Wutai or anybody's puppet! That Avaalnche fights for the peoplethe planet! That we fight to hold Shinra to account for its crimes! That is Avalanche! The filthy sewer rats...who brought down a goliath! You tell 'em that.
Dialogue: You're gonna get on TV and tell 'em. Tell 'em what you did to Sector 7—that it was you who killed all those people! Then, you're gonna tell them the truth about Avalanche. That Avalanche ain't Wutai or anybody's puppet! That Avaalnche fights for the people—the planet! That we fight to hold Shinra to account for its crimes! That is Avalanche! The filthy sewer rats...who brought down a goliath! You tell 'em that.

Original: President Shinra: Is that really all you want? For your names to be cleared? Hmph. That is what matters most to you? More than shutting down the reactors? Than the future of the planet itself?
Dialogue: Is that really all you want? For your names to be cleared? Hmph. That is what matters most to you? More than shutting down the reactors? Than the future of the planet itself?

Original: Barret: Huh? Damn.
Dialogue: Huh? Damn.

Original: President Shinra: You're lying to yourself, even now. Truth...justice, honor, freedom! Vain indulgences, every one. Picture it! Picture a world without Shinra. Without mako energy. A stagnant, impotent world. Now picture a natural disaster. Who would help the people? Help the recover and rebuild? You? With their old would ruined, will they thank you for the new? I'm going to give you a chance. One last opportunity to consider what your principles are truly worth. But bear in mind that time is of the essence.
Dialogue: You're lying to yourself, even now. Truth...justice, honor, freedom! Vain indulgences, every one. Picture it! Picture a world without Shinra. Without mako energy. A stagnant, impotent world. Now picture a natural disaster. Who would help the people? Help the recover and rebuild? You? With their old would ruined, will they thank you for the new? I'm going to give you a chance. One last opportunity to consider what your principles are truly worth. But bear in mind that time is of the essence.

Original: Barret: And what about you Mister President. What are your vaunted principles?
Dialogue: And what about you Mister President. What are your vaunted principles?

Original: President Shinra: What principles!? Did you understand even a single word of what I told you? I know what I want, and I take it. I take advantage of whatever I can, and discard that which I cannot. There is no room for sentiment or guilt.
Dialogue: What principles!? Did you understand even a single word of what I told you? I know what I want, and I take it. I take advantage of whatever I can, and discard that which I cannot. There is no room for sentiment or guilt.

Original: Barret: You son of a bitch!
Dialogue: You son of a bitch!

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Red XIII: This is...
Dialogue: This is...

Original: Aerith: The source. Of everything.
Dialogue: The source. Of everything.

Original: Tifa: What's happening!?
Dialogue: What's happening!?

Original: Red XIII: It's an illusion. Stay calm.
Dialogue: It's an illusion. Stay calm.

Dialogue: You okay?

Dialogue: HQ, this is Avalanche 3-1. Making another pass to search for friendlies.

Dialogue: Barret! Are you hurt!?

Dialogue: Don't think so.

Dialogue: This death was not the one ordained for you by fate.

Dialogue: Thanks.

Dialogue: Sephiroth!

Dialogue: Everyone okay?

Dialogue: Hey. Get your man?

Dialogue: He got away.

Dialogue: Huh. 'Bout time we made our escape too.

Dialogue: Shit.

Dialogue: Sure you wanna do this personally, boss?

Dialogue: If it ain't Rufus Shinra. Heir to the throne himself.

Dialogue: Yep.

Dialogue: Stop.

Dialogue: Huh!? The hell I will! We can finish off the family here and now!

Dialogue: Take Aerith and get outta here.

Dialogue: I'll buy you guys some time.

Dialogue: I could stay here—back you up.

Dialogue: Barret...I'm asking you. Please.

Dialogue: Fine. Have it your way then. But you better be right behind us.

Dialogue: You're a SOLDIER, aren't you? Which, of course, would mean that I own you.

Dialogue: Ex-SOLDIER. I quit.

Dialogue: Secure the others. Just the two of us. Well. Maybe three.

Dialogue: Let's get this over with.

Original: Rufus: Don't say that.
Dialogue: Don't say that.

Dialogue: Hmph. Not bad.

Dialogue: Okay.

Dialogue: This is control. Hostile air units sighted. Redirect to engage.

Dialogue: Understood.

Dialogue: Think you got my number?

Dialogue: Not at all. You're making me sweat. Good thing I came prepared.

Original: Cloud: That's a new trick.
Dialogue: That's a new trick.

Original: Rufus: Like it? 'Course you do.
Dialogue: Like it? 'Course you do.

Original: Cloud: Now it's just the two of us.
Dialogue: Now it's just the two of us.

Original: Rufus: Let's make it a night to remember.
Dialogue: Let's make it a night to remember.

Original: Cloud: It's on for real now?
Dialogue: It's on for real now?

Original: Rufus: Yeah. You should be honored.
Dialogue: Yeah. You should be honored.

Original: Cloud: I could end thishere and now.
Dialogue: I could end this—here and now.

Original: Rufus: No, not quite. Tonight marks a new beginning for Shinra!
Dialogue: No, not quite. Tonight marks a new beginning for Shinra!

Dialogue: You gotta be better than this...if you're gonna play the hero.

Original: Red XIII: Think they can manage on their own?
Dialogue: Think they can manage on their own?

Original: Barret: You've seen the both in action. You know they can. Besides
Dialogue: You've seen the both in action. You know they can. Besides—

Original: Barret: What was that!?
Dialogue: What was that!?

Dialogue: Gotta believe they made it out.

Dialogue: I hope so.

Dialogue: Dammit!

Original: Red XIII: Hey.
Dialogue: Hey.

Original: Barret: Screw itwe gotta go back!
Dialogue: Screw it—we gotta go back!

Original: Red XIII: Hey!
Dialogue: Hey!

Dialogue: What, Red!?

Original: Barret: Get down!
Dialogue: Get down!

Dialogue: 64th Floor - Conference Rooms

Dialogue: We're cool. Everything's cool.

Dialogue: Barret!

Dialogue: Not again!

Dialogue: You can't stop me! For Bigggs... For Jessie... Tifa...and Barret too! I'm sorry, Cloud... (screams)

Dialogue: Just...tell me that—that I made a difference...

Dialogue: 59th Floor - Skyview Hall

Dialogue: Hey. Still in one piece?

Dialogue: Yeah. Somehow.

Dialogue: Oh, you gotta be kidding me!

Dialogue: 58th Floor - Skyview Atrium

Dialogue: Okay, you asked for it, mech! Open wide! And suck on this!

Dialogue: Get ready.

Dialogue: I was born ready, Red.

Dialogue: Barrier drones damaged. Overriding main cannon safety protocols.

Dialogue: Threat level critical.

Dialogue: Now! Its right arm!

Dialogue: Defensive systems compromised. Threat level elevated.

Dialogue: Threat level critical.

Dialogue: We piss it off?

Dialogue: This doesn't look good!

Dialogue: Any ideas!?

Dialogue: Take cover behind debris!

Dialogue: They all just...flew off.

Dialogue: If more come, we're done.

Dialogue: Then let's finish this quick.

Dialogue: Not this again!

Dialogue: We can't hide! What do we do!?

Dialogue: Stop its attack!

Dialogue: Damn, does it feel good to be alive!

Dialogue: Quite. But we could still die later tonight. Cloud and Tifa could be dead already.

Dialogue: The hell they are!

Original: Red XIII: Then we need to find a way we can all escapeand quickly.
Dialogue: Then we need to find a way we can all escape—and quickly.

Dialogue: You're right. Let's go.

Dialogue: All we gotta do now is find the others.

Dialogue: We have them surrounded, sir.

Dialogue: Yes...I can see that. It was only a matter of time. And here we are. (laughs) So then—what is this ragtag group of misfits I see before me?

Dialogue: And where are the rest of you?

Dialogue: Up your ass.

Dialogue: Hm. Charming. Though not what I would've chosen as my last words. Secure the Ancient, but feel free to kill both the idiot and the dog.

Dialogue: Aerith. You saved my Marlene. Now...it's time I returned the favor.

Dialogue: Stop, them you fools! Don't let them escape!

Dialogue: Let's roll.

Dialogue: Why's he always gotta— Whoa! Shit.

Dialogue: Home free, Red!

Dialogue: Man, you need to lighten up. Hell, you might even try smiling.

Dialogue: On second thought...maybe frowning suits you better. Hey, don't pout!

Dialogue: Whoa! Are you guys seeing this!?

Dialogue: The men are on standby, sir. Your orders?

Dialogue: It's like the whole damn building's made of 'em.

Dialogue: I don't understand. What are they doing?

Dialogue: This, we don't need.

Dialogue: Time to go!

Dialogue: They're gainin' on us! C'mon, step on it!

Dialogue: I'm trying, but it won't go any faster!

Dialogue: How the hell'd we get saddled with this junker!?

Dialogue: Give it up! There's nowhere to run!

Dialogue: No...dammit...

Dialogue: Pull over right now! We will use lethal force to make you comply!

Dialogue: Stubborn bastards!

Dialogue: Look!

Dialogue: That chopper is all mine! I'll bring it down real quick!

Dialogue: (laughs) Try catching us now, ya bastards!

Dialogue: I hate to spoil the celebration, but...there's more.

Dialogue: What the—!?

Dialogue: Cloud! Keep your guard up!

Dialogue: That's it! Now seize the opening and attack!

Dialogue: Ha ha ha! How do you like that!?

Dialogue: Shit! We got incoming! I'll take the chopper! The bikes are all yours, Cloud!

Dialogue: We've got 'em! Engaging targets!

Dialogue: So now...they're on our side?

Dialogue: Oh no, don't you dare!

Dialogue: Hey!

Dialogue: I don't want any trouble!

Dialogue: Time to meet your maker!

Dialogue: Okay, y'all! Let's finish him off! C'mon!

Dialogue: Cloud!

Dialogue: Nice!

Dialogue: End of the Road

Original: Barret: Okay, asshole, let's
Dialogue: Okay, asshole, let's—

Original: Aerith: Don't.
Dialogue: Don't.

Original: Aerith: And you... You'rewrong.
Dialogue: And you... You're wrong.

Dialogue: Those who look with clouded eyes see nothing but shadows.

Original: Aerith: Everything about you iswrong.
Dialogue: Everything about you is wrong.

Dialogue: All born are bound to her. Should this world be unmade, so too shall her children.

Dialogue: The world won't end today. But you... You will.

Dialogue: Listen.

Original: Sephiroth: Destiny come.
Dialogue: Destiny come.

Original: Zack: We drag our asses all this way...and this is the welcome we get.
Dialogue: We drag our asses all this way...and this is the welcome we get.

Original: Zack: Boy, oh boy... The price of freedom is steep.
Dialogue: Boy, oh boy... The price of freedom is steep.

Original: Zack: Embrace your dreams. And, whatever happens... Protect your honor...as a SOLDIER! Come and get it!
Dialogue: Embrace your dreams. And, whatever happens... Protect your honor...as a SOLDIER! Come and get it!

Original: Sephiroth: I'm waiting, Cloud.
Dialogue: I'm waiting, Cloud.

Original: Aerith: This is the point of no return.
Dialogue: This is the point of no return.

Original: Aerith: Destiny's crossroads.
Dialogue: Destiny's crossroads.

Original: Cloud: Then why did you stop me?
Dialogue: Then why did you stop me?

Original: Aerith: I'm not really sure.
Dialogue: I'm not really sure.

Original: Tifa: What will we find on the other side?
Dialogue: What will we find on the other side?

Original: Aerith: Freedom. Boundless, terrifying freedom. Like a great, never-ending sky. What you heard just now were the voices of the planet. Those born into this world. Who lived and who died. Who returned. They're howling in pain.
Dialogue: Freedom. Boundless, terrifying freedom. Like a great, never-ending sky. What you heard just now were the voices of the planet. Those born into this world. Who lived and who died. Who returned. They're howling in pain.

Original: Cloud: Because of him? Sephiroth?
Dialogue: Because of him? Sephiroth?

Original: Aerith: They... Their words...they don't reach him. All these moments and memories, precious and fleeting...they're like rain rolling off his back... And when they're gone, he won't cry...or shout...or anything. He'd tell you that he only cares about the planet. That he'd do everything in his power to protect and preserve it. But this isn't the way it's supposed to be. There's no greater threat to the planet than him. Sephiroth has to be stopped. He has to be. And that's why... I'm asking you to help me. I know that together, we can do this. But if we do... We'll be changing more than fate itself. If we succeed...if we win...we'll be changing ourselves... I guess...maybe, that's why I hesitated.
Dialogue: They... Their words...they don't reach him. All these moments and memories, precious and fleeting...they're like rain rolling off his back... And when they're gone, he won't cry...or shout...or anything. He'd tell you that he only cares about the planet. That he'd do everything in his power to protect and preserve it. But this isn't the way it's supposed to be. There's no greater threat to the planet than him. Sephiroth has to be stopped. He has to be. And that's why... I'm asking you to help me. I know that together, we can do this. But if we do... We'll be changing more than fate itself. If we succeed...if we win...we'll be changing ourselves... I guess...maybe, that's why I hesitated.

Original: Cloud: You said it yourself. He has to be stopped. And frankly, I've heard enough howling for a lifetime.
Dialogue: You said it yourself. He has to be stopped. And frankly, I've heard enough howling for a lifetime.

Dialogue: Ready?

Original: On-screen: Ready?
Dialogue: Ready?

Dialogue: Never tried to challenge destiny.

Dialogue: This could well be her last line of defense. It won't be easy.

Dialogue: Let's go.

Dialogue: Wouldn't be the first time I spit in destiny's eye. Whether you can see the seams or you can't...doesn't change that she's always trying to have it her way.

Dialogue: Daddy's coming home real soon, honey!

Dialogue: Aerith!

Dialogue: Right!

Original: Aerith: We can do thistogether!
Dialogue: We can do this—together!

Original: Aerith: Barret, we're counting on you!
Dialogue: Barret, we're counting on you!

Original: Barret: Ain't no stoppin' us now!
Dialogue: Ain't no stoppin' us now!

Original: Barret: Gotcha!
Dialogue: Gotcha!

Original: Aerith: Red, you're up!
Dialogue: Red, you're up!

Original: Barret: I'm gonna show you what Avalanche is made of!
Dialogue: I'm gonna show you what Avalanche is made of!

Original: Tifa: Barret, go for it!
Dialogue: Barret, go for it!

Original: Red XIII: I decide my destiny.
Dialogue: I decide my destiny.

Original: Aerith: We did it!
Dialogue: We did it!

Original: Tifa: Right.
Dialogue: Right.

Original: Cloud: Where are we?
Dialogue: Where are we?

Original: Sephiroth: I'm waiting, Cloud.
Dialogue: I'm waiting, Cloud.

Original: Barret: What the hell is this!?
Dialogue: What the hell is this!?

Original: Red XIII: This is
Dialogue: This is—

Original: Cloud: Sephiroth...
Dialogue: Sephiroth...

Original: Cloud: Let's finish this.
Dialogue: Let's finish this.

Original: Sephiroth: Fate is not to be taken lightly, Cloud.
Dialogue: Fate is not to be taken lightly, Cloud.

Original: Cloud: Shut up!
Dialogue: Shut up!

Original: Tifa: Need some help?
Dialogue: Need some help?

Original: Cloud: Don't know about need... Good to go?
Dialogue: Don't know about need... Good to go?

Original: Tifa: You know it!
Dialogue: You know it!

Original: Aerith: Did you miss me?
Dialogue: Did you miss me?

Original: Cloud: Not really. He's tough.
Dialogue: Not really. He's tough.

Original: Aerith: Yeah, so what? Screw him.
Dialogue: Yeah, so what? Screw him.

Original: Aerith: Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa!

Original: Tifa: What'd I miss?
Dialogue: What'd I miss?

Original: Tifa: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Aerith: Sorry I'm late!
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late!

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: Ain't you two havin' fun!
Dialogue: Ain't you two havin' fun!

Original: Aerith: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Barret: Better late than never!
Dialogue: Better late than never!

Original: Cloud: Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Tifa: Barret!
Dialogue: Barret!

Original: Aerith: Welcome back.
Dialogue: Welcome back.

Original: Barret: We get him!?
Dialogue: We get him!?

Original: Aerith: Tifa!
Dialogue: Tifa!

Original: Barret: 'Bout time you showed!
Dialogue: Bout time you showed!

Original: Barret: We get him!?
Dialogue: We get him!?

Original: Tifa: Aerith!
Dialogue: Aerith!

Original: Barret: 'Bout time you showed!
Dialogue: Bout time you showed!

Original: Aerith: We can do this. We can. We can change itmake it right!
Dialogue: We can do this. We can. We can change it—make it right!

Original: Aerith & Tifa: Cloud!
Dialogue: Cloud!

Original: Barret: Go!
Dialogue: Go!

Original: Sephiroth: Careful now. That which lies ahead...does not yet exist.
Dialogue: Careful now. That which lies ahead...does not yet exist.

Original: Sephiroth: Our world will become a part of it...one day. But I...will not end. Nor will I have you end.
Dialogue: Our world will become a part of it...one day. But I...will not end. Nor will I have you end.

Original: Cloud: This is...?
Dialogue: This is...?

Original: Sephiroth: The edge of creation. Cloud, lend me your strength. Let us defy destiny...together.
Dialogue: The edge of creation. Cloud, lend me your strength. Let us defy destiny...together.

Original: Cloud: Never.
Dialogue: Never.

Original: Sephiroth: Not yet. Seven seconds till the end. Time enough for you. Perhaps. But what will you do with it? Let's see.
Dialogue: Not yet. Seven seconds till the end. Time enough for you. Perhaps. But what will you do with it? Let's see.

Original: Heidegger: Mister Vice President.
Dialogue: Mister Vice President.

Original: Tseng:Mister President.
Dialogue: Mister President.

Original: Rufus: That's right.
Dialogue: That's right.

Original: Hojo: (laughs)
Dialogue: (laughs)

Original: Zack: Wait... Was that all of 'em?
Dialogue: Wait... Was that all of 'em?

Original: Zack: Hey, Cloud. You see that?
Dialogue: Hey, Cloud. You see that?

Original: Undercity Resident (1): There.
Dialogue: There.

Original: Undercity Resident (2): Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Elmyra: Marlene!
Dialogue: Marlene!

Original: Marlene: Coming!
Dialogue: Coming!

Original: Marlene: Daddy...?
Dialogue: Daddy...?

Original: Barret: Marlene!
Dialogue: Marlene!

Original: Barret: I'll come back.
Dialogue: I'll come back.

Original: Tifa: So...what now?
Dialogue: So...what now?

Original: Cloud: Sephiroth. Long as he's still out there, I...
Dialogue: Sephiroth. Long as he's still out there, I...

Original: Barret: I thought you beat him.
Dialogue: I thought you beat him.

Original: Aerith: We can. We will.
Dialogue: We can. We will.

Original: Tifa: Count me in.
Dialogue: Count me in.

Original: Red XIII: If it's to be a hunt, you could use a nose like mine.
Dialogue: If it's to be a hunt, you could use a nose like mine.

Original: Barret: I'm in too! Bastard wants to destroy the whole planet, doesn't he? An enemy of hers is an enemy of Avalanche!
Dialogue: I'm in too! Bastard wants to destroy the whole planet, doesn't he? An enemy of hers is an enemy of Avalanche!

Original: Zack: Almost there, Cloud. We're almost there...
Dialogue: Almost there, Cloud. We're almost there...

Original: Aerith: I miss it. The steel sky.
Dialogue: I miss it. The steel sky.

Original: On-screen: The Unknown Journey Will Continue
Dialogue: The Unknown Journey Will Continue

Original: Yuffie: (hums "Yuffie's Theme")
Dialogue: (hums "Yuffie's Theme")

Original: Yuffie: Well, guys... Your girl finally made it to Midgar.
Dialogue: Well, guys... Your girl finally made it to Midgar.

Original: Yuffie: Whoa...
Dialogue: Whoa...

Original: Yuffie: Awha! (screams)
Dialogue: Awha! (screams)

Original: Yuffie: (sniffs) Blech!
Dialogue: (sniffs) Blech!

Original: Yuffie: You got this, Yuffie! Mm-hm.
Dialogue: You got this, Yuffie! Mm-hm.

Original: Yuffie: My name is Yuffie, materia hunter and elite special forces operative for the new Wutai government. I have orders to infiltrate Shinra headquarters and steal their ultimate materia. To prove to our common enemy that Wutai is not to be trifled with. Members of Avalanche...with your full support... We got this!
Dialogue: My name is Yuffie, materia hunter and elite special forces operative for the new Wutai government. I have orders to infiltrate Shinra headquarters and steal their ultimate materia. To prove to our common enemy that Wutai is not to be trifled with. Members of Avalanche...with your full support... We got this!

Original: Yuffie: So, members of Avalanche... Where are you!? Come get me already!
Dialogue: So, members of Avalanche... Where are you!? Come get me already!

Original: Yuffie: Okay. If I was a man in a moogle hat...
Dialogue: Okay. If I was a man in a moogle hat...

Original: Yuffie: Wait, does this mean what I think it does? Interesting... So, I gotta come to you, do I? You got some nerve! (chuckles)
Dialogue: Wait, does this mean what I think it does? Interesting... So, I gotta come to you, do I? You got some nerve! (chuckles)

Original: On-screen: Sector 7 Slums - Outskirts
Dialogue: Sector 7 Slums - Outskirts

Original: Yuffie: Hmph! Guess you're never far from a rat in Midgar! Let's see what you've got!
Dialogue: Hmph! Guess you're never far from a rat in Midgar! Let's see what you've got!

Original: Yuffie: Well, that was easy! And my search for the elusive moogle continues.
Dialogue: Well, that was easy! And my search for the elusive moogle continues.

Original: Yuffie: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Yuffie: (sighs) No pom...
Dialogue: (sighs) No pom...

Original: Yuffie: You okay? Anybody home?
Dialogue: You okay? Anybody home?

Original: Yuffie: Well, guess I'm not going anywhere until I get that elevator moving.
Dialogue: Well, guess I'm not going anywhere until I get that elevator moving.

Original: Yuffie: (chuckles) Ah, I never cease to amaze myself.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Ah, I never cease to amaze myself.

Original: Yuffie: Yeesh, this town's a total dump. I thought Midgar was supposed to be "the marvel of the modern world." Talk about false advertising. "City of Mako"? "City of Garbage," more like.
Dialogue: Yeesh, this town's a total dump. I thought Midgar was supposed to be "the marvel of the modern world." Talk about false advertising. "City of Mako"? "City of Garbage," more like.

Original: Yuffie: Huh? I gotta do something!
Dialogue: Huh? I gotta do something!

Original: Yuffie: Ah... You'll do the trick. Come on down!
Dialogue: Ah... You'll do the trick. Come on down!

Original: Yuffie: Sweet! Now to save the day!
Dialogue: Sweet! Now to save the day!

Original: Yuffie: Have no fear, Yuffie's here!
Dialogue: Have no fear, Yuffie's here!

Original: Robed Man: Uh... Urah...
Dialogue: Uh... Urah...

Original: Yuffie: Uh, so...not even a "thank you"?
Dialogue: Uh, so...not even a "thank you"?

Original: Robed Man: Je...no...va...
Dialogue: Je...no...va...

Original: Robed Man: Je...no...va...
Dialogue: Je...no...va...

Original: Yuffie: This is too weird...
Dialogue: This is too weird...

Original: Yuffie: Hn, hn, hah! Okay...! You got this!
Dialogue: Hn, hn, hah! Okay...! You got this!

Original: On-screen: Scrap Boulevard
Dialogue: Scrap Boulevard

Original: Yuffie: Huh, okay... That rotten egg smell's gone. Must've gotten used to it. Hah. Way things are goin', I'll be workin' for Shinra next. Nice try, Midgar.
Dialogue: Huh, okay... That rotten egg smell's gone. Must've gotten used to it. Hah. Way things are goin', I'll be workin' for Shinra next. Nice try, Midgar.

Original: Yuffie: I'm talkin' to myself. City's getting to me!
Dialogue: I'm talkin' to myself. City's getting to me!

Original: Scarlet: Mako Reactor 5 has been temporarily shut down, and all fires have been successfully extinguished. The situation is under control, and the people of our fair city need not worry about any additional complications. We are in the process of conducting a full forensic investigation. But we suspect the device used was similar to that employed in the attack on Mako Reactor 1.
Dialogue: Mako Reactor 5 has been temporarily shut down, and all fires have been successfully extinguished. The situation is under control, and the people of our fair city need not worry about any additional complications. We are in the process of conducting a full forensic investigation. But we suspect the device used was similar to that employed in the attack on Mako Reactor 1.

Original: On-screen: Sector 7 Slums
Dialogue: Sector 7 Slums

Original: Yuffie: Oh, oh, oh! Whadda we have here!? (chuckles) Man, that's gotta be Avalanche! Not bad. Not bad at all... But I can do better!
Dialogue: Oh, oh, oh! Whadda we have here!? (chuckles) Man, that's gotta be Avalanche! Not bad. Not bad at all... But I can do better!

Original: Zhijie: Yuffie?
Dialogue: Yuffie?

Original: Zhijie: Yo.
Dialogue: Yo.

Original: Yuffie: Wha...? There's our pom!
Dialogue: Wha...? There's our pom!

Original: Yuffie: So, you're Avalanche?
Dialogue: So, you're Avalanche?

Original: Zhijie: I'mZhijie. Follow me.
Dialogue: I'm Zhijie. Follow me.

Original: Yuffie: Wha? W-wait up!
Dialogue: Wha—? W-wait up!

Original: Yuffie: So, Zhijie, why didn't you come meet me before?
Dialogue: So, Zhijie, why didn't you come meet me before?

Original: Zhijie: I figured an elite W agent could find their own way.
Dialogue: I figured an elite W agent could find their own way.

Original: Yuffie: I may be elite, but it's not like I've ever been to Midgar. ...And what exactly is a "W" anyway?
Dialogue: I may be elite, but it's not like I've ever been to Midgar. ...And what exactly is a "W" anyway?

Original: Zhijie: Anyone who lives where you just came from. Think of it as a codename.
Dialogue: Anyone who lives where you just came from. Think of it as a codename.

Original: Yuffie: Uh-huh...
Dialogue: Uh-huh...

Original: Zhijie: Still can't believe they sent a kid to do this job...
Dialogue: Still can't believe they sent a kid to do this job...

Original: Yuffie: This "kid" could kick your ass!
Dialogue: This "kid" could kick your ass!

Original: Zhijie: Sayin' you're a fresh face is all.
Dialogue: Sayin' you're a fresh face is all.

Original: Yuffie: Oh, don't worry. I know exactly what you're saying!
Dialogue: Oh, don't worry. I know exactly what you're saying!

Original: Zhijie: Gimme a break, will ya?
Dialogue: Gimme a break, will ya?

Original: Yuffie: And let you walk all over me?
Dialogue: And let you walk all over me?

Original: Zhijie: Well, here we are. Ladies first.
Dialogue: Well, here we are. Ladies first.

Original: Jessie: I don't get it. The mission was a success. So why aren't they back yet?
Dialogue: I don't get it. The mission was a success. So why aren't they back yet?

Original: Biggs: Well, judging from the news, they didn't get caught. They'll turn up.
Dialogue: Well, judging from the news, they didn't get caught. They'll turn up.

Original: Wedge: Amd when they do, we're gonna treat 'em to a feast! I can almost taste your pizza now, Jessie!
Dialogue: Amd when they do, we're gonna treat 'em to a feast! I can almost taste your pizza now, Jessie!

Original: Jessie: Shame, since you won't be getting any.
Dialogue: Shame, since you won't be getting any.

Original: Wedge: What!?
Dialogue: What!?

Original: Biggs: Heh heh...
Dialogue: Heh heh...

Original: On-screen: Avalanche's Base
Dialogue: Avalanche's Base

Original: Zhijie: These two are Billy Bob and Polk. And that's Nayo.
Dialogue: These two are Billy Bob and Polk. And that's Nayo.

Original: Yuffie: Hi. My name is Yuffie, materia hunter and elite special forces operative for the new Wutai government. I have orders to infiltrate Shinra HQ and steal their ultimate materia. To prove to our common enemy that Wutai is not to be trifled with. Members of Avalanche, with your full support... We got this!
Dialogue: Hi. My name is Yuffie, materia hunter and elite special forces operative for the new Wutai government. I have orders to infiltrate Shinra HQ and steal their ultimate materia. To prove to our common enemy that Wutai is not to be trifled with. Members of Avalanche, with your full support... We got this!

Original: Billy Bob: (chuckles) Ready to rumble, huh?
Dialogue: (chuckles) Ready to rumble, huh?

Original: Yuffie: You better believe it! So, did you guys meet Sonon yet? He was supposed to be here.
Dialogue: You better believe it! So, did you guys meet Sonon yet? He was supposed to be here.

Original: Polk: Yeah, he got in three days ago.
Dialogue: Yeah, he got in three days ago.

Original: Nayo: He's out on the town as we speak. Really seems to be enjoying it here.
Dialogue: He's out on the town as we speak. Really seems to be enjoying it here.

Original: Yuffie: Oh he does, does he!?
Dialogue: Oh he does, does he!?

Original: Polk: You, uh...got any bags?
Dialogue: You, uh...got any bags?

Original: Yuffie: As if. Ninjas always travel light. It's like a rule.
Dialogue: As if. Ninjas always travel light. It's like a rule.

Original: Yuffie: But I did bring theseWutai's famous Da-chao beans. Eat up. And here you go.
Dialogue: But I did bring these—Wutai's famous Da-chao beans. Eat up. And here you go.

Original: Billy Bob: And you...eat these things?
Dialogue: And you...eat these things?

Original: Billy Bob: (chuckles) Guess you do.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Guess you do.

Original: Nayo: Sheesh. You ninjas are insane.
Dialogue: Sheesh. You ninjas are insane.

Original: Zhijie: Do me a favor, Yuffie, and wait here for Sonon. I gotta head out. Your IDs should be ready for pickup by now.
Dialogue: Do me a favor, Yuffie, and wait here for Sonon. I gotta head out. Your IDs should be ready for pickup by now.

Original: Yuffie: Then why don't I join ya!?
Dialogue: Then why don't I join ya!?

Original: Zhijie: Naw, I got this. Besides, you reek of trouble. (chuckles)
Dialogue: Naw, I got this. Besides, you reek of trouble. (chuckles)

Original: Yuffie: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Billy Bob: Hey, you gonna be okay out there? Got all the info you need?
Dialogue: Hey, you gonna be okay out there? Got all the info you need?

Original: Polk: Uh, Yuffie? Might wanna wait for Sonon before hittin' the city.
Dialogue: Uh, Yuffie? Might wanna wait for Sonon before hittin' the city.

Original: Nayo: You must be tired from your trip. Why don't you get some rest?
Dialogue: You must be tired from your trip. Why don't you get some rest?

Original: Yuffie: With all the noise in this city? Im-freakin'-possible. How about you tell me where in the Shinra Building they're keeping that materia instead. Don't hold out on me now. I know you know.
Dialogue: With all the noise in this city? Im-freakin'-possible. How about you tell me where in the Shinra Building they're keeping that materia instead. Don't hold out on me now. I know you know.

Original: Nayo: Actually...I kind of don't. At least, not an exact location. All I know is that Shinrafor most purposestreats materia as a weapon. Which means the Advanced Weaponry Division probably deals with it. And since that's in the basement...
Dialogue: Actually...I kind of don't. At least, not an exact location. All I know is that Shinra—for most purposes—treats materia as a weapon. Which means the Advanced Weaponry Division probably deals with it. And since that's in the basement...

Original: Yuffie: I see... So... Shinra hides its top secret materia in the basement. (chuckles) You won't have to wait much longer, my precious...I promise.
Dialogue: I see... So... Shinra hides its top secret materia in the basement. (chuckles) You won't have to wait much longer, my precious...I promise.

Original: Nayo: Just be careful, will you? Please?
Dialogue: Just be careful, will you? Please?

Original: Nayo: Oh yeah, you should introduce yourself to Billy Bob. He knows a thing or two about the Shinra Building.
Dialogue: Oh yeah, you should introduce yourself to Billy Bob. He knows a thing or two about the Shinra Building.

Original: Billy Bob: My teeth...
Dialogue: My teeth...

Original: Yuffie: You're welcome. So, the materia I'm looking for is in the Shinra Building, right? And where is that, exactly?
Dialogue: You're welcome. So, the materia I'm looking for is in the Shinra Building, right? And where is that, exactly?

Original: Billy Bob: (chuckles) Ignorance truly is bliss, huh?
Dialogue: (chuckles) Ignorance truly is bliss, huh?

Original: Yuffie: What did you just say?
Dialogue: What did you just say?

Original: Billy Bob: Haha, didn't mean to offend you. Of course, you probably knew this already, but there's a whole other city built on the plate above us. Shinra Building's right in the middle. You can't miss it.
Dialogue: Haha, didn't mean to offend you. Of course, you probably knew this already, but there's a whole other city built on the plate above us. Shinra Building's right in the middle. You can't miss it.

Original: Yuffie: Oh,thatone. Why didn't you say so?
Dialogue: Oh, that one. Why didn't you say so?

Original: Billy Bob: Now, if ya wanna get topside, ya first gotta get outta the slums. And for help with that, you should talk to Polk.
Dialogue: Now, if ya wanna get topside, ya first gotta get outta the slums. And for help with that, you should talk to Polk.

Original: Polk: You look kinda nervous.
Dialogue: You look kinda nervous.

Original: Yuffie: I just wanna make sure I have the plan down pat. You know, like how to get up top and all that.
Dialogue: I just wanna make sure I have the plan down pat. You know, like how to get up top and all that.

Original: Polk: Huh, well... If you had an ID, you'd normally just take the train up there. But with all the commotion going on, that's not really an option. Security's on high alert. If you ask me, your best bet is to sit tight and wait for things to settle down some.
Dialogue: Huh, well... If you had an ID, you'd normally just take the train up there. But with all the commotion going on, that's not really an option. Security's on high alert. If you ask me, your best bet is to sit tight and wait for things to settle down some.

Original: Yuffie: Sit tight? But I wanna go now...
Dialogue: Sit tight? But I wanna go now...

Original: Polk: Be my guest, thengo get killed.
Dialogue: Be my guest, then—go get killed.

Original: Yuffie: Harsh.
Dialogue: Harsh.

Original: Nayo: Sonon's still not back? Must be in Wall Market, then.
Dialogue: Sonon's still not back? Must be in Wall Market, then.

Original: Yuffie: What's Wall Market?
Dialogue: What's Wall Market?

Original: Nayo: Let's just say it's a place for people with "mature tastes."
Dialogue: Let's just say it's a place for people with "mature tastes."

Original: Yuffie: Mature tastes...
Dialogue: Mature tastes...

Original: Nayo: There's lots of different establishments. It's...kinda hard to explain.
Dialogue: There's lots of different establishments. It's...kinda hard to explain.

Original: Yuffie: No, I think I get it. Like bars filled with smoke so thick you can't even see, and drinks so bitter you wanna spit 'em right back out!
Dialogue: No, I think I get it. Like bars filled with smoke so thick you can't even see, and drinks so bitter you wanna spit 'em right back out!

Original: Nayo: Uh...
Dialogue: Uh...

Original: Yuffie: Where everyone gets drunk and complains about how "Kids just don't understand the value of hard work. They'll be the death of society." Ugh, how can they not see thatthey'rethe ones destryoing it!?
Dialogue: Where everyone gets drunk and complains about how "Kids just don't understand the value of hard work. They'll be the death of society." Ugh, how can they not see that they're the ones destryoing it!?

Original: Nayo: (chuckles)
Dialogue: (chuckles)

Original: Yuffie: Wutai's got a place like that, where grown-ups drink their lives away. It's called the "Happy Turtle."
Dialogue: Wutai's got a place like that, where grown-ups drink their lives away. It's called the "Happy Turtle."

Original: Nayo: Interesting. There's a Happy Turtle in Midgar as well.
Dialogue: Interesting. There's a Happy Turtle in Midgar as well.

Original: Nayo: I don't know where exactly, because I've never actually been, but I do see their flyers from time to time.
Dialogue: I don't know where exactly, because I've never actually been, but I do see their flyers from time to time.

Original: Yuffie: You do, huh? (gasp) They're taking down Midgar one citizen at a time!
Dialogue: You do, huh? (gasp) They're taking down Midgar one citizen at a time!

Original: Nayo: (chuckles)
Dialogue: (chuckles)

Original: Yuffie: I salute you, Happy Turtle!
Dialogue: I salute you, Happy Turtle!

Original: Nayo: Come to think of it... There's a man who goes around putting up flyers for the bar. People call him "Old Snapper." And he doesn't dress like your average Midgar male. Might be from Wutai.
Dialogue: Come to think of it... There's a man who goes around putting up flyers for the bar. People call him "Old Snapper." And he doesn't dress like your average Midgar male. Might be from Wutai.

Original: Yuffie: I oughta find him! Man deserves some Da-chao beans.
Dialogue: I oughta find him! Man deserves some Da-chao beans.

Original: Billy Bob: You know about the VR combat simulation module, right?
Dialogue: You know about the VR combat simulation module, right?

Original: Yuffie: Huh? Uh...course I do! Why wouldn't I? It's that thing that...stimulates...modulation.
Dialogue: Huh? Uh...course I do! Why wouldn't I? It's that thing that...stimulates...modulation.

Original: Billy Bob: Hm. (chuckles) Kinda. It's a machine that puts you in a virtual world where you can practice fighting all you want. There's even a portable version of it. Guy around the corner has one.
Dialogue: Hm. (chuckles) Kinda. It's a machine that puts you in a virtual world where you can practice fighting all you want. There's even a portable version of it. Guy around the corner has one.

Original: Yuffie: Uh-huh...
Dialogue: Uh-huh...

Original: Billy Bob: Hardly ever see technology that cutting-edge down here. So whaddya say? Wanna try it?
Dialogue: Hardly ever see technology that cutting-edge down here. So whaddya say? Wanna try it?

Original: Yuffie: I really don't have time to be playin' around with some stimulator. But, just to be polite, I guess I'll take it for a spin.
Dialogue: I really don't have time to be playin' around with some stimulator. But, just to be polite, I guess I'll take it for a spin.

Original: Billy Bob: The guy's name is Chadley. He's over by the neighborhood watch. If you ever feel like some virtual training, I'm sure he'd be happy to help.
Dialogue: The guy's name is Chadley. He's over by the neighborhood watch. If you ever feel like some virtual training, I'm sure he'd be happy to help.

Original: Polk: You look about ready to die of boredom. Wanna play Fort Condor?
Dialogue: You look about ready to die of boredom. Wanna play Fort Condor?

Original: Yuffie: "Fort...Condor"?
Dialogue: "Fort...Condor"?

Original: Polk: (chuckles) I shoulda known. It hasn't been out long, so there's no way you Ws would've heard of it.
Dialogue: (chuckles) I shoulda known. It hasn't been out long, so there's no way you Ws would've heard of it.

Original: Yuffie: Uh, yes I have! And what's more, I'm awesome at it. I'll whoop you so hard, you'll wonder if you ever knew the rules!
Dialogue: Uh, yes I have! And what's more, I'm awesome at it. I'll whoop you so hard, you'll wonder if you ever knew the rules!

Original: Polk: For my benefit, then, lemme go over them...
Dialogue: For my benefit, then, lemme go over them...

Original: Polk: Damn, Yuffie! How'd you do that? You totally kicked my ass!
Dialogue: Damn, Yuffie! How'd you do that? You totally kicked my ass!

Original: Yuffie: You mean you didn't lose on purpose? ...Wow.
Dialogue: You mean you didn't lose on purpose? ...Wow.

Original: Polk: (chuckles) Well, if you're looking for a challenge, the undercity's got no shortage of serious players.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Well, if you're looking for a challenge, the undercity's got no shortage of serious players.

Original: Yuffie: I've kinda got better things to do.
Dialogue: I've kinda got better things to do.

Original: Polk: Sure 'bout that? Word is if you beat the grandmaster, you can win some serious cashmateria, too.
Dialogue: Sure 'bout that? Word is if you beat the grandmaster, you can win some serious cash—materia, too.

Original: Yuffie: Materia!?
Dialogue: Materia!?

Original: Polk: That's right. But you should know the hardcore competitors won't give you the time of day till you've proven yourself.
Dialogue: That's right. But you should know the hardcore competitors won't give you the time of day till you've proven yourself.

Original: Yuffie: Whatever! Bring it on!
Dialogue: Whatever! Bring it on!

Original: Yuffie: Ugh... Al this talking's giving me a headache. I'm gonna go do some recon.
Dialogue: Ugh... Al this talking's giving me a headache. I'm gonna go do some recon.

Original: Nayo: I won't stop you. Just don't go too far, okay?
Dialogue: I won't stop you. Just don't go too far, okay?

Original: Yuffie: His ways are a mystery.
Dialogue: His ways are a mystery.

Original: New Recruit: Um... Sir? What are we going to do?
Dialogue: Um... Sir? What are we going to do?

Original: Senior Officer: We're going to concentrate on our jobs, and not worry about things that don't concern us.
Dialogue: We're going to concentrate on our jobs, and not worry about things that don't concern us.

Original: New Recruit: But...what if Avalanche is hiding somewhere in this sector?
Dialogue: But...what if Avalanche is hiding somewhere in this sector?

Original: Yuffie: Sonon's gotta be back by now.
Dialogue: Sonon's gotta be back by now.

Original: Sonon: I'm back.
Dialogue: I'm back.

Original: Nayo: Ah, there you are. Someone's been expecting you.
Dialogue: Ah, there you are. Someone's been expecting you.

Original: Yuffie: What took you!?
Dialogue: What took you!?

Original: Sonon: Sorry 'bout that.
Dialogue: Sorry 'bout that.

Original: Yuffie: Wh-what?
Dialogue: Wh-what?

Original: Sonon: Just thinking how you're nothing like your old man. Anyway, it's nice to meet you. I'm Sonon Kusakabe. I was lucky enough to learn how to fight from G
Dialogue: Just thinking how you're nothing like your old man. Anyway, it's nice to meet you. I'm Sonon Kusakabe. I was lucky enough to learn how to fight from G—

Original: Yuffie: Yeah, I don't wanna talk about him. Let's talk about something else. Like how you've adjusted to life hereindulging in "adult" pastimes. Which I guess means...drinking yourself stupid! Last thing I need is my partner stinking like an over-the-hill has-been.
Dialogue: Yeah, I don't wanna talk about him. Let's talk about something else. Like how you've adjusted to life here—indulging in "adult" pastimes. Which I guess means...drinking yourself stupid! Last thing I need is my partner stinking like an over-the-hill has-been.

Original: Yuffie: Speaking of drinking...you been to the Happy Turtle? If you're part of Operation Down-in-One, I take it back. I amtherenext time you go. Don't worry, I can do adult stuff just fine.
Dialogue: Speaking of drinking...you been to the Happy Turtle? If you're part of Operation Down-in-One, I take it back. I am there next time you go. Don't worry, I can do adult stuff just fine.

Original: Sonon: Well, I don't even know where to begin with all of that... But Idoknow I haven't heard of "Operation Down-in-One." At any rate, I'm looking forward to working with you, Boss.
Dialogue: Well, I don't even know where to begin with all of that... But I do know I haven't heard of "Operation Down-in-One." At any rate, I'm looking forward to working with you, Boss.

Original: Yuffie: "Boss"? As inme?
Dialogue: "Boss"? As in me?

Original: Sonon: Well, I've got a few years on you, I'll admitbut out of us two, you've done this longer.
Dialogue: Well, I've got a few years on you, I'll admit—but out of us two, you've done this longer.

Original: Yuffie: I...I guess I have! "Boss," huh? I could get used to that. Beats being stuck on the bottom rung, that's for sure. (chuckles)
Dialogue: I...I guess I have! "Boss," huh? I could get used to that. Beats being stuck on the bottom rung, that's for sure. (chuckles)

Original: Sonon: After we get that materia, we can celebrate your promotion at the Happy Turtle.
Dialogue: After we get that materia, we can celebrate your promotion at the Happy Turtle.

Original: Yuffie: Yeah! Yeah!
Dialogue: Yeah! Yeah!

Original: Yuffie: Stupid bird.
Dialogue: Stupid bird.

Original: Polk: Says the merchandise is good to go. Handoff's at a depot in municipal storage.
Dialogue: Says the merchandise is good to go. Handoff's at a depot in municipal storage.

Original: Nayo: Okay. Yuffie, Sonon. You mind coming along?
Dialogue: Okay. Yuffie, Sonon. You mind coming along?

Original: Yuffie: Not at all! Need to scope out the city anyway. Really get to know the enemy.
Dialogue: Not at all! Need to scope out the city anyway. Really get to know the enemy.

Original: Nayo: We'll be passing through a rough part of town, so you'll wanna go prepared. I'll leave you to get ready. Hit met up outside when you're done, okay?
Dialogue: We'll be passing through a rough part of town, so you'll wanna go prepared. I'll leave you to get ready. Hit met up outside when you're done, okay?

Original: Yuffie: Be right there!
Dialogue: Be right there!

Original: Chadley: Searching for candidates...
Dialogue: Searching for candidates...

Original: Chadley: Candidate detected. Performing physical analysis. She seems relatively agile, and has substantial muscle mass for her stature. Hm. An acceptable candidate.
Dialogue: Candidate detected. Performing physical analysis. She seems relatively agile, and has substantial muscle mass for her stature. Hm. An acceptable candidate.

Original: Yuffie: Hey, uh...you wanna tell me what you're mumblin' about?
Dialogue: Hey, uh...you wanna tell me what you're mumblin' about?

Original: Chadley: My apologies. My name is Chadley. Would you be interesting in helping me with my research?
Dialogue: My apologies. My name is Chadley. Would you be interesting in helping me with my research?

Original: Yuffie: I'm Yuffie. Neet to meet you. So...what're you researchin'?
Dialogue: I'm Yuffie. Neet to meet you. So...what're you researchin'?

Original: Chadley: Combat. It would entail doing battle with a summon in a virtual arena using this portable simulator. Interested?
Dialogue: Combat. It would entail doing battle with a summon in a virtual arena using this portable simulator. Interested?

Original: Yuffie: Hmmm...sure! Why not. Imma kick its butt!
Dialogue: Hmmm...sure! Why not. Imma kick its butt!

Original: Chadley: Very well then...
Dialogue: Very well then...

Original: Chadley: Can I assume you're ready to do battle with a virtual summon?
Dialogue: Can I assume you're ready to do battle with a virtual summon?

Original: Chadley: You're withdrawing? That is...most disheartening.
Dialogue: You're withdrawing? That is...most disheartening.

Original: Chadley: What a shame. It was a close match. However, I did manage to obtain some invaluable data. Analyze and learn from your mistakes, so that you can claim victory next time.
Dialogue: What a shame. It was a close match. However, I did manage to obtain some invaluable data. Analyze and learn from your mistakes, so that you can claim victory next time.

Original: Chadley: Splendid! Thanks to the data you provided during your battle, I succeeded in developing a new materia! One might say you were "faster than lightning." And with the Lord of Levin on your side, your enemies will struggle to keep up!
Dialogue: Splendid! Thanks to the data you provided during your battle, I succeeded in developing a new materia! One might say you were "faster than lightning." And with the Lord of Levin on your side, your enemies will struggle to keep up!

Original: Kyrie: Attention! For three gil, you can play Fort Condor against the lovely Kyrie!
Dialogue: Attention! For three gil, you can play Fort Condor against the lovely Kyrie!

Original: Kyrie: You know the drill. You wanna play, you gotta fork overHm? What's your deal? And why're you dressed like a five-year-old? That's just weird.
Dialogue: You know the drill. You wanna play, you gotta fork over—Hm? What's your deal? And why're you dressed like a five-year-old? That's just weird.

Original: Yuffie: Uh... What are you talking about? This isn't weirdit's super cute!
Dialogue: Uh... What are you talking about? This isn't weird—it's super cute!

Original: Kyrie: "Super cute"? Heh. More like "super lame."
Dialogue: "Super cute"? Heh. More like "super lame."

Original: Yuffie: Not as lame as Midgar.
Dialogue: Not as lame as Midgar.

Original: Kyrie: Huh?
Dialogue: Huh?

Original: Yuffie: Just saying how much I was looking forward to playing Fort Condor. I could really use the training, y'know?
Dialogue: Just saying how much I was looking forward to playing Fort Condor. I could really use the training, y'know?

Original: Kyrie: Sure, I'll put you through your paces...but you do know it's gonna cost ya, right? One match, three gil. Play up.
Dialogue: Sure, I'll put you through your paces...but you do know it's gonna cost ya, right? One match, three gil. Play up.

Original: On-screen: Challenge Kyrie (Rank 1) to a match?
Dialogue: Challenge Kyrie (Rank 1) to a match?

Original: Kyrie: Um, excuse me? I cheated and Istilllost?
Dialogue: Um, excuse me? I cheated and I still lost?

Original: Yuffie: (chuckles) What can I say? Talent trumps all.
Dialogue: (chuckles) What can I say? Talent trumps all.

Original: Kyrie: Whatever. You still owe me for my time. It's gotta be worth...seven gil at least!
Dialogue: Whatever. You still owe me for my time. It's gotta be worth...seven gil at least!

Original: Yuffie: As if!
Dialogue: As if!

Original: Kyrie: I don't wanna think about it. Maybe I should just go home and pass out.
Dialogue: I don't wanna think about it. Maybe I should just go home and pass out.

Original: Johnny: Ugh. Great work, Johnny. Just great. Where you gonna find enough money at this short notice?
Dialogue: Ugh. Great work, Johnny. Just great. Where you gonna find enough money at this short notice?

Original: Johnny: Ah! Don't freakin' scare me like that! I'm highly strung! You trying to kill me orHuh? Who the hell are you?
Dialogue: Ah! Don't freakin' scare me like that! I'm highly strung! You trying to kill me or—Huh? Who the hell are you?

Original: Yuffie: Who am I? Someone who doesn't spend all day muttering to themselves in the shadows... Like some kinda Shinra spy!
Dialogue: Who am I? Someone who doesn't spend all day muttering to themselves in the shadows... Like some kinda Shinra spy!

Original: Johnny: Say what!?Me!? Nuh-uh! I was just...y'know...thinkin' about stuff. Huh? Hmm... (chuckles) Yeah, like how to bag that sweet, sweet Fort Condor prize money! It's my ticket outta here!
Dialogue: Say what!? Me!? Nuh-uh! I was just...y'know...thinkin' about stuff. Huh? Hmm... (chuckles) Yeah, like how to bag that sweet, sweet Fort Condor prize money! It's my ticket outta here!

Original: Yuffie: Heh. So you're after the grandmaster too? Sorry to burst your bubble, Mr. Shadow Lurker, butI'llbe the one takin' home those spoils of war.
Dialogue: Heh. So you're after the grandmaster too? Sorry to burst your bubble, Mr. Shadow Lurker, but I'll be the one takin' home those spoils of war.

Original: Johnny: WhaOver my dead body you will! My life's on the line here! I deserve to eat! I deserve to live!
Dialogue: Wha—Over my dead body you will! My life's on the line here! I deserve to eat! I deserve to live!

Original: On-screen: Challenge Johnny (Rank 1) to a match?
Dialogue: Challenge Johnny (Rank 1) to a match?

Original: Johnny: What!? No, this can't beSay it ain't so! Goodbye fortune... Goodbye pride!
Dialogue: What!? No, this can't be—Say it ain't so! Goodbye fortune... Goodbye pride!

Original: Yuffie: (chuckles) NowI'mtaking down Midgar, a citizen at a time.
Dialogue: (chuckles) Now I'm taking down Midgar, a citizen at a time.

Original: Johnny: Huh? Wait, what'd you say?
Dialogue: Huh? Wait, what'd you say?

Original: Yuffie: That all of Midgar's gonna suffer the same fate.
Dialogue: That all of Midgar's gonna suffer the same fate.

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: So when your opponent leads with this, you respond with...this? This game is insane...
Dialogue: So when your opponent leads with this, you respond with...this? This game is insane...

Original: Yuffie: Hey there, suit. How's that conversation with yourself workin' out?
Dialogue: Hey there, suit. How's that conversation with yourself workin' out?

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: Oh! Sorry, I didn't mean to disturb anyone. My daughter's been dying to play this game, and I promised to teach her. But first, I have to teach myself.
Dialogue: Oh! Sorry, I didn't mean to disturb anyone. My daughter's been dying to play this game, and I promised to teach her. But first, I have to teach myself.

Original: Yuffie: That "game" wouldn't happen to be Fort Condor, would it!? If you want, I'll help you figure stuff out.
Dialogue: That "game" wouldn't happen to be Fort Condor, would it!? If you want, I'll help you figure stuff out.

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: Y-you will? Uh, thanks, that'd be a great help.
Dialogue: Y-you will? Uh, thanks, that'd be a great help.

Original: On-screen: Challenge the Shinra middle manager (Rank 1) to a match?
Dialogue: Challenge the Shinra middle manager (Rank 1) to a match?

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: Well, whaddya know! I think I'm startin' to get the hang of this!
Dialogue: Well, whaddya know! I think I'm startin' to get the hang of this!

Original: Yuffie: Starting to get the hang of what? Losing?
Dialogue: Starting to get the hang of what? Losing?

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: Losing on purpose, to be precise. If I can let my daughter win without her suspecting, that to me is as good as a victory.
Dialogue: Losing on purpose, to be precise. If I can let my daughter win without her suspecting, that to me is as good as a victory.

Original: Yuffie: Boo!
Dialogue: Boo!

Original: Shinra Middle Manager: (chuckles) I know, I know... But if it'll make her happy...
Dialogue: (chuckles) I know, I know... But if it'll make her happy...

Original: Jessie: Where are they? They should've been here by now...
Dialogue: Where are they? They should've been here by now...

Original: Yuffie: Hm? Waiting for somone? Ooh, you got stood up.
Dialogue: Hm? Waiting for somone? Ooh, you got stood up.

Original: Jessie: As if! Wait, who are you?
Dialogue: As if! Wait, who are you?

Original: Jessie: Don't mean to be rude or anything, kid, but do you mind? I'm not exactly in the mood.
Dialogue: Don't mean to be rude or anything, kid, but do you mind? I'm not exactly in the mood.

Original: Jessie: Not in the mood. Go bug literally anyone else.
Dialogue: Not in the mood. Go bug literally anyone else.

Original: Roche: Why, hello there! Forgive me for saying, but you remind me of a dear friend of mine. Perhaps you've met him?
Dialogue: Why, hello there! Forgive me for saying, but you remind me of a dear friend of mine. Perhaps you've met him?

Original: Yuffie: I dunnois he Shinra too?
Dialogue: I dunno—is he Shinra too?

Original: Roche: Perhaps, perhaps... My name is Roche, by the way. Ordinarily, your ill-concealed hostility and exotic wardrobe would give me pause. But not today, for I am here on business of apersonalnature. Looking for my aforementioned friend.
Dialogue: Perhaps, perhaps... My name is Roche, by the way. Ordinarily, your ill-concealed hostility and exotic wardrobe would give me pause. But not today, for I am here on business of a personal nature. Looking for my aforementioned friend.

Original: Yuffie: What's his name?
Dialogue: What's his name?

Original: Roche: Oh, I only wish I knew! But Icantell you that he has a real..."need for speed," as they say. And while he boasts averylarge sword, his first love his plainly his mount!
Dialogue: Oh, I only wish I knew! But I can tell you that he has a real..."need for speed," as they say. And while he boasts a very large sword, his first love his plainly his mount!

Original: Yuffie: Yeah, he sounds great. Say, is that Fort Condor I see over there? You play?
Dialogue: Yeah, he sounds great. Say, is that Fort Condor I see over there? You play?

Original: Roche: I'm always ready for a round of Fort Condor!
Dialogue: I'm always ready for a round of Fort Condor!

Original: Roche: Though...I suspect a delicate flower like you would wither if exposed to my scorching passion for the game. Maybe after some practice, hm?
Dialogue: Though...I suspect a delicate flower like you would wither if exposed to my scorching passion for the game. Maybe after some practice, hm?

Original: Roche: (chuckles) In the absence of my friend, you will provide some much-needed entertainment, my dear!
Dialogue: (chuckles) In the absence of my friend, you will provide some much-needed entertainment, my dear!

Original: On-screen: Challenge Roche (Rank 2) to a match?
Dialogue: Challenge Roche (Rank 2) to a match?

Original: Roche: Well played, my friend! And to think I thought I'd best you easily!
Dialogue: Well played, my friend! And to think I thought I'd best you easily!

Original: Yuffie: Wait...did you just call me your friend?
Dialogue: Wait...did you just call me your friend?

Original: Roche: But of course! With that display of passion, you've more than proven yourself worthy! Henceforth, you shall occupy a place in the pantheon of my closest companions! When next we meet, it will be on the open road, the wind in our hair... Just don't make me come looking for you, my friend!
Dialogue: But of course! With that display of passion, you've more than proven yourself worthy! Henceforth, you shall occupy a place in the pantheon of my closest companions! When next we meet, it will be on the open road, the wind in our hair... Just don't make me come looking for you, my friend!

Original: Roche: Hahahahahaha! Nice try, but no.
Dialogue: Hahahahahaha! Nice try, but no.

Original: On-screen: Fort Condor You may now challenge Rank 2 players!
Dialogue: Fort Condor You may now challenge Rank 2 players!

Original: Yuffie: So, I've been thinkin' about it, and I know just what you need... Round of Fort Condor?
Dialogue: So, I've been thinkin' about it, and I know just what you need... Round of Fort Condor?

Original: Jessie: You gotta beDidn't I tell you I'm not in the mood?
Dialogue: You gotta be—Didn't I tell you I'm not in the mood?

Original: Jessie: (sighs) You know what? Fine, why the hell not. Might help take my mind off things.
Dialogue: (sighs) You know what? Fine, why the hell not. Might help take my mind off things.

Original: On-screen: Challenge Jessie (Rank 2) to a match?
Dialogue: Challenge Jessie (Rank 2) to a match?

Original: Jessie: Damn... Well, can't win 'em all.
Dialogue: Damn... Well, can't win 'em all.

Original: Yuffie: (laughs)
Dialogue: (laughs)

Original: Jessie: Ha ha, laugh it up. Now leave me alone, wouldja?
Dialogue: Ha ha, laugh it up. Now leave me alone, wouldja?

Original: Yuffie: Hm? What's that I hear? The sound of the world's smallest violin?
Dialogue: Hm? What's that I hear? The sound of the world's smallest violin?

Original: Jessie: Keep pushing me...
Dialogue: Keep pushing me...

Original: Yuffie: So...I couldn't help noticing your Fort Condor set. Got time for a game?
Dialogue: So...I couldn't help noticing your Fort Condor set. Got time for a game?

Original: Wedge: It'd be my pleasure!
Dialogue: It'd be my pleasure!

Original: Yuffie: Then let's do it up! I gotta warn you, though, I'm kind of an expert at this.
Dialogue: Then let's do it up! I gotta warn you, though, I'm kind of an expert at this.

Original: Wedge: (laughs) Pretty sure I'll hold my own. I eat experts for breakfast!
Dialogue: (laughs) Pretty sure I'll hold my own. I eat experts for breakfast!

Original: Yuffie: Oho, is that right? Well, you can talk the talk, so let's see ya walk the walk!
Dialogue: Oho, is that right? Well, you can talk the talk, so let's see ya walk the walk!

Original: On-screen: Challenge Wedge (Rank 3) to a match?
Dialogue: Challenge Wedge (Rank 3) to a match?

Original: Wedge: Not gonna lie...I didn't think you had a chance. Sure showed me.
Dialogue: Not gonna lie...I didn't think you had a chance. Sure showed me.

Original: Yuffie: You freakin' bet I did! Aw, not gonna go cryin' to your cats, are ya!?
Dialogue: You freakin' bet I did! Aw, not gonna go cryin' to your cats, are ya!?

Original: Wedge: Ugh!
Dialogue: Ugh!

Original: Yuffie: Looks like you've got your work cut out for you, my furry friends!
Dialogue: Looks like you've got your work cut out for you, my furry friends!

Original: Yuffie: Hey... Wait a second. That was everyone, right? Including the grandmaster? So where's my materia!? I want it now!
Dialogue: Hey... Wait a second. That was everyone, right? Including the grandmaster? So where's my materia!? I want it now!

Original: Chadley: Hell, Yufife. I've finished reviewing your Fort Condor match records. You exhibit what in sporting parlance is called "the ability to perform in the clutch," and "the heart of a champion." In combination, these traits make you the ideal player! That being the case, if it isn't too much trouble, would you mind testing your mettle against me?
Dialogue: Hell, Yufife. I've finished reviewing your Fort Condor match records. You exhibit what in sporting parlance is called "the ability to perform in the clutch," and "the heart of a champion." In combination, these traits make you the ideal player! That being the case, if it isn't too much trouble, would you mind testing your mettle against me?

Original: Yuffie: Uh... I guess so?
Dialogue: Uh... I guess so?

Original: Chadley: I'm sure you'll "kick butt"!
Dialogue: I'm sure you'll "kick butt"!

Original: Chadley: That was quite the performance, Yuffie! Thanks to you, my hypothesis has been substantiated.
Dialogue: That was quite the performance, Yuffie! Thanks to you, my hypothesis has been substantiated.

Original: Yuffie: Your hypo-thingy's what now?
Dialogue: Your hypo-thingy's what now?

Original: Chadley: Substantiated. I was testing security measures against Wutaian espionage operations. By offering a reward, I surmised I could accelerate the rate of adoption, which would, in turn
Dialogue: Substantiated. I was testing security measures against Wutaian espionage operations. By offering a reward, I surmised I could accelerate the rate of adoption, which would, in turn—

Original: Yuffie: Yeah, yeah, skip to the end!
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, skip to the end!

Original: Chadley: (sighs) My apologies. What I meant to say was this: The money and the materia are yours. Do with them as you please.
Dialogue: (sighs) My apologies. What I meant to say was this The money and the materia are yours. Do with them as you please.

Original: Yuffie: did you say "materia"!? So...you'rethe Grandmaster!? Whodda thunk! (laughs) How does it feel, Shinrato see the whole of Midgar brought to its knees by the Amazing Yuffie!
Dialogue: did you say "materia"!? So...you're the Grandmaster!? Whodda thunk! (laughs) How does it feel, Shinra—to see the whole of Midgar brought to its knees by the Amazing Yuffie!

Original: Chadley: Heh. Your capacity to remain undeterred and overcome adversity is commendable. You are truly a worthy competitor. When I next test a hypothesis, I would be honored if you would agree to... ..."kick its butt"!
Dialogue: Heh. Your capacity to remain undeterred and overcome adversity is commendable. You are truly a worthy competitor. When I next test a hypothesis, I would be honored if you would agree to... ..."kick its butt"!

Original: Yuffie: Anytime!
Dialogue: Anytime!

Original: Chadley: Shame; it was a close match. Maybe next time.
Dialogue: Shame; it was a close match. Maybe next time.

Original: Chadley: Would you care to assist in my research by joining me in a game or two of Fort Condor?
Dialogue: Would you care to assist in my research by joining me in a game or two of Fort Condor?

Original: Old Snapper: Oh the joy and cheer that await at the Happy Turtle...
Dialogue: Oh the joy and cheer that await at the Happy Turtle...

Original: Old Snapper: Oho! Greetings, softshell. So, how many of those flyers didja find?
Dialogue: Oho! Greetings, softshell. So, how many of those flyers didja find?

Original: Yuffie: Wha?
Dialogue: Wha?

Original: Old Snapper: Ahem! Collect just six flyers for the Happy Turtle, and a one-of-a-kind prize could be yours! Ring any bells?
Dialogue: Ahem! Collect just six flyers for the Happy Turtle, and a one-of-a-kind prize could be yours! Ring any bells?

Original: Yuffie: Nope.
Dialogue: Nope.

Original: Old Snapper: Well then! Allow me to explain. The Happy Turtle's running a contest. And the rules are simple. All you have to do is collect six of our fabulous flyers from around Sector 7...and you'll earn yourself a prize sure to delight even the dourest diamondback! Hah hah! Sadly, a handful of locals have taken to acting like stinkpots toward anything Wutaian, 'speciall since the bombings. Some've even gone so far as to tear down my poor posters. Little wonder nobody's won yet.
Dialogue: Well then! Allow me to explain. The Happy Turtle's running a contest. And the rules are simple. All you have to do is collect six of our fabulous flyers from around Sector 7...and you'll earn yourself a prize sure to delight even the dourest diamondback! Hah hah! Sadly, a handful of locals have taken to acting like stinkpots toward anything Wutaian, 'speciall since the bombings. Some've even gone so far as to tear down my poor posters. Little wonder nobody's won yet.

Original: Yuffie: Bummer.
Dialogue: Bummer.

Original: Old Snapper: (sighs) Which leaves me in a pretty predicament... But hey, my pain might be your gain. By collecting just a handful of flyers, you could be the first, andat this ratethe only winner of the most testudinarious contest in Midgar's history! This here's a sample of one of our ads. Breathtaking, isn't it? Now it's up to you to find all six. Leave no shell unturned, no pond unplumbed!
Dialogue: (sighs) Which leaves me in a pretty predicament... But hey, my pain might be your gain. By collecting just a handful of flyers, you could be the first, and—at this rate—the only winner of the most testudinarious contest in Midgar's history! This here's a sample of one of our ads. Breathtaking, isn't it? Now it's up to you to find all six. Leave no shell unturned, no pond unplumbed!

Original: Yuffie: That prize is as good as mine!
Dialogue: That prize is as good as mine!

Original: Old Snapper: Ah, since you're here. You wouldn't happen to have any condor coins on you, wouldja? This job may keep a shell over my head, but my real passion's coin collecting. I'd gladly party with some oddities and commodities in exchange for those little beauts.
Dialogue: Ah, since you're here. You wouldn't happen to have any condor coins on you, wouldja? This job may keep a shell over my head, but my real passion's coin collecting. I'd gladly party with some oddities and commodities in exchange for those little beauts.

Original: Yuffie: Hm hm hm hm-hm-hm-hm-hmmm... (hums Happy Turtle theme)
Dialogue: Hm hm hm hm-hm-hm-hm-hmmm... (hums Happy Turtle theme)

Original: Old Snapper: So, what can I do ya for?
Dialogue: So, what can I do ya for?

Original: On-screen: What can Old Snapper do for you?
Dialogue: What can Old Snapper do for you?

Original: Old Snapper: Went to check on one of my flyers, and would't ya know, some rascally youngsters've hidden the darn thing.
Dialogue: Went to check on one of my flyers, and would't ya know, some rascally youngsters've hidden the darn thing.

Original: Old Snapper: Friend of mine manages some apartments nearby, and she's been kind enough to let me post a flyer.
Dialogue: Friend of mine manages some apartments nearby, and she's been kind enough to let me post a flyer.

Original: Old Snapper: Saw one of my babies floating through the air earlier! Poor thing...
Dialogue: Saw one of my babies floating through the air earlier! Poor thing...

Original: Old Snapper: The one I put up in Culvert Street's vanished, too. Swiped by one of those pesky cats...
Dialogue: The one I put up in Culvert Street's vanished, too. Swiped by one of those pesky cats...

Original: Old Snapper: Oh, if you overhear any songs, jams, or grooves about the Happy Turtle, be sure and follow 'em.
Dialogue: Oh, if you overhear any songs, jams, or grooves about the Happy Turtle, be sure and follow 'em.
